title: Guillaume Tell, at Royal Opera House, Draws Criticism for Violence and Nudity
description: LONDON  Rossinis opera Guillaume Tell has long been known for the scene in which the hero is forced to shoot an arrow at an apple perched on the head of his son. Now, however, at least in London, it may be memorable for a different reason: A sequence in the Royal Opera House production here includes full frontal nudity and suggests a gang rape.

title: Garden Hires New President From Agency With Knick Ties
description: Madison Square Garden on Tuesday hired David OConnor, a longtime executive of the Creative Artists Agency, as its new president and chief executive.

title: Tailoring Makes the Man at Givenchy,Berluti, Dior Homme, Herms,Junya Watanabe,Commes des Garons,Thom Browne andSaint Laurent
description: PARIS  Sometimes a metaphor lands at your feet, literally. This happened last Friday, midway through Riccardo Tiscis mens wear show for Givenchy in Paris, when a weighty jailers key embellishing a necklace worn by a model slipped off and went flying, thudding into dust in front of an audience member.

title: Historic Football, Florences Brutal Sport
description: Images of calcio storico in Florence, Italy, a centuries-old competition with few rules and the sort of human wreckage generally associated with the gladiators.

title: Theodore Weesner, Author of The Car Thief, Dies at 79
description: Theodore Weesner, a novelist who mined his wayward youth for the stuff of his celebrated first novel, The Car Thief, and whose half-dozen other books earned plaudits for their patient, realistic narratives and humanely considered characters, died on Thursday at a hospital near his home in Portsmouth, N.H. He was 79.

title: On Wall Street, Cautious Optimism as Merger Deals Near Peak Level
description: Shortly after the financial crisis, even merger bankers and lawyers  among the most optimistic lot on Wall Street  fretted that the good times might never come back.

title: Donald Trump Sues Univision for Dropping Pageant Broadcast
description: Donald J. Trump filed a lawsuit against Univision for $500 million on Tuesday, following the networks announcement last week that it would no longer broadcast the Spanish-language version of his Miss USA beauty pageant.

title: Oklahoma Court Rules Homeowners Can Sue Oil Companies Over Quakes
description: The Oklahoma Supreme Court ruled Tuesday that homeowners who have sustained injuries or property damage from rampant earthquakes they say are caused by oil and gas operations can sue for damages in state trial courts, rejecting efforts by the industry to block such lawsuits from being decided by juries and judges.

title: ISIS Allies Target Hamas and Energize Gaza Extremists
description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip  One bomb hit a Hamas security checkpoint in northern Gaza. A few days later, another exploded in a trash can. Another blew up next to a Gaza City high-rise, and a small one targeted a chicken store owned by a Hamas intelligence official, Saber Siyam.

title: Divide on Iran Nuclear Deal: Hard-Liners vs. Invisible People
description: TEHRAN  In the little shade provided by Tehrans Freedom Tower, a group of about 200 Iranian hard-liners, some with hats made of folded newspapers to protect them against the suns rays, sat in the searing heat Tuesday on blue plastic chairs next to blaring loudspeakers.

title: U.S. vs. Germany
description: The United States went up against Germany in a Womens World Cup semifinal.

title: Jeb Bush Profited From a Hospital Stock, Thanks in Part to Obamacare
description: Jeb Bush the candidate is not a fan of Obamacare. But Jeb Bush the investor made a big bet on the Affordable Care Act, and it paid off.

title: From All Corners of the World, Becoming Fellow Americans
description: You have to abide by the law, first of all, and that is not a problem for me, Felix A. Okema of the Ivory Coast and Elm Park, Staten Island, said on Tuesday morning.

title: Greece Is Placed in Arrears, as the I.M.F. Spells Default
description: When borrowers  whether they are countries, companies or individuals  do not pay their debts on time, they are in default. For practical purposes, then, Greece  which on Tuesday failed to make a scheduled debt repayment of about 1.5 billion euros, or $1.7 billion, to the International Monetary Fund  has defaulted.

title: Obama and Rousseffs Clean-Energy Goals
description: President Obama and the Brazilian president Dilma Rousseff laid out their plans to increase the countries use of renewable energy.

title: Dilma Rousseff of Brazil Visits U.S. Amid Turbulence at Home
description: WASHINGTON  President Dilma Rousseff of Brazil said at the White House on Tuesday that the spying scandal that damaged ties with the United States had been surmounted because telephones between Braslia and Washington work both ways.

title: Full Speech: Christie Announces 2016 Bid
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey told supporters on Tuesday in Livingston, N.J., that he was joining the 2016 presidential race.

title: Women in Photojournalism
description: Ruth Fremson takes a look back at the women  and men  who helped open the door for female photographers.

title: Egyptian President Vows Swifter Justice for Terrorists After Assassination
description: CAIRO  President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi vowed Tuesday to enact new laws to speed terrorism trials and sentences, including executions, a day after a bombing killed Egypts top prosecutor as he drove to work.

title: Jeb Bushs 1040 Tax Form for 2013
description: Mr. Bush and his wife, Columba, reported adjusted gross income of $7.3 million on their 2013 tax return, the last of 33 years of returns he released on Tuesday. Here is the 1040 form.

title: Charleston Gathers for Farewell a 9th Time
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  Amid rousing music and prayers and eulogies of healing and forgiveness, the Rev. Daniel L. Simmons Sr. was remembered Tuesday at the last funeral for victims of the June 17 massacre at Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church here.

title: A College in Maine That Tackles Climate Change, One Class at a Time
description: BAR HARBOR, Me.  Like many residents of this picturesque island town on the edge of Acadia National Park, Zach Soares had trouble keeping his house warm, going through five cords of wood in the winter. So he jumped at an offer last year for free energy improvements through a class project at the College of the Atlantic, where he works.

title: Pressure Mounting on Saudis Coalition in Yemen
description: UNITED NATIONS  Pressure is mounting on the Saudi-led military coalition that seeks to stanch a rebellion in Yemen, as aid officials prepare to add Yemen to the ranks of the worlds most severe humanitarian crises and human rights groups point to what may be war crimes.

title: Donna Karan Throughout the Years
description: Ms. Karan announced on Tuesday that she was stepping down at her company after 31 years at its helm.

title: Colleges Brace for Supreme Court Review of Race-Based Admissions
description: The Supreme Courts decision to reconsider a challenge to affirmative action at the University of Texas at Austin has universities around the country fearing that they will be forced to abandon what remains of race-based admission preferences and resort to more difficult and expensive methods if they want to achieve student diversity.

title: Misty Copeland: I Want to Bring More People to Ballet
description: Ballet news conferences tend to draw television cameras in Russia, where dance is a national obsession, and they rarely do so in the United States. But Misty Copeland, whose fame has spread beyond traditional dance circles, faced a phalanx of cameras when she met the press on Tuesday afternoon at the Metropolitan Opera House to discuss becoming the first African-American female principal dancer in the 75-year history of American Ballet Theater.

title: Obama Overtime Rule Scratches the Surface in Helping the Middle Class
description: WASHINGTON  For all the ambition of President Obamas plan to significantly expand the number of Americans eligible for overtime pay, the proposal falls well short of helping substantially increase middle-class wages, its chief advertised benefit.

title: Obama Tries to Soften European Creditors Stance to Salvage a Deal
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama said Tuesday that he was trying to prod European leaders to salvage a deal to keep Greece in the eurozone, even as his government was bracing for the possible consequences of a once unimaginable divorce.

title: Where Four-Letter Words Lead to Four-Figure Fines
description: WIMBLEDON, England  The first audible obscenity in tennis history surely went unpenalized.

title: States Snub Execution Drug Approved by Supreme Court
description: HOUSTON  Several death-penalty states that continue to scramble for limited supplies of execution drugs showed no signs of adopting the drug that was upheld by the Supreme Courton Mondayand that had a role in three apparently painful executions last year, lawyers and opponents of capital punishment said Tuesday.

title: World Cup: Against Top Foe, U.S. Brings Its A Game
description: MONTREAL  The twisted carnival ride of emotions began to churn for defender Julie Johnston in the 59th minute, when she was caught flat-footed in front of the United States goal and impulsively dragged down Alexandra Popp, the German player who had surged ahead with the ball.

title: The Bonds That Broke Puerto Rico
description: When Puerto Ricos governor told lawmakers and citizens on Monday that the commonwealth could not pay its $72 billion in debt, many wondered how a small, seemingly low-key American island in the Caribbean could have amassed a debt big enough to crush it.

title: New Envoy for Prison Transfers
description: The Obama administration on Tuesday named Lee Wolosky as the State Departments envoy for negotiating transfers of detainees from the prison in Guantnamo Bay, Cuba. Mr. Wolosky fills a position that had been vacant since Clifford Sloan, the previous envoy, stepped down in December. The only transfers approved since then involved a resettlement of six Yemenis in Oman in June, a deal that was struck last year. President Obama wants to close the prison, but many Republicans want to block any more transfers, and the State Department and Pentagon often disagree over the risk of releasing certain prisoners. Of the 116 detainees remaining, 52 are approved for release if security conditions can be met. Mr. Wolosky worked on illicit transnational financing at the National Security Council in the late Clinton and early Bush administrations. He is a partner at Boies, Schiller & Flexner.

title: Hedge Funds Fight to Save Puerto Rico Investments
description: Hedge funds like Appaloosa Management, Paulson & Company and Blue Mountain Capital gathered in a conference room at the Barclays offices in Midtown Manhattan last September to talk about what was then the hottest trade: Puerto Rico.

title: Mets and Cubs Take Different Routes on the Road Back
description: Before we start with the baseball analysis, we must discuss the soda can. This is how it is with Joe Maddons teams, so just go with it.

title: Chris Christie Carries Announcement Vibe to New Hampshire
description: SANDOWN, N.H.  Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey opened his first campaign event as an official candidate for president on Tuesday by barreling into the town hall building here, with Bon Jovis full-throated snarl blaring on the speakers as his wife and four children trailed behind him. It was as if he had just kicked through the double doors of the high school gym in Livingston, N.J., where only hours earlier he had formally announced his campaign.

title: Review: In Of Good Stock, Alicia Silverstone Is a Sister in Distress
description: In the middle of a Scotch-and-tear-soaked session of recrimination and consolation with her two sisters, the kind that begins with insults and ends in a group hug, a woman named Jess sees fit to wail, I am trapped in a bad chick flick.

description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  We have a sound substitution theme by Ned White today, with phrases beginning with the letter S being swapped out for the TH sound.

title: Uber Says Proposed Freeze on Licenses in New York City Would Limit Competition
description: Just a week after Uber offered rare words of praise for New York Citys Taxi and Limousine Commission, the ride-hailing company was back in a familiar position on Tuesday, criticizing the latest move to regulate the fast-growing service.

title: A Conversation With Michael Rudder
description: Mr. Rudder, 37, is the founder and principal of the Rudder Property Group, a boutique commercial brokerage firm that specializes in the sale of office condominiums and co-ops in Manhattan, including 866 United Nations Plaza. Before starting the New York-based company in 2010, Mr. Rudder served as the director of office leasing and sales for Time Equities.

title: Historic Football, Florences Brutal Sport
description: Images of calcio storico in Florence, Italy, a centuries-old competition with few rules and the sort of human wreckage generally associated with the gladiators.

title: Its Charter Expired, Export-Import Bank Will Keep the Doors Open
description: WASHINGTON  Time was running out on the nations 81-year-old Export-Import Bank on Tuesday, but its employees were not. Instead they casually walked in and out of the banks classical headquarters a block from the White House, none of them carrying packing boxes or personal effects as one might expect at a federal agency whose charter would expire at midnight.

title: Haitian Migrants Face Deportation From Dominican Republic
description: The Dominican governments threat to send Haitians away has been popular domestically, playing on the frustration many Dominicans feel toward their poorer neighbors.

title: Sanitation Worker Thwarts Robbery at a Manhattan 7-Eleven
description: Collecting trash in Midtown Manhattan was all that Curtis Jackson, a probationary sanitation worker, had planned to do on Tuesday as he began his shift at 6 a.m.

title: Nike Chairman Philip Knight, Set to Exit, Wants Chief as Successor
description: Philip H. Knight, Nikes co-founder and chairman, said on Tuesday that he planned to step down, and that he wanted to pass the companys reins to Mark Parker, the president and chief executive.

title: Mets Bats Take the Night Off, and Jon Niese Loses Again
description: In the Mets much-discussed six-man rotation, there is no shortage of idiosyncrasies among its members.

title: Brooklyn Senator Told Friend Not to Show Check Register to Investigators
description: After a witness testified on Tuesday that he was urged by State Senator John L. Sampson to withhold evidence, prosecutors presented the jury with the conversation itself, which had been secretly recorded by the government.

title: Adam Warren Appreciates Intent Behind Move to Yankees Bullpen
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.  You might say the Yankees are hitching Secretariat to a milk cart.The team is taking Adam Warren, its most effective and dependable starting pitcher, and sending him to the bullpen to serve as another capable setup man among many.

title: New Trove of Hillary Clintons Emails Highlights Workaday Tasks at the State Department
description: WASHINGTON  The State Department released a trove of email messages on Tuesday night from Hillary Rodham Clintons first year as secretary of state amid deep curiosity in both parties about what they will show as she mounts her second campaign for the White House.

title: Choosing a Husband
description: The Ethicists consider whether a mistress is required to honor a couples marriage.

title: Affirmative Action: A Supreme Court Timeline
description: Some milestone affirmative action decisions by the Supreme Court that govern university admissions.

title: A Trunk Worth Bringing as Carry-On
description: This summer, small, portable suitcases in bright colors and luxe textures feel polished and unfussy  and will set you apart at check-in.

title: King of All Media: Larry Kings Internet Afterlife
description: Larry King has looked like a retiree for at least three decades  like the snappiest dresser at a Boca Raton assisted-living facility  but he only stopped working in 2012, and not by choice. First, in 2010, King was eased out of his post at Larry King Live, the nightly talk show he had hosted on CNN since 1985. Then, in February 2012, CNN severed the relationship entirely, announcing that King would no longer appear even in occasional specials on the network. King was 78 years old, but he was worse at being retired than Brett Favre or Jay Z. Exactly a month later came the news that King would be returning to talk show hosting, though not, strictly speaking, to the airwaves. He co-founded a new production company, Ora TV, with the Mexican tycoon Carlos Slim Hel (who also has an ownership stake in The New York Times), and signed a multiyear deal for a new web series, Larry King Now, with the streaming site Hulu.

title: Record Number of Refugees Crossing to Europe, U.N. Says
description: UNITED NATIONS  Record numbers of people crossed the Mediterranean Sea in a bid to reach the shores of Europe in the first six months of this year, and most of them were entitled to be resettled as refugees under international law, the United Nations said Wednesday.

title: Average Home Price in Manhattan Reaches $1.87 Million, a New High
description: After flirting with records for more than a year, the average sales price of a Manhattan apartment hit a new high in the second quarter, according to at least two reports to be released on Wednesday by major real estate brokerage firms.

title: Word of the Day | endearment
description: endearment  \in-dir-mnt\  noun

title: Shadows of 1999 One Step Closer to Fading in 2015
description: MONTREAL  The United States defender Ali Krieger admitted that she had thought and thought about the last time the United States won the Womens World Cup.

title: Whats On TV Wednesday
description: 8 P.M. (Encore) A RIVER RUNS THROUGH IT (1992) Craig Sheffer portrays the writer Norman Maclean as a quiet young man, and Brad Pitt (above right, with Mr. Sheffer) is Paul, his wilder, more magnetic brother in this adaptation of Mr. Macleans 1976 autobiographical story about the sons of a Presbyterian minister coming of age in Montana between Prohibition and the Great Depression  and finding expression for their emotions through fly-fishing. These are men for whom the physical is inseparably entwined with the spiritual, men for whom both aspects of life are best appreciated knee-deep in a rushing river on a glorious day, Janet Maslin wrote in The New York Times about this visually stunning film, for which Philippe Rousselot won an Oscar for best cinematography. Between the novellas well-known first sentence (In our family, there was no clear line between religion and fly-fishing) and its elegiac last line (I am haunted by waters), A River Runs Through It circled gracefully among the landmarks of Mr. Macleans early years without violating the distant perfection of those memories. It is easy to recognize Robert Redfords reverent film version of this beautifully spare novella as a labor of love, she added. The same thoughts embraced by Mr. Maclean  of family and history, of the unbridgeable distances between men, of a wild natural landscape as a pathway to spiritual grace  are ably reflected on the screen.

title: Corrections: July 1, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I am not running for president of the United States as surrogate forbeing elected prom king of America. I am not going to be the most popular guy who looks into your eye every day and says what you want to hear.

title: Yankees Veteran Roster Taking Its Lumps Against Young and Hungry Opponents
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.  Trailing by a run against the Los Angeles Angels, the Yankees sent the top of the order up to bat against Huston Street in the top of the ninth. Brett Gardner took a halfhearted cut at strike three, Chris Young went down on an indecisive swing, and Alex Rodriguez pounded an 84-mile-per-hour sinker into the ground.

description: I had my first war assignment 20 years ago when The Associated Press sent me to Sarajevo. As prepared as I was, I was caught off guard when I encountered a different sort of conflict.

description: To the Editor:

title: What Would Thucydides Say About the Crisis in Greece?
description: A FOREIGN delegation representing a powerful alliance confronts a small Mediterranean country with an ultimatum. Either join our alliance, pay ruinous dues and cede your national sovereignty, or you will be destroyed. Unwilling to allow the delegation to present its case to their fellow citizens, the countrys political elite tries to buy time. But appeals to reason, pragmatism and common decency fail to budge the visitors. When the elite finally replies that it is not prepared to surrender its nations freedom, the delegation withdraws and, true to its threat, crushes the rebellious country.

title: A Good Bad Deal?
description: Sometime after the 1973 war, I remember seeing a cartoon that showed President Anwar el-Sadat lying flat on his back in a boxing ring. The Israeli prime minister, Golda Meir, wearing boxing gloves, was standing over him, with Sadat saying to Meir something like, I want the trophy, I want the prize money, I want the belt.

title: A Needed Update for Overtime Pay
description: The Labor Departments new proposal to update the overtime-pay rules would give millions of American workers a toehold in the middle class. By raising the salary threshold for overtime, which has barely budged since 1975, nearly five million more people would start earning overtime pay, according to White House estimates.

title: Give Police Commissioner Brattons Reforms a Chance
description: Police Commissioner William Bratton testified before the New York City Councils Public Safety Committee on Monday, taking aim at a set of bills intended to increase oversight of his department and to rein in abuses like the attack by officers that killed Eric Garner on Staten Island last year.

title: The Real Problem With Medical Internships
description: APPROXIMATELY 26,000 newly minted doctors across the United States will begin their internships today. For many, this legendarily grueling year will be the most trying time of their professional lives. Most will spend it in a state of perpetual exhaustion, as near ascetics with regard to family, friends and other pleasures. I was an intern nearly 20 years ago, but I still remember it the way soldiers remember war.

title: Pressed by Debt Crisis, Doctors Leave Greece in Droves
description: Greece is in the midst of the worst brain drain in modern history, experts say.

title: Canto-Pop Sings Hong Kongs Working-Class Blues
description: A labor groups cramped office in a nondescript building in working-class Kowloon is not where one would expect a producer to be working on his latest Canto-pop release, a musical genre known for syrupy ballads, upbeat hits and photogenic stars. But WildFires, a compilation of songs about Hong Kongs blue-collar workers, is not a typical album.

title: After Heads Bang, Interests Collide for FIFA
description: MONTREAL  Morgan Brian turned onto her stomach and kicked the turf in pain. Red bloomed in Alexandra Popps blond hair like an excruciating carnation.

title: Test Your Vocabulary | Farm Waste and Animal Fats Will Help Power a United Jet
description: Below, several paragraphs from a June 30 article, Farm Waste and Animal Fats Will Help Power a United Jet.

title: Court Rejects Investors Move to Disrupt Samsung Merger
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A court here on Wednesday rejected an attempt by the American activist investor Paul E. Singer to block a shareholders vote later this month on the proposed merger between two subsidiaries of Samsung.

title: Chinese Markets Fall Again, Ignoring Beijings Efforts to Soothe Them
description: HONG KONG  Chinas stock markets plunged in the final hour of trading on Wednesday, as a series of government measures on Monday night and through the day on Tuesday to prop up share prices once again proved to have little enduring effect.

title: Morningside Heights, More Than a College Town
description: Those who are skeptical of the idea that New York could be considered a college town might change their minds after visiting the Morningside Heights neighborhood on the Upper West Side of Manhattan.

title: Eisenhower Memorial Design Nears Approval, but Funding Remains Uncertain
description: Today, buffeted by repeated setbacks over the past five years, the proposed memorial to Dwight D. Eisenhower appears closer to becoming a tribute to a federal impasse than to the five-star World War II general and 34th president.

title: William Styrons My Generation: Collected Nonfiction
description: William Styron was born in 1925 and died in 2006, which places him squarely in the constellation of writers who transformed American literature after World War II. In My Generation, a posthumous collection of assorted nonfiction, Styron offers vivid, gossipy and illuminating portraits of these celebrated figures, himself among them. One gets the impression that he happily socialized in an ocean of Scotch and martinis with just about everyone of his vintage, as he often puts it, as well as with slightly older and younger authors he admired: Robert Penn Warren, James Baldwin, Truman Capote, James Jones, Terry Southern, Arthur Miller, James Dickey, Ralph Ellison, Philip Roth, J.D. Salinger and many others among the literary anointed.

title: U.S. Chamber Fights Smoking Laws While Hospitals and Insurers Sit on Its Board
description: Anthem, one of the nations largest health insurers, wants its members to stop smoking.

title: Skyfaring, by Mark Vanhoenacker
description: While orbiting the moon on the Apollo 8 mission in December 1968, the astronaut William Anders took a photograph of the Earth rising over the lunar surface, and the image created a psychological shock back home. It was a striking color shot of the planet hanging as a sphere in a dark void. Some have called this the true beginning of the environmental movement; the biophysicist John Platt remarked that the image may have been worth the cost of the whole Apollo project.

title: Full Toll From Aurora Theater Shooting Goes Untold at Trial
description: AURORA, Colo.  Before the bullets and bloodshed in the movie theater, Stefan Moton was a teenager who did push-ups and boxing exercises in his bedroom, his dreams fixed on becoming a mixed martial arts fighter. Now, his goals are humbler: Strengthen the sections of his upper body that he can still move. Maybe get a new tattoo. Feed himself again.

title: 6 Qs About the News | California Mandates Vaccines for Schoolchildren
description: Note: Were experimenting with a new format for this feature. Tell us what you think!

title: Restoring a Lackluster Worlds Fair Sculpture for Legacys Sake
description: As the Worlds Fair semicentennial winds down this summer, a crew of young apprentices is rehabilitating a monumental bronze by Marshall M. Fredericks that stands in Flushing Meadows-Corona Park in Queens, not far from where it was placed in 1964 as a sculptural counterpoint to the United States Pavilion.

title: China Approves Sweeping Security Law, Bolstering Communist Rule
description: BEIJING  The Chinese government announced Wednesday that it had enacted a new national security law, one that amounts to a sweeping command from President Xi Jinping to maintain the primacy of Communist Party rule across all aspects of society. The law is expected to bolster the power of the domestic security apparatus and the military.

title: In Hong Kong, Handover Day Is a Day of Protest
description: Its Handover Day in Hong Kong, which means its also time for the annual protest calling for universal suffrage and the preservation of civil liberties under Chinese rule. July 1, which marks the former colonys transfer from Britain to China in 1997, has served as the backdrop of protests, originally organized by the Civil Human Rights Front. It has since become an annual event that carries multiple demands and themes  some political, some not.

title: Wednesdays Travel News and Tips
description: Our weekday morning digest that includes consumer news, deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.

title: Safety Tips for Using Hotel Gym Equipment
description: The death of Dave Goldberg, the chief executive of SurveyMonkey, in May at a resort gym in Mexico raised some unsettling questions for travelers who like to work out when theyre on the road: How safe are hotel fitness facilities and their equipment? (Initial news reports suggested that Mr. Goldberg died in a treadmill accident, though later accounts said a heart ailment could have played a role.) And how risky is it to exercise when few people may be around?

title: The Prancing Elites Dance Their Way Up
description: MOBILE, ALA.  One sultry afternoon in May, the Prancing Elites were wandering the empty streets here, five 20-something men giving a tour of their hometown. They were dressed modestly enough, in T-shirts and denim, and their attention would stray now and then as they tapped their phones, some with bedazzled nails.

title: Older Athletes Have a Strikingly Young Fitness Age
description: Older athletes can be much younger, physically, than they are in real life, according to a new study of participants in the coming Senior Olympics. The study found that the athletes fitness age is typically 20 years or more younger than their chronological age, providing a clear inspiration to the rest of us to get out and start moving more.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Why Im Still Bullish on Europes Future
description: BRUSSELS  IF London is Europes New York, Brussels is our Washington, D.C., a small city made globally important by the political institutions centered here, and at the same time, and perhaps for that reason, often unloved by the people who pass through it. In the eyes of jaded Western travelers it is boring, so clogged with international bureaucracy that it has no soul.

title: New York Today: Summer Lovin
description: Good morning on this brightening Wednesday.

title: Alexis Tsipras Budges on Greeces Debt, but Meets a Cool Response
description: ATHENS  An unexpected new effort by Greece to compromise with its creditors on a bailout package prompted a cool response from most of the rest of Europe on Wednesday as efforts to find a way out of the financial crisis confronting Athens remained chaotic.

title: Tsipras Letter to European Leaders
description: In a letter Tuesday night, Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras said Greece was prepared to accept a deal set out publicly over the weekend by the creditors, with modifications to some of the key points of contention.

title: Jailed American Executive Resigns From Toyota
description: TOKYO  The American public relations chief of Toyota Motor resigned on Wednesday, the automaker said, offering her notice from a Japanese jail after her arrest last month on suspicion of illegally bringing a restricted painkiller into the country.

title: How to Talk About Dying
description: I was 25 when I flew home for my fathers last birthday. His cancer had returned and he would die three months later at the age of 57. What I remember most about that weekend was the large rectangular gift box he opened. My mother had bought him a new suitcase.

title: What You Need to Know About Chinas New National Security Law
description: On Wednesday, Chinas pro forma legislature approved a sweeping new national security law.Here is what you need to know:

title: Today in Politics: Clinton Trove Shows Fax Machine Confusion, but Little Fodder for Opponents
description: Good Wednesday morning from Washington, where Republicans are declaring a legislative victory even while in recess, candidates are sending urgent appeals for money, and Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey is officially running. But its another release of Hillary Rodham Clinton emails from her time at the State Department that is driving the bus.

title: Intact Families, Continued: The Red-County Advantage
description: Nearly everyone who talks about politics  including us  talks about red states and blue states, even though we all know that every state has both red and blue areas.

title: A Philosophy of Herbs
description: There are two ways of seeing herbs in error. In my gastronomic memory, the blunt and mostly bald symbol of the first way is the altruistic Signor Giocondo Cavaliere, of the village Amalfi, region Campania, population 5,428 (or so). On a blue May day, three other nave Americans and I invited him, along with Gennaro, the chauffeur; Giulio, who ran the fish market; Nino, who staked the peas; and an assortment of others to lunch in the white stucco villa we were borrowing.

title: What Happens When a State Is Run by Movie Stars?
description: On the evening of May 8, I stood in the offering hall of a Hindu temple in Chennai, the capital of the South Indian state of Tamil Nadu, amid a phalanx of anxious politicians dressed in their customary white shirts and dhotis. Lord Perumal, we pray that justice will prevail, a priest intoned. Tamil Nadu was on the verge of prosperity, but evil powers have left it stagnant. Let Amma resume her work. Let her opponents be punished. Let the evil that has imprisoned her be banished into hell. While we waited for the ceremony to begin, the politicians showed me their tattoos. The minister of higher education had a womans plump face inscribed on his forearm. A district secretary had the words Long Live Amma.

title: Do Another Womans Marriage Vows Bind Me?
description: A single woman, I moved to a new town and became friendly with a married man who then told me that he was romantically interested in me. He said that while he wasnt in an open marriage, his wife knew how he felt, and they were negotiating some arrangement that might allow him to pursue his feelings if they were shared. I was attracted to him but made it clear that I wouldnt have an affair in secret and that I had no desire to cause a rift between him and his wife (whom I didnt know as well but liked). At one point we saw a movie together, and we continued talking at work; were adjunct professors at the same university. It quickly became clear that his wife took a far more traditional view of their marriage, and although I thought I was being fairly responsible, I was pilloried by his wife, by her friends and by a close friend of mine for encouraging his attraction. I was told that I had no girl code, that I was antifeminist, that you just dont do that to other women. Is a woman who has chosen not to marry really responsible for acting as a custodian of another womans marriage? My behavior may have been self-serving, thoughtless or any number of things, but I dont believe it was ethically objectionable, at least not on the grounds that were presented. NAME WITHHELD

title: A Jump to Honor a Fallen Marine
description: We step off the C-130 ramp from 13,000 feet above the Florida Keys and into a radiant, cool blue sky, cloudless yet hazy on the horizon. Arms interlocked, Dan, Paul and I skydive in a three-man formation while a fourth chases us with his helmet-cam. There is nothing inherently unique about the act of falling at 149 miles per hour, not after youve done it enough. But this jump has a sacramental feel even at terminal velocity, and I know its due to the name of the drop zone beneath us.

title: The Economys Missing Metrics
description: Nearly every day, a few hundred federal workers, carefully spread around the United States by a rigorous statistical model, carry out a peculiar task on a special, secure tablet computer. Throughout the day, they are directed to visit specific stores in search of specific items  say, organic romaine lettuce hearts; or a 2015 Hyundai Sonata Sport with the premium package; or a mens long-sleeve button-down shirt, blue, size XL and made of 80 percent cotton and 20 percent polyester. Over the course of the month, 80,000 prices are entered into tablets throughout the country, and the data flow to Washington for processing. Parsed and analyzed by economists, that information determines the official United States government inflation rate: arguably the most influential bit of data in the world, determining whether new factories are built, new employees hired.

title: Woe to You Who Are at Ease in Zion
description: On June 5, Franklin Graham, son of the legendary evangelist Billy Graham, took to Facebook to mourn the approach of legalized same-sex marriage:

title: Painted-Over Murals by Thomas Cole Found in His Former Home
description: Murals by the Hudson River landscape artist Thomas Cole have been discovered hidden under layers of wall paint in his former home, now a historic site in the village of Catskill in Greene County.

title: Jihadist Attacks on Egypt Grow Fiercer
description: CAIRO  Two years after President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi led a military takeover promising to restore order and security in Egypt, he faces a rising jihadist insurgency that has shaken the stability of this most populous Arab state, a key ally of the United States.

title: A Conversation With White People on Race
description: Why do so many white people find it extremely uncomfortable to talk about race? Setting out to make the next installment of our Op-Doc video series about race in America, we hoped to address that question. Because we live in New York, where there is no shortage of opinions, we didnt think it would be too hard to find white people willing to speak publicly on this topic. We were wrong.

title: A Conversation With White People on Race
description: This short documentary features interviews with white people on the challenges of talking about race.

title: White House Ends 40-Year-Old Ban on the Use of Cameras, to Delight of Tourists
description: WASHINGTON  They posed grinning beside a bust of George Washington and stood solemnly in front of a portrait of John F. Kennedy. A few even caught President Obama as he walked across the South Lawn to Marine One.

title: Nancy Pelosi Is Happy to Not Be Going Anywhere
description: Having led House Democrats for a dozen years, now in the minority, Nancy Pelosi faces periodic questions about how long she wants the job.

title: Greeces Doctor Brain Drain
description: In part of a large brain drain that could affect Greece for decades, thousands of doctors have left the nation for Germany since the financial crisis began five years ago.

title: Greek Pensioners Line Up Outside Bank
description: People waited in front of the National Bank of Greece in Athens on Wednesday to receive part of their pensions for July.

title: Morning Agenda: Tsipras Signals Acceptance of Creditors Terms
description: TSIPRAS SIGNALS ACCEPTANCE OF CREDITORS TERMS | The Greek prime minister, Alexis Tsipras, is ready to accept the bailout terms set by Greeces creditors, with a few changes, if they are part of a broader deal to address the countrys funding needs for the next two years, officials said on Wednesday,  Suzanne Daley and Niki Kitsantonis write in The New York Times. In a letter sent to the heads of the European Commission, International Monetary Fund and European Central Bank on Tuesday, Mr. Tsipras said Greece was prepared to accept a deal set out publicly over the weekend by the creditors, with small modifications to some of the key points of contention on issues like pension cuts and tax increases. Mr. Tsipras linked Greeces acceptance of the terms to a new package of bailout aid that would need to be negotiated, Ms. Daley and Ms. Kitsantonis write.

title: Classical Music This Week: A Maverick Fourth, Netrebkos Newest and Twyla
description: Listeners, hello! The Fourth of July is coming up fast, but do you need more Sousa marches? I didnt think so.

title: Perfectly Reasonable Question: Publishing Religious Images That May Offend
description: The Timess decision last January not to print images of cartoons depicting the Prophet Muhammad brought more mail to this office than just about anything else in recent memory. Many readers felt the images were newsworthy after the massacre at the offices of the satirical French newspaper Charlie Hebdo.

title: Marco Rubio Increases Ad Buys to $7 Million in Early Voting States
description: Voters in Iowa, Nevada, New Hampshire and South Carolina should get ready to see a lot more of Marco Rubio  on their television sets.

title: An Earful From a Barber in Queens
description: Dear Diary:

title: Lightning Believed Cause of Fire at a Black Church
description: GREELEYVILLE, S.C.  A day after a fire gutted a small black church here, a law enforcement official said Wednesday that lightning was the likely cause of the blaze.

title: Irans President to Meet With Top U.N. Nuclear Official
description: TEHRAN  President Hassan Rouhani of Iran will meet with the head of the International Atomic Energy Agency on Thursday in an effort to resolve differences over the inspection of military sites, the Iranian news media reported.

title: Thousands Protest on Anniversary of Hong Kongs Return to China
description: HONG KONG  As Hong Kong marked the 18th anniversary on Wednesday of its handover from Britain to China, thousands of residents took to the streets in what has become an annual tradition of rallying for greater democracy. But in contrast to last year, when by the organizers estimate the turnout was more than half a million, the crowd this year was tiny.

title: $2.9 Million Homes in Key West, Dallas and South Carolina
description: KEY WEST, FLA.

title: Independently Drawn Districts Have Proved to Be More Competitive
description: Buoyed by a Supreme Court ruling, opponents of gerrymandering want to get more state legislatures out of the business of drawing congressional districts. So its worth examining the performance of the independent redistricting commissions validated by the court on Monday.

title: Heating Up the Holidays
description: TIMES INSIDER  Its the height of summer, but this month we will be paying tribute to some well-known and some off-the-wall July holidays. Pick up your solving implement (pen or pencil, we dont judge), a tall iced beverage and lets get started.

title: Poppy Delevingnes Secrets for Staying, and Looking, Cool This Summer
description: For the English model and actress Poppy Delevingne, smelling good is every bit as important as looking good. All my life, Ive always been very into scent; Im very sensitive to it, she said earlier this month from London, where she was busy packing for the Glastonbury Festival. I can literally meet someone in a pub and be like, You smell like my best friend, and know exactly what the scent is. Delevingne is especially fond of the aromas of popcorn and jasmine, which she says evoke memories of her childhood. But when it comes to her own signature scent, she has long been loyal to the British perfume house Jo Malone, whose Red Roses has been her everyday perfume since her early 20s. And the house recently named Delevingne its first-ever brand ambassador. Ive gotten into layering the scents, kind of like being a chemist, she says. Ive been wearing a lot of the Peony & Blush Suede; at night I add Tuberose Angelica to make it a little muskier, a little sexier. And lately Im really into Wood Sage & Sea Salt. It reminds you literally of the sea, so Ive been wearing that for the summer.

title: Ace to Buy Chubb for $28.3 Billion
description: Merger mania has swept across huge swaths of the corporate landscape in the last five years. Now the insurance industry, spurred by a $28.3 billion deal, could be about to join that wave.

title: Facebook Wins a Round in Austrian Court Case
description: A court in Vienna has rejected a class-action suit against Facebook that centered on how the social network collected and used data on its 1.4 billion users.

title: House Hunting in ... Italy
description: A FIVE-BEDROOM STONE HOUSE IN SOUTHERN UMBRIA

title: Twinges of Disappointment Amid Sighs of Relief at End of Manhunt
description: MALONE, N.Y.  The escaped convicts had been caught, the search was over and residents of the villages and hamlets across northern New York State were breathing a collective sigh of relief this week.

title: Havanas Vital Biennial Was Trumped by a Stifled Voice
description: In its falling-apart gorgeousness, Havana is a stage set for many dramas, past, present and future. Cruise the old Miramar neighborhood, with its mansions and parks, and youre in the 1950s Sin City of Fulgencio Batista. Head to the center of town, where Che Guevaras face looms, a colossal logo high over Revolution Plaza, and you hit the socialist 1960s, as hard and unyielding as a cellblock wall. Wander from there in almost any direction and you enter the Havana of today, resiliently tight-belted but, with United States links reforged, a platinum-card paradise-to-be.

title: E.U. to Wait for Greek Vote, Merkel Says
description: The German chancellor said on Wednesday that the door for negotiations with Greece remained open, but that Europe would stand by for the result of the referendum.

title: A Familiar Sense of Uncertainty
description: When I gave birth to my son Ryan, I managed all my new-mom worries easily with one simple tactic: Research, research, research.

title: A Mac-to-iPhone Handoff
description: Q. I have OS X Yosemite and iOS 8, yet I cant get my email in progress on the Mac to hand off to my iPhone. What should I do?

title: Gazprom Halts Natural Gas Deliveries to Ukraine
description: MOSCOW  The Russian energy giant Gazprom announced on Wednesday that it had halted deliveries of natural gas to Ukraine because of a pricing dispute.

title: Think Like a Doctor: Limping Along
description: The Challenge:  A 2-year-old boy suddenly stops walking. Can you figure out why?

title: Daily Report: Apple Music Goes Boldly Where Others Have Gone Before
description: Into the unknown we go, the D.J. Zane Lowe said just after noon on Tuesday, as he began his first show on Beats 1, the Internet radio station that is a big feature of Apples new music service, Ben Sisario reports.

title: Scott Walker Holds Early Lead Over Muddled Iowa Field
description: As the Republican field of presidential candidates continues to grow, the nominating contest in Iowa becomes more muddled.

title: New York Musical Theater Festival Offers Innovative Works
description: Its not every year that a show coming out of the New York Musical Theater Festival achieves the momentum and subsequent success of Next to Normal or [title of show], past festival hits, but Broadway is hardly the only measure of success. This annual event is always a summer theater high point, offering a chance to see innovative work as its being born, and for a fraction of the average Broadway ticket price.

title: Makers of Custom Sneakers Cash In on Desire for One-of-a-Kind Goods
description: Blake Barash had just left his job as a credit analyst at Union Bank in Irvine, Calif., in 2010 when he saw an ad on Craigslist that changed the trajectory of his life.

title: Apple Music, Spotify and a Guide to Music Streaming Services
description: Different music streaming services have varying costs, platforms and catalog sizes. See how some of the most popular companies stack up against one another.

title: U.S. Can Thank Defense for Spot in Womens World Cup Final
description: The United States is undefeated in six games at the Womens World Cup and considered the comfortable favorite to win the final on Sunday.

title: On Housing, Signs of Health and Signs of Harm
description: It has been seven years since the crash of the housing market. Signs of a real-estate recovery have emerged. But problems remain.

title: Macys Drops Donald Trumps Fashion Line Over Immigrant Remarks
description: Another arm of Donald J. Trumps business empire is suffering repercussions from his presidential run: his fashion line.

title: 1915: A Lusitania Passenger Is Heard
description: LONDON  Lord Mersey yesterday heard further evidence in the inquiry into the sinking of the Lusitania. M. Joseph Marchal, professor of languages in Ontario, formerly a French army officer, who was a second-class passenger on the Lusitania, expressed the opinion that the second explosion was due partly to the explosion of ammunition. He strongly criticized the Cunard Company as regards the reduced speed of the ship, and declared that the captain was incompetent, not as regards nautical ability, but so far as war strategy was concerned, and that he proved himself a hopeless failure. The New York Herald, European Edition, July 2, 1915

title: 1965: Crisis for Common Market
description: PARIS  France today [July 1] declared a boycott of the Common Market after negotiations in Brussels failed on financial regulations for agriculture. This was seen as the Common Markets worst crisis and raised the question of its survival. Information Minister Alain Peyrefitte stated: For the moment, there is no question of France participating in new meetings about the Common Market in Brussels. In a statement dictated by President de Gaulle, Mr. Peyrefitte made it clear that France considers itself free to renounce all accords made by the Common Market since January, 1962. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, July 2, 1965

title: Indonesia Plane Crash Witnesses Heard Rumbling, Then Boom
description: MEDAN, Indonesia  For the past decade, Rudina Simbiring has run a small wooden vegetable stand in a working-class neighborhood in this sprawling metropolis, and she is used to seeing many other local shopkeepers and residents drop by each day to buy her lettuce and tomatoes.

title: A Strong Fund-Raising Start: Hillary Clinton Campaign at $45 Million
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton estimates that she has raised about $45 million since declaring her candidacy in April, according to a campaign spokeswoman, a figure that would rank among the strongest starts in presidential fund-raising.

title: Illinois Not Alone in Struggling to Pass a State Budget
description: CHICAGO  As a new fiscal year opened on Wednesday, Illinoiss leaders had no state budget, no hint of an agreement on the horizon, and no consensus about what all of it will mean for services to residents and for paying public employees and state contractors.

title: Kids in the Kitchen: Easy Sheet-Pan Chicken
description: Some of my earliest memories are of being in the kitchen while my mother cooked. First in my yellow highchair, observing and tasting, then standing on a chair next to her, helping. After she died when I was 12, cooking was a way to feel connected with her, and it still is. My daughters will never know their Grandma Janie, but they will know her recipes for Danish Puff, Brown-Edged Cookies and French Bread, and that is something. I suppose it makes sense then that Ive included my older daughter in the kitchen since she was a baby, first in a sling, then on my hip, then standing on a chair next to me while I cracked eggs into a bowl or sifted flour for a batch of chocolate chip cookies. Now, at 3, she is always eager to sift, dump, stir and cut (using this egg slicer and a blunt-nosed serrated knife).

title: Noise May Be Bad for the Heart
description: Continual exposure to traffic noise may increase the risk for cardiovascular disease, British researchers report.

title: Camouflage on the Runway
description: Designers like Valentino and Dior have been showing the military-style pattern.

title: A New Camouflage Pattern Now in Fashion for the U.S. Army
description: Just in time for the Fourth of July, the United States military is getting a new look.

title: Ex-Editor Is Acquitted in British Phone Hacking Scandal
description: LONDON  The last of the dozens of phone-hacking prosecutions of journalists from The News of the World ended on Wednesday with the acquittal of Neil Wallis, the former deputy editor, on charges of conspiracy to hack telephones between 2003 and 2006.

title: Scientists See Neurons Change as Memories Form
description: Learning can be traced back to individual neurons in the brain, according to a new study.

title: Greece Wanted to Reframe Europes Austerity Debate. It Failed.
description: Zoom out a bit from the gushing river of breaking news about Greeces fiscal future, and heres the big picture of what looks to have happened in Athens on Wednesday.

title: Iran Nuclear Talks Could Stall Over Access to Scientists and Sites
description: VIENNA  For more than a decade, the C.I.A. has closely followed the workings of one Iranian officer and his sprawling nuclear empire: Mohsen Fakhrizadeh, the relentless driving force behind what Western intelligence agencies say was Irans Manhattan Project, its effort to design a compact nuclear weapon that could fit atop a missile.

title: The Decisions That Greece Faces
description: To the Editor:

title: Absolute Transmetropolitan and Melody': A Squalid City and a Stripper Memoir
description: An occasional series on vintage comics.

title: What Leaders Are Saying About the Greek Proposal
description: European leaders weighed the latest measures from Athens.

title: Robin Thicke on Blurred Lines and Learning From His Mistakes
description: Not long ago, Robin Thicke seemed an unlikely candidate for pop stardom, let alone pop infamy. He was a curio: a white Canadian-American showbiz scion (his father is the 1980s sitcom actor Alan Thicke), who, over the course of the 2000s, transformed himself into a midlevel R&B star with a sound steeped in suave 70s soul and a core fan base of black women.

title: Advice to Build New Heathrow Airport Runway Is Clear. Political Will, Less So.
description: LONDON  About 70 years have passed since greater London got a new airport runway, seven decades of economic growth and stupendous wealth that have transformed the city into a global capital to rival New York and Paris.

title: Announcing Cuba Embassy Deal, Obama Declares New Chapter
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Wednesday announced his plans to formally re-establish diplomatic relations with Cuba this month, declaring that the two nations were ready to reopen embassies in each others capitals and to start a new chapter of engagement after more than a half-century of estrangement.

title: Puerto Rico Power Utility Makes Debt Payment
description: Puerto Ricos power authority, which supplies electricity to the islands 3.6 million people, made a $415 million debt payment that was due Wednesday after reaching a deal with its bond insurers to borrow more money.

title: Nicholas Winton, Rescuer of 669 Children From Holocaust, Dies at 106
description: Nicholas Winton, a Briton who said nothing for a half-century about his role in organizing the escape of 669 mostly Jewish children from Czechoslovakia on the eve of World War II, a righteous deed like those of Oskar Schindler and Raoul Wallenberg, died on Wednesday in Maidenhead, England. He was 106.

title: Double the Fun
description: Misha Vladimirskiys manipulated photos feature celebrities interacting with themselves.

title: The Sharing Economy Visits the Backcountry
description: Think of it as Airbnb, with lots more fresh air.

title: Chris Christie Picks Up an Endorsement, but Its Value Is Unclear
description: ASHLAND, N.H.  On his first full day as a declared presidential candidate, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey took a detour.

title: Exxon Lumbers Along to Catch Up With Gay Rights
description: A day after the United States Supreme Court affirmed same-sex marriage as a right, more than 125 Exxon Mobil employees marched in the Houston L.G.B.T. Pride Celebration for the first time. They carried an Exxon banner and wore rainbow-hued Exxon T-shirts  all with the companys approval.

title: Two World Cup Paths Diverge
description: The United States path through the Womens World Cup this year mirrored Brazils run through the mens tournament. Until it didnt. Heres a game-by-game breakdown.

title: Druid Theater Company Makes Shakespeares Histories Its Own
description: On Tuesday at the Lincoln Center Festival, the Druid Theater Company, one of Irelands most acclaimed troupes, will sit upon the ground and tell sad stories of the death of kings. A lot of stories. A lot of kings. A very particular ground.

title: In Bushwick, an Art Show Collides With a Yard Sale
description: When the artists Daniele Frazier and Trenton Duerksen opened D+T, a storefront gallery and studio space in Bushwick, they had another storefront in mind: The Store, Claes Oldenburgs 1961 studio-cum-exhibition-space on the Lower East Side. Oldenburgs experiment allowed visitors to buy anything from sculptures to one-off plaster renditions of everyday items like ice cream or sneakers  all made by the artist  for anywhere from $21.79 to $499.99. The concept of blending high and low art with commerce appealed to Frazier and Duerksen. Having an open door to your studio practice seems rarer and rarer in the art world, Frazier says.

title: Amid Strong 1st Half for Auto Sales, G.M. Saw 3% Drop in June
description: The auto industry, which at this time last year was embroiled in recall scandals that threatened to tarnish its image among consumers, just finished its best first half in recent memory.

title: Greek Prime Minister Addresses Nation
description: The Greek prime minister Alexis Tsipras made a televised address on Wednesday during which he said the government remained committed to reaching an agreement with its creditors.

title: Officials Investigate S.C. Church Fire
description: Federal and state government officials said on Wednesday that they would leave no stone unturned after the burning of a historic black church in South Carolina.

title: Worried Greek Retirees Line Up to Claim Just a Part of Pensions
description: ATHENS  At the Piraeus Bank branch on Eftihidou Street here, and across Greece, retirees lined up Wednesday for a chance to get a down payment of just 120 euros on their July pensions.

title: 36 Hours in Chengdu
description: In high-tech Chengdu, the old way of life persists, with graceful teahouses, serene parks and a lively Tibetan quarter.

title: 36 Hours in Chengdu, China
description: Chengdu might look like a typically gray Chinese metropolis of skyscrapers and chaotic traffic, but beneath the concrete exterior is one of Chinas most inviting, charming cities. Life moves just a little more slowly here. The teahouses fill up quickly on weekends with locals practicing calligraphy and cracking sunflower seeds, and at the Chengdu panda research center, the citys most famous residents seem content lazing about in trees most of the time. Recently, though, this unpretentious city has seen its economy boom as one of Chinas new high-tech hubs, luring young entrepreneurs to found creative start-ups and innovative architects to transform the skyline. Theres definitely a buzz about the place, though its hard to notice over the clacking of tiles during a rousing game of mah-jongg in the park.

title: Olly Alexander Releases His Debut Album With Years & Years
description: Skinny and gap-toothed, with a mop of brown curls now cropped and bleached platinum, Olly Alexander has parlayed his unusual good looks and boyish R&B vibrato into a diverse career. This British actor and singer has appeared in television shows including Showtimes Penny Dreadful and a bunch of indie films, and once played Peter Pan on the West End. Now his electro-pop trio, Years & Years, is set to release its debut full-length album, Communion (Interscope), on Friday, just five days before Mr. Alexander turns 25. The band plays The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon on July 16.

title: Sean Bakers Offbeat Characters, in 3 Films at Lincoln Center
description: Prince of Broadway, Starlet, and Tangerine, the must-see films in the program Sean Baker x 3 at the Film Society of Lincoln Center on July 9, explode with so much vitality that they transcend the often-gloomy neorealist genre whose boundaries they push.

title: Discovery Channel Begins Its Annual Shark Week
description: We seem to be in a particularly sharky stretch at the moment. Its the 40th anniversary of the release of Jaws. A new Sharknado film is coming July 22 on Syfy. Several shark attacks have taken place off North Carolina recently.

title: Latin Alternative Music Conference Offers Mix of Banda and Electronica
description: The annual Latin Alternative Music Conference is stubbornly devoted to slipping music from across the Americas (and Spain too) past the barriers of language and radio formats. Many of its headliners are repeat visitors, like the bilingual, quietly crafty Mexican indie-pop songwriter Ximena Sariana, who shares a free showcase on Saturday afternoon at Central Park SummerStage with Vicentico, the Argentine rocker who founded Los Fabulosos Cadillacs in the 1980s and went solo in 2001. (3 p.m. Rumsey Playfield.)

title: A Venture Capital Giant Says: Bubble? What Bubble?
description: The unicorns are multiplying, but if Andreessen Horowitz is right, the highflying venture capital community will have cause for concern when the inevitable thinning of the herd takes place.

title: ISIS Threatens Hamas
description: The Islamic State released A Message to Our People in Jerusalem over social media, warning Hamas that it will be run over by the Islamists.

title: National Youth Orchestras Big Day at Carnegie Hall
description: Writing last year in The Times, Anthony Tommasini praised the National Youth Orchestra of the United States for its fresh, urgent and weighty, richly characterized playing. Not bad for an ensemble whose members range in age from 16 to 19. The orchestra, founded in 2013 by the Weill Music Institute, has already worked with eminent conductors and soloists. On Saturday, it returns to Carnegie Hall for a program led by Charles Dutoit and featuring Berliozs Symphonie Fantastique, Tan Duns Passacaglia: The Secret of Wind and Birds and Beethovens Emperor Concerto, with the pianist Yundi Li as soloist. (8 p.m., Saturday, carnegiehall.org.)

title: Tap Dance Festival Steps Into Times Square
description: For its 15th edition, the American Tap Dance Foundations boisterous summer festival, Tap City, plants itself in the heart of Midtown.

title: Verbatim: Lindsey Graham and Uncle John McCain
description: Senator Lindsey Graham describing to MSNBC what Senator John McCains role would be if he wins the White House.

title: Cavaliers Kevin Love Is Among Stars Staying Put as Free Agency Begins
description: The early hours of N.B.A. free agency on Wednesday featured plenty of lucrative deals without much player movement. Several stars, including Clevelands Kevin Love, opted to stay with their teams, which chose to spend freely as the league waded into a new era of inflated payrolls.

title: The Rise of Sneaker Culture Tracks Coolness at the Brooklyn Museum
description: Dont ever be caught out there with a pair of grips that everybody and their mother has, Bobbito Garcia, high priest of sneaker culture, counseled in an influential essay for The Source magazine in 1991. What Mr. Garcia meant, translated, was: The harder a pair is to find, the cooler it is. Judging by that metric, the Brooklyn Museum should be the coolest place on the planet for sneakerheads with The Rise of Sneaker Culture, which opens July 10 and runs through Oct. 4. The show will include not only rare examples of prized shoes, like the original Nike Air Force 1 (a pristine 1983 pair can command $1,500), but also more than a centurys worth of footwear that united the casual, the athletic and the artful in a way that has become ubiquitous worldwide. One of the oldest existing running shoes, from the 1860s, will be featured, along with 1920s Keds. But the shows main attraction will be examples of the shoes that meshed with hip-hop, the graffiti scene and basketball subculture beginning in the 1970s to lay what Mr. Garcia calls the foundation for all the madness. (718-638-5000, brooklynmuseum.org.)

title: Obama Says U.S. Embassy Will Open in Cuba
description: President Obama announced that the United States and Cuba have agreed to open embassies in Havana and Washington.

title: Ex-Nazi on Trial in Germany Admits Complicity
description: LNEBURG, Germany  Stating that he could only ask forgiveness from the Lord, a 94-year-old former SS soldier who worked at the Auschwitz concentration camp acknowledged again on Wednesday his complicity in the Holocaust but disappointed survivors by failing to apologize for his deeds.

title: Battery Dance Festival to Kick Off Aug. 15
description: If summer is sleepy for New York dance, then the Battery Dance Festival is a caffeine boost to help tide it over until the fall.

title: Zozi Raises $30 Million in Financing
description: As it seeks to become the bridge between the travel industry and the Internet, the start-up Zozi has drawn yet more backers.

title: Six Matches Involving U.S. Women at Wimbledon, and Six Victories
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Six American women rampaged through the singles draw at Wimbledon on Wednesday, the most who could have won. Perhaps it was because of the hot weather, which resembled a typical summer day in the United States, or maybe it was the beginning of a new wave of success. But the Americans looked right at home on the smooth grass of the All England Club.

title: A Deterrent at the White House for Fence Jumpers
description: The Secret Service has decided against putting a moat around the White House to prevent fence jumpers, but it does plan to rely on something from medieval times to protect the residence: metal spikes.

title: Sugary Drinks Take a Deathly Toll
description: Consumption of sugary drinks results in some 184,000 deaths worldwide each year, a new analysis found.

title: Apple Music Is Strong on Design, Weak on Social Networking
description: WHEN I visited Microsoft many years ago, an employee cheekily compared designing Microsoft Office to making a pizza that feeds a billion people. At Apple, the company has a different saying: There are a thousand nos for every yes. In other words, they vigorously debate a feature before it shows up in a product.

title: The Photographer Who Introduces Celebrities to Themselves
description: The San Francisco-based photographer Misha Vladimirskiy, who regularly shoots for GoPro and is a member of the graphic design team Butchershop Creative, travels a great deal for his career; as a result, he spends a healthy amount of time on his own. Just over two years ago, alone and bored, Vladimirskiy started making vignettes and self-portraits of himself interacting with, well, himself  an effect accomplished using Photoshop. The practice wasnt originally intended as a grand artistic statement: It was funny, and something fun to do, he says.

title: Ex-President of Sri Lanka Says Hell Lead Opposition in Elections
description: MEDAMULANA, Sri Lanka  Six months after his defeat in presidential elections, Sri Lankas former president took the stage on Wednesday in the gardens of his home in this southern village to tell a crowd of thousands that he would lead an opposition group in parliamentary elections in August.

title: Reruns of The Dukes of Hazzard Taken Off the Air
description: TV Land has pulled reruns of the old CBS show, The Dukes Of Hazzard from its lineup, a spokeswoman for the network said Wednesday.

title: Country Music Finds a Home Far From Home, in Kenya
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Sir Elvis, dressed in a yellow and black plaid shirt, jeans, boots and a black cowboy hat, tuned his guitar under the wooden roof and neon beer advertisements of the Reminisce Bar and Restaurant. With a signal to the band, he began singing the Don Williams country hit It Must Be Love in a purring baritone. Patrons got up to dance, rocking back and forth.

title: Former Wall St. Giants Tangled in Dispute Over Missing Shares
description: The case of missing Franklin Resources stock certificates is pitting two of the most patrician names on Wall Street  onetime friends, no less  against each other in federal court in San Francisco, with conflicting narratives and accusations of extortion.

title: Searching for America (in Europe)
description: Naomi Harris has been on a trek to visit places where Europeans celebrate what they think is American culture, and vice versa.

title: Hillary Clinton, Loudly and Proudly, Taps Into a Vein of Support Among Gay Voters

title: Airlines Under Justice Dept. Investigation Over Possible Collusion
description: Federal prosecutors on Wednesday said they had begun an investigation into possible collusion among the airlines to limit seating, two years after the Justice Department approved the latest in a wave of airline mergers, saying the combination would benefit consumers.

title: Joe Manganiello Shows Off His Moves in Magic Mike XXL
description: Can a beautiful man make a womans day just by tying his shoe? Only if you have the right man, and Joe Manganiello will do. Throw in a bottle of water, a bag of Cheetos and the Backstreet Boys, and a classic movie dance is born.

title: Cubas Environmental Concerns Grow With Prospect of U.S. Presence
description: HAVANA  Like many of his countrymen, Jorge Angulo hopes the United States will lift the decades-old economic embargo against Cuba.

title: Is Weed the New Almond?
description: Broccoli, beef, and perhaps most notably almonds have all come under fire in the past year for sucking up too much of Californias scarce water. Now you can add another crop to the tally of alleged water-guzzlers: marijuana.

title: As More Tech Start-Ups Stay Private, So Does the Money
description: Not long ago, if you were a young, brash technologist with a world-conquering start-up idea, there was a good chance you spent much of your waking life working toward a single business milestone: taking your company public.

title: New Stratford Season Features Shakespeare in Love
description: The stage adaptation of the Oscar-winning film Shakespeare in Love will have its North American premiere as part of the 2016 season at the Stratford Festival in Ontario, the organization announced on Wednesday.

title: Gerson Lehrman Seeks New Image as Investor Cashes Out
description: After an insider trading investigation tarnished some firms that match hedge funds with industry experts, the industrys biggest player is trying to recast its image just as an early financial backer has cashed out.

title: European Police to Target Islamist Radicals on Social Media Accounts
description: LONDON  Europol, the European police agency based in The Hague, will create a new unit next month to discover and dismantle social media accounts used by Islamist radicals to spread their message and recruit foreigners, the agency announced on Wednesday.

title: Pictures of the Day: Germany, Switzerland and Elsewhere
description: Switzerland, Burundi and More  Pictures of the Day

title: July 1, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Switzerland, Germany, Greece and Indonesia.

title: Glen Sather Steps Down as Rangers General Manager
description: Glen Sather, who has been at the helm of the Rangers since 2000, said Wednesday that he was relinquishing his role as general manager in favor of his assistant Jeff Gorton. Sather, 71, will remain team president.

title: Maple Leafs Trade Phil Kessel to Penguins as N.H.L. Free Agency Opens
description: When the N.H.L. free-agent frenzy season began Wednesday, the Toronto Maple Leafs made the biggest move  with a trade.

title: Justice Department Sues to Block G.E. Appliance Deal
description: The Justice Department moved on Wednesday to block General Electrics plan to sell its famed home appliances division to Electrolux of Sweden, as federal regulators again showed a willingness to assert their antitrust oversight.

title: Breaking Benjamin Arrives on Top With Its First No. 1 Album
description: On the music charts this week, the rock band Breaking Benjamin has its first No. 1 album and Wiz Khalifas See You Again notches its 11th week as the top single.

title: Eurogroup Leader Wont Budge on Greece
description: Jeroen Dijsselbloem, the eurozone group president, said on Tuesday there will be no talks with Greece until that countrys referendum on a deal with European creditors planned for this weekend.

title: Classical Playlist: David Lang, Fiamma del Belcanto and More
description: DAVID LANG: The Difficulty of Crossing a Field Beverly ORegan Thiele, Laquita Mitchell, Jay O. Sanders, soloists; Douglas Kinney Frost, conductor; Harlem String Quartet(Cantaloupe Music)Mysticism and entertainment make strange bedfellows. But Mr. Langs chamber opera, based on a one-page story by Ambrose Pierce about a slave owner who vanishes into thin air while crossing a field in pre-Civil War Alabama, manages to combine pathos, satire and meditation to strangely addictive effect. Together with the librettist Mac Wellman, Mr. Lang mines the story for all its weird urgency and wonder. The music, performed by a fine roster of singers and actors against a now sparse, now seething instrumental accompaniment shows this composer at his most inventive. (Corinna da Fonseca-Wollheim)FIAMMA DEL BELCANTODiana Damrau, soprano; Gianandrea Noseda, conductor; Orchestra Teatro Regio Torino(Erato)Ms. Damrau has made her mark in a range of Italian repertory, and has been impressive at the Metropolitan Opera in recent years in works including La Traviata and La Sonnambula. On this disc she has assembled some of her favorite Italian roles from the bel canto, verismo and Verdi repertory. The selections include roles that have become her trademarks, including Violetta from Traviata, as well as parts she has yet to perform on stage, like Nedda in Pagliacci. In all the arias, Ms. Damraus impeccable technique and emotional commitment yield alluring results. (Vivien Schweitzer)BIRTWISTLE: Angel Fighter'; In Broken Images'; Virelai Andrew Watts, countertenor; Jeffrey Lloyd-Roberts, tenor; David Atherton, conductor; BBC Singers; London Sinfonietta(NMC)Harrison Birtwistle might have turned 80, but he shows no sign of slowing down. His recent work has been of stunning quality, and the ones included on this new recording are no exception: Angel Fighter, a fearsome dramatic cantata on the fight between Jacob and the Angel; In Broken Images, an homage to Gabrieli for groups of instruments imagined as choirs; and Virelai, a rethinking of a piece from the Middle Ages by Johannes Ciconia. Spare a thought, too, for the London Sinfonietta and NMC  their work for Birtwistle has been crucial. (David Allen)

title: Geographical Notes on Puerto Rico
description: Greece isnt the only debt crisis boiling over right now; theres also Puerto Rico, which I was aware was brewing but wasnt tracking carefully. Ill probably have a fair bit to say about the PR crisis once I get back from my current trip, but meanwhile a few notes.

title: Video Feature: One Last Ingredient for a Well-Stocked Bar
description: A NEGRONI, anyone? Or maybe a Jack Rose? Knowing how to make good cocktails is a great party trick and almost always more interesting than serving wine or beer to guests. And even if you are a complete cocktail novice, you can deliver delicious drinks, as long as you have the right app.

title: Lt. Gen. Robert Neller Nominated to Lead the Marines
description: WASHINGTON  The Pentagon on Wednesday announced the nomination of Lt. Gen. Robert B. Neller as commandant of the Marine Corps, ending nearly two months of uncertainty over who would lead the force as it prepares for the prospect of opening combat roles to women.

title: Our Supreme Court Reporter Sets a Personal Record and Hopes for a Break
description: Anthony Lewis, the legendary New York Times reporter and columnist, told me that the key to covering the Supreme Court is to prepare diligently, for months, in an effort to be ready for a few days of relentless activity at the end of June. But no amount of reading briefs, attending arguments, consulting law professors and interviewing lawyers and litigants could ever quite prepare you for the way this term ended.

title: Saudi Prince Alwaleed Bin Talal Vows to Donate $32 Billion to Charity
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A Saudi prince pledged on Wednesday to give away his entire $32 billion fortune to charitable causes in Saudi Arabia and elsewhere in the world.

title: Review: Ensemble LPR Plays, With Central Park as an Inspiration
description: Music of all kinds is performed by ensembles of all sizes every summer in Central Park. But not many programs are so tailored to the setting as the one Ensemble LPR presented on Tuesday evening at the Naumburg Bandshell, the second of this seasons free Naumburg Orchestral Concerts.

title: Collector Gives Back Ancient Indian Statue Said to Have Been Stolen From Temple
description: An ancient Indian statue said to have been looted from a temple and then smuggled into the United States by a longtime Manhattan art dealer was turned over Wednesday to federal agents who said that the work, an 11th-century bronze relic depicting a Hindu poet and mystic, was valued at $1 million.

title: Remarks on Mexicans Take Financial Toll on Donald Trump
description: Donald J. Trump has boasted that running for president is cheap for him, but in recent days the costs have been creeping up.

title: Video Review: Mazda Offers a Bit of Sportiness With the CX-5 Crossover
description: MAZDA is somewhat of the everymans BMW. The small Japanese companys trophy case is stuffed with awards, its design language is passionate, and there is a dollop of the magical Miata in every cars driving dynamic. And that is true even in the five-passenger CX-5 crossover.

description: Almost a year after the organizers of the New York City St. Patricks Day Parade said they were lifting a ban on openly gay groups marching, an anticipated surge in participation by gay Irish-Americans traditionally marginalized by the Roman Catholic Church has yet to materialize.

But this strip of Charleston and the lives of the people who visit and work here are far from what they were just two weeks ago, before nine people were killed during Bible study.

title: Ruth Hogben, Fashion Filmmaker, Pushes the Envelope
description: LONDON  If I didnt have fashion, I wouldnt make films, the director Ruth Hogben said. People always ask me if I want to make feature films. No. I love fashion.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Unknown Thomas Cole Paintings Found at His Home
description: CATSKILL, N.Y.  Late last year, Matthew J. Mosca, a specialist in historic paint finishes, gazed up at what looked like a scrap of wallpaper. It was jutting up from an old coat of red paint covering the walls of a pantry inside the yellow-brick farmhouse where the 19th-century artist Thomas Cole displayed paintings that revolutionized American ideas about art and wilderness.

title: Tighter Security at Prison in Dannemora, N.Y., After Escapes
description: New York States prison agency has tightened security measures at the maximum-security penitentiary from which two killers escaped last month, the agency said on Wednesday, in a tacit acknowledgment that lax controls and weak oversight helped pave a path for the breakout.

title: Sid Golds Offers Piano Bar Karaoke, Sans Show Tunes
