description: HONG KONG  Struggling to respond to precipitous declines on Chinas stock markets over the last three weeks, the countrys biggest brokerage firms unveiled a government-endorsed plan on Saturday to buy shares starting on Monday, while both of the countrys stock exchanges suspended all further initial public offerings of stock.

title: Back At My Desk (Personal)
description: It wasnt optimal to be taking a bike trip this past week, and I do feel a bit bad about having what you can see was lots of fun at a time of crisis. But Im a kibitzer, not a player, and no purpose would have been served by calling it off. Im now back, and normal blogging will resume.

title: A Co-op Pool Closing, Just in Time for Summer
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours torealestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: Insurance and Reaganomics
description: For my sins, Im debating Stephen Moore next week, so Ive been doing some reading. And one assertion on Moores part actually sent me off to do some research. In an attack on Obamacare, he ridiculed the administration for taking credit for an expansion of Medicaid:

title: U.N. Nuclear Chief Is Optimistic About Iranian Cooperation on Review
description: VIENNA  The head of the International Atomic Energy Agency said on Saturday that, with Iranian cooperation, his agency could complete an assessment on Irans suspected past nuclear work by December, potentially removing a major obstacle to a nuclear agreement.

title: Pariss Voiceless Find a Megaphone Online
description: BONDY, France  They gather every Tuesday for a staff meeting, bloggers, journalists and young people from the impoverished Paris suburbs, at the offices of the Bondy Blog, named for the surrounding neighborhood. The subject of a recent meeting: how best to challenge the leader of the Socialist Party, Jean-Christophe Cambadlis, during his appearance on a monthly talk show, The Bondy Blog Caf.

title: Samsung Merger Plan Called Unfair to Some Investors
description: Samsung has built a name for itself among consumers around the world as a leading manufacturer of smartphones, televisions and home appliances. For investors, though, its reputation is not so stellar.

title: The Story of the Cellphone With a Past Life, Continued
description: As a connoisseur of corporate bungling, the Haggler cannot resist taking a second look at the strange story, told in our last episode, of Tom Patersons smartphone. You may recall that after Mr. Patersons Nexus 5 broke down, he mailed it to a T-Mobile repair/exchange center and, nine days later, received a refurbished version of the same device.

title: Baffled by Office Buzzwords
description: When my new supervisor passed by my desk and said, Ill have to schedule your bilateral, I nodded and assumed a look that suggested I knew what he was talking about. It took some time before I was able to deduce that this would be a one-on-one meeting with my boss.

title: Small Town Maintains Hold on Residents
description: Despite dwindling job prospects, residents are drawn to Sandoint, Idaho.

title: Variety: Cryptic Crossword Puzzle
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Happy Independence Day to our American readers!

title: Pope Francis Visit to Latin America Will Test His Ability to Keep Catholics in the Fold
description: QUITO, Ecuador  Pope Francis has turned heads with bold stands on climate change and income inequality. He helped broker a historic thaw between the United States and Cuba. He has shaken up the stodgy brand of the Roman Catholic Church.

title: Nations Roars for Carli Lloyd Are Missing the Voice of a Cherished Fan
description: WEST DEPTFORD, N.J.  In a perfect world, Rudi Klobach would be gearing up for the Womens World Cup final on Sunday night, preparing to follow his same old plan for watching the United States play.

title: Cooking With Love
description: Julio Rodriguez and Dolores Batista share a love of good food. He cooks it, she eats it, and whatever he makes, her response is the same: Oh, my favorite.

title: She Wooed Him With Stew. Now He Does the Cooking.
description: Julio Rodriguez was a seasoned flirt. Tall and handsome, he persuaded women to call him just by handing them a card printed with youre beautiful and his number on the back.

title: Bailout Referendum Lays Bare Deep Schisms Among Beleaguered Greeks
description: ATHENS  Pangiotis Smailis paused from his lunch and cleared his throat with a swig of bitter retsina wine. The patrons seated around him on Friday at the Hangout, a legendary taverna inside Athenss oldest food market, had broken into a heated dispute over Greeces referendum on a European bailout, and he jabbed his finger in the air to command attention.

title: Tide Suddenly Turns Against Second-Seeded Petra Kvitova
description: WIMBLEDON, England  For the many highs and lows her young career has had, Wimbledon has remained something of a constant for Petra Kvitova, who has reached the quarterfinals or better in each of the last five years and won the tournament twice, in 2011 and last year.

title: The Selfie Election
description: Forget about waiting in line to get your baby kissed or your lawn sign autographed. Here is a gallery of campaign-trail selfies with presidential hopefuls.

title: Facing a Selfie Election, Presidential Hopefuls Grin and Bear It
description: Press that white button! This right here, the former secretary of state instructed a technologically deficient fan in New Hampshire who was fumbling to work an iPhone camera. Her patience thinning, Hillary Rodham Clinton took matters into her own hands and jabbed the button herself. And with the sound of an electronic shutter snap, another selfie  the must-have political souvenir of 2016  went up into the cloud for campaign posterity.

title: New Hampshire Voters Bemoan Size of G.O.P. Field
description: AMHERST, N.H.  The Independence Day parades across New Hampshire on Saturday turned into parades of presidential candidates, and voters like Stuart Harmon were left shaking their heads at the daunting reality of watching, hearing and judging more than 20 contenders for the White House over the next seven months.

title: LaMarcus Aldridge Says He Will Sign With San Antonio
description: LaMarcus Aldridge, one of the top free agents available in the N.B.A. this off-season, announced on Saturday that he would sign with the San Antonio Spurs, bolstering the teams aging core and instantly vaulting the franchise back into championship contention.

title: Nakia Letang: Inspiring by Example
description: Nakia Letang, 33, is an associate admissions director at Fairfield University in Fairfield, Conn.

title: State of Emergency Is Declared in Tunisia
description: TUNIS  Speaking on national television, President Beji Caid Essebsi declared a state of emergency in Tunisia on Saturday, eight days after a terrorist attack killed more than 30 foreign tourists.

title: A Few Wishes Before Baseballs All-Stars Come Out
description: The National League All-Star team trailed by two runs heading into the bottom of the eighth inning last July in Minnesota. The leadoff hitter for the American League would be Jose Abreu, a slugger for the Chicago White Sox. N.L. Manager Mike Matheny summoned Tony Watson, a reliever who throws left-handed, to face Abreu, who bats right-handed.

title: In Case You Missed It: Top Articles of the Week
description: Catch up with the most-read sports stories in The New York Times from June 26 to July 2.

title: How Therapists Mourn
description: One day, not long after his brain biopsy, I visit Joseph in the hospital, bearing two corned beef sandwiches on rye. I figure well enjoy lunch together, as best we can  he is in and out of consciousness these days.

title: National Cathedrals Repair Work: Finials, Finance and Faith
description: WASHINGTON  Its vaulted nave has been the site of presidential funerals and inaugural prayer services for almost a century. Woodrow Wilson is entombed here, as is Helen Keller. Outside, protruding from the intricate stonework of the buildings northwest tower, a limestone Darth Vader watches over the sprawling grounds.

title: Mitt Romney Criticizes Donald Trump for Comments on Mexican Immigrants
description: Mitt Romney criticized the real-estate mogul and presidential candidate Donald Trump on Saturday, saying he was damaging the Republican Party with his comments linking Mexican immigrants to crime.

title: Joey Chestnut, Hot Dog Eating Champ, Is Dethroned in Coney Island
description: Joey Chestnut, one of Americas most famous competitive eaters, missed his chance to claim a ninth consecutive victory in the annual Fourth of July Nathans Famous hot-dog-eating contest in Coney Island, Brooklyn.

title: Tiger Woods Sees How the Other Half Plays, if Not How It Lives
description: WHITE SULPHUR SPRINGS, W.Va.  The 220th-ranked player in the world arrived here on his private jet, refreshed after a vacation on his yacht in a luxury resort community in the Bahamas. That player, Tiger Woods, the 14-time major winner and former world No. 1 whose career earnings total over $109 million, returned to work the other day at the Greenbrier Classic at the Greenbrier Resort, an opulent oasis in the middle of West Virginia hill country.

title: The Appeal of Christian Piety
description: I FOLLOW a lovely blog called There Is a River, written by a young Christian evangelical named Christie Purifoy, whom I knew when we both lived in Chicago. She lives now in an old brick farmhouse in southeastern Pennsylvania. She writes about the changes in the seasons: the sudden spring flowering of her big magnolia, the last of the tomatoes. What I find moving about her words is how hard she works to adapt to the imperfections of the world, and the way she interprets disappointment as compost: Some beginnings are brown. There is nothing fresh or new about them. This insistent recasting of the negative as positive, of suffering as love, marks the writing, to my mind, as Christian.

title: Take Jackson Off the $20 Bill, Put a Woman in His Place
description: There is no question that the United States should put a woman on its paper currency. But the Treasury Departments plan to put one on the $10 bill, which currently has the image of Alexander Hamilton, is the wrong way to do it.

title: The Activist Roberts Court, 10 Years In
description: What is the most useful way to understand the direction of the Supreme Court 10 years into the tenure of Chief Justice John Roberts Jr.? After a series of high-profile end-of-term rulings that mostly came out the way liberals wanted, it is tempting to see a leftward shift among the justices.

title: Paris When It Sizzles
description: PARIS  THE turquoise tranquillity of the Cte dAzur was rocked a couple of times during the Cannes Lions Festival, the advertising worlds ros-soaked answer to the Cannes Film Festival.

title: California, Camelot and Vaccines
description: IF you had told me a while back that Id someday dread, dodge and elect not to return phone calls from a prominent member of the Kennedy dynasty, I would have said you were nuts.

title: To Stop Crime, Hand Over Cash
description: Richmond, Calif.  IN 2007, this city of about 100,000 people, north of Berkeley, had the dubious distinction of being the ninth most dangerous in America. That year saw a total of 47 homicides. In some neighborhoods, gunfire was almost a daily event.

title: What the Russians Crave: Cheese
description: RIGHT across from Gate 21 in Heathrows Terminal 4  the gate from which Aeroflots London-Moscow flight most often departs  sits the small shop of the Caviar House & Prunier Seafood Bar. One of its glass refrigerators houses a fine selection of artisanal cheeses. The shop also sells fish and, yes, caviar, but its the cheese refrigerator that Moscow-bound passengers raid several times a day, making their last-minute purchases. You cant buy this stuff in Russia anymore.

title: A Grandfathers Postcard Poems
description: MY father was a great believer in the Postal Service, and when his grandchildren were young, his postcards to them arrived almost daily. They were plain white postcards, never the photo variety, so there was plenty of room to write on both sides, and from edge to edge. What he wrote was almost always nonsense verse, with titles like The Mother of All French Fries, and Reasons to Sneeze.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: Swift Release for Detained Migrants
description: Homeland Security Secretary Jeh Johnson took a step in the right direction last month when he announced substantial changes in how the department treats migrant families taken into custody along the southern border.

title: Giving Consent to Sex
description: Should a clear yes be required, or is that unromantic and unworkable?

title: Tim Tucker
description: Tim Tucker is a beekeeper in Niotaze, Kan., and president of the American Beekeeping Federation.

title: Days of Our Digital Lives
description: WE search for doctors at 8:20 a.m., recipes at 4:52 p.m. and enlightenment at 3:16 a.m. So far, the Google data that analysts have worked with has been daily, weekly or annual, but Google recently released the same anonymous, aggregate data down to the minute. I looked at this data for New York State for four weekdays, a small sample, certainly, yet the patterns were very sharp.

title: My Own Private Baltimore
description: A FRIEND of mine told me that on the Monday morning after hed attended my first book-release party back in 2004, a co-worker asked him politely how his weekend had been. I should explain that this had not been a typical New York publishing-industry book-release party, which are less like parties than the sort of thing parties were invented as an antidote to  it was a raucous, bawdy, brawling affair in a south Baltimore dive bar. And by dive bar I do not mean a New York dive bar, which is more like a dive-themed bar with sexy barmaids and a video hunting game and $5 Pabst Blue Ribbon drafts  I mean an actual dive bar, with skanky patrons and pop country on the jukebox and cases of Miller High Life takeout at last call, a place where you might, on occasion, get punched in the face for no reason at all.

title: The Myth of Big, Bad Gluten
description: AS many as one in three Americans tries to avoid gluten, a protein found in wheat, barley and rye. Gluten-free menus, gluten-free labels and gluten-free guests at summer dinners have proliferated.

title: Enduring Summers Deep Freeze
description: ITS summertime. The season when you can write your name in the condensation on the windows at Starbucks, people pull on parkas to go to the movies and judges have been known to pause proceedings so bailiffs can escort jurors outside the courthouse to warm up.

title: The Supreme Court and the Politics of Fear
description: WHEN he ran for president the second time almost half a century ago, Richard M. Nixon made Earl Warrens Supreme Court a target of his campaign. It was a brilliant move. His accusation that the court had tilted too far in weakening the peace forces against the criminal forces, as he put it in a widely noticed 1967 Readers Digest article, resonated with a public that had seen the crime rate double since 1960. It was no longer acceptable, at least in polite circles outside the South, to denounce the Supreme Court explicitly on race, so Nixons dark warnings about a breakdown in public order (the article was entitled What Has Happened to America?) served double duty. Fear was in the air, fear that Nixon and his henchmen (Patrick J. Buchanan was the articles ghost writer) knew how to exploit.

title: Tales of Horror Should Galvanize Obama
description: IN THE MARSHLAND OF SOUTH SUDAN  BAREFOOT and shellshocked, the survivors trickle into a village here with unimaginable stories of rape, castration and mass murder committed by a government that the United States helped install.

title: Womens World Cup Final: Jill Ellis, a Serene and Innovative Tactician, Leads the U.S.
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia  Jill Ellis will coach the United States against Japan in the Womens World Cup final on Sunday, quite a geographic and cultural distance from her upbringing in England, where soccer was invented for men and discouraged for women.

title: A Packed Field in New Hampshire
description: New Hampshire voters discuss whether or not there are too many candidates in the presidential primary.

title: The U.S. Women Go on the Offensive
description: The U.S. shifted its strategy in the later stage of the World Cup to push more players forward. The change has led to a more aggressive and dynamic offensive attack.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Evoking a Stereotype and Diminishing an American Triumph

title: Indignant Jeb Bush Says He Takes Donald Trumps Remarks Personally
description: MERRIMACK, N.H.  Jeb Bush, whose wife is Mexican and three children were raised to celebrate their bicultural roots, showed a flash of anger on Saturday as he said that he absolutely took personal offense when Donald Trump recently described Mexican immigrants coming to the United States as rapists and criminals.

title: Militants and Soldier Are Killed in Kashmir Gun Battle, Indian Official Says
description: BARAMULLA, Kashmir  At least two people suspected of being militants and one soldier were killed in a protracted gun battle in a forested area near the disputed border with Pakistan in the Indian state of Jammu and Kashmir, an Indian Army official said Saturday.

title: No, Puerto Rico Isnt Greece
description: There are obvious parallels between the crisis in Puerto Rico and the disaster in Greece  a poor economy overshadowed by a huge wealthier economy to the north, budget problems, declarations that the debt is unpayable. And I dont want to minimize the problems and pain in San Juan. But its important to understand that the depth of the pain is just not of the same order of magnitude, and not just because Puerto Ricos banks are secured by a national safety net, although that helps.

title: Yankees Complete Solid First Half With a Second Straight Thriller
description: A well-executed bunt can be among the most exciting plays in baseball, but a poor one can be equally disheartening.

title: Dominican Plan to Expel Haitians Tests Close Ties
description: SABANETA, Dominican Republic  For decades, the people of Barrio Cementerio, a neighborhood divided evenly between Dominicans and Haitians, have shared a peaceful coexistence. Proximity smothered prejudice: Working side by side and raising families together helped keep tensions in check.

title: Boyd K. Packer, Advocate of Conservative Mormonism, Dies at 90
description: Boyd K. Packer, the leader of the second-highest governing body of the Mormon Church and a vigorous advocate for a highly conservative strain of Mormonism, died on Friday at his home in Salt Lake City. He was 90.

title: Officers Deaths Revive Concerns Over Dangers of Spike Strips
description: DENVER  When the police on stretches of country road want to stop a high-speed chase, they reach for their spike strips. Long and spiny like the tail of some steel porcupine, the strips are hurled into the road to flatten a fleeing suspects tires, ideally ending a dangerous pursuit in just moments. The devices sit in thousands of patrol cars across the country.

title: Protesters Challenge Hillary Clinton During Parade in New Hampshire
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton made her first visit of the campaign to northern New Hampshire on Saturday, marching in a Fourth of July parade alongside dozens of her supporters and, for the first time since she became a candidate, being met by a handful of persistent protesters.

title: Heads of State
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  This isnt carved in stone [Please stop. Stop now, Im begging you.  Ed.] but, every now and then, rumors pop up that there may be eventual additions to the subject of todays puzzle by Elizabeth Gorski.

title: Veterans Hotline Tries to Survive Without Pentagon Funds
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J.  In a row of beige cubicles in a suburban office park, a hulking former Army sergeant hunched over his phone next to a photo taken in Afghanistan, a few days before he was hurt by a roadside bomb.

title: Top-Selling Diet Drug Phentermine Is Cheap and Easy to Get
description: The Food and Drug Administration has approved several new weight-loss drugs in recent years, but the best-selling diet pill in America isnt among them.

title: In Health Law, a Boon for Diet Clinics
description: Dr. Michael Kaplan looked across his desk at a woman who had sought out his Long Island Weight Loss Institute and asked the question he often poses to new patients: Where do you think you go wrong with food?

title: Teenagers Jailing Brings a Call to Fix Sex Offender Registries
description: ELKHART, Ind.  Until one day in December, Zachery Anderson was a typical 19-year-old in a small Midwestern city.

title: U.S. Soldiers Used Restraint in Kabul Confrontation, Inquiry Finds
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A military investigation into a violent confrontation between Afghan residents of this capital city and United States soldiers last week has concluded that the troops acted with admirable restraint even after an American soldier was stabbed, a military official said.

title: If America Had a National Church
description: The Washington National Cathedral has been a place for visitors to rejoice, to mourn  and to marvel at its architecture.

title: Celebrating the Nations Independence
description: Americans marked the Fourth of July with parades, fireworks, eating contests and music.

title: Hillary Clinton Reassures Gay Youth in Viral Facebook Photo
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton offered moral support to a distraught gay youth who shared his anxiety about his future in a viral photograph posted on the Humans of New York Facebook page, telling him on Friday that it would be amazing.

title: Growing Tired of Wimbledon Matches That Become Marathons
description: WIMBLEDON, England  There will be no need for a plaque outside Court 1 at Wimbledon.

title: Mark Teixeiras Resurgence as a Leader Is All in the Finally Healthy Wrist
description: It is all about production. Mark Teixeira has learned that lesson across 13 major league seasons. People love good players and loathe bad ones. He has been both.

title: Corrections: July 5, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Sometimes theyll ask me, Dont you want a normal picture? No, I just want a selfie.

title: From a Front Row Seat, Scott Boras Notes Matt Harveys Struggles
description: LOS ANGELES  As Matt Harvey took the mound Saturday, Scott Boras, his agent, was positioned in his usual seat at Dodger Stadium, at the end of the first row just to the left of home plate. He took out a yellow legal pad and began making intricate markings that looked like math equations. He tracked every pitch, noting its velocity, its type and the result.

title: Argentine Judges Allowed to Resign After Child Abuse Ruling
description: BUENOS AIRES  Two Argentine judges whose controversial decision to reduce the sentence of a convicted child abuser provoked widespread anger here have had their resignations accepted, Argentinas state news agency reported on Saturday.

title: Predators Add Cody Bass
description: The Nashville Predators signed the free-agent forward Cody Bass to a one-year, two-way contract. Basss contract will be worth $575,000 when he is in the N.H.L. and $125,000 when he is in the American Hockey League. Bass, 28, has played 49 N.H.L. games with the Ottawa Senators and Columbus Blue Jackets since the 2007-8 season.

title: N.B.A. Testing New Technology
description: Referees in the N.B.A. summer leagues will be wearing headsets, and replay reviews will be used during games. The policies were revealed when Miami and Indiana met in the first summer-league game of the season. Referees will communicate with the help of earpieces and microphones.

title: Lukas Podolski Joins Galatasary
description: The Turkish club Galatasaray signed forward Lukas Podolski from Arsenal on a three-year contract. Galatasaray, the defending Turkish league champion, will pay 2.5 million euros ($2.8 million) for Podolski, a 30-year-old German, and an additional 500,000 ($556,000) if it qualifies for the Champions League.

title: Lady Gagas Stylist Shares the Making of Her Custom Balenciaga Met Gala Look
description: Lady Gaga attended last nights hugely anticipated Met Gala on the arm of Alexander Wang, in a look created by his Balenciaga team and Brandon Maxwell, her stylist and fashion director since 2012. Here, Maxwell recounts his preparations for her red-carpet masterpiece.

title: Jaco van Zyls First Title Is in Reach
description: Jaco van Zyl held a two-stroke lead entering the final round of the French Open, giving him a shot at his first European Tour title after he carded a seven-under-par 64 in Paris. Van Zyl has won 13 times on the Sunshine Tour, and has 17 top-10 finishes on the European Tour, including two this season while playing on a medical exemption with a brace on his leg.

title: John Traier, Mark Peterson
description: John Martin Traier and Mark Edward Peterson were married Saturday evening at Skylands Manor, an event space in Ringwood, N.J. Lawrence Kramer, a former mayor of Paterson, N.J., officiated.

title: Rebecca Rabinowitz, Shai Akabas
description: Rebecca Gayle Rabinowitz, a daughter of Judy K. Rabinowitz and Robert I. Rabinowitz of Ocean Township, N.J., was married Thursday to Shai Arthur Akabas, a son of Meg Akabas and Seth Akabas of New York. Rabbi Roly Matalon officiated at the Rockleigh Country Club in Rockleigh, N.J.

title: Heather Hoffman and Benjamin Rasmus: In for the Long Haul
description: Heather Diana Hoffman and Benjamin Fedje Rasmus were married Friday at Grace University Lutheran Church in Minneapolis. Pastor Erik Strand, a Lutheran minister, performed the ceremony.

title: S. Gerald Saliman, Raymond Vallejo
description: S. Gerald Saliman and Raymond Vallejo were married Monday at North Square Restaurant in Manhattan by Jane Sovern, who became a Universal Life minister for the event.

title: Rita DeCaria,  Andrew Zasowski
description: Rita Virginia DeCaria and Andrew John Zasowski were married Saturday evening at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden. The Rev. Jim Rooney, a Roman Catholic priest now affiliated with CITI Ministries, officiated.

title: Kelsey Osgood and Matthew Levy
description: Kelsey Osgood and Matthew Wolf Levy were married Thursday. Rabbi Steven Exler officiated at the University Club in New York.

title: Lisa Dacey,  Jennifer Snook
description: Lisa Marie Dacey and Jennifer Teser Snook were married Saturday. The Rev. Cathleen Cox, a Unitarian Universalist minister, officiated at Cornerstone Sonoma, a garden and events space in Sonoma, Calif.

title: Kimberly Dao, Jeffrey Fei
description: Dr. Kimberly Ann Dao, the daughter of Dr. Duyen T. Dao and Phat T. Dao of Pittsford, N.Y., was married Saturday to Dr. Jeffrey Zhaoke Fei, the son of Weibing Zhang and Ruian Fei of South Setauket, N.Y. The Rev. Maurine C. Waun, a Unitarian Universalist minister, officiated at the Phipps Conservatory and Botanical Gardens in Pittsburgh.

title: Rebecca Birmingham,  Matthew Weingarden
description: Rebecca Sarah Birmingham and Matthew Lewis Weingarden were married Thursday at the Friars Club in New York. Benjamin Wright, a friend of the couple and a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Emily Lawrence and Ari Rasekh
description: Emily Catherine Lawrence and Ari Daniel Rasekh were married Thursday at the Museum of Jewish Heritage in New York. Rabbi M. Mitchell Serels officiated.

title: Nicole Poteat, Emilie Dubois
description: Nicole Kathryn Poteat, the daughter of Kathryn K. Poteat and George H. Poteat of Southern Pines, N.C., was married Saturday to Emilie Anne Dubois, the daughter of Darline M. Amaral and the stepdaughter of David Amaral of North Smithfield, R.I. Rabbi Kenneth Brickman officiated at the Rosecliff mansion in Newport, R.I.

title: Kasie Gorosh,  Nathan Brill
description: Kasie Michelle Gorosh, the daughter of Rhona L. Gorosh and Alan S. Gorosh of West Bloomfield, Mich., was married Saturday to Nathan Seth Brill, the son of Linda N. Brill and Bernard D. Brill of Potomac, Md. Rabbi Harold Loss performed the ceremony at Temple Israel in West Bloomfield.

title: Arielle Siboni, Joshua Grossman
description: Arielle Nili Siboni, the daughter of Judy L. Siboni and Sylvain S. Siboni of Alpine, N.J., was married Thursday to Joshua Maxwell Grossman, the son of Ellen C. Grossman and Dr. David R. Grossman of Ocean Township, N.J. Rabbi David-Seth Kirshner officiated at the Pierre hotel in New York.

title: Kathryn Rice, Evan Weber
description: Kathryn Mary Rice, a daughter of Eileen F. Rice and Gary R. Rice of Wilton, Conn., was married Saturday to Evan William Weber, a son of Robin G. Weber and Richard S. Weber of Northbrook, Ill. Rabbi Adam Chalom officiated at the Lacuna Artist Lofts in Chicago.

title: Gabriela Jara, Edward Bersuder
description: Gabriela Jara, the daughter of Sandra E. Diaz of Medford, N.Y., and Patricio H. Jara of Stamford, Conn., was married in Hartford Thursday to Edward Thomas Williams Bersuder, a son of A. Hope Williams and Thomas J. Bersuder of Raleigh, N.C. Matt S.A. Loter, a Connecticut justice of the peace, officiated at the ceremony in Elizabeth Park that was led by the grooms father, who became a Universal Life minister for the event.

title: Tsering Norpa and Ethan Middlebrooks
description: Tsering Dolkar Norpa, the daughter of Sherab Sangmo Norpa and Nawang Rabgyal Norpa of Sunnyside, Queens, and Dharamsala, India, was married Saturday to Ethan Wilson Middlebrooks, a son of Elizabeth Bryant Middlebrooks and David J. Middlebrooks of Birmingham, Ala. Khenpo Pema Wangdak, a Tibetan Buddhist lama, performed the ceremony at the Synod House at the Cathedral of St. John the Divine in Manhattan.

title: Andrea Bernstein and Lizabeth Schalet
description: Andrea Tal Bernstein and Lizabeth Sue Schalet are to be married Sunday at the Mountain House, a vacation lodge in Keene, N.Y. Rabbi Ellen Lippmann is to officiate.

title: Irene Lee, Larry Ge
description: Irene Yih Lee and Larry Yilei Ge were married Tuesday at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau. Edwina Townes, a staff member of the New York City clerks office, officiated.

title: Elizabeth Leong and Gregory Wong
description: Elizabeth Charlene Leong and Gregory Kenton Wong were married Friday at the High Line park in New York. The officiant was the Rev. Jon Tyson, who was ordained by Trinity Grace Church in New York, where he is a pastor.

title: Lisa Sheridan,  Alexander Tarshis
description: Lisa Danielle Sheridan, a daughter of Tobey H. Sheridan and Randy Sheridan of Highland Park, Ill., was married Saturday evening to Alexander Brophy Tarshis, a son of Philippa Brophy of New York and Steven M. Tarshis of Pittstown, N.J. Rabbi Wendi Geffen officiated at the Palmer House, a hotel in Chicago.

title: Hallie George, Pavan Tankha
description: Hallie Therese George and Dr. Pavan Tankha were married Saturday. The Rev. Donald C. Oglesby, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony at the Old Stone Church in Cleveland. On Friday, the couple had a Hindu ceremony at Venue South, a banquet hall in Richfield, Ohio, that was led by Pandit Manishkumar D. Trivedi, a Hindu priest.

title: Amanda Lynn Hernndez, Sebastin Prez
description: Amanda Lynn Hernndez, a daughter of Lynn A. Mendoza of Manhattan and David Hernndez of Montrose, N.Y., was married on Friday to Sebastin Prez, the son of Migdalia A. Prez and Justo Prez, of the Bronx. Anne C. Ortelee, a friend of the brides family who was ordained by Open Ministry for the occasion, officiated at the Dumbo Spot, an event space in Brooklyn.

title: Peter Colussy,  William Recht
description: Peter Alan Colussy and William Joseph Lutz Recht were married Saturday at the McNichols Building, an event space in Civic Center Park in Denver. Alec W. Garnett, a Colorado state representative who was ordained by the American Fellowship Church, officiated.

title: Julie Kochman, William Harsh
description: Julie Nicole Kochman, the daughter of Caroline Berlin Kochman and E. Michael Kochman of Melville, N.Y., was married Saturday to William Whitman Harsh, a son of Meg Whitman and Dr. Griffith R. Harsh IV of Atherton, Calif. Eric J. Venable, a minister ordained by Shoreline Community Church in Monterey, Calif., led a nondenominational ceremony at the vacation home of the grooms parents in Telluride, Colo.

title: Sonya Pal and Gunjan Sharma
description: Sonya Pal and Gunjan Sharma were married Friday at Ocean Place Resort, a hotel in Long Branch, N.J. Pandit Krishna K. Pandey, a Hindu priest, officiated.

title: Day of Reckoning for Greek Banks and Eurozones Central Banker
description: FRANKFURT  No matter which way the Greek vote goes, the European Central Bank on Monday will face a series of agonizing decisions. Greeces future in the eurozone may well depend on how far the central bank is willing to go to prop up struggling Greek banks and prevent a total economic collapse.

title: Whats On TV Sunday
description: 9 P.M. (TMC) BABEL (2006) The director Alejandro Gonzlez Irritu and the screenwriter Guillermo Arriaga weave together four stories, set in Morocco, Tokyo, Mexico and the United States and told in several languages, to create a tapestry of misunderstandings. The cast of this Oscar nominee for best picture includes Brad Pitt, above, and Cate Blanchett as an American couple trying to move beyond the death of their infant son; Adriana Barraza as their housekeeper; Gael Garca Bernal as a reckless nephew; and Rinko Kikuchi as a deaf teenage girl. On paper, very little of it makes sense, but what is on screen has an almost physical impact, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times. In the end Babel, like that tower in the Book of Genesis, is a grand wreck, an incomplete monument to its own limitless ambition. But it is there, on the landscape, a startling and imposing reality. Its a folly, and also, perversely, a wonder.

title: 1915: Swiss Neutrality Rules
description: LONDON  The Swiss Governments new regulations for the preservation of neutrality come into force on July 15. According to a Berne message, they provide that anyone who, by written or spoken words or pictorial illustration, slanders or publicly belittles a foreign nation, its ruler, or government, is liable to imprisonment not exceeding six months, or a fine not exceeding forty pounds, or both together. The Federal Council will decide when a prosecution is necessary, and the trial will be conducted before the Federal Court and not a military tribunal. The new regulations will have the effect of removing the censorship, except for military news, from the hands of the military authorities. The press censorship in future will be entrusted to a special Censorship Committee, some members of which are journalists.  The New York Herald, European Edition, July 6, 1915

title: A Selfie Election
description: Candidates for president can now spend an hour  or sometimes two  exhausting a line of eager photograph seekers.

title: New Bike Tours of Macedonia
description: Jim Johnson, of Bike Tours Direct, was so impressed with Macedonian culture and sights that he worked with Ride Macedonia, a local outfitter, to develop Discover Macedonia,  nine-day guided tours with moderate cycling and hiking. The first one, now sold out, departs Aug. 25; the second, Sept. 23. The cost is 1,010 euros a person, about $1,093, at $1.09 to the euro. (Bike Tours Direct doesnt operate tours but represents operators in more than 70 countries.)

title: A Gay Couples Love, in Life and Death, Goes to the Supreme Court
description: Its easy to forget there are real people behind Supreme Court rulings. Back when the court announced it would hear six cases about same-sex marriage, I scrolled through the documents, waiting for anything human to jump out at me. When I read that a funeral director was a plaintiff in one, I thought, Thats weird.

title: 1940: Britain Puts Ban on Kite Flying as Safety Move
description: LONDON  In a series of new orders designed to brace the home front against invasion of fifth columnists the British government banned today [July 5] kite or balloon flying by the public, decreed that British subjects or aliens must not possess large-scale maps of these islands and gave regional commissioners power to clear roads of non-essential vehicular traffic.

title: On July 4, the Grateful Dead Show Pride in Being an American Band
description: CHICAGO  On this Fourth of July, Grateful Dead fans came prepared. They arrived at Soldier Field for the second Fare Thee Well concert wearing Uncle Sam hats, stars-and-stripes-patterned clothes and the bands red, white and blue skull-and-lightning-bolt logo. And when the Dead played the nights inevitable encore, U.S. Blues, fans had little American flags ready for the chorus: Wave that flag/Wave it wide and high. Images of the Empire State Building, lighted in a tribute to the Dead, showed on the video screen.

title: Greeks Reject Bailout Terms in Rebuff to European Leaders
description: ATHENS  Greeks delivered a shocking rebuff to Europes leaders on Sunday, decisively rejecting a deal offered by the countrys creditors in a historic vote that could redefine Greeces place in Europe and shake the Continents financial stability.

title: Stephanopoulizing
description: Forgot to mention  Ill be on This Week, fairly late in the program, talking about the obvious.

title: When It Comes to My Son, Im a Better Spectator Than Coach
description: Last month, I sat in the stands behind home plate, and watched my 8-year-old son take the field. It was probably the 100th game of his youth-baseball career; it was my first as spectator. Up until then, Id been his coach. But it was time. It was definitely time to not be his coach.

title: Unicorn: A Fitting Label for Its Time and Place
description: Aileen Lee tried a few lesser terms before she hit on unicorn. One was home run. Another was megahits. Neither quite worked for what she was going for  an unusual, mysterious word to describe what, in the tech industry, was an unusual, mysterious phenomenon: American software companies that had achieved a valuation of at least $1 billion.

title: Greece Votes on Bailout Referendum
description: The results of the referendum could redefine the countrys place in Europe and shake the Continents financial stability.

title: Charmant Hotel to Open in Wisconsin
description: The Charmant Hotel is to open in September in a former candy factory in La Crosse, Wis. The 1898 structure at 101 State Street housed the Joseph B. Funke Candy Company until it closed in 1933. Funke was the largest of La Crosses three candy companies  with a line of chocolates called Charmant, which means charming in French  and was the citys largest employer, with some 220 employees during peak production, according to the Wisconsin Historical Society.

title: Meanwhile In China
description: I am, of course, anxiously awaiting the results of Greferendum, although the next few days in Greece will be terrible whoever wins. But we shouldnt lose sight of other risks facing the world. Some of us have been worrying quite a lot about China  an economy that at market exchange rates is 40 times the size of Greece, and is severely unbalanced. And in the past month, mainly in the past few days, the Shanghai stock index has fallen almost 30 percent. This doesnt necessarily mean that the feared crisis has come, but its definitely not a good sign.

title: Chinas Market Rout Is a Double Threat
description: HONG KONG  For nearly three years, President Xi Jinping of China has crushed opposition by silencing and often locking up anyone who dares defy the government. But that aura of invincibility has been shaken by stock market speculators who have made a mockery of efforts to halt a steep slide in share prices.

title: David Sweat, Escaped Convict, Is Released From Hospital and Transferred to Upstate Prison
description: David Sweat, the New York prison escapee who was shot and taken into custody last week, was released from the hospital on Sunday morning and returned to prison, corrections officials said.

title: Ted Cruz Raises About $10 Million in 2nd Quarter
description: Senator Ted Cruz, Republican of Texas, raised about $10 million for his presidential campaign in the second quarter of the year, he announced on Sunday.

title: New, Simple Buy Buttons Aim to Entice Mobile Shoppers
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Denise Chapman, a director at a San Diego advertising agency, is afraid to count how many hours of each day she spends on her mobile phone, browsing for clothes or gifts. But when it comes time to actually buy something, instead of using her iPhone, she fires up an aging Dell computer that sits on a desk in her familys kitchen.

title: Woman Found Stabbed to Death in Bronx Park; Ex-Boyfriend Is Charged
description: Not long after the sun rose on Sunday, signaling the end of New York Citys Fourth of July celebrations, a 911 call was received.

title: Greek Voters React to Referendum
description: Greeks voted on Sunday in a high-stakes referendum on an international bailout.

title: A Puerto Rican Luminary Emerges, Piece by Glistening Piece
description: Like a deconstructed rainbow, glistening bits of tiles were spread out on a table before Manny Vega. He hunched over them, his rough hands holding each jagged bit as he gently glued them in place. Up close, they looked like a pixilated jumble. But step back, and the big picture emerged.

title: Austerity Arithmetic
description: The betting markets now believe that Greece will vote no, but nobody really knows even now. So let me take some time to do a calculation that I should have done a while ago. Heres the question: Even if you ignore everything else, can austerity policies really improve the debt position of a country in Greeces situation? If so, how long will that take?

title: Terminator Falters at Box Office
description: Old, but not obsolete. Arnold Schwarzenegger repeatedly deadpanned that line in Terminator Genisys, which opened on Wednesday, but a lot of moviegoers in North America decided otherwise.

title: A Tough Beat for a Detective: Recruiting Black Police Officers
description: The lanky black detective strode to the front of the school auditorium, grabbed the microphone and turned to face the crowd. He had a feel for the room, for the mistrust and doubt in many hearts, and a strategy to win them over.

title: Hamilton (and Mercedes) Win Again, but It Isnt a Ho-Hum Race
description: SILVERSTONE, England  There is a tradition in Formula One: After one or two uneventful races in the middle of a season dominated by one team, the fans, the media and the losing teams condemn the series as fundamentally flawed and boring and call for a re-writing of the rules.

title: Colorados Effort Against Teenage Pregnancies Is a Startling Success
description: WALSENBURG, Colo.  Over the past six years, Colorado has conducted one of the largest experiments with long-acting birth control. If teenagers and poor women were offered free intrauterine devices and implants that prevent pregnancy for years, state officials asked, would those women choose them?

title: Iran Faces Hard Choices in Nuclear Talks, Kerry Warns
description: VIENNA  Secretary of State John Kerry warned Iran on Sunday that hard choices were still needed to seal a landmark nuclear accord, and that the United States was prepared to walk away if a sound agreement could not be reached.

title: The U.S. and the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank
description: Obama is left outside in the rain.

title: Review: Marianela Nuez Enchants as Cinderella With American Ballet Theater
description: Until this summer, the Argentine ballerina Marianela Nuez has scarcely been known in New York whereas for more than 10 years shes been one of the Royal Ballets most beloved ballerinas. Suddenly, however, New York has seen her in three dissimilar roles. In the Royals weeklong season at the David H. Koch Theater at Lincoln Center (it ended on June 28), she danced the heroine of Kenneth MacMillans Song of the Earth and the pas de deux of Christopher Wheeldons Aeternum (created for her in 2013). Those roles are serious and heroic, but on Thursday, when she made her debut with American Ballet Theater in the title role of Frederick Ashtons Cinderella  the Metropolitan Opera House was packed  her qualities of humanity and radiance were abundantly apparent.

title: Atelier Versace: Fall 2015 Couture
description: Paris

title: Brook and Robin Lopez, With Identical Genes, Are Often a Study in Contrasts
description: In an attempt to win the heart of the woman he loved, Steve Urkel, the nerd at the heart of the television show Family Matters, took cool juice, transforming himself into Stefan Urquelle. The plan was not perfect, but it fulfilled the dream of outcasts everywhere to shake up the way people saw them.

title: La eleccin del papa Francisco mueve epicentro de la Iglesia hacia Amrica Latina
description: ROMA  De un solo golpe, la eleccin sorpresiva de un argentino, el cardenal Jorge Mario Bergoglio, como nuevo papa, desplaz el centro de gravedad de la Iglesia catlica romana de Europa a Amrica Latina. Y adems fue un reconocimiento clarsimo del creciente poder de los latinos.

title: Studio Museum in Harlem Unveils Design for Expansion
description: The Studio Museum in Harlem, whose ambitions have long been checked by the limitations of its 1914 building, will construct a new $122 million home designed by the British architect David Adjaye on West 125th Street.

title: Europe Wins
description: Tsipras and Syriza have won big in the referendum, strengthening their hand for whatever comes next. But theyre not the only winners: I would argue that Europe, and the European idea, just won big  at least in the sense of dodging a bullet.

title: Syrian Forces and Hezbollah Push to Bolster Border Control
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Syrian government troops and Hezbollah fighters from Lebanon pushed into the Syrian border town of Zabadani on Sunday amid heavy airstrikes, continuing an offensive aimed at strengthening their control of routes between Lebanon and Syria.

title: Israeli Cabinet Rejects Measure to Ease Jewish Conversions
description: JERUSALEM  The Israeli cabinet on Sunday rejected a proposed change that was supposed to ease the process of conversion to Judaism in Israel, a move that signaled the renewed strength of ultra-Orthodox parties in the ruling coalition formed by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu after he won parliamentary elections in March.

title: Once Wimbledons Foundation, Croquet Now Lives in Its Margins
description: WIMBLEDON, England  World-class croquet lacks the surrealism of the Queen of Hearts game in Disneys animated film Alice in Wonderland, as playing cards are replaced by rigid hoops often barely wide enough for a ball to pass through. Competitive croquet also does not include the tactical spitefulness of stepping on one ball while sending an opponents ball flying into backyard shrubbery, as in the 1988 dark comedy Heathers.

title: Not Much Goes Well for Ivan Nova, and Same Is True for Rest of the Yankees
description: Joe Girardi almost never criticizes his players, and his default setting in public is to give an upbeat version of the days events. But there was no sanitizing the facts on Sunday, when the Yankees pitched, hit and fielded poorly, seeming to take their cue from a wobbly Ivan Nova.

title: Marco Rubio Is Cubas Least Favorite Son
description: Cuba has loomed large in the Republican senators professional and personal life.

title: Marco Rubio Is Hardly a Hero in Cuba. He Likes That.
description: CABAIGUN, Cuba  In the lush countryside and teeming city neighborhoods where Senator Marco Rubios family cut sugar cane, toiled in tobacco mills and scraped by to make a better life for their children, the first Cuban-American to have a plausible chance to become president of the United States is the islands least favorite son.

title: Review: In The Billion Dollar Spy, David E. Hoffman Recalls a Cold War Spy
description: In an era of suicide bombers and ISIS beheadings, the spy dramas of the Cold War can seem tame, almost polite affairs. Central Intelligence Agency officers who worked in the Soviet capital complained about operating under Moscow rules, meaning the relentless scrutiny of the K.G.B. And they knew that any Soviet citizen caught spying faced certain execution. Still, there were rules.

title: Orchestra Musicians Head Off to Summer Camp
description: At this time of year it is a common fantasy for wage slaves who slog to the office in the city: If only work could be relocated to the mountains, or the shore, or maybe a lake. But it is a reality for many orchestra musicians, whose talents are sought by music festivals at desirable spots around the country when their concert halls and opera houses go dark for the summer.

title: Now Europe Must Decide Whether to Make an Example of Greece
description: For years now, it has seemed to any reasonably informed outsider that something was going to have to give in Greece. You surely couldnt have an economy in depression for five years and counting, in a democracy, without the people demanding a different approach, consequences be what they may.

title: Greece Rejects Austerity
description: Greek voters rejected an international bailout deal for their hemorrhaging economy.

title: Sean Baker Talks Tangerine, and Making a Movie With an iPhone
description: When the comedy Tangerine had its premiere in January at the Sundance Film Festival, it was warmly embraced by critics. Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times that it was beautifully directed. And Justin Chang of Variety touted its bracingly cinematic wide-screen look that takes on an almost radioactive glow. So it might be surprising that it was shot with a device that many viewers had in their pockets during screenings: an Apple iPhone.

title: Multi-Story Orchestra Turns a Parking Garage Into a Concert Hall
description: LONDON  The most exciting new concert space here takes some finding.

title: Quin soy yo para juzgar? se pregunta el Papa Francisco, mostrando una actitud ms abierta a los homosexuales
description: ROMA  Durante generaciones, la homosexualidad ha sido un tema tab para el Vaticano, y ha sido ignorado o tratado como un mal moral intrnseco, en las palabras del papa anterior.

title: Tapers at the Grateful Dead Concerts Spread the Audio Sacrament
description: CHICAGO  Between his first Grateful Dead show in 1988, at the age of 15, and the death of Jerry Garcia in 1995, William Walker saw the band about 130 times, a modest number in the Deadhead universe. But Mr. Walker has experienced many, many more of the bands concerts through his passion for live audience taping, collecting thousands of cassettes and terabytes-worth of digital audio, while also contributing his own recordings to the seemingly endless archive.

title: Meek Mill Is Loudly Reflective on His Second Album, Dreams Worth More Than Money
description: The first 90 seconds of Meek Mills 2012 debut album, Dreams and Nightmares, are placid  no drums, just piano and strings. Hes rapping crisply atop them, contemplative but not preachy. The build begins. The beat drops. He goes from speaking to shouting. The effect is that of a missile strike on a rural pond. Its one of the great triumphant moments in recent pop, and it suggested that for every time Meek Mill was wielding his words like a billy club, there was a meditation just underneath.

title: Pass the Coleslaw
description: MONDAY PUZZLE The rule when solving a Lynn Lempel puzzle is that you must smile while you work it. You most likely wont be able to help yourself, what with the smoothness and fun entries, anyway.

title: Review: Tree of Codes Flaunts Jaw-Dropping Effects
description: MANCHESTER, England  Tree of Codes, a new work by Wayne McGregor, Olafur Eliasson and Jamie xx, inspired by Jonathan Safran Foers book of the same name, is the Manchester International Festivals first major dance commission. This work uses dancers from Mr. McGregors company and the Paris Opera Ballet, an unusual combination that, along with its illustrious collaborators, helped build excitement. At the premiere here on Friday night, audience members screamed and cheered as they gave Tree of Codes a standing ovation.

title: Eurozone Central Bank Now Controls Destiny of Greeces Battered Banks
description: FRANKFURT  Now that Greek voters have said no to the economic demands of its international creditors, the fate of the countrys struggling banks is in the hands of the European Central Bank.

title: Review: Tough Love on PBS Examines Custody Battles With the State
description: Tough Love, a documentary on PBSs POV series on Monday night, tells two stories of parents fighting to regain custody of children who were taken away from them. Both reflect the typical nature of child-welfare cases, which makes them atypical subjects for a film: The children were removed not because they were abused but simply because their parents were deemed unable to care for them.

title: Pope Francis Lands in Ecuador to Begin South America Trip
description: QUITO, Ecuador  Met by indigenous children in traditional garb and a stiff Andean wind that blew the white skullcap off his head as he emerged from his airplane, Pope Francis arrived here on Sunday to start a three-nation tour that will take him to some of the poorest and yet most environmentally rich countries of his native continent.

title: Egypt Warns Journalists Over Coverage of Militant Attacks
description: CAIRO  To the list of urgent threats facing Egypt, including militants behind assassinations and car bombings, Egyptian officials have warned of another danger in recent days: journalism, or at least the kind of reporting that strays from the government line.

title: Ending Greeces Bleeding
description: Europe dodged a bullet on Sunday. Confounding many predictions, Greek voters strongly supported their governments rejection of creditor demands. And even the most ardent supporters of European union should be breathing a sigh of relief.

title: Con Francisco, un Vaticano ms humilde y al servicio de los pobres
description: CIUDAD DEL VATICANO  Ha criticado el culto al dinero y la codicia que domina el sistema financiero mundial, demostrando cierta afinidad por la teologa de la liberacin. Funcionarios del Vaticano no logran seguirle el ritmo con sus comentarios improvisados y sus incursiones espontneas entre las multitudes que colman la Plaza de San Pedro. E incluso tiene encantados a los vendedores de recuerdos del Vaticano por el aumento de turistas.

title: South Carolina Legislators Gird for Confederate Flag Debate
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  The South Carolina legislature is expected on Monday to take up the fate of the Confederate battle flag that flies on the State House grounds, responding to demands that it be removed after the June 17 massacre of nine people at Emanuel A.M.E. Church in Charleston.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of July 6
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: War Veterans Lead the Way in Reconciling Former Enemies
description: DA NANG, Vietnam  The American and Vietnamese war veterans, former enemies, sat together at wooden picnic tables eating hamburgers and chili while Creedence Clearwater Revival played in the background.

title: Jane Aaron Dies at 67; Her Film Animation Sprouted on Sesame Street
description: Jane Aaron, a filmmaker and childrens book illustrator who brought young viewers the letter X, the numbers 1 through 20 and other lessons in dozens of instructive animated shorts on Sesame Street, died on June 27 in Manhattan. She was 67.

title: Indias Leader Maps Out a More Robust Digital Future
description: NEW DELHI  Standing alongside some of the titans of Indian industry and senior ministers in his cabinet, Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the start of a Digital India week at a packed stadium in the capital last week, highlighting his governments push for greater Internet connectivity and services for more of the countrys people and a desire to jump-start Indian manufacturing in electronics.

title: Jason Pierre-Paul Injures Hand With Fireworks
description: Since March, Jason Pierre-Paul, the Giants best defensive player, has declined to sign the one-year contract offered by the Giants when they designated him as their franchise player. Pierre-Paul has instead been hoping for a long-term deal.

title: With Merging of Insurers, Questions for Patients About Costs and Innovation
description: The nations five largest health insurance companies are circling one another like hungry lions closing in on prey.

title: Drought Sends U.S. Water Agency Back to Drawing Board
description: FOLSOM, Calif.  Drew Lessard stood on top of Folsom Dam and gazed at the Sierra Nevada, which in late spring usually gushes enough melting snow into the reservoir to provide water for a million people. But the mountains were bare, and the snowpack to date remains the lowest on measured record.

title: With Greek No Vote, Tsipras Wins a Victory That Could Carry a Steep Price
description: ATHENS  Now comes the hard part.

title: Pow! Gay Comic Book Characters Zap Stereotypes
description: Mainstream comic book publishers have tried for years to draw a more diverse readership by incorporating gay characters and story lines.

title: Manhunt Over and Patrols Gone, Calm and Quiet Return to Dannemora
description: DANNEMORA, N.Y.  For the first time in weeks, Cook Street was free of television news trucks  the swarm of journalists had moved on. Children played in their front yards and rode bikes, their voices carrying to the next block. Out-of-town cyclists appeared from time to time, blurs of colorful spandex and purring freewheels, once again enjoying the hills unimpeded by police roadblocks and traffic.

title: A Migrant Mothers Anguished Choice
description: GELUGOR, Malaysia  Carrying one child in her arm, a second on her back and holding the hand of a third, Hasinah Izhar waded waist-deep through a mangrove swamp into the Bay of Bengal, toward a fishing boat bobbing in the dusk.

title: The Big Rock in Riverside Park
description: Dear Diary:

title: I.R.S. Expected to Stand Aside as Nonprofits Increase Role in 2016 Race
description: WASHINGTON  As presidential candidates find new ways to exploit secret donations from tax-exempt groups, hobbled regulators at the Internal Revenue Service appear certain to delay trying to curb widespread abuses at nonprofits until after the 2016 election.

title: In a Rout and a Romp, U.S. Takes World Cup
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia  The Womens World Cup began uncertainly for midfielder Carli Lloyd. But it quickly built toward predatory dependability, then concluded Sunday in a display of startling deliverance.

title: The Dominican Republic Must Stop Expulsions of Haitians
description: A HUMAN rights crisis is unfolding on the island of Hispaniola, which is shared by the Dominican Republic and Haiti.

title: White Supremacists Extend Their Reach Through Websites
description: In late June, as much of the nation mourned the killing of nine parishioners in a Charleston, S.C., church, The Daily Stormer, a white supremacist website, was busy posting articles on a different issue: black crime against white people. Adolescent Ape Jailed for Murdering White Man Out of Boredom, one headline blared.

title: Emphatic No Prompts Greek Pride and Revelry
description: ATHENS  As news spread of the surprisingly strong victory for the no side in Sundays referendum on the terms of a European bailout offer, Greeks poured into Syntagma Square, which has been the site of many historic political demonstrations.

title: Mets Feed Off Steven Matzs Poise During Rout of the Dodgers
description: LOS ANGELES  In the first inning Sunday, Steven Matz stared down Adrian Gonzalez, the Dodgers slugger who had homered twice in his last two games against the Mets. Matz tried to make a statement. He hurled a 95-mile-per-hour fastball, challenging Gonzalez, one of the games best hitters.

title: Stan Lee and Michelle Phan Help Line Webtoon, Digital Comics Site, Expand in U.S.
description: Comic books are known for unlikely pairings  from the classic meeting of Superman and Spider-Man to the more recent face-off between Archie Andrews and the movie alien Predator.

title: Greeks in New York Talk and Cheer, Then Debate Future After Referendum
description: It did not matter if they had left decades or mere months ago, pushed out by unemployment. Greeks in Astoria, the Queens neighborhood of blue-and-white flags and Orthodox churches, were riveted by the drama unfolding in Athens and anxious about what the coming days would hold for their homeland.

title: On the Trail, Every Day for 30 Years
description: Just after 7 a.m. on a sunny Wednesday in June, a 61-year-old woman darted in front of taxis in Columbus Circle outside Central Park. A few seconds later, she proclaimed  to no one, to everyone  how great it was to be alive.

title: Review: Oklahoma! Preserves a Classic While Adding Punch
description: ANNANDALE-ON-HUDSON, N.Y.  Its a brash, fresh wind thats sweepin down the plain of Oklahoma! these days, the kind that dispels mists and must. Daniel Fishs vibrant, essential excavation of Rodgers and Hammersteins 1943 classic  which opened on Thursday at the Richard B. Fisher Center for the Performing Arts at Bard College  asks that we listen with virgin ears to the show that changed the course of the Broadway musical.

title: Abby Wambach, U.S. World Cup Teams Soul, Soars Despite a Lesser Role
description: During this womens World Cup, Abby Wambach, the soul of the United States team, called herself clairvoyant. A seer. A fortune teller.

title: With Terminator Genisys, David Ellison Stops Playing It Safe
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif.  David Ellison, the 32-year-old son of Larry Ellison, the billionaire Oracle founder, sat in a temporary office here in early June and offered his take on Hollywood  lessons learned from five years of producing big-budget movies like his Terminator Genisys, which was then just a few weeks from opening.

title: Global Markets Dip After Greek Referendum
description: PARIS  Global stock markets mostly dropped on Monday but did not plunge, as investors reacted with muted dismay to the results of the Greek referendum and showed nervousness about steep declines in Chinas stock market over the last three weeks.

title: A $530 Motivational Tool That Helped Turn CoCo Vandeweghe Around
description: WIMBLEDON, England  CoCo Vandeweghes reward for a first-round loss in the qualifying round at Acapulco, Mexico, last year was a $530 check, barely enough to pay for her hotel room and meals. In a sport where the best players count their winnings in the millions of dollars, this was the turning point.

title: Misty Copeland of American Ballet Theater to Join On the Town
description: Misty Copeland, the ballerina who made history last week when she became the first African-American woman to be named a principal dancer with American Ballet Theater, is taking on a new challenge this summer: She is heading to Broadway.

title: True Detective Recap: Some Bounce Back, Others Descend
description: This post has spoilers for Sundays episode of True Detective.

title: Next Steps After Greek No Vote; Comic-Cons 46th Year
description: With the Greek no vote on the economic demands of its creditors on Sunday, attention now turns to the European Central Bank. The central bank has been propping up Greeces banks, though just barely in the week since the Greek prime minister called for the referendum. On Monday, the central banks policy makers plan to meet to determine their next step, though they may wait to see what eurozone heads of state decide at an emergency summit meeting on Tuesday. Phyllis Messinger

title: Watermill Centers Summer Speakers Include Philip Glass and Pussy Riots Nadezhda Tolokonnikova
description: Pussy Riots Nadezhda Tolokonnikova and Philip Glass are among the speakers for the Watermill Centers coming summer lecture series. The center, an artists and performers laboratory in Water Mill on Long Island founded by the director and artist Robert Wilson in 1992, has hosted this free lecture series for more than 10 years, presenting leading voices in the arts, sciences, and humanities.

description: The United States jumped out to an early lead in Sundays Womens World Cup final behind a hat-trick from midfielder Carli Lloyd and held on to win, 5-2.

description: Greeks delivered a rebuff to Europes leaders, rejecting a deal offered by the countrys creditors.

title: M.L.B. All-Star Lineup Not Quite as Flush With Royals (4) as It Might Have Been
description: With baseballs All-Star Game returning to Cincinnati for the first time since 1988, and with Pete Rose cleared to participate in the festivities, there will be a distinct Reds flavor at Great American Ball Park on July 14.

title: The Faces Before the Womens World Cup Face-Off
description: There was no shortage of festive apparel for spectators at the Womens World Cup final between the United States and Japan.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Weve reached our limit. This is not a society of beggars.

title: Whats on TV Monday
description: 8:55 A.M. (FXM) THREE CAME HOME (1950) Claudette Colbert stars as Agnes Newton Keith, an American writer living with her British husband (Patric Knowles) and 4-year-old son (Mark Keuning) in colonial comfort in 1942 North Borneo, in this adaptation of Ms. Keiths memoir. Then Japanese soldiers attack Pearl Harbor, and Agnes and her child are taken to a prisoner-of-war camp. Sessue Hayakawa, the silent-film actor, plays the Japanese officer who, despite his cruel treatment of other captives, befriends Ms. Keith out of admiration for her literary talents  even while failing to save her from torture. Played against realistic settings, which vividly convey the meanness of the jungle prisons, and directed by Jean Negulesco for physical and emotional credibility, Three Came Home is a comprehensive film, Bosley Crowther wrote in The New York Times. It will shock you, disturb you, tear your heart out. But it will fill you fully with a great respect for a heroic soul.

title: Grateful Dead Break Soldier Field Records
description: Theres been a fair share of grumbling from fans over the Grateful Deads handling of that bands final concert tour. (Its just a huge, pathetic money grab, Alan Mande, a longtime fan, told The New York Times recently.) The backlash did not seem to have hurt sales, though: The band broke the attendance record at Soldier Field in Chicago two nights in a row.

title: Corrections: July 6, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Rift Emerges as Europe Gears Up for New Talks on Greece Bailout
description: ATHENS  Germany continued to maintain a hard line with Athens on Monday, just a day after Greek voters decisively rejected a bailout deal from its creditors. But some European countries showed a willingness to soften the push for austerity that has proved so contentious.

title: The Grateful Dead Close Out Their Final Concert With Music and the Words Please, Be Kind
description: CHICAGO  There were tears among the tie-dyed and enough hugs to recall Haight-Ashbury at its most loving as the surviving members of the Grateful Dead played their fifth and final Fare Thee Well concert on Sunday night at Soldier Field, having vowed it would be their last as a group.

title: Finding the Right Types in August Sanders Germany
description: Artists have always been difficult to categorize, something August Sander might have learned when he embarked on his ambitious project to create a complete typological survey of German society through his photographs.

title: After Marriage Equality
The Hero and the Nazi
description: The lives of two old men from opposing sides in World War II intersected last week in a vivid reminder of how the horrendous events of the Holocaust are fading inevitably into history.

title: Bring Back Prostate Screening
description: MELVILLE, N.Y.  FOR years, research on prostate cancer has sought an approach to screening that is more individualized than a one-size-fits-all measurement of the level of prostate-specific antigen in a mans blood. These efforts are now paying off.

title: How Los Angeles Is Becoming a Third World City
description: LOS ANGELES  A GENERATION ago, this West Coast metropolis became a third world city. At least in the rhetoric of certain East Coast thinkers.

title: The Democrats Fractured Views on Trade
description: One way to think about the recent fight between President Obama and Democratic lawmakers over trade agreements is that the fight is part of the larger debate among liberals over what policies are best at creating good jobs and raising wages.

title: Lessons of New Yorks Prison Escape
description: Its a good thing that the Federal Bureau of Investigation opened a corruption inquiry at the maximum security prison in northern New York where prison workers smuggled in tools, including hacksaw blades, that helped two convicted murderers to escape last month.

description: To the Editor:

title: Singapore Frees Amos Yee, 16, Blogger Who Criticized Lee Kuan Yew
description: HONG KONG  A teenage blogger who was convicted of two charges after criticizing Lee Kuan Yew, the founding father of modern Singapore, was released on Monday after a court sentenced him to four weeks detention, which he had already served.

title: Free Hotel Wi-Fi Is Increasingly on Travelers Must-Have List
description: Travelers sometimes compare Wi-Fi to hot water, electricity or air  and when wireless access at a hotel shows up as a line item on their bill, they tend to make a few other comparisons as well.

title: Awaiting Iran Deal, Nuclear Sleuths Gather Sophisticated Tools
description: VIENNA  On the outskirts of this graceful city, the Iran Task Force of the International Atomic Energy Agency is preparing to move quickly if American and Iranian negotiators here manage to cut a deal on Irans nuclear program in the coming days.

title: Cannabis Construction: Entrepreneurs Using Hemp for Home-Building
description: STUYVESANT, N.Y.  It started with Hurricane Katrina: the flooded houses in New Orleans festering with mold, many uninhabitable to this day. Then came the earthquake in Haiti: thousands dead, crushed by homes that should have been their sanctuaries.

title: Chinese Share Sell-Off Spills Over to Hong Kong
description: HONG KONG  Heavy government-coordinated purchases pushed up the value of large companies shares on mainland Chinese stock exchanges on Monday, interrupting at least temporarily a three-week downturn. But shares in smaller and midsize companies, which make up as much as two-thirds of the market by value, kept falling.

title: The Brunello Bunch
description: Mens fashion insiders describe their looks during a dinner party hosted by the luxury-brand mogul Brunello Cucinelli.

title: Mondays Travel News and Tips
description: Our weekday morning digest that includes consumer news, deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

description: This feature looks at some of the earliest mentions of famous names or terms in The Times. Have an idea for someone or something you would like to read about? Leave a suggestion in the comments section.
