title: 1890: Husband Poisoners Convicted
description: VIENNA  The Assize Court of Mitrowitz, in Hungary, yesterday [July 6] concluded its trial of ten peasant women arraigned for poisoning their husbands. Four of the prisoners were sentenced to death, one to penal servitude for life, three to fifteen years penal servitude, and two were acquitted. The evidence disclosed that the murderesses acted with the most cold-blooded premeditation; nor were their crimes extenuated in any way by ill treatment received at their husbands hands. On the contrary, the husbands seem to have been good fellows, and it does not appear that their wives cherished any strong animosity against them.  The New York Herald, European Edition, July 8, 1890

title: Amy Schumer, Aziz Ansari to Headline Oddball Comedy Fest
description: Aziz Ansari and Amy Schumer  two busy multiplatform star comics  will headline the new Oddball Comedy and Curiosity Festival, which will travel to 18 cities starting Aug. 28 in Kansas City, Mo., and ending Oct. 18 in Dallas.

title: Scot Breithaupt, Who Blazed a Trail in BMX, Dies at 57
description: Scot Breithaupt was a motocross racer for Yamaha who liked to ride his motorcycle on a rugged dirt track in Long Beach, Calif. One day in November 1970, he noticed that he was being followed by teenagers pedaling Schwinn Sting-Rays.

title: Avoiding a Climate Inferno
description: The current issueof Science features a short, but forceful editorialby the journals editor in chief, the geophysicist Marcia K. McNutt, calling for humanity, after decades of delay, to get serious about cutting greenhouse-gas emissions linked to global warming.

title: Roasted Monkfish, a Dish to Fool Lobster Lovers
description: I love the French term for whole monkfish tail, gigot de mer, which means leg of lamb of the sea. Its an apt description for this meaty fish, which has a texture more akin to lobster than to flaky white-fleshed fish, and a shape that is somewhat reminiscent of a leg of lamb.

title: Exor Revises Its Takeover Bid in Appeal to PartnerRe Investors
description: LONDON  In its effort to woo the reinsurance firm PartnerRe, the Italian investment company Exor has sweetened its unsolicited takeover bid as it takes its case directly to investors.

title: Summer Reading Contest Winner, Week 2 | Reshaping Our Views of North Korea
description: Though many features on The Learning Network are on a July hiatus, our Sixth Annual Summer Reading Contest is going strong.

title: With Tempura Matsui, Fine Tempura Dining Arrives in New York
description: New Yorks first fine tempura tasting restaurant, Tempura Matsui, is set to open next week. It is owned by America Ootoya, part of a Japanese restaurant company. Diners can devote a couple of hours to eating delicately fried seafood and vegetables, one modest piece at a time, just as it is done in Japan.

title: In Key & Peele Season Premiere, a Shift in Tone and Volume
description: When Key & Peele made its debut on Comedy Central in 2012, it involved a lot of yelling. The shows signature Anger Translator sketches were predicated on the contrast between the button-down cool of Jordan Peeles Barack Obama and the volcanic squawks and wails of Keegan-Michael Keys Luther, the man hired to express the presidents hidden emotions. Mr. Key also got to pump up the volume as Mr. Garvey, the volatile substitute teacher bedeviled by his white suburban students. Two of the shows most vivid characters, the mean girl Meegan (Mr. Peele) and her boyfriend, Andre (Mr. Key), spent their time shouting at each other outside clubs.

title: Do Moralists Make Bad Novelists?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Alice Gregory and Pankaj Mishra discuss whether moral preoccupations have a place in good fiction.

title: Garbie Muguruza Is Excelling on, of All Things, Grass
description: WIMBLEDON, England  In an era when Spanish men have been staples of top-tier tennis, Wimbledon sees the countrys flag carried on by a woman: Garbie Muguruza, who has outlasted all the men by reaching the semifinals.

title: The Age of Super PACs
description: The 2016 race could be the most expensive in history, in part because of spending by super PACs. Legally, the groups cannot coordinate with candidates, but there is plenty of wiggle room.

title: Super PACs Take On New Role, Organizing Voters
description: IOWA CITY  College students supporting Rand Paul for president were out in force going door to door in this university town recently, using their iPad Minis to help identify Republicans committed to voting for the Kentucky senator in next years Iowa caucuses.

title: Couture Slots! Chanel Spends a Day at the Casino
description: Weve seen everything from a supermarket to a brasserie; and today, Karl Lagerfeld upped the ante by turning Chanels fall 2015 couture show into a giant, bustling casino. As guests entered Pariss Grand Palais, they were greeted by the sight of Chanel-branded slot machines and roulette tables. When the show began, celebrities  including Julianne Moore, Kristen Stewart, Rita Ora, Lara Stone, Lily-Rose Depp and Vanessa Paradis  walked out in their best Chanel eveningwear, took a seat at the tables in the center of the room, and began to play roulette. Next, models including Binx Walton and Sasha Pivovarova came out in severe, Kabuki-like wigs with strong, dark eyebrows and bright red, matte lips. They wore an updated assortment of Chanels signature tweeds, long, lace dresses with white collars, and evening dresses with elaborate beading and feathers. And, since no Chanel show would be complete without one, the spectacle ended with a Couture bride: this time, it was Kendall Jenner, who took a trip around the room in a white suit with a long tulle veil. It was as if Bianca Jagger had spent a day in Vegas.

title: Donald Trump, Chris Christie and the Republican Race to the Bottom
description: While your attention is riveted on the competition for the Republican presidential nomination (well, maybe not riveted, or even focused, but maybe occasionally mildly interested), there is another contest among Republican politicians  to say the most obviously ridiculous thing that pops into their heads.

title: Jacobs Pillow Director to Depart for Mellon Foundation
description: Ella Baff, the executive and artistic director of Jacobs Pillow Dance Festival, will be leaving the organization to join the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation as senior program officer for arts and cultural heritage starting in October.

title: Senator Tim Scott Sees Barriers Coming Down, After Charleston Church Attack
description: ANDERSON, S.C.  Along the storied hallways of the United States Capitol, Senator Tim Scott moves quietly, often disappearing behind his loquacious Senate colleagues and frenetic staff.

title: What Uber Can Learn From Airbnbs Global Expansion
description: Last week, the home-sharing service Airbnb had more than 40,000 listings in Paris, making the French capital the companys most popular destination for travelers looking to rent a room or an entire apartment. Paris officials applaud it for bringing innovation to the citys hotel industry.

title: Judge Rejects JPMorgans Effort to Investigate Time Warner Center Condo
description: In a ruling that illustrates the difficulty unraveling shell companies, a federal judge has rejected an effort by JPMorgan Chase to investigate the ownership of a Time Warner Center apartment.

title: Eurogroup President on Reform Proposals
description: Jeroen Dijsselbloem, president of the eurozone finance ministers, spoke on Tuesday about the next steps in debt negotiations between Greece and the European Union.

title: A New Pineapple Rum, With a Nod to Dickens
description: Many of Charles Dickenss characters like to drink as much as their creator did. They fill pages by availing themselves of a glass of this or a bowl of punch. For this reason, Dickenss novels have proved useful as windows into 19th-century drinking habits. And now, one character has lent his name to a new spirit.

title: Marco Rubios Education Plans Echo Some Obama Ideas
description: Senator Marco Rubios economic speech in Chicago on Tuesday criticized the failed Democratic policies of the past and called for the need to unleash American innovation. But when it came to education policy, some of presidential candidates proposals had a familiar ring to them.

title: Spring Awakening Is to Return to Broadway in Deaf West Production
description: Spring Awakening is returning to Broadway. Presented by Deaf WestTheater, the 18-week engagement will open on Sept. 27 at the Brooks Atkinson Theater, and will be performed simultaneously in American Sign Language and spoken English.

title: Thieves Grab Bomb Parts at French Military Base
description: PARIS  Thieves were able to penetrate a French military base in the south of France and escape with bomb-making matriel, despite heightened security in the wake of a terrorist attack at a gas and chemical factory last month.

title: 1965: One of Israels Founders Dies
description: JERUSALEM (Israeli Sector)  Former Premier Moshe Sharett, 70, one of the founders of the State of Israel, died here today [July 7] of cancer. Mr. Sharett was the first foreign minister of the State of Israel from the time of its creation in 1948 until 1956. During part of that time  from 1953 to 1955  he was premier. A joint statement today by the government of Israel, the World Zionist Organization and the Knesset (parliament), said that Mr. Sharett was one of the true nobility of the House of Israel.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, July 8, 1965

title: Fat Stigma Fuels Weight Bullying
description: Being fat is the most common reason children are bullied, and something needs to be done about it.

title: Syracuses Spike Epidemic
description: One of the poorest cities in America has become a hotbed for synthetic marijuana.

title: CVS Health Quits U.S. Chamber Over Stance on Smoking
description: The CVS Health Corporation said on Tuesday that it would resign from the U.S. Chamber of Commerce after revelations that the chamber and its foreign affiliates were undertaking a global lobbying campaign against antismoking laws.

title: Bill Cosby Admission About Quaaludes Offers Accusers Vindication
description: She was 19 and visiting her mother when, Therese Serignese recounted later, she met Bill Cosby in the gift shop at the Las Vegas Hilton in 1976.

title: Republicans Aim to Hamper Obamas Policies With Spending Bills
description: WASHINGTON  From environmental and work force regulations to health care and contraception, congressional Republicans are using spending bills to try to dismantle President Obamas policies, setting up a fiscal feud this fall that could lead to a government shutdown.

title: A (Real, Former) Fortress of (Luxurious) Solitude
description: While you can occasionally hear the loud techno beats of party boats passing by  carrying visitors to snorkel in the deep blue water  Cap Rocat, which hugs the craggy coastline of the bay of Palma de Mallorca, is a departure from the scene of discotheques and nightlife that draws many tourists to the island. And no one under the age of 15 is allowed to stay at the former 19th-century military fortress that in 2010 was converted to a privately owned 28-room hotel. (Given the catwalks over dry moats, private terraces perched on fortified ramparts, and steep roads descending to the rocky edge of the Mediterranean Sea, the rule is not entirely unwarranted.) Meticulously refurbished by the Spanish architect Antonio Obrador, what were once surveillance points are now three luxury suites called the Sentinels  private enclaves carved into the rocks, complete with their own plunge pools, which opened in June. The military drills have been replaced with a burgeoning breakfast of fresh bread, fruit and eggs, delivered to each room in large wicker baskets. And an airy hilltop cabana houses a spa, where the natural breeze off the sea is a free addition to any treatment.

title: Music Rights Group Is Buying Harry Fox Agency
description: The Harry Fox Agency, a clearinghouse for songwriting rights that has been a mainstay of the music publishing business since 1927, is being sold to Sesac, another rights group, for slightly more than $20 million, according to several people briefed on the deal who spoke on condition of anonymity because they were not authorized to discuss it.

title: Armani Priv: Fall 2015 Couture
description: Paris

title: Houthi Supporter Reacts to Airstrike
description: A Houthi supporter in Sana, Yemen, on Tuesday reacted to a Saudi airstrike on rebel political offices. A pause in the fighting was announced Thursday.

title: Your Spending Choices Often Reflect Your Values
description: I have a crazy idea I want to run by you. Imagine that a cultural anthropologist finds one of your credit card statements in 100 years. What would your spending suggest you value the most? Based on your spending, what assumptions might someone make about how you live your life?

title: Panel Calls W.H.O. Unfit to Handle a Crisis Like Ebola
description: UNITED NATIONS  More than a year after the Ebola epidemic began tearing through three of the worlds most fragile countries, the World Health Organization remains unfit to handle a public health emergency, an independent panel concluded in a blistering report issued Tuesday.

title: Document in Cosby Case
description: A deposition unsealed in a case brought against Bill Cosby in 2005 by Andrea Constand, a staff member with the basketball program at Temple University, Mr. Cosbys alma mater.

title: Man Booker International Prize Changes Its Focus
description: The Man Booker International Prize is getting a major makeover. The Booker Prize Foundation said Tuesday that, starting next year, the literary award will be given annually to a single book of fiction translated into English and published in Britain.

title: Germans Forget Postwar History Lesson on Debt Relief in Greece Crisis
description: As negotiations between Greece and its creditors stumbled toward breakdown, culminating in a sound rejection on Sunday by Greek voters of the conditions demanded in exchange for a financial lifeline, a vintage photo resurfaced on the Internet.

title: Harry Shearer to Return to The Simpsons
description: Goodiddly news neighborinos: Fox announced on Tuesday that all six primary voice actors will return to The Simpsons for its record-setting 27th and 28th seasons. This includes Harry Shearer, who in May indicated that he planned to leave the animated comedy, the longest-running scripted show in television history.

title: Californias Drought Changes Habits in the Kitchen
description: SANTA CRUZ, Calif.  Andrea Nguyen, who writes cookbooks for a living, knows that making pho in a pressure cooker is not the solution to Californias drought. Still, developing a reasonable version of the Vietnamese noodle soup that can be made in less than an hour, with half the water, matters to her these days.

title: Horizon Pharmas Bid for Depomed Leaves Room to Grow
description: The latest pharmaceutical industry acquisition attempt leaves lots of room to grow. Horizon Pharmas $1.75 billion unsolicited offer for its American rival Depomed continues the sectors deal-making trend, fed by tax savings and cost cuts. Horizon is a relatively recent arrival on the scene, though, and its low debt load and small size mean it could easily expand.

title: Hannibal Buress on His New Show, Justin Bieber and Hawaiian Shirts
description: It might be hard to believe, but Why? With Hannibal Buress, which begins  Wednesday on Comedy Central, is that comics first solo TV show.

title: A Canadian Clothing Line Takes a Very American Road Trip
description: This summer, the Vancouver-based clothing line Kit & Ace is embarking on a road trip across America. Traveling in a beautifully designed Airstream trailer called the Copper Studio, the Canadian company, conceived in 2014 by J.J. and Shannon Wilson (the son and wife, respectively, of the Lululemon founder Chip Wilson), is aiming to make its mark on American soil. Kit & Ace rethinks athleisure, one of the most successful  and saturated  markets in fashion, with luxury tees made from machine-washable cashmere designed, in Shannons words, for people living full-contact lives. Throughout the spring and summer, the Copper Studio, which began its journey at Coachella in April, has been operating as a traveling Kit & Ace pop-up shop, stopping in 24 cities and inviting customers to browse or lounge on one of two custom Acapulco chairs by Innit Designs placed outside. The Copper Studio has now arrived on the East Coast, where it will make its final stops in New York, Boston, Philadelphia and the Hamptons this month.

title: Milton Friedman, Irving Fisher, and Greece
description: I continue to be amazed by how many people regard debt relief and devaluation as wild-eyed radical ideas; of course, it matters most that so many influential people in Europe share this ignorance. Anyway, for the record (and for my own future reference) I thought it would be helpful to post what Milton Friedman and Irving Fisher had to say about the Greek disaster. OK, they werent writing specifically about Greece  Friedman was writing in 1950, Fisher in 1933. But their analyses ring truer than ever.

title: Why a Back Door to the Internet Is a Bad Idea
description: In recent months top American and British political leaders have been arguing that there should be no encrypted communication system that they cannot unlock whenever they deem it necessary to do so. Officials like the director of the National Security Agency, Michael Rogers, and Prime Minister David Cameron have said that unless technology companies grant them the technical equivalent of a back door to snoop on encrypted communications, the worlds bad guys will go dark and become untraceable.

title: Effects of a New Housing Policy in Dallas
description: An experimental federal program, begun in Dallas in 2011, encourages low-income families to move to neighborhoods with better schools and lower crime rates.

title: Vouchers Help Families Move Far From Public Housing
description: PLANO, Tex.  Lamesa White and her four children moved in February from the most dangerous public housing project in Dallas to a single-family home in this affluent suburb. On the day she left, one of her daughters old schoolmates was shot to death.

title: Can Bernie Sanders Beat Hillary Clinton? Reporters Notebook
description: Deep down, does Bernie Sanders actually believe he can beat Hillary Rodham Clinton for the 2016 Democratic presidential nomination?

title: First Draft Focus: Bernie Sanders Draws a Crowd
Lincoln Center Announces Dance-Film Lineup
description: More dance is coming to a theater near you: Lincoln Center announced Tuesday that this falls Great American Dance cinema series would feature performances by the San Francisco Ballet, Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater, Ballet Hispanico and New York City Ballet.

title: Of Drought and Man in the West
description: Killing the Colorado, a joint reporting project by ProPublica and Matter, set out to tell the truth about the American Wests water crisis. As serious as the drought is, the investigation found that mismanagement of that regions surprisingly ample supply has led to todays emergency. Among the causes are the planting of the thirstiest crops; arcane and outdated water rights laws; the unchecked urban development in unsustainable desert environments; and the misplaced confidence in human ingenuity to engineer our way out of a crisis  with dams and canals, tunnels and pipelines.

title: After Health Care Act, Sharp Drop in Spending on Birth Control
description: Out-of-pocket spending on most major birth control methods fell sharply in the months after the Affordable Care Act began requiring insurance plans to cover contraception at no cost to women, a new study has found. Spending on the pill, the most popular form of prescription birth control, dropped by about half in the first six months of 2013, compared with the same period in 2012, before the mandate took effect.

title: Awkward, Androgynous Style
description: Hlose Letissier, who performs as Christine and the Queens, is 27, raw and an uncontested hit in Paris.

title: A Photographers Dark Design Aesthetic
description: Los Angeles sunshine cant touch Nicholas Maggios noir glamour.

title: Israeli Minister Says Reform Jews Are Not Really Jewish
description: JERUSALEM  Israels strictly Orthodox minister of religious services said Tuesday that he did not consider Reform Jews to be Jewish, inflaming internal discord over religious issues and underscoring tensions with American Jews, who mostly belong to the more liberal streams of Conservative and Reform Judaism.

title: Private Plane and F-16 Jet Collide Over South Carolina; 2 Are Killed
description: WASHINGTON  Two people were killed when their small civilian aircraft collided in midair with an F-16 fighter jet on Tuesday near Charleston, S.C., according to the National Transportation Safety Board.

title: South Carolina Senator on Flag Vote
description: State Senator Gerald Malloy spoke of the momentous vote in the South Carolina senate on a bill that would remove the Confederate flag from state grounds. The bill moves on to the House for approval.

title: Gun-Shaped iPhone Case Is a Terrible Idea, Police Officials Warn
description: An iPhone case that looks like a handgun is drawing warnings that it could be too easily mistaken for a real weapon.

title: Michael Chernow Focuses on Fish at Seamores
description: Michael Chernow, a founder of the many-tentacled Meatball Shop, now has a place to call his own, and the focus is on fish. Theres a lot of good seafood swimming locally, and I wanted to take advantage of it in a basic way, he said. The subtext? No salmon or red snapper. A blackboard in the airy white storefront lists local fish like hake, porgy, flounder and sea robin. A wooden spoon hanging alongside the name indicates that its on the menu that day, ready to be seared and served in a bowl over greens and quinoa with a sauce. Fish tacos, a few sandwiches (including one beef burger) and dishes like curried mussels are also produced in the open kitchen. The wine list is sourced from coastal areas: 390 Broome Street (Mulberry Street), 212-730-6005, seamores.com.

title: P.G.A. Moves Event From Donald Trump Golf Course
description: About five years ago, when golf was going through an economic downswing, Donald Trump took the opportunity to buy in, scooping up failed properties. He already had courses emblazoned with his name around the world, but credibility? That eluded him.

title: Main Areas of Taliban Attacks
description: The Taliban are aggressively trying to seize territory in many parts of Afghanistan and have made some gains in pockets of several provinces.

title: Obstacles in Regulators Push to Reduce Leveraged Loans
description: In its effort to limit leveraged loans, the government is finding once again that regulating the financial industry is like a game of Whac-a-Mole, with new unregulated players popping up to fill the risky gaps.

title: The Look of a Champion Surfer
description: Stephanie Gilmore, 27, is a six-time world champion surfer. She won her first title at 17 and is defending her crown this year. Ms. Gilmore was born in Murwillumbah, Australia, and lives in Rainbow Bay in the Australian state of Queensland. She will be in Huntington Beach, Calif., on July 27 for the Vans United States Open of Surfing. Here, she describes her beauty regimen.

title: Pictures of the Day: Spain and Elsewhere
description: Spain and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Hillary Clinton Criticizes Jeb Bush on Immigration Stance
description: IOWA CITY, Iowa  Hillary Rodham Clinton used the first major news interview of her presidential campaign to directly attack the Republican candidate Jeb Bush for supporting an immigration policy that would not provide a path to citizenship for the 11 million to 12 million immigrants living illegally in the United States.

title: July 7, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Spain, Pakistan, Greece and Great Britain.

title: Classical Playlist: Lewis Spratlan, Beethoven and Brahms
description: LEWIS SPRATLAN: Hesperus Is Phosphorus The Crossing; Network for New Music; Donald Nally, conductor(Innova)Born in 1940, Lewis Spratlan came to international attention in 2000 when a concert performance of Act II of his 1970s opera Life Is a Dream won the Pulitzer Prize for Music before the full work had ever been staged. That complex and compelling opera was finally given its premiere in Santa Fe in 2010. This recording offers his 2012 vespers cantata, Hesperus Is Phosphorus, performed by the Philadelphia forces that commissioned it: the Crossing, the superb contemporary-music vocal ensemble, and Network for New Music. The title plays on the belief of the early Greeks that Phosphorus was the morning star, and Hesperus the evening one, before they realized that the two were one celestial body, Venus. The inventive text draws together writings by David Eagleman, Wallace Stevens, Richard Feynman, Wallace Shawn and others. Mr. Spratlans pungently modern language comes through continually in this intricate 65-minute score. Still, he sets words for clarity, often in long stretches of spiky block chords. A beautiful recording of a sensual and mysterious work. (ANTHONY TOMMASINI)

title: A Gloomy, Glamorous Los Angeles Apartment
description: Nicholas Maggio

title: Review: Rebecca Makkais Music for Wartime, Stories With Echoes of Loss
description: The best short story in Rebecca Makkais new collection, Music for Wartime, isnt the one about the artist who makes his work by punching more famous artists in the face and then photographing the resulting mayhem: tears, snot, blood.

title: Reading Aloud to My Daughter, From Prison
description: I spent a little over five years of my childrens lives away from them in a maximum-security prison. When I left them, my daughter was 22 months old and my son was 15. They were devastated and their lives were completely changed. My parents, who had already raised their children, were now starting over with mine.

title: A Condominium With a Terrace and Views in Monaco
description: In a modern building, the one-bedroom apartment is on the market for $3.72 million.

title: What You Get for ... $800,000
description: This weeks properties include a cabin in Washington, an adobe in Albuquerque and a contemporary in Oklahoma City.

title: Verbatim: Hillary Clinton Wants Those Ropes Dropped
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton speaking to her press secretary, Nick Merrill, before a media availability in Iowa and after days of facing questions about a rope used to separate her from reporters during a parade last weekend in New Hampshire.

title: Whipclip, App That Shares Video Clips, Raises $40 Million
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Investors are betting big on video audiences sharing clips online  in a way that benefits both watchers and the producers of that content.

title: Elie Top on How to Spend Downtime in Paris During Couture Week
description: In January in Paris,Elie Top debuted his eponymous jewelry line during Spring/Summer 2015 Couture Week. In the months since, hes been looking forward to another season, going on now, of what he calls the expression of the search for perfection, a mix of tradition and advanced research when the fashion set, celebrities and generally fabulous types flock to his hometown to see the industrys hautest designs. Top also remarks on the pleasant, less tiring rhythm of the shows during Couture Week which leaves ample time for exploring the City of Light armed with his short list of where to eat traditional French food and feel appropriately dressed in pajamas (in daytime), which follows.

title: At a Los Angeles Boutique, Small Labels Are the Stars
description: In certain circles, the New York-Los Angeles exchange has been a topic of nearly constant conversation of late. Someone is always leaving, or arriving. Migration patterns are studied and debated.

title: Law Firm Mergers Record Highest Midyear Number
description: The legal industry is consolidating at a fast pace, with 48 law firm mergers or acquisitions so far this year, the most recorded at midyear, and more activity is predicted, according to a report.

title: A Conversation With Tobias Oriwol
description: Mr. Oriwol, 30, is a former Olympic swimmer and now a project developer at Monadnock Development, a Brooklyn company that specializes in affordable housing. He is overseeing the citys first microapartment complex, at 335 East 27th Street, with 55 units, each from 260 to 360 square feet. Mr. Oriwol, a backstroke swimmer from Canada, competed in the Summer Olympics in 2008 and 2012.

title: The Case for New Hudson River Rail Tunnels
description: Across the country, competition is stiff for the most dilapidated bridge, tunnel or train system.

title: Selfie Celebration
description: Jubilation at a rally in Los Angeles for the victorious U.S. womens soccer team.

title: Harper Lee Receives Copy of Go Set a Watchman as Release Nears
description: Nearly 60 years after Harper Lee wrote Go Set a Watchman, the novel she hoped would be her literary debut, the 89-year-old author was handed a finished copy of the book at a private lunch in Monroeville, Ala., last week.

title: Review: Danny Elfmans Music From the Films of Tim Burton, Macabre Yet Sweet
description: The opening night of the Lincoln Center Festival, which tends to present high-minded international fare, does not usually draw crowds of gawkers and rows of photographers to the centers plaza. Thats what happened on Monday, though, when this summers festival opened with Danny Elfmans Music From the Films of Tim Burton, a concert of suites from the 15 scores Mr. Elfman has composed over three decades for his collaborations with Mr. Burton, performed by an orchestra and chorus at Avery Fisher Hall.

title: Coming From Theater for a New Audience: Trevor Nunn, John Douglas Thompson and Richard Maxwell
description: The Tony Award-winning director Trevor Nunn, best known for the blockbuster musicals Cats and Les Misrables, will mount Shakespeares Pericles as part of the 2015-16 season at Theater for a New Audience, the company announced on Tuesday.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week.

title: Review: The Tempest Brings Music and Spirits to Marcus Garvey Park
description: He cuts quite a figure, this sorcerer-duke: the seaweed cape flowing from his shoulders, the rams-head staff he carries. But its the straw top hat, adorned with a tiny skull and tied festively with dried grass, that makes Ron Cephas Joness lonely Prospero look island magnificent.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: SubCulture in New York Cancels Much of Its Schedule
description: One of the bright spots in classical and contemporary music in recent years has been the rise of the cool space: the proliferation of new rooms with downtown or Brooklyn vibes that feel more like nightclubs than concert halls, where emerging talents are free to experiment, and audiences can listen to live music in unstuffy settings.

title: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres the latest.

title: Living In Queens Plaza
description: Luxury buildings with great views and quick access to Manhattan are the main attractions of the Long Island City neighborhood at the foot of the Queensboro Bridge.

title: Steel-Pan Bands in Brooklyn Struggle to Find Rehearsal Space
description: Steel-pan bands, introduced to New York City by Caribbean immigrants, have joyously chimed across central Brooklyn for decades, performing at graduations and weddings and at annual events near Prospect Park like a musical competition called Panorama and an exuberant predawn street procession each Labor Day called Jouvert.

title: F.D.A. Approves Heart Drug Entresto Said to Cut Death Risk by 20%
description: The Food and Drug Administration on Tuesday approved a new heart failure drug from Novartis that has been shown to reduce death and hospitalizations from the condition.

title: Jared Fogle and Subway Suspend Ties After Raid at His Home
description: Subway suspended its relationship with its well-known spokesman, Jared Fogle, on Tuesday, hours after investigators in Indiana raided his suburban home.

title: Obama Hosts Vietnam Communist Leader
description: President Obama met with Nguyen Phu Trong, the head of Vietnams Communist Party, at the White House and praised the progress made in relations between the U.S. and Vietnam.

title: The Scene
description: Armani Priv at Paris Couture Week.

title: Photo Diary: Armani Priv Fall/Winter 2015 Couture
description: Scenes from Paris Couture Week, captured by Schohaja.

title: U.S. Womens Soccer Win Draws Big Sales on Mobile Devices
description: By the sixth minute of the United States victory over Japan in the Womens World Cup final on Sunday, after midfielder Carli Lloyd scored her second goal, sales of World Champions T-shirts and other championship merchandise on Fanatics, the online retailer, had started surging.

title: Same Sex, Love and Hate, in South Africa
description: Zanele Muholi has spent her Saturdays photographing two sides of lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender life in South Africa  joyous same-sex weddings, and the funerals of those murdered in hate.

title: Judge Rakoff Ruling on Tips May Help Prosecution on Insider Trading Cases
description: Insider trading cases based on the passing of tips seemed endangered after a decision by the federal appeals court in Manhattan in December.

title: A Philadelphia Workplace, With Millennials in Mind
description: PHILADELPHIA  A boxy brown-brick distribution center on the northeast side of downtown may become the latest project for millennial-focused redevelopment of an old industrial area.

title: Suit to Accuse New York City and State of Keeping Children in Foster Care Too Long
description: Elisa, 16, has been in foster care for more than two-thirds of her life, moving through so many foster homes that she has lost track of them all  including four in the past two years. She was sexually abused in one, punched by her foster mother in another and hospitalized for depression, bipolar disorder and post-traumatic stress disorder after several more. She has been on the verge of adoption twice, only to see it fall through each time.

title: Live With the Grateful Dead in Chicago:  Reporters Notebook
description: Confession: The last-ever Grateful Dead show, on Sunday night at Soldier Field in Chicago, was my first.

title: Recent Commercial Transactions
description: RECENT SALE

title: Fox Is Planning to Make Movie About Same-Sex Marriage Ruling
description: LOS ANGELES  With an eye toward the mainstream success of gay-themed films like Philadelphia, 20th Century Fox has secured the rights to make a movie about the Supreme Court case that effectively legalized same-sex marriage.

title: Obama Hosts a Top Official From Vietnam at Oval Office
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama said Tuesday that the United States and Vietnam had moved beyond their difficult history and would move ahead on trade and security cooperation that could benefit both countries. He warmly welcomed the head of the nations Communist Party to the White House and spoke of a future visit to Vietnam.

title: Pope Francis, in Ecuador, Calls for More Protection of Rain Forest and Its People
description: QUITO, Ecuador  Pope Francis on Tuesday called for increased protection of the Amazon rain forest and the indigenous people who live there, declaring that Ecuador must resist exploiting natural riches for short-term benefits, an implicit rebuke of the policies of President Rafael Correa.

title: A Lightning Strike of Guerrilla Art as Rents Become Artisanal
description: It was pushing toward midnight on Saturday when a team of pranksters hoisted a sign renaming the tiny steam-table Latin diner at the corner of 162nd Street and Broadway in Washington Heights.

title: Jordan Spieth Seeks Another Big Catch
description: SILVIS, Ill.  If Jordan Spieth were not the lead story on Golf Channel, he could be starring on Discovery Channels Shark Week. Having added the United States Open title to his Masters crown, Spieth spent a few days this month in the Bahamas with his close circle of friends from Dallas.

title: Redemption, and an All-Star Spot, for Stephen Vogt
description: If Stephen Vogts career had played out as he expected, he would never have become an All-Star catcher for the Oakland Athletics. He would never have ended a playoff game with a hit, and he would never have been asked to share his comedy skills on television.

title: Juli Soler, the El Bulli Restaurateur Who Changed Dining, Dies at 66
description: Juli Soler, a restaurateur who put Ferran Adri in charge of the kitchen at El Bulli in Catalonia, Spain, and helped him transform the restaurant into one of the most innovative centers of gastronomy in the world, died on Monday at his home in Rub, near Barcelona. He was 66.

title: States Weigh Gay Marriage, Rights and Cake
description: DENVER  The case before the court on Tuesday grappled with issues of equal rights, religious objections to same-sex marriage and wedding cake.

title: Former No. 1 Victoria Azarenka Is at Her Best, but Serena Williams Is Even Better
description: WIMBLEDON, England  On the draw sheet, it was a quarterfinal between the No. 1 seed and the No. 23 seed.

title: Argentina: Top Court Rules for Family of Patient in a Right-to-Die Case
description: In a landmark decision, Argentinas Supreme Court ruled Tuesdaythat a patient who has required life support for two decades can be allowed to die, renewing debate here over a so-called death with dignity law. In their ruling, the justices fended off resistance against a measure approved in 2012by lawmakers that allows patients, or their relatives, to refuse life support. The patient, Marcelo Diez, who is reported to be around 50, has been in a vegetative state since a motorcycle crash in 1994. Mr. Diezs sistersasked that life support be removed, but officialsin Neuqun Province objected and used his case to challenge the 2012 measure. In a television interview, Lucas Pica, their lawyer, criticized figures in the Catholic Church who he said had resisted their moves in the courts.

title: San Francisco Murder Case Exposes Lapses in Immigration Enforcement
description: The case of a Mexican laborer with a lengthy criminal record who was charged on Tuesday in the fatal shooting of an American woman on a pier in San Francisco has exposed a gulf of mistrust and failed communication between the federal authorities and the police in California over immigration enforcement.

title: John Maxtone-Graham, an Authority on Ocean Liners, Dies at 85
description: John Maxtone-Graham, a New Jersey-born naval historian whose books and shipboard lectures evoked the lost glamour of trans-Atlantic ocean liners, died on Monday in Manhattan. He was 85.

title: Cuomo to Appoint Special Prosecutor for Killings by Police
description: With pressure mounting from families whose loved ones have died at the hands of a police officer, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said on Tuesday that he was preparing to issue an executive order naming the state attorney general as a special prosecutor for police-related civilian deaths.

title: Markets Dive Could Delay Economic Reforms in China
description: HONG KONG  Chinas stock market tumble has presented the government of President Xi Jinping with a searing test of its commitment to overhaul the countrys financial system and open up the state-controlled economy.

title: At Federal Bridal Show, Things Old, New, Seized and Blue
description: The offerings at the Down the Aisle bridal show in Atlanta appeared no different from what you would find in any other shop in America, except for the federal security guards who checked the customers for firearms, knives and explosives when they entered the building.

title: Common Ground for Vietnam and the U.S.
description: Forty-plus years after the Americans withdrew from Vietnam, and 20 years after the two countries re-established diplomatic relations, President Obama took the relationship to a new level on Tuesday by hosting Nguyen Phu Trong, the head of Vietnams Communist Party, at the White House.

title: Question Answered
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Today we welcome a new constructor, Ryan Milligan, who shows us how important it is to pay attention to opportunities when you are brainstorming a theme.

title: New York City Is Sued Over Lotteries Used for Subsidized Housing
description: A federal lawsuit filed on Tuesday on behalf of three black residents accuses New York City of perpetuating residential segregation by reserving as many as half of the subsidized apartments planned in the city for applicants already living in the neighborhood where the units are to be built.

title: Susannah Mushatt Jones, Worlds Oldest Person, Is Feted in Brooklyn
description: As the cameras and news media crews amassed before her, it was clear that Tuesday was not the best of days for Susannah Mushatt Jones.

title: Panel Blocks a Larger CVS Store in Katonah
description: Katonah, a storybook hamlet of small singular shops in northern Westchester County, succeeded on Tuesday night in obtaining a zoning amendment intended to keep CVS Health from opening a far larger outlet than it now has.

title: Bronx Man Is Fatally Shot While Holding His 1-Year-Old Daughter
description: A 21-year-old man holding his 1-year old daughter was fatally shot in the back across the street from an elementary school abutting a city playground in the Bronx on Tuesday, the police said.

title: Tourists on Greek Island Join Local Volunteers to Aid Refugees
description: As the summer holiday season kicks off on the Greek island of Lesbos this year, some tourists have taken time away from the beach to join local volunteers offering aid to refugees who continue to arrive by sea in record numbers.

title: Man Who Threatened Muslim Is Sentenced to 13 Months
description: A Queens man who sent death threats to the executive director of an Islamic nonprofit organization was sentenced on Tuesday to 13 months in prison, the time he has already served.

title: All-Stars Teixeira and Betances Are of Little Help as Yankees Fall to As
description: If the Yankees, at their best, carry with them a mystique, there has always been an un-Yankee-like quality to Brett Gardner. He has never been their most fearsome player, just a 9-to-5 grinder who runs out every ground ball as if he is being chased by trouble and wants nothing out of the game but a victory.

title: Ron Pollard, Oddsmaker on Just About Everything, Dies at 89
description: You might not want to wager that the Loch Ness monster, which has made appearances either for real or in imaginations for centuries, was going to show itself indisputably any time soon. But as Ron Pollard understood, a fair number of people would make that bet.

title: Suspension Over, Jenrry Mejia Rejoins the Mets
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Late Monday night, the old friends Jenrry Mejia and Jeurys Familia gathered in Bartolo Colons hotel room. Colon and Familia had not seen Mejia in about three months, since he was suspended for 80 games for using performance-enhancing drugs, and they talked about baseball, about their families, about life. Familia had become a father since then, and although they had communicated regularly, he wanted to hear how Mejia was doing.

title: Pretrial Rhetoric Sets Stage for Murder Trial of Suge Knight
description: LOS ANGELES  I think its an outrage, Thomas Mesereau, a defense lawyer, told Los Angeles County Superior Court Judge Stephen A. Marcus at a hearing here on Tuesday.

title: Golden State Warriors Trade David Lee
description: David Lee, an expensive bench player for the Golden State Warriors, has been traded to the Boston Celtics for Gerald Wallace.

title: Whats On TV Wednesday
description: 5:20 P.M. (TMC) PHILOMENA (2013) With the help of a former political journalist (Steve Coogan), an Irish Roman Catholic woman (Judi Dench, in an Oscar-nominated performance, above left, with Mr. Coogan) seeks the son who was taken from her 50 years earlier, when she became pregnant as a teenager and was forced to live in a convent. In this drama directed by Stephen Frears, their sleuthing takes them to Washington after they discover that the boy was adopted by an American couple and worked for the Reagan administration as an adult. Ms. Denchs Philomena Lee glows with the radiance of someone serene in her faith despite inhumane treatment by the church, Stephen Holden wrote in The New York Times. Her dignified performance and the screenplay  adapted by Mr. Coogan and Jeff Pope from Martin Sixsmiths 2009 nonfiction book, The Lost Child of Philomena Lee  stabilize a volatile blend of ingredients, Mr. Holden added.

title: Cutting Jobs, Microsoft Turns Page on Nokia Deal
description: SEATTLE  When Microsoft announced its deal to acquire Nokias mobile phone business, Steven A. Ballmer, Microsofts chief executive at the time, boasted that the deal was a bold step into the future.

title: Corrections: July 8, 2015
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Retribution is a valid societal interest.

title: Player Ratings: United States (2) vs. Honduras (1)
description: The United States mens national team opened its Concacaf Gold Cup campaign with an ugly, 2-1 win over Honduras in Frisco, Tex., on Tuesday. Honduras controlled most of the game, but the Americans walked away with 3 valuable points.

title: Chinas Efforts Fail to Contain Market Plunge
description: SHANGHAI  As the Chinese stock market slumps, the countrys government has stepped in boldly, unveiling a series of measures to prop up shares. But those efforts have done little to stabilize the market, with stocks continuing to slide on Wednesday.

title: Same Sex, Love and Hate, in South Africa
description: Zanele Muholi thinks about Saturday a lot. As a longtime visual activist devoted to gender and sexuality rights in South Africa, that day represents the many weddings and funerals she has documented throughout her career, even before same-sex marriage was legal in her country.

title: Argentinas Debt
description: To the Editor:

title: Supreme Courts Ruling on Hotel Guests Privacy
description: To the Editor:

title: Bernie Sanders in the 1960s: Serious, Not Wild
description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: Authority and the South
description: To the Editor:

title: Marco Rubio: Obamas Faustian Bargain With Cuba
description: MIAMI  WHEN President Obama announced the formal re-establishment of diplomatic relations with Cuba last week, he criticized the supposed failures of United States policy toward Cuba, which, Mr. Obama said, hasnt worked for 50 years.

title: President Donald Trump? Just Say No
description: Donald Trump is a force in the Republican presidential race. Two recent polls show him running second to Jeb Bush nationally. Hes also polling second in Iowa and New Hampshire. And his pronouncements are commanding attention, especially on Fox News, where hes a popular presence.

title: BP Deal Will Lead to a Cleaner Gulf
description: Though no amount of money can ever compensate for the staggering damage caused by the 2010 BP oil spill, last weeks provisional $18.7 billion settlement among five states, the federal government and the company will help make amends for one of the worst environmental disasters in American history.

title: The Wasted Gift of Donald Trump
description: I keep reading that Donald Trump is wrecking the Republican Party. I keep hearing that hes a threat to the fortunes of every other Republican presidential candidate, because he sullies the brand and puts them in an impossible position.

title: Ever-Growing Waits for Veterans Care
description: It was shocking last year when hospitals operated by the Department of Veterans Affairs were caught falsifying data to hide the long delays endured by patients needing medical care.

title: Antony Jenkins Ousted as Barclays Chief Executive
description: LONDON  A retail banker by trade, Antony Jenkins was elevated to the top job at Barclays three years ago to radically reshape an aggressive investment banking culture at the British lender that politicians and some investors saw as out of control.

title: Queens Plaza, a Neighborhood Under Construction
description: Cody Steele, 28, tries not to gloat when he talks about living in Queens Plaza. I work in Midtown, and my 15-minute commute is a lot faster than most of my friends who live in Manhattan, Mr. Steele, who works for a financial services firm, said.

title: De Blasios Dilemma: Fight for a Mall Near Citi Field or Disavow It
description: It is an unlikely battleground. It is an even less likely corner of Flushing Meadows-Corona Park in Queens.

title: The Unraveling, by Emma Sky
description: Emma Sky has a lovely sense of irony about many things, from her evocative name to her frustrated dreams for Iraq, where, in the first decade of this century, she spent what she thinks of as the most important years of her life advising senior officers in the American military. Amidst the horror of war, I had experienced more love and camaraderie than I had ever known, she writes. I had become part of their band of brothers.

title: Oratory onConfederate Flag in South Carolina Legislature Shows Deep Divisions
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  The drama in South Carolinas graceful Greek Revival capitol unfolded on Wednesday with a jangle of the solemn and the absurd, a mix of state history, Southern history and family history that grew more passionate as the day wore on.

title: The Sage of Waterloo, by Leona Francombe
description: A place of great conflict should bring on great reflection, Leona Francombe writes in her new novel, The Sage of Waterloo. If it doesnt, all might as well have happened in vain.

title: The Sneaky Power of Amy Schumer, in Trainwreck and Elsewhere
description: Almost as soon as she started her Comedy Central series, the comedian Amy Schumer thought up a sketch: What if there was a single day on which an aging actresss desirability evaporates?

title: Russian Belts Tighten, Affecting Tastes for the Finer Things
description: RUBLOVKA, Russia  For Sale: Nine-bedroom, 15-bathroom, 84,000-square-foot family home with singular amenities: a 16-car garage, indoor-outdoor swimming pool, movie theater, wine cellar, dining table that seats 22, private dental suite and ambient heat throughout the 3.5-acre property to vaporize snow.

title: Wednesdays Travel News and Tips: United Airlines Flight Delays
50 Cent, Renaissance Man
description: LAS VEGAS  So there I was with my finger inside 50 Cents mouth. At his invitation, I was massaging the back of his tongue.

title: How Grounded Is Your Love Life?
description: Balancing on one leg may test the stability not just of your body but also of your marriage or other intimate relationships, according to a remarkable new study of how bodily posture may affect emotional thinking.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: New York Today: Be True to Your Pool
description: Good morning on this variable Wednesday.

title: Didi Kuaidi, the Chinese Ride-Hailing Service, Raises $2 Billion
description: HONG KONG  As companies listed in China continue to suffer fallout from the stock market collapse, the Chinese ride-sharing app Didi Kuaidi on Wednesday showed why it is good to be private.

title: Birthday Candles on Her Deathbed
description: Ingrid Bergman famously died on her birthday. Shakespeare is said to have died 52 years to the day after he was born. Tidy and distinct enough on Wikipedia, I suppose  but this was not what I wanted for my mother. And certainly not for me.

title: Srebrenica Massacre, After 20 Years, Still Casts a Long Shadow in Bosnia
description: LONDON  As Europe marks the 20th anniversary of the massacre of about 8,000 Muslim men and boys in the Bosnian town of Srebrenica, reconciliation has been halting in a region where memories and wounds, personal and political, run deep.

title: Whose Party Is It Anyway?
description: Are the job losses resulting from trade larger or smaller than the economic gains?

title: Today in Politics: Approaching a Clearer Look at a Tangled Field
description: Good Wednesday morning from Washington, where Congress is debating an education law and where another Republican has said he just might join the race for the White House. It is a crowded race, after all, where the full picture is hidden among polling numbers and money raised, and where a first crucial deadline is just around the corner.

title: The Autobots Hits Theaters, and Many Chinese Say Theyve Seen It Before
description: China is no stranger to knockoff goods. Over the years, the country has taken the proverbial expression imitation is the sincerest form of flattery to the next level, churning out scores of shanzhai, or counterfeit, items, including everything from fake Apple iPhones to Harry Potter books to Rolls-Royces and French luxury wines.

title: In Spain, an Eco-Tour That Follows Cork From Tree to Bottle
description: From June to August, three rural regions across Spain are transformed into otherworldly landscapes; trees in the heart of the cork forest are sheared of their bark, becoming brick-red sentinels with leafy tops that guard the woods. And this year, for the first time, visitors are able to experience the harvest with them.

title: Why Bernie Sanderss Momentum Is Not Built to Last
description: Bernie Sanders is surging. He trailed Hillary Rodham Clinton by as much as 50 points in the polls a few months ago, but he has pulled within 10 points in New Hampshire, according to some surveys. He has doubled his support in Iowa over the last month. The signs of his support are palpable: Last week, about 10,000 people attended an event in Madison, Wis., and he announced that he raised $15 million in the first three months of his campaign.

title: Eat a Peach
description: It has been a season full of Prufrock for me: restless one-nighters in cheap hotels and sawdust restaurants with oyster shells. And of course I dare to eat a peach. It is the summers great fruit, soft and warm, slick beneath its fuzz, almost impossibly sweet, creamy with a slight acidic tang.

title: Spike Nation
description: One evening in April, Ethan Darbee, a 24-year-old paramedic in Syracuse, responded to a call on the citys south side: unknown man down. Rolling up to the scene, he saw a figure lying motionless on the sidewalk. Darbee raked his knuckles across the mans sternum to assess his level of consciousness. His eyelids fluttered. Inside the ambulance, Darbee hooked him up to a heart monitor, and he jerked involuntarily. The odd reaction puzzled Darbee. Why would the guy recoil from an electrode sticker but not a sternal rub? The driver started for the hospital. Darbee sat in the captains chair in the back of the rig, typing on a laptop. Then he heard a sound no paramedic ever wants to hear: the click of a patients shoulder harness unlatching. Swiveling around, he found himself eyeball to eyeball with his patient, who was now crouched on all fours on top of the stretcher, growling.

title: Should I Respond to My Mechanics Racist Poster?
description: I live in a small rural town. At the local garage, the owner has photocopied and displayed a poster that he apparently thinks is clever. It proclaims to picture the most useful cellphone to have with you  a handgun that has a cellphone keypad in its handle. It then names the cities where this might be useful, naming cities that are primarily African-American. The owner is a nice guy and not a virulent racist; he probably does not realize that the poster is offensive, or why it is overtly racist. How should I respond? NAME WITHHELD

title: Morning Agenda: Economic Reforms at Risk as Chinese Markets Fall
description: ECONOMIC REFORMS AT RISK AS CHINESE MARKETS FALL | Chinese markets continued their slump on Wednesday, with the main Shanghai index falling more than 8 percent in early trading,  David Barboza writes in The New York Times. It closed 5.9 percent lower. Nearly half the listings on Chinas exchanges stopped trading by Wednesday morning, most of them at the request of companies, although some listings were also suspended by regulators.

title: Is Hillary Clinton's Feminism Out of Style?
Plunge in Chinese Stocks Leads to Bull Market for Gallows Humor
description: The plunge in Chinese stock markets has created widespread uncertainty and losses for millions of investors who only recently had enjoyed remarkable gains. The drop-offs have been so steep that many shares stopped trading after their declines hit the maximum 10 percent daily limit.

title: The Wrong Sign
description: The Ethicists consider when and how to call out another persons prejudice.

title: Classical Music This Week: Bagatelles, La Favorite and Kirsten Flagstad
description: It feels like the dog days of summer out there in New York, classical lovers. And things certainly thin out on the performance front in these humid weeks.

title: Greece Requests a 3-Year Loan but Is Vague on Its Financial Plans
description: ATHENS  Greece, running out of money and under a tight deadline from European leaders, requested a three-year loan on Wednesday from the eurozones bailout fund as the country and its creditors began what could be a last effort to avert a historic rupture.

title: The Youngest Mom in the Office
description: Last year, as a 26-year-old career woman (maybe that should be 26-year-young) with a high-stress job in an industry I loved, I got pregnant. My partner and I didnt plan it, but we chose to have our child. Our plan: We would have a baby, and we would both keep our careers. Thats the way it worked out, but for him, it was pretty much a given and very little changed. For me, it meant navigating silent judgment, revising my approach to work and eventually shifting to a new position in the same field, one that allowed me to slow down, for now, with the possibility to travel and work longer hours, eventually.

title: A Foster Childs Questions: Is This My House? Is This My Home?
description: My 3-year-old foster son, BlueJay, is playing on the living room floor, running toy trains around a track, when he suddenly looks up and asks: Is this my house? Is this my blue house? I look back at him in surprise. Weve had a bit of a rough morning and Im surprised to see his scowl suddenly replaced by this new, perplexed expression.

title: A Cockroach Breaks the Ice
description: Dear Diary,

title: Greece Wants to Reach Deal, Tsipras Says
description: The Greek prime minister Alexis Tsipras told the European Parliament on Wednesday that his government was determined to reach a viable agreement with its creditors.

title: $800,000 Homes in Washington State,Albuquerque and Oklahoma
description: PORT LUDLOW, WASH.

title: Symantec Report Suggests Hackers Motives Are Blurring
description: PALO ALTO, Calif.  A group of financially motivated hackers has been infiltrating major corporations and stealing valuable intellectual property, a sign that the motives and techniques of different types of online criminals are starting to blur, researchers at a computer security company will announce in a report on Wednesday.

title: A Political Lifer, Scott Walker Has Long Been His Own Strategist
description: WASHINGTON  When Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin met privately here at the Capitol Hill Club recently with a group of congressional Republicans, he did not just seek their support for his presidential candidacy. He also laid out a state-by-state assessment of how the 2016 race would unfold.

title: Free and Cheap Photoshop Alternatives for Windows
description: Q. I recently got a new laptop and lost my free Adobe Photoshop Starter Edition, which is no longer offered. Is there a free photo-editing program that can correct digital pictures, create slide shows and send them out to friends in email?

title: Visa Europe to Reduce Its Stake in Mobile Payment Company Monitise
description: LONDON  Monitise, a British mobile payment developer and processor, said on Wednesday that Visa Europe plans to sell down its 5.3 percent stake in the company over time.

title: Policy Lessons From The Eurodebacle
description: Its now clear, or should be clear, that the Greek program was doomed to failure without major debt relief; no matter how hard the Greeks tried, austerity would shrink GDP faster than it reduced debt relative to the baseline, so that the debt situation was bound to worsen even as the attempt to balance the budget imposed vast suffering.

title: Real Estate in Monaco
description: AN APARTMENT WITH A TERRACE AND VIEWS IN MONACO

title: Elie Saab: Fall 2015 Couture
description: Paris

title: Albertsons, Big Grocery Chain, Files for I.P.O.
description: Albertsons, one of the countrys biggest supermarket chains, is preparing to return to the public markets, months after its private owners bought rival Safeway.

title: A Sliver of Opportunity Emerges in the Gaza Strip
description: JERUSALEM  Robert Turner is recognized everywhere in the Gaza Strip, jokingly called its governor. To most people there, he is known simply as Mr. Bob. He departs on Thursday after serving as Gaza director of the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for three years  or, put another way, through two wars between Israel and Hamas, the militant group that controls the coastal enclave.

title: Betting on the New York Ferris Wheel to Elevate Staten Islands Fortunes
description: It does not cost anything to take the boat there. A quaint waterfront minor league baseball stadium offers sweeping views of Lower Manhattan and cheap tickets. A fort dating to the War of 1812 is one of the countrys oldest military installations. There had been talk of a Nascar track.

title: Amy Poehler Programs a Summer Film Series
description: If Amy Poehler were putting together a collection of films for her friends to view, what might that look like? Surely a little Woody Allen would make the cut. And probably some Wes Anderson.

title: 1915: Vatican Will Not Free Comte
description: The Vatican, passing for the third time on the validity of the marriage between Comte Boni de Castellane and Miss Anna Gould  now Duchesse de Talleyrand et Sagan  has declared the bond indissoluble. The ruling of the Tribunal of the Rota, according to the Semaine Religieuse, is that the marriage was properly contracted according to the rules of the Catholic Church governing unions between Protestants and Catholics. The present Duchesse de Talleyrand secured a divorce from Comte de Castellane in 1906. Five years ago Comte de Castellane asked the Vatican to annul the marriage, but the request was denied.  The New York Herald, European Edition, July 9, 1915

title: Just When Spurs Seem Spent, They Win at N.B.A. Free Agency
description: The San Antonio Spurs dynasty was ending. Until it wasnt.

title: Popes Speech to Congress to Be Broadcast in Front of Capitol
description: Anticipating huge public demand for a glimpse of Pope Francis during his visit to Congress on Sept. 24, Speaker John A. Boehner said Wednesday that the speech would be broadcast live to those gathered on the West Front of the Capitol, with the possibility that the pope himself would make an appearance outside after his remarks.

title: Obama Unveils Stricter Rules Against Segregation in Housing
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration announced an aggressive effort on Wednesday to reduce the racial segregation of residential neighborhoods. It unveiled a new requirement that cities and localities account for how they will use federal housing funds to reduce racial disparities, or face penalties if they fail.

title: Paula Deen Faces Backlash Over I Love Lucy Posting
description: Paula Deen, the Southern celebrity chef who faced a public scandal in 2013 after she admitted using racist language, is facing new criticism after an image was posted to her Twitter account that showed her son in skin-darkening makeup.

title: United Airlines Grounds Flights, Citing Computer Problems
description: United Airlines grounded planes nationwide for nearly two hours Wednesday morning after a faulty computer network router disrupted its passenger reservations system.

title: K.K.R. Raises $3.1 Billion to Invest in Road and Other Infrastructure Projects
description: Kohlberg Kravis Roberts said on Wednesday that it had raised $3.1 billion for a new fund focused on investing in infrastructure like roads, water supply systems and energy pipelines.

title: N.F.L. and Tottenham Reach Deal to Play at New Stadium in London
description: The N.F.L., eager to continue building its brand internationally, signed a deal to play a minimum of two games a year for 10 years in London at the new stadium being built for Tottenham Hotspur of the English Premier League.

title: Marching to Remember Srebrenica Massacre
description: Marchers, including a survivor of the 1995 Srebrenica massacre, commemorated the 20th anniversary of the mass killing of Muslim men and boys by Bosnian Serb forces.

title: Buly 1803, the Best of Old-World Beauty
description: Last year, the artist and entrepreneur Ramdane Touhami and his stylish wife, Victoire de Taillac-Touhami, revived Buly 1803, a 19th-century perfumery that once provided French high society with signature scents. Their chic Rue Bonaparte boutique in the Sixth Arrondissement, with its cabinet-of-curiosities shelves, apothecary drawers and tiled turquoise floors, looks straight out of the Directoire era. Its a nod to the brands history, which the couple  who have also been behind the success of Cire Trudon candles  invokes with their new line of exquisite all-natural beauty products. Nail polishes, for instance, are colored with chemical-free resins, while luxurious shaving cream is accompanied by a pamphlet from the 1800s on the art of grooming. Also new: an expanded line of sophisticated fragrances that includes Hinoki (a woodsy Japanese cypress) and rich, sweet Heliotrope, each wrapped in beautiful packaging that evokes the companys Napoleonic roots.

title: Quip Builds for Computing Everywhere
description: Maybe it isnt about mobility after all  instead, its about putting computing everywhere. That could mean big changes for the way people design and build their computer systems.

title: F.B.I. Investigating 2013 Fatal Police Shooting in Florida
description: The F.B.I. is reviewing the 2013 police shooting death of Jermaine McBean, the South Florida computer engineer who was photographed as he lay dying, in an image that his family believes suggested that Broward County sheriffs office tampered with evidence and lied, court records filed on Tuesday show.

title: What the Hispanic Vote Says About Bernie Sanderss Chances
description: Even as Bernie Sanders moves up in the polls, many people are realizing that theres a big hole in his coalition: black voters.

title: Your Questions Answered: United Airlines Flight Delays
description: United Airlines flights were grounded Wednesday morning after the carrier experienced a system outage. Not long after the Federal Aviation Administration issued an advisory, however, it announced the ground stop was cancelled and that Uniteds automation issue had been resolved.

title: Why We Shut Down Reddits Ask Me Anything Forum
description: We are moderators for the website reddit.com, a place where, on a typical day, millions of users read and share content in self-contained communities called subreddits. We volunteer our time to help manage the subsection called IAmA  a popular part of the site where thousands of interviews, known as ask me anythings, take place. Its where Bill Gates has talked about the importance of vaccines, and where an airline baggage handler revealed mysteries of the trade  and where President Obama once responded to a question about the White House beer recipe by promising: I can tell from firsthand experience, it is tasty.

title: A Culinary Look at the California Drought: Reporters Notebook
description: As a food writer, I think every story can be told from the plate. Politics, race relations, health and crime  all of it has a food angle, somehow. You just have to find it.

title: Daily Report: Microsoft to Cut Up to 7,800 Jobs, Mostly in Phones Unit
description: Microsoft announced a major new round of layoffs on Wednesday, Nick Wingfield reports.

title: 1965: Second Train Robber Escapes
description: LONDON  Britains Great Train Robbery gained a new sensational chapter today [July 8] with the daylight escape of one of the bandits from Londons Wandsworth jail. Ronald Arthur Biggs, 34, serving a 30- year jail sentence for his part in the Aug. 8, 1963, train holdup, broke out at 3.15 p.m. along with three other inmates. Like the $7.2 million holdup of the Glasgow-to-London Royal Mail train two years ago, and the escape of another key gang member from Birminghams Winson Green prison last August, todays escape had the planning and precision of a military operation.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, July 9, 1965

title: Redskins Lose Round in Battle Over Name
description: A federal judge upheld a decision by the United States Patent and Trademark Offices appeal board to cancel six trademarks held by the Washington Redskins, another victory for Native American groups that have been urging the team for decades to scrap its name.

title: New York City to Relax Bail Requirements for Low-Level Offenders
description: New York City officials announced a plan on Wednesday to change bail requirements for some low-level offenders in an effort to keep thousands of people accused of nonviolent crimes and misdemeanors out of the troubled Rikers Island jail complex.

title: An Indefatigable Collectors Visual History of the 19th Century
description: Object Lessons: The Visualisation of Nineteenth-Century Life Sciences ($32, Ridinghouse) is a grand tour of the latest obsession of an indefatigable collector. For the last decade, the retired investment banker George Loudon has gathered some 200 extraordinary natural-history specimens, scientific models and botanical drawings from the Darwinian age. And the Boston photographer Rosamond Purcell has documented every last one of them in this thoughtfully compiled, scrapbook-style compendium.

title: Mens Team Continues U.S. Soccers Winning Ways
description: United States soccer is still alive this summer. On Tuesday night, two days after the womens national team beat Japan, 5-2, to win its third World Cup in the most-watched soccer game in United States history (and three days before the Americans victory parade in New York City), the mens team played Honduras in its first game of the Concacaf Gold Cup in Frisco, Tex.

title: The Problem With Chinas Efforts to Prop Up Its Stock Market
description: Repeat after me: The stock market is not the economy. And the economy is not the stock market.

title: The Stock Market Bell Rings, Computers Fail, Wall Street Cringes
description: Problems with technology have at times roiled global financial markets, but the 223-year-old New York Stock Exchange has held itself up as an oasis of humans ready to step in when the computers go haywire.

title: Wimbledon 2015: Richard Gasquet Crashes a Party of Three Stars
description: WIMBLEDON, England  One by one, the mens quarterfinal results came in, with three favorites winning quickly and efficiently in straight sets Wednesday. But as the sun sank low, Richard Gasquet and Stan Wawrinka kept pumping their graceful one-handed backhands at each other on Court 1.

title: Deflation and You-know-who
description: Source.

title: Armani's Shock to the System
description: PARIS  Shocking! read the scrawl on the, well, shocking pink invitation to the Armani Priv show. It was hard to know what to make of it.

title: Afghanistan Announces Peace Talks
description: A spokesman for Afghanistans foreign ministry, Ahmad Shekib Mustaghni, discussed the initial round of talks between the government and the Taliban, calling it a first step toward peace.

title: The American Revolutionary
description: Lin-Manuel Miranda has transformed theater  and the way we think about history  with 'Hamilton,' his new multiethnic hip-hop romp about 18th-century politics. His collaborators, Stephen Sondheim, Ron Chernow and the Roots, talk Broadways latest founding father.

title: Lindsey Grahams Old-School Campaign Amid Field of Memes
description: In a presidential election cycle awash in social media and high-tech campaign tactics, Senator Lindsey Graham of South Carolina is proudly, almost defiantly, old-fashioned.

title: Jean Paul Gaultier: Fall 2015 Couture
description: Paris

title: Viktor & Rolf: Fall 2015 Couture
description: Paris

title: Berbers and Arabs Clash in Algeria, Leaving at Least 18 Dead
description: TUNIS  At least 18 people have been killed in clashes between Berbers and Arabs in several desert towns in Algeria this week, the Algerian news media reported on Wednesday. Several buildings were burned and one police officer was wounded in clashes on Monday and Tuesday. Longstanding disputes between the native Berbers and Arab settlers over land and housing in the eastern province of Ghardaia turned violent two years ago, and the government has struggled to contain the continuing unrest. The latest casualties occurred even after the arrival of police reinforcements and a visit by Interior Minister Nourreddine Bedoui to the town of Ghardaia a week ago.

title: Kevin Hart Is a Comedian Built for the Big Stage (and Screen)
description: Theres only one comedian in the world who would use Madison Square Garden as an out-of-town tryout.

title: Kushners The Intelligent Homosexuals Guide Finds a Niche at the Shaw Festival
description: NIAGARA-ON-THE-LAKE, ONTARIO  Playwright. Theater critic. Vegetarian. Suffragist. Phonemic alphabet enthusiast. London School of Economics co-founder. And now sentimental pseudo-socialist, peddling an idealist conception of history.

title: Chinese Investors Worried About Markets
description: Investors in Shanghai discussed their concerns on Wednesday as Chinas stock markets continued to plummet.

title: Verbatim: Donald Trump Vows to Win Latino Vote
description: Donald J. Trump, telling NBC News that he employs many legal immigrants from Mexico. He added that he loves them, and they love him.

title: New York City to Allow Relatives to Visit Grave Sites at Potters Field
description: In a major policy shift in the way New York runs its potters field for the burial of unclaimed bodies, the city has settled a lawsuit and will allow relatives to visit grave sites on Hart Island, off City Island in the Bronx.

title: 36 Hours in Vilnius
description: In Vilnius, you can wander through the 13th-century Old Town, sample rustic Lithuanian fare and explore galleries and sleek boutiques.

title: The Comic Book Artist Fiona Staples Gives Archie a Makeover
description: When executives at Archie Comic Publications decided to reinvigorate their flagship character, first introduced in 1941, they turned to the writer Mark Waid and the rising artist Fiona Staples. In Archie No. 1, which was released on Wednesday, Ms. Staples has transformed the central character from a juvenile man-child into an attractive ginger fresh from CW casting.

title: 36 Hours in Vilnius, Lithuania
description: Unlike the historic districts of its Baltic siblings Tallinn and Riga, which often seem solely the dominion of tourists and kitschy souvenir stands, the Baroque Old Town of Lithuanias capital seems to attract as many  if not more  locals as visitors to its sinuous lanes. With streets lined with Burberry and Max Mara outposts as well as boutiques by Lithuanian designers, the charming 13th-century historic center labyrinth flows seamlessly into the newer boulevards, and remains a deeply integrated part of the local fabric. Much of Vilnius retains its bleak Soviet-era sprawl, which youll pass on the 10-minute drive from the airport, but its a city in transition  and with Lithuanias adoption of the euro this year, expect the city thats often heralded as one of the cheapest in Europe to become even more accessible to travelers. If youre in town from Sept. 4 to 6, join the locals to celebrate the end of summer with Sostines Dienos, the Vilnius City Fiesta  when open-air concerts pop up across the city, and the Gedimino Prospektas boulevard transforms into a street market.

title: Lindsey Graham Says Republicans Are in a Hole With Hispanics
description: Senator Lindsey Graham said on Wednesdaythat Republicans have been doing themselvesno favors when it comes to courting the crucial Hispanic vote and warnedthat Donald J. Trump should not be the partys spokesman on the issue.

title: Rory McIlroy Pulls Out of British Open With Ankle Injury
description: Rory McIlroy has a stubborn streak as broad as his drives are long, so nobody was surprised when he did not immediately bow out of the British Open after sustaining a bad left ankle sprain 12 days before the events start. No matter what the doctors said about a four-to-eight-week rehabilitation period, McIlroy did not figure to give up the defense of his British Open title without a fight.

title: The Debt Crisis: What Greece Wants and What Its Offering
description: What does Greece want?

title: Eurovision Contest to Be Held in Stockholm in 2016
description: Stockholm, the city that gave the world Abba, will host the 2016 Eurovision Song Contest, organizers announced on Wednesday. The contest, which will take place next May 10, 12 and 14, will be held in the Globe Arena, which can seat 16,000 spectators, and, according to a news release, is the largest hemispherical building in the world.

title: Ads in New Hampshire for John Kasich to Start Running
description: A political group representing Gov. John Kasich of Ohio has started buying air time in New Hampshire for a five-day period ahead of the official announcement of his presidential campaign later this month.

title: Excerpts From the Confederate Flag Debate in the South Carolina House
description: Remarks made Wednesday before the vote on whether to remove the Confederate battle flag.

title: Greeks Spend in Droves, Afraid of Losing Savings to a Bailout
description: MAROUSI, Greece  Business has been so brisk in the giant Kotsovolos appliance and electronics store in this upper-middle-class suburb of Athens that you might think a sale was on.

title: The Siren Call, and Dangers, of the Zero-Percent Car Loan
description: Car dealerships tend to offer zero-percent loans in the summer, and this season is no different. But while a no-interest loan may sound like a no-brainer, consumers should weigh whether it is really the best deal.

title: The Absolute Brightness of Leonard Pelkey and Its Chameleon Actor Return
description: In The Absolute Brightness of Leonard Pelkey, James Lecesne portrays nearly a dozen characters, including a New Jersey detective, a sullen teenager, her brassy hairdresser mom and the British proprietor of a dance-and-drama school.
