Theyve all in some way come to know the unseen title character, a flamboyant gay teenager who has disappeared. Mr. Lecesne is both a virtuoso performer and a bighearted writer (he adapted the play from his young-adult novel); bravo to the producers whove brought back this emotionally stirring production, which had a brief engagement at Dixon Place earlier this year, for a longer run. (Westside Theater; westsidetheatre.com)

title: Russia Vetoes U.N. Resolution Calling Srebrenica Massacre Crime of Genocide
description: UNITED NATIONS  Russia vetoed a British-sponsored draft resolution in the United Nations Security Council on Wednesday condemning the Srebrenica massacre of 1995 as a crime of genocide, marking a new low in relations among world powers.

title: Comedys Sweet Weapon: The Cream Pie
description: Ah, the thrown pie. Among the sweetest delights in life is the sight of an airborne cream-and-crust concoction finding purchase. It is the great leveler, a puncturing of pretension, and those who find pie throwing beneath their refined comic sensibility deserve nothing more than a lemon meringue treat, smack in the kisser.

title: Hired Hacker Who Named Clients Now Fears Retaliation
description: Its not uncommon for a criminal defendant in a white-collar case to cooperate with prosecutors in hopes of receiving a lenient sentence. But it is less common for a defendant to then seek to keep that cooperation secret out of fear of retaliation from those he named.

title: Fed Still Looking at Raising Rates This Year, Minutes Show
description: WASHINGTON  Federal Reserve officials spent their most recent policy meeting, in June, preparing to raise interest rates later this year.

title: Briefing: South Carolina Votes to Remove the Confederate Battle Flag
description: In the wake of the Charleston church massacre, South Carolina Lawmakers consider removing the Confederate battle flag from the Capitol.

title: Putin Says He Has Not Yet Tried Yoga
description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, told Indias prime minister, Narendra Modi, that he had not yet tried yoga, and that the perfection of the yoga masters was holding him back.

title: Painted Hair Pops Up at Haute Couture
description: Barely touched ponytails on runways may, finally, be a thing of the past: The Haute Couture shows in Paris this week have featured painted hairstyles of every color and stripe. At Schiaparellis show on Monday  which marked Bertrand Guyons debut as creative director  the hair master Odile Gilbert painted gold flecks in models hair, which she then twisted into updos. For his outing, Giambattista Valli  who also celebrated his 10-year collaboration with MAC Cosmetics this week opted for a distinctly punky vibe: Models wore their hair in low, orange ponytails, which looked like they had been spray-painted minutes before the show. Finally, at Maison Margiela, each model came down the runway with a distinct hair look: Molly Bair, who opened the show, wore a chalky white handprint on the side of her head, while another model came out wearing a hand-painted vine that snaked from collarbone to updo.

title: Plan to Curb U.S. Taxation of Overseas Profit Finds Bipartisan Support
description: WASHINGTON  Two senior senators  one Republican, one Democrat  proposed on Wednesday that the government significantly reduce the tax rate on United States corporate profits overseas, but with a mandatory transition tax on such profits to pay for an expansive highway and infrastructure program.

title: Bally's Collaboration With the Rapper J. Cole
description: Plus: Grooming products that will add some high class to your medicine cabinet; mens fashion designers are trying out lace; Yohji Yamamotos new capsule collection features pieces adorned with his drawings and more.

title: A History of Stock Exchange Failures
description: Stray squirrels, security breaches and, more commonly, technical glitches have caused exchanges around the world to halt.

title: Kimono Promotion Yields to Outrage at Bostons Museum of Fine Arts
description: Audience engagement efforts, increasingly a priority for museums, often ask viewers to interact with historic works of art, possibly providing a more distinctive experience than mere looking. And the results are usually designed to be shareable on social media, to stoke further engagement.

title: Irans Hard-Liners Sharpen Attacks on U.S. as Nuclear Talks Continue
description: TEHRAN  The chants of Death to America and the burning of American flags in the streets are as familiar a part of life here as air pollution and traffic jams. With the United States and Iran on the verge of a potentially historic nuclear accord, however, there has been a distinct change in tone: the anti-Americanism is getting even more strident.

title: Bill Cosby: The Latest from His Accusers and Defenders
description: This week, newly unsealed court documents from 2005 showed that the comedian Bill Cosby admitted he obtained seven prescriptions for quaaludes in the 1970s and that he gave the pills to women he wanted to have sex with.

title: Review: Looking Inward in Poetry Books From Ron Padgett and Nick Flynn
description: These days were taught to be leery of the man-child, that sloppy, skateboard-toting guy of a certain age who seems determined to cling to his concert T-shirts and skillfully avoid adulthood for as long as he can.

title: Owls Brew Tea-Infused Cocktail Mixers Find Their Flow
description: Jennie Ripps and Maria Littlefield like to describe themselves as tea-drinking boozers  always in moderation, of course. And in 2012, they set out on a quest: They wanted to fuse their passion for tea with their thirst for premium cocktails.

title: When Computers Go Down, Its Not Always a Hack
description: In the immediate aftermath of terrorist attacks like the 2011 massacre in Oslo and the 1995 Oklahoma City bombing, many people mistakenly jump to the conclusion that the perpetrators are Islamic fundamentalists. Increasingly, something similar seems to be happening with technical failures: If an important computer system goes down somewhere, many people suspect that it was the result of a hacking attack that originated in China, Russia or North Korea.

title: Treasury Sticks to Plans for a Woman on the $10 Bill, Despite Hillary Clintons Displeasure
description: Of all the problems that might cause Treasury Secretary Jacob J. Lew to lose sleep  a bankrupt Greece and an aggressive China, terrorist financing and Iran sanctions, tax and banking disputes  he could hardly have foreseen that his recent good news announcement about seeking a womans portrait for the $10 bill would end up among them.

title: President Erdogan Is Accused of Stalling as Turks Await a Government
description: ISTANBUL  After Turkeys governing party lost its majority in Parliament in the June 7 elections, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan urged the countrys lawmakers to form a new coalition government swiftly.

title: Guy Yanais Thoroughly Modern Ancient Paintings
description: The young Israeli artist Guy Yanai is obsessed with borders  the way the paint touches the edge of a canvas; the liminal spaces between people and between people and places. The show is really about edges between many things, he says of his solo exhibition Ancienne Rive, which opens tomorrow at the Chelsea gallery Ameringer McEnery Yohe. Like much of his previous work, the 15 new paintings Yanai created for this show convey the everyday: sailboats, the sea, plants, a quiet lawn and a horseback rider are meticulously painted in vibrant horizontal stripes. Its not really clear where they are, or what space they are, says Yanai. Theyre nowhere, and in that sense its really a very synthetic kind of work.

title: German Aides Phone Numbers Appear on U.S. Intelligence Documents
description: BERLIN  Telephone numbers for top aides to Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany, as well as for senior figures in the administrations of her predecessors, emerged on an American intelligence document, raising anew questions about the United States spying on one of its closest allies.

title: Mars Rovers 26 Miles in 26 Seconds
description: Using footage provided by NASA, this time-lapse video shows the Mars rovers 26-mile journey from its landing site in 26 seconds.

title: Diabetes Takes a Toll on the Brain
description: Having Type 2 diabetes is associated with greater impairment of blood flow to the brain and a sharper decline in mental acuity compared with nondiabetic people of similar age and health status, even over a two-year period, researchers report.

title: Facebooks New Female-First Friends Icon
description: Attentive Facebook users may soon notice a change in the sites interface  where once friends were represented by a man in front of a woman, now the positions have been reversed.

title: Meek Mill Is No. 1 as Billboard Chart Prepares for Shift
description: This week the Philadelphia rapper Meek Mill has reached No. 1 on the last Billboard chart of its kind, as the global music industry shifts its release calendar.

title: Yahoo Will Enter Daily Fantasy Sports Market
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Even as legalized gambling has spread nationwide to include lotteries, casinos and just about every imaginable type of slot machine, the notion of betting on sports has remained, outside of Las Vegas, largely in the shadows.

title: Review: Wayne Horvitz Waxes Poetic on Some Places Are Forever Afternoon
description: WAYNE HORVITZ

title: Open Doors Along Back Roads
description: A bicycle trip through eastern Kentucky.

title: In Austin, One Sweet Sommelier Shares the Gospel of Good Wine
description: In Austin  the muddy land of South by Southwest; outdoor sanctuary for hikers, bikers and swimming-hole enthusiasts; and home to an ever-growing culinary and cocktail scene with a particularly hipster lean (crab toasts and fried oysters are plated up at a onetime laundromat, quail and waffles at a former apothecary)  finding a sophisticated, well-air-conditioned, French restaurant with a wine cellar isnt at the top of most visitors lists. But since it opened the doors last year to its shiny interiors, across the street from a sober graveyard in the citys transitional east side, laV has quickly earned national recognition for its wine program.

title: Marathon on Mars
description: Glimpses of the 11-year journey of a Mars rover.

title: Marco Rubio Super PAC Reports Raising $16 Million
description: A super PAC with ties to Senator Marco Rubio of Florida reported on Wednesday that it had raised more than $16 million through June 30, with nearly all of the cash remaining on hand.

title: S.C. House Debate Confederate Flag
description: The South Carolina House of Representatives met Wednesday to begin debating a bill to remove the Confederate battle flag from its perch near the State House.

title: Where a Prince Might Lay His Head
description: An 11th-century chateau in La Flocellire, a small town in the Vende, France, has a new life as a bed-and-breakfast.

title: Pictures of the Day: The Philippines and Elsewhere
description: The Philippines and More  Photos of the Day

title: Kids in the Kitchen: Strawberry-Rhubarb Ice Cream With a Caramel Swirl
description: Ice Cream. Ice cream, using custard, and with caramel. To me, thats cooking with a solid degree of difficulty, so thats the challenge I decided to offer to my just-14-year-old-son, Sam (with a little help from his 9-year-old brother, Wyatt, and a 9-year-old friend, Trevor).

title: Review: MTVs One Bad Choice, Cautionary Tales of Growing Up
description: For the first half-hour of the first episode of One Bad Choice, an MTV program that begins Thursday night, puzzled viewers might think they have mistakenly landed on Investigation Discovery, the channel known for true-crime stories cheesily re-enacted. But this stark, well-intentioned series turns out to be more serious than that.

title: July 8, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from the Philippines, Bosnia, Iran and France.

title: Baltimore Fires Police Chiefin Wake of Unrest and Crime Surge
description: WASHINGTON  The Baltimore police commissioner, Anthony W. Batts, who arrived in that city three years ago pledging change but lost the confidence of many in his rank and file in the wake of riots in April, was ousted Wednesday by Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake, who said he had become a distraction that hindered efforts to fight a recent surge in violent crime.

title: Tunisia Plans to Build Antiterrorism Wall Along Border With Libya
description: TUNIS  Tunisia is building a 100-mile-long wall along its border with Libya as part of a plan to protect the country from Islamist militants operating in Libya, Prime Minister Habib Essid has said in interviews with local news organizations.

title: Countering Anti-Muslim Hostility With Jokes, Via Ads, Film and a Festival
description: Comedy has long been used by outsiders to ease the worries of a distrustful society, and Muslim stand-up comedians in New York are no different. A coming three-day comedy festival will spotlight their perspective, but their recent efforts to counter Islamophobia through humor have had mixed results.

title: Review: In The Blackest Eye, Aye Nako Draws on Race and Identity
description: AYE NAKO

title: From Will Ferrell to Stuffed Squirrels: 6 Steps to the Perfect TV Spoof
description: The Spoils Before Dying, a freewheeling riff on Los Angeles noir, jazz and bad filmmaking that debuts Wednesday on IFC, is the sequel to The Spoils of Babylon, last years goof on the bombast and sweep of miniseries events like The Winds of War and Shogun.

title: Medicare Plans to Pay Doctors for Counseling on End of Life
description: Medicare, the federal program that insures 55 million older and disabled Americans, announced plans on Wednesday to reimburse doctors for conversations with patients about whether and how they would want to be kept alive if they became too sick to speak for themselves.

title: Review: On Communion, Years & Years Turns the Familiar Into Something of Its Own
description: YEARS & YEARS

title: Scent Received, With a Tap of a Smartphone
description: Back when people communicated more often through physical letters, there was a strong market for perfumed stationery. One sniff, it is said, could bring a rush of memories or longings.

title: Jeb Bush Says He Would Probably Close a U.S. Embassy in Cuba if Elected
description: Jeb Bush is not happy that the United States is planning to open an embassy in Cuba, and he suggested on Wednesday that if he became president it might not remain open for long.

title: Euro, Envisioned as Force for Unity, Becomes Weapon in Greek Crisis
description: As the Greek crisis escalated in recent days, Europes common currency crossed a line that could taint it forever.

title: Hillary Clinton and House Republican Clash Over a Subpoena
description: Representative Trey Gowdy, the South Carolina Republican who is chairman of the House subcommittee investigating the 2012 attacks in Benghazi, Libya, on Wednesday released a copy of a  subpoena sent to Hillary Rodham Clinton, a day after she seemed to suggest in an interview that a subpoena was never issued.

title: .@Twitter. Who Do You Think You Are?
description: Over the last nine years, I have written almost a quarter-million words about Twitter  in blog posts, columns, a book, and, of course, on Twitter. And yet, if you ask me what Twitter actually is, I cant answer that question.

title: App Smart | Secure Your Cellphone
description: Smartphones carry a lot of our personal data, including passwords and credit card and bank account numbers. A variety of security programs add an additional layer of protection for that information.

title: Video Feature: Protect Your Smartphone Data With Some Fortifications
description: Smartphones have a million practical uses, which means they are jammed with credit card numbers, website passwords and other personal information that can tempt thieves or hackers. While phones have built-in protection, you can always add a little more in the form of security apps.

title: Martin OMalley Offers Plan for Debt-Free College in Appeal to Liberals
description: Seeking to appeal to the more liberal wing of the Democratic Party, Martin OMalley unveiled a plan for debt-free college education on Wednesday as he campaigned in New Hampshire, staking out ground on a major policy debate before Hillary Rodham Clinton, his main rival for the partys presidential nomination.

title: A Vintage Dealers Curated Yard Sale
description: MONTAUK, N.Y.  This is the worst place if you have FOMO, or Fear of Missing Out, the designer Cynthia Rowley said at 10 a.m. last Saturday. Thats why Ive been here for three hours.

title: Microsofts Write-Down on Nokia Adds to String of Merger Missteps
description: Microsoft just got a $7.6 billion rude awakening related to its purchase of Nokia. The software giant is writing off most of what it paid for a big piece of the Finnish mobile company in 2014.

title: Amazon Gears Up for New York Fashion Week for Men
description: The click-clack that echoed through the loftlike fashion photography studio was the same click-clack that can be heard in fashion offices around New York City: Manolo Blahnik high heels on polished floors.

title: Review: Off the Main Road Stars Kyra Sedgwick as a Wife in Distress
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass.  The beautiful woman in the bath towel is fast succumbing to the advances of the hunky, hairy-chested man who has forced his way into her rustic hideaway. Shes a society princess; hes a freelance taxi driver, whose true calling is to seek out lonely women who need his special kind of loving.

title: Living With Mental Illness
description: A photographer spent four years documenting the mentally ill to show how  apart from times of crisis  their lives were much the same as other peoples.

title: Vision Festival Celebrates Jazz, Both Past and Future
description: Among the myriad forms of dissonance associated with jazzs avant-garde, the most pernicious might be an inconsistency of tense  as in past, present and future. The first wave of so-called free jazz, near the dawn of the 1960s, arrived with proclamations of hurtling progress: Jazz Advance and Looking Ahead! were the first two albums by Cecil Taylor, their titles brashly echoed in Ornette Colemans Tomorrow Is the Question! and The Shape of Jazz to Come.

title: Review: Gyan Riley Begins an Intimate Residency at the Stone
description: At the Stone, the East Village space known for its experimental programming, genre-hopping musicians can avoid the rigid scheduling of performers and repertory common in the classical music world and announce lineups at the last minute. They also have an ideal platform to try out new collaborations, as the guitarist Gyan Riley did on Tuesday evening.

title: Britain Pledges to Hit NATO Military Spending Target
description: LONDON  After months of pressure from the United States, Britain committed on Wednesday to meeting NATOs military spending target for the rest of the decade, as the government outlined broader plans to smooth the path toward healthy public finances.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres the latest.

title: Showing Dad the Ropes About Braids
description: On a recent Monday evening, 10 men, most in shirt sleeves, escaped work early to attend class on the Upper West Side. The narrow space was at maximum capacity and others were turned away. They would have to wait for the next course in another month. The hot ticket? Dad Braiding 101.

title: American Ballet Theater Fall Season Includes Mark Morris Premiere
description: American Ballet Theater will present a new work by Mark Morris as well as the company premieres of Frederick Ashtons Monotones I and II and George Balanchines Valse-Fantaisie this fall at the David H. Koch Theater, the company announced Wednesday.

title: Haute Couture in Paris
description: The photographer Landon Nordeman captures the beauty on the runways and backstage at the fall 2015 haute couture shows in Paris.

title: Ethiopia Drops Charges Against 5 Defendants in Terrorism Case
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia  Charges against five of the 10 defendants in Ethiopias most high-profile court case were unexpectedly dropped on Wednesday.

title: Dylan Brant: A Young Champion of Young Artists
description: AGE 25

title: The Scene
description: Fendi at Paris Couture Week.

title: Photo Diary: Fendi Fall/Winter 2015 Couture
description: Scenes from Paris Couture Week, captured by Schohaja.

title: Cuomo Establishes Special Prosecutor
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo issued an executive order naming the state attorney general as a special prosecutor for civilian deaths by the police.

title: Its a Stretch, but Putin Will Add Yoga to His Repertoire
description: MOSCOW  Maybe somebody told President Vladimir V. Putin that yoga was all about the warrior poses. Or maybe it was just part of his Asian charm offensive.

title: Study Finds Low Incomes Constrain Half of World
description: UNITED NATIONS  Poverty may be down worldwide, yet that does not mean that yesterdays poor are todays middle class. Data analyzed by the Pew Research Center concluded that more than half the worlds population remains low-income, while another 15 percent are still what a report issued by the center on Wednesday called poor.

title: Promise Is Seen in an Inexpensive Cholera Vaccine
description: An inexpensive, little-known cholera vaccine appears to work so well that it can protect entire communities and perhaps head off explosive epidemics like the one that killed nearly 10,000 Haitians in 2010.

title: Jacob deGrom Rebounds to Help Mets Continue Resurgence Out West
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Come Sunday night, when his teammates head for a brief vacation, Jacob deGrom will travel to Cincinnati for the All-Star Game. He will enjoy the festivities with family members, but more important, he will pitch.

title: A Look Back at Sneakers
description: Some iconic sneakers from the 1800s to present day

title: For Sneakerheads, an Exhibit That Chronicles the Culture of Their Beloved Shoes
description: Sean Williams, the producer of Obsessive Sneaker Disorder, an online talk show, remembers the dark days of casual footwear  the dirty looks, the stigma, the straight-up bans.

title: How to Look Sharp and Office Appropriate in the Summer
description: Begin by relaxing, with tailoring in looser, breezier cuts. Here are some more tips.

title: A Look Inside Couture Fashion Week
description: The photographer Landon Nordeman was on the scene at Couture Fashion Week, documenting the action both on the runways and behind the scenes.

title: Shopping Events and Sales Happening This Week in New York
description: The Fourth of July has come and gone, but midsummer sales? Theyre just getting started. Barneys New York and Bergdorf Goodman have slashed prices by up to 75 percent. The goodies at Barneys include Saint Laurent leopard-print suede platform sandals ($399, originally $995) and a Proenza Schouler clutch with a lamb-fur flap and suede side panels ($729, originally $1,825). At Bergdorf, youll find a Dries Van Noten sequined skirt ($459, originally $1,840) and a Marc Jacobs military jacket ($299, originally $1,200). And at the Saks Fifth Avenue consolidation sale, discounts reach 80 percent.

title: Berlusconi Is Convicted in Graft Case
description: ROME  A court in Naples on Wednesday convicted Silvio Berlusconi  the media mogul and Italys former prime minister  of corruption, finding him guilty of bribing a senator to undermine the government of his longtime opponent, Romano Prodi.

title: Doctors Notes for Pregnant Employees Can Backfire, Experts Warn
description: Women who seek accommodations from their employers during pregnancy are sometimes fired or forced into unpaid leave for a surprising reason: Their doctors note was not carefully worded, experts warned on Wednesday.

title: Mapping Segregation
description: New government rules will require all cities and towns receiving federal housing funds to assess patterns of segregation.

title: Taliban-Afghan Meeting Ends With Optimism and Plans to Hold More Talks
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Delegations from the Afghan government and the Taliban wrapped up their first official meeting in Pakistan with an agreement to meet again in several weeks and continue discussions about the possible opening of peace talks, Afghan and Pakistani officials said Wednesday.

title: A ColoradoCoal Mining Town Struggles to Define Its Future
description: SOMERSET, Colo.  For more than a century, the economy and identity of this tiny community wedged into the mountains have been defined by the coal heaps, railroad tracks and deep underground mines that filled train cars with coal and miners pockets with money. Welcome to Somerset, says the blue sign at the entrance to town, Coal mining town since 1896.

title: Nearly 200,000 Hummers Recalled After Fires Are Reported to G.M.
description: General Motors is recalling about 196,000 Hummer sport utility vehicles because of an electrical problem that resulted in at least two vehicles being destroyed in fires, the automaker said on Wednesday.

title: For Soccer Teams Parade, a Whirlwind of High-Level Activity in City Hall
description: As the United States national soccer team prepared to take the field in the Womens World Cup final on Sunday, the phone of Mayor Bill de Blasios top political fixer began to buzz.

title: Paramount and 2 Theater Chains in Deal to Hurry 2 Films to Digital
description: LOS ANGELES  Two theater chains will allow Paramount Pictures to make two low-budget horror movies available on digital services just 17 days after they leave most theaters in return for a cut of the studios digital revenue.

title: Setting a Deadline for Greece Proves Much Easier Than Sealing a Fate
description: BRUSSELS  After five years of crises, conflicts and deadlines that have come and gone without resolution, Greece and the European countries that have been propping it up financially have come to what they all insist is a final reckoning, with just days to decide whether Greece stays in the euro system or is cast out.

title: Mother Recalls Last Breath of Slain Boy, 1, as Trial Begins
description: Cherisse Miller wept on the witness stand in a Brooklyn courtroom on Wednesday when shown a photograph of her son Antiq Henniss stained nylon stroller. On the evening of Sept. 1, 2013, she testified, she had watched emergency workers lift her wounded son from that stroller into a waiting ambulance.

title: Minnesotas Somali-Americans Urge New Treatment for Would-Be Terrorists
description: MINNEAPOLIS  A federal judge here on Wednesday ordered three young men accused of plotting to travel to Syria to fight for the Islamic State kept in detention while awaiting trial, at least for now. That decision came after the defense argued that entrusting the men immediately to their families and Somali-American leaders was the best way to insulate them from radical Islam.

title: Trans-Pacific Partnerships Potential Impact Weighed in Asia and U.S.
description: HONG KONG  Willie Fung, a leader in the worlds bra industry, knows just what he will do if negotiators from the United States and 11 Pacific Rim nations complete a Trans-Pacific Partnership trade agreement this summer.

title: An Optimistic Marco Rubio Introduces Himself to Iowans
description: WINDSOR HEIGHTS, Iowa  There was something off about Marco Rubios yard signs. They were not his. An enterprising staff member had borrowed a few from a local state senator and covered up his name by taping over it with a placard that read Marco Rubio: A New American Century.

title: Bad Math and a Coming Public Pension Crisis
description: When Jim Palermo was serving as a trustee of the village of La Grange, Ill., he noticed something peculiar about the local police officers and firefighters. They were not going to live as long as might be expected, at least according to pension tables.

title: Audit Details $310,000 in Prohibited Expenses by Queens Librarys Leaders
description: In a sweeping critique of past spending and accounting practices at the Queens Library, a city audit released on Wednesday detailed more than $310,000 in prohibited expenses by the former president of the system, Thomas W. Galante, and by other executives. More than $100,000 of these expenses, officials contended, could amount to fraud and embezzlement.

title: Cosby Legal and Publicity Teams Opt for Silence After Admission Is Released
description: Since last fall, as more than two dozen women have come forward to accuse Bill Cosby of sexual assault, the star and his team of advisers have pursued an aggressive legal and media strategy.

title: Montclair State University Receives $20 Million, Anonymously
description: Montclair State University announced on Wednesday that it had received a $20 million gift from an anonymous donor, the largest in its 107-year history.

title: A Revived Approach: The Serve and Volley
description: WIMBLEDON, England  It was hardly like the old days, when serve and volley and getting to the net were the rule at Wimbledon instead of the clear exception.

title: An Offline N.Y.S.E. Makes Barely a Ripple in a Days Trading
description: Investors who wanted to buy and sell shares of companies listed on the New York Stock Exchange, such as I.B.M. or Target, were still able to do so with ease on Wednesday.

title: For Jeb Bush, Love for His Wife and a Secure Border
description: HUDSON, N.H.  Jeb Bush declared Wednesday night that his love for his Mexican-American wife was entirely compatible with his views on tightening the border with Mexico, calling an online skirmish started by Donald Trump over the weekend ludicrous and bizarre.

title: I.R.S. Cracks Down on Hedge Fund Tax Strategy
description: Hedge funds that used a strategy to claim billions of dollars in tax savings will face new scrutiny from the government, according to guidance issued by the Internal Revenue Service on Wednesday.

title: Lawmakers Move to Limit Governments Role in Education
description: WASHINGTON  Congress on Wednesday moved to substantially scale back the federal governments role in education, particularly the use of high-stakes standardized testing to punish schools, in the first significant proposed revisions since the No Child Left Behind law was passed 14 years ago.

title: After Killing Tied to Deported Felon, San Francisco Mayor Mulls Policy Shift
description: LOS ANGELES  With San Franciscos immigration policies drawing criticism from Democrats and Republicans alike, Mayor Edwin M. Lee said Wednesday that he would speak to federal officials about how the city could participate in a new Obama administration deportation program, after a Mexican felon who had been deported five times was charged with murdering a 32-year-old woman, Kathryn Steinle, as she walked on a tourist pier in the city last week.

title: United States Womens Open: Trying to Gain an Edge, a Caddie Loses His Job
description: LANCASTER, Pa.  Sei Young Kim of South Korea was on the practice green putting for 29 minutes in the late afternoon sun on the eve of the United States Womens Open. But Kim, a 22-year-old rookie sensation on the L.P.G.A. Tour, was the only one who stood out among several players.

title: Aurora Gunman Legally Insane, Psychiatrist Says
description: DENVER  A star witness for the defense in James E. Holmess murder trial testified this week that Mr. Holmes was schizophrenic and legally insane in July 2012, when he opened fire in a crowded movie theater in the neighboring suburb of Aurora, killing 12 people and injuring 70.

title: Baltimore Mayor on Police Shake-Up
description: Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake announced that she had decided to replace the citys police commissioner, Anthony W. Batts. She named Kevin Davis as the interim commissioner.

title: Prompt
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  When last we saw John Guzzetta, he was busy impressing us with his avian knowledge. Today, he is bending the theme entries in his grid to his will. Actually, hes bending them to the right.

title: Running in the Wild
description: Orienteering is a cross-country race that requires a map, a compass and a pair of running shoes.

title: Helen Harrison, Authority on the Trials of Premature Births, Dies at 68
description: Helen Harrison, who was so unprepared when her son was born prematurely that she later wrote a popular manual for parents in similar situations and became their advocate, died on Saturday at her home in Berkeley, Calif. She was 68.

title: Orienteerings Key to Winning: Not Getting Lost
description: UPPSALA, Sweden  About 100 yards inside one entrance of the Lunsen forest is a rock ledge formed millenniums ago when all of Scandinavia was covered by ice. A thicket of bushes lines the near edge of a gully that drops down 15 feet. On the far edge, a group of trees rises, like fingers splayed wide, providing the false impression that they are not so far away when in fact, a steep fall awaits anyone who steps off the precipice. To the side of the ledge is a medium-size stone.

title: Amtrak Is Urged to Install Cameras to Monitor Engineers
description: WASHINGTON  The National Transportation Safety Board on Wednesday recommended that Amtrak install video cameras inside the cabs of all its trains to monitor the actions of its engineers.

title: Jason Pierre-Paul Is Said to Lose Right Index Finger After Fireworks Accident
description: Jason Pierre-Paul, the Giants two-time Pro Bowl defensive end, had his right index finger amputated Wednesday at a South Florida hospital, according to a person in football with knowledge of the procedure.

title: Cuomos Order for Special Prosecutor in Police Deaths Is Criticized
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo signed an executive order on Wednesday designating the state attorney general, Eric T. Schneiderman, as a special prosecutor for certain police-related civilian deaths. The order came amid vociferous calls for police reform from several families of New Yorkers who died at the hands of police officers.

title: Principal to Be Fired Over Investigation Into Grade-Fixing at a Brooklyn School
description: The Department of Education announced on Wednesday that it would fire the principal of John Dewey High School in Brooklyn, after a yearlong investigation found that she allowed students at risk of not graduating to make up credits in classes where they received no substantial instruction and, in some cases, were not required to have contact with teachers.

title: Yankees Again Rely on Home Runs, and Get a Home Win
description: Clinging to first place with the All-Star break approaching, the Yankees were buoyed Wednesday by the return of two difference makers, Jacoby Ellsbury and Andrew Miller.

title: Overhauled Knicks Set to Take the Court
description: LAS VEGAS  As off-seasons go, this has been a relatively pleasant one for the Knicks. For starters, they have not lost a game in nearly three months. They picked up two first-round picks, Kristaps Porzingis and Jerian Grant, in the N.B.A. draft. They agreed to deals with four players, albeit no franchise-altering stars, in free agency.

title: Fashion Blogger Who Claimed Tie to Johnny Depp Accepts Plea Deal
description: A fashion blogger who claimed to be a stylist for the actor Johnny Depp and the musician Brandon Flowers  and then bought expensive clothing in Manhattan boutiques, purportedly on their behalf  has pleaded guilty in a deal that allows him to avoid prison.

title: Chinese Stocks Rise, but Fears Persist
description: HONG KONG  Volatility continues to reign in the Chinese stock market, as investors and the government scramble to deal with wild ups and downs.

title: Islanders Still Touching Up Their New Home
description: The Islanders are three months from their regular-season opener at Barclays Center, against the reigning Stanley Cup champions, the Chicago Blackhawks. Their first preseason game in Brooklyn is Sept. 21. And there still seems to be plenty of work to do before the team can call their new rink a home.

title: A Fancy Planter from Louis Vuitton
description: Louis Vuittons new collection of limited-edition accessories and furniture is inspired by luxury and travel. One of their collaborators, the French designer Damien Langlois-Meurinne, created an object associated with neither: a plant stand. Inspired by the fashion houses classic No bag, his elegant Totem Floral is wrapped in sumptuous leather, with five gold-plated brass brackets.

title: One Photographers Eerie, Mysterious View of Nature
description: In this weekly series, Ts photo editors share the most compelling visual projects theyve discovered.

title: History of Abuse Seen in Many Girls in Juvenile System
description: As many as 80 percent of the girls in some states juvenile justice systems have a history of sexual or physical abuse, according to a report released Thursday. The report, a rare examination of their plight, recommends that girls who have been sexually trafficked no longer be arrested on prostitution charges.

title: Keith Olbermann and ESPN to Part Ways
description: Keith Olbermann, who returned to ESPN two years ago to host a late-night show on ESPN2 that was eventually shifted to the afternoon, will leave the network this month.

title: IBM Discloses Working Version of a Much Higher-Capacity Chip
description: IBM said on Thursday that it had made working versions of ultradense computer chips, with roughly four times the capacity of todays most powerful chips.

title: DeAndre Jordan Rejoins Clippers, Spurning Mavericks
description: DeAndre Jordan, whose foray into N.B.A. free agency ballooned into an adventure, ended nearly 12 hours of suspense and ridiculousness by re-signing with the Los Angeles Clippers shortly after midnight Eastern on Thursday, minutes after the leagues eight-day moratorium on signings and trades reached its conclusion.

title: Whats On TV Thursday
description: 10:34 A.M. (Comedy Central) BE KIND REWIND (2008) Mike (Yasiin Bey, then known as Mos Def), a clerk in a failing video store in Passaic, N.J., and Jerry (Jack Black), his auto-mechanic friend, recreate the shops films after theyre accidentally erased in this comedy, written and directed by Michel Gondry. (Above, from left, Melonie Diaz, Mr. Black and Mos Def.) The result: a line around the block. Writing in The New York Times, A. O. Scott said the film connects the do-it-yourself aesthetic of YouTube and other digital diversions with the older, predigital impulse to put on a show in the backyard or play your favorite bands hits with your buddies in the garage, adding, Its inviting, undemanding and altogether wonderful.

title: Number of Syrian Refugees Climbs to More Than 4 Million
description: GENEVA  The number of Syrians who have fled into neighboring countries to escape the civil war has reached more than four million, the United Nations said Thursday, and with the fighting dragging into its fifth year the number is still rising.

title: South Carolina House Votes to Remove Confederate Flag
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  The Confederate battle flag that has flown at the South Carolina State House for more than 50 years will soon be gone after lawmakers capped a tension-filled session early Thursday and voted to remove it from the grounds of the State Capitol.

title: Corrections: July 9, 2015
description: NATIONAL

title: Quotation of the Day
description: There are no buyers, only sellers.

title: Hollywood Interns
description: To the Editor:

title: Fixing Summer School
description: To the Editor:

title: Limiting the Use of Antisatellite Weapons in Space
description: To the Editor:

title: Boko Haram in Nigeria
description: To the Editor:

title: Two Views of Baltimore
description: To the Editor:

title: Health Insurers Request for Higher Rates
description: To the Editor:

title: Why Is the Federal Government Afraid of Fat?
description: BOSTON  SINCE the publication of the federal governments 1980 Dietary Guidelines, dietary policy has focused on reducing total fat in the American diet  specifically, to no more than 30 percent of a persons daily calories. This fear of fat has had far-reaching impacts, from consumer preferences to the billions of dollars spent by the military, government-run hospitals and school districts on food. As we argue in a recently published article in The Journal of the American Medical Association, 35 years after that policy shift, its long past time for us to exonerate dietary fat.

title: Jimmy Carter, His Legacy and a Rabbit
description: Quiz time: Which American president was attacked by a killer rabbit?

title: Germanys Failure of Vision
description: BERLIN  THE Greek crisis represents the first real test of German leadership since World War II. Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany has thus far flunked it, with tragic consequences for Europe.

title: Harper Lee, My Daughter and Me
description: FAIRHOPE, ALA.  IN 2004 my daughter, Meredith, won an Alabama-wide high school contest to write an essay about To Kill a Mockingbird. The finalists from each school were invited to a luncheon at the University of Alabama, and Meredith, as statewide winner, got to bring Mom and Dad along. My wife, Nancy, and I were delighted. The elusive author herself, wed learned, was scheduled to be there. Harper Lee. The name was an incantation.

title: Gov. Christies Chance to Do Right by Voters
description: As he roams far from New Jersey hugging voters in his quest for the White House, Gov. Chris Christie has a golden opportunity to demonstrate his faith in the people  yes, the people  by signing a groundbreaking voter registration bill passed last month by the state Legislature. It would make New Jersey a national leader by establishing automatic voter enrollment at the state Motor Vehicle Commission, encouraging early voting opportunities and expanding multilanguage election materials.

title: The Struggle for Fairness for Transgender Workers
description: Shortly after graduating from college in Pennsylvania last year, Elaine Rita Mendus hopped on a Greyhound bus, hoping the $2,000 in her bank account would keep her afloat until the first paycheck. There was only one city in the country that seemed moderately promising for a 6-foot-3 transgender woman in the early stages of transitioning to launch a career.

title: Honda Recalls 4.5 Million More Vehicles Over Takata Airbags
description: TOKYO  Honda on Thursday announced another multimillion-vehicle recall to replace airbags supplied by Takata, this time targeting 4.5 million vehicles in Japan and other markets outside North America.

title: Etgar Keret: By the Book
description: The novelist, story writer and author, most recently, of the memoir The Seven Good Years, is a fan of Kafka. It was a great comfort to discover a writer who seemed to be even more stressed and screwed up than I was.

title: The Mixed-Up Brothers of Bogot
description: What happens when two pairs of identical twins are accidentally scrambled at birth?

title: Welser-Mst and the Cleveland Orchestra Head to Lincoln Center Festival
description: CLEVELAND  After an hourlong private yoga lesson here, hanging upside down from ropes on the wall and stretching into positions that sometimes left him gasping for breath, Franz Welser-Mst, the music director of the Cleveland Orchestra, was in a contemplative state of mind.

title: The Mixed-Up Brothers of Bogot
description: Leer en espaol

title: Greek Economy Under Siege, With Fears That the Worst Is Coming
description: ATHENS  As Greece hurtles toward a Sunday deadline for either reaching a bailout deal or risking a hasty exit from the eurozone, the one certainty is that its economy is already on the brink of collapse.

title: GVC Holdings Offers to Buy Gambling Rival Bwin.Party
description: LONDON  The online gambling company GVC Holdings said on Thursday that it had offered to acquire Bwin.Party Digital Entertainment in a deal that values its rival at more than 900 million pounds, or about $1.4 billion.

title: What You Need to Know About Chinas Draft Cybersecurity Law
description: China, which has some of the worlds tightest Internet restrictions, has released a draft of a new cybersecurity law that authorizes broad powers to control the flow of online information. The bill, which has been translated into English on the website China Law Translate, comes after the recent passage of a law on national security and with the expected approval of bills on nongovernmental organizationsand counterterrorism.

title: In Iran Nuclear Talks, U.S. Will Not Be Rushed, Kerry Says
description: VIENNA  Secretary of State John Kerry said on Thursday that the United States would continue to negotiate in pursuit of a nuclear agreement with Iran that could endure for decades, but cautioned that the talks would not be open-ended.

title: Thursdays Travel News and Tips
description: Our weekday morning digest that includes consumer news, deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.

title: A Bike Tour of Eastern Kentuckys Back Roads
description: Ale-8-One is a ginger-ale-like soda usually sold in glass bottles and popular in the hills of eastern Kentucky. During a bike trip through the region last month, for example, I washed down a burger with one on the back porch of a bed-and-breakfast owned by a man who once walked more than 3,000 miles across America on stilts. The next night, I blasted another out of the crook of a tree branch with a 9-millimeter Smith & Wesson.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Skeet Shooting With Lindsey Graham  Katie Couric Is Coming!
description: Yes, I went skeet shooting with Senator Lindsey Graham. I actually stood directly to the South Carolina Republicans left at one point, calling out Pull  the required command, apparently, to launch a clay pigeon into the air  and popping off a few (wildly off the mark) rounds.

title: New York Today: A Confetti Primer
description: Good morning on this slightly cooler Thursday.

title: Chuck Blazer, Ex-FIFA Official, Is Banned for Life From Soccer
description: LONDON  Chuck Blazer, the former FIFA executive committee member who has pleaded guilty to widespread corruption charges in the United States, was banned for life from soccer-related activities on Thursday by world soccers governing body.

title: The Illusion of a Liberal Supreme Court
description: For one, brief shining moment  that is to say, last week  there was a liberal Roberts court.

title: Black Lives and Books of the Dead
description: The past weekend, I met with the New Orleans mayor, Mitch Landrieu, in his office. He had something he wanted to show me.

title: Today in Politics: Senate Leaves Cybersecurity Off Its Post-Holiday Rush
description: Good Thursday morning from Washington. Congress is making plans to accommodate the pope, two former presidents are meeting while their families squabble, and the Senate has a lengthy to-do list. But that list does not include a cybersecurity bill the Senate deemed crucial only a few weeks ago.

title: Morning Agenda: Alarm Over Computer Failures
description: ALARM OVER COMPUTER FAILURES | There was no evidence that the computer failures that disrupted the New York Stock Exchange, United Airlines and The Wall Street Journals website on Wednesday were part of a coordinated attack, but  Nathaniel Popper writes in DealBook that they are likely to revive a debate about how regulators can better safeguard the markets from technological glitches. A person who was on a call with other members of the trading industry told Mr. Popper that New York exchange employees expressed panic as they acknowledged they had lost control of the system.

title: Joshua Oppenheimer Wont Go Back to Indonesia
description: Your first film, The Act of Killing, was a portrait of the perpetrators of the 1965 Indonesian genocide, in which perhaps a million people suspected of being Communists were killed. In your new film, The Look of Silence, you focus on the murder of a single victim, Ramli Rukun. What made his killing stand out? Ramlis murder had witnesses. Tens of thousands of others in that region were taken to rivers and killed, their bodies left to drift out to sea. Ramlis body was dumped on an oil-palm plantation. For survivors, talking about Ramli was a way of insisting that the genocide had actually happened.

title: Why Did Every Touch Cause This 2-Year-Old Pain?
description: The child stopped walking. Bones in his scans appeared to be mottled and irregular. Could there be a nutritional cure?

title: A French Castle, Now Open to All
description: Viscount Patrice Vignials home has been in his family, on and off, since the turn of the century  the 11th century.

title: Hillary Clintons Economic Agenda Aims at a Party Shifting Left
description: Nearly 20 years after President Bill Clinton declared that the era of big government is over, Hillary Rodham Clinton is proposing muscular federal policies that would require hundreds of billions of dollars in new spending and markedly expand Washingtons influence in a host of areas, from universal prekindergarten to Alzheimers disease research.

title: Seeing God Through My Patients
description: My patient was in her early 20s and a newlywed when she learned she had acute leukemia four years ago. Despite the tsunami of procedures, conversations, medications and emotions that always accompany such a diagnosis, she was a tranquil island, still and serene.

title: The Souths Heritage Is So Much More Than a Flag
description: First off, I love the Southland.

title: Beyonc to Perform at Global Citizen Festival in Central Park
description: Beyonc is fighting against inequality and world hunger the best way she knows how: with a huge concert.

title: Conservationists in China Seek to Get Firefly Parks Closed
description: A program inviting Chinese city dwellers to reconnect with nature by visiting a Shanghai enclosure with thousands of fireflies inside has been suspended after conservationists warned that it could lead to ecological damage and the local authorities raised safety concerns.

title: Living With Mental Illness
description: Dramatic black-and-white images of the mentally ill have been a mainstay in photography since the early 20th century. Hundreds of photographers have documented out-of-control  and often untreated  patients trapped in mental hospitals that were often more like prisons.

title: A Different Bagpiper
description: Dear Diary:

title: An Impassioned Plea in South Carolina
description: State Representative Jenny Anderson Horne calls on colleagues to remove the Confederate battle flag from the grounds of the South Carolina State House.

title: Facebook Gives Users More Control Over Their News Feeds
description: A perennial complaint from Facebook users is that they dont have much control over what appears in their news feed, the main flow of posts on their Facebook home page or app screen. The social networks mysterious computer algorithm analyzes thousands of signals, then spits out what it thinks you want to see based on the kinds of posts you have liked in the past and who you tend to interact with or ignore on the service.

title: Jeb Bush and Hillary Clinton Spar Over Worker Hours
description: The sparring between the presidential candidates Jeb Bush and Hillary Rodham Clinton has started early, and in this case the fight is over who better understands the plight of the American worker.

title: Scientists Demonstrate Animal Mind-Melds
description: A single neuron cant do much on its own, but link billions of them together into a network and youve got a brain.

title: Review: Robin Williams as a Hustler-Hiring Husband in Boulevard
description: In Boulevard, billed as Robin Williamss final on-screen performance, the twinkle in his eye had faded into a dead stare. The mischievous, manic clown, beckoning us to follow him to a comic three-ring circus, has shriveled to an unreadable automaton with cringing body language. This isnt the first movie in which Mr. Williams played dark and shrouded. His character in One Hour Photo (2002) was a creepy smiling psychopath.

title: For Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders, Bold Fixes Mean High Price Tags
description: Both candidates have laid out lofty policy proposals that would require high levels of new spending in areas ranging from child care to job growth.

title: Cant Fire Him: Republican Party Frets Over What to Do With Donald Trump
description: Republican Party leaders agonize over the prospect that Donald Trump will mount a third-party candidacy that could undermine their nominee. They fear insulting the white working-class voters who admire him. They are loath to tangle with a threat-flinging firebrand for whom there are no rules of engagement.

title: Daily Report: Yahoo to Enter Fantasy Sports Market
description: Even as legalized gambling has spread nationwide to include lotteries, casinos and just about every imaginable type of slot machine, the notion of betting on sports has remained, outside of Las Vegas, largely in the shadows, Vindu Goel and Joe Drape report.

title: Jenny Hornes Plea to Remove the Confederate Flag
description: In the early morning on Thursday, after hours of emotional debate, members of the South Carolina House voted to remove the Confederate flag from the State Capitol.

title: A Scene From Self/Less
description: A sequence from the film.

title: The Power of Perfume
description: PARIS  A few years ago, I was standing in a crowded New York subway car when I caught a brief, passing whiff of the perfume worn by the elegantly dressed woman next to me: lilac with perhaps a trace of talcum powder.

title: MasterCard Faces Antitrust Charges in E.U.
description: LONDON  European antitrust officials filed formal charges against MasterCard on Thursday, accusing the company of setting artificially high fees for credit card transactions in the European Union, which ultimately may have hurt consumers.

title: Beauty and Truth, Fountains at the New York Public Library, Flow Again
description: You all know Patience and Fortitude.

title: Gazprom Cancels Italian Contractors Deal for Black Sea Pipeline
description: LONDON  The Italian oil field contractor Saipem said on Thursday that Gazprom, the Russian natural gas exporter, had canceled its 2.4 billion euro, or $2.6 billion, contract to build a pipeline under the Black Sea.

title: P.&G. Sells 43 Beauty Brands to Coty
description: The consumer products giant Procter & Gamble has agreed to sell its portfolio of 43 beauty brands to the beauty products maker Coty for $12.5 billion, the companies announced on Thursday.

title: Israel Says Hamas Is Holding Two Citizens in Gaza
description: JERUSALEM  Two Israeli civilians are being held by Hamas in Gaza, one of them a man who walked into the Palestinian coastal territory in September, the Israeli authorities said Thursday.

title: Pope Francis Faces a Latin America Where Many Catholics Worship to a Different Beat
description: QUITO, Ecuador  The rock music boomed as the congregants at this simple, white-walled church sang and clapped, raising their arms skyward as they prayed aloud and swayed to the beat. The sermon included jokes and a call-and-response with people in the pews. There was even a faith healing testimonial.

title: 1915: Germans Capitulate in Africa
description: LONDON  An official telegram received from Pretoria to-day [July 9] announces that General Botha has accepted the capitulation of the whole of the German forces in German South-West Africa. This triumphal end of General Bothas masterly campaign against the German forces had been expected for some days, owing to the rapid progress of General Bothas troops in Damaraland. A despatch received from Cape Town yesterday stated that the capture of 750 Germans and their guns represented only the first results of General Bothas masterly enveloping movement, which is paralyzing the Germans and has entirely frustrated any attempt at scattered guerrilla warfare. The end is believed to be near.  The New York Herald, European Edition, July 10, 1915

title: Sonya Tayeh Strides Into New Yorks Dance World With The Wild Party
description: The choreographer Sonya Tayeh had been working in Los Angeles for six months, when she presented her agent with a career wish list. It said: I want to do a musical like Spring Awakening. I want a career like Bill T. Jones  that shows Tony Award-winning choreographer and a pillar of the modern dance scene. And the list ended: I want to be on So You Think You Can Dance. Her agent, she recalled recently, was looking at me like I was crazy. Choreographers pursuing a career in Hollywood might also have Broadway aspirations, but few dream of making a mark in concert dance, too, with its different aesthetics and audiences, not to mention its smaller paychecks.

title: Argentine Lessons For Greece
description: If Grexit happens, then what? As so often in recent years, the best hope for an answer comes from turning to history; even though exits from a currency union are rare, we do have cases that seem to offer reasonable parallels, notably Argentinas abandonment of the convertibility law  basically a supposedly permanent one-peso-one-dollar rule  at the beginning of 2002.

title: Chaos After London Tube Workers Strike
description: Mayor Boris Johnson of London and commuters on Thursday spoke about getting through the day after a 24-hour walkout by union members brought the citys underground rail network to a halt.

title: Another Flag Spurs Controversy, This Time in Spain
description: MADRID  The running of the bulls this week in Pamplona, Spain, has produced its usual share of drama, including the goring of two Americans and one Briton on Tuesday.

title: Greek Cash Crunch Goes to Market
description: Athenss Ichthyoskales fish auction is the largest in Greece, but capital controls and bank closings have hurt its ability to function.

title: Donald Trump Says R.N.C. Chairman Called to Congratulate Him
description: Donald J. Trump insisted on Thursday that his phone call with Reince Priebus, the chairman of the Republican National Committee, was brief and described it as congratulatory instead of condemnatory, in contrast to news accounts of the talk.

title: Lightweight Shoes for the Warmest Months
description: Snappy summer boat footwear, sneakers and slip-ons, for the beach, the tennis court and beyond.

title: The Material World of Fendi, Boucheron and De Beers
description: PARIS  They knew it would be controversial. Before the show, attendees received emails asking everyone to bring formal identification as security at the venues entrance will be strict.

title: Greek Plan Accepts Austerity to Get Debt Relief
description: ATHENS  Only a day after grim predictions of financial and social collapse in Greece, a scramble appeared underway to work out the details of a new bailout package to bring the country back from the brink of falling out of the euro.

title: ISIS Leaders Reported Killed in Drone Strike in Afghanistan
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan  Two senior Pakistani militants who had pledged allegiance to the Islamic State were among at least 24 people killed in an American drone strike in eastern Afghanistan on Monday, Pakistani and Afghan security officials said Thursday.

title: Defying Time and Space
description: He looks out of place, at least at first. Wearing a Mets uniform that grants no slimming effect to his block of a body, he could easily be mistaken for an overinvested fan who has wandered past assorted Authorized Personnel Only signs at Citi Field, onto the outfield grass.

title: What to Do This Weekend
description: Need help making plans this weekend?

title: The Characters
description: Meet the four men whose lives were upended when they discovered that they were identical twins raised as two pairs of fraternal twins.

title: Restaurant Report: Konyvbar in Budapest
description: When Gabor Szalay and Ildiko Beky told friends they planned to open a restaurant with menus inspired by books, the response was unanimous. Everyone said, Dont do it!  Ms. Beky recalled. They said, People will come to read, not to eat.

title: Review: Missing Sneaker Culture at the Brooklyn Museum
description: Whatever your demographic, youve probably worn sneakers at some point in your life, whether for running, walking, any number of sports or just as everyday footwear. You might be amused to find examples of some you have actually owned in The Rise of Sneaker Culture at the Brooklyn Museum, a nostalgically affecting but intellectually lightweight show. As a kid in the early 60s, I wore PF Flyers like the ones in the exhibition. The distinctively blue and yellow Nike Waffle Trainers with wafflelike treads introduced in 1974? I had a pair of those, too.

title: Review: Hannibal Buress Debuts His New Comedy Central Show
description: Hannibal Buress meant it when he said he didnt want to talk about Bill Cosby anymore. He could have addressed the latest Cosby revelation (this weeks report that Mr. Cosby had acknowledged procuring sedatives to drug women) in the first episode of his Comedy Central series, Why? With Hannibal Buress, on Wednesday night. (Episodes of the show are taped the day before broadcast.)

title: Hotel Review: Occidental El Embajador in the Dominican Republic
description: From 5,390 Dominican pesos, about $120 at 44.75 pesos to the dollar.

title: F.D.A. Extends Deadline for Calorie Counts on Menus
description: WASHINGTON  The Food and Drug Administration has delayed by a year the deadline for the nations chain restaurants, pizza parlors and movie theaters to post calorie counts on their menus in what some consumer advocates said was a setback for public health but others contended would simply give companies enough time to comply.

title: Wimbledon 2015: Serena Williams and Garbie Muguruza Gain Final
description: WIMBLEDON, England  There are few things that put Serena Williams in a cheerful and expansive mood more easily than a dominant victory over Maria Sharapova.

title: New York Police Department Is Undercounting Street Stops, Report Says
description: Some New York City police officers have been stopping people for questioning but not documenting the encounters as required, calling into doubt the official accounting of a significant decline in stop-and-frisk activity, according to the first report of the federal monitor overseeing the Police Department.

title: Willie Nelson Named Winner of Gershwin Prize by Library of Congress
description: The Library of Congress has named Willie Nelson, a musical explorer in country music and beyond, the latest recipient of its Gershwin Prize for Popular Song, James H. Billington, the Librarian of Congress, said in a statement Thursday.

title: Comic-Con 2015: Sometimes, Celebrities Also Don Costumes
description: SAN DIEGO  Dont be too quick to step on the clawed toes or elbow the heavily mailed ribs of the character next to you in the endless lines at Comic-Con International. They might belong to someone whose autograph you should be chasing.

title: Turkeys President Issues Mandate to Form a New Government
description: ISTANBUL  President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey gave the countrys prime minister, Ahmet Davutoglu, a formal mandate on Thursday to form a new government, after days of criticism that the president had been dragging his feet.

title: Keith Richards Releasing a Solo Album
description: Keith Richards, the seemingly invincible Rolling Stones guitarist, will release a solo album  his first in 23 years  on Sept. 18, he announced Thursday. Crosseyed Heart (Republic) will touch on rock, country, blues and reggae, with songs written by Mr. Richards, as well as the drummer and producer Steve Jordan and Norah Jones, among other guests.

title: Phil Rudd Sentenced to Eight Months of House Detention
description: Phil Rudd, a drummer for AC/DC, was sentenced to eight months of house detention by a New Zealand court on Thursday for threatening murder and drug possession. Mr. Rudd, 61, pleaded guilty to the charges in April and will serve his sentence at his home in Tauranga, New Zealand, according to the BBC.

title: Ad for Rolling Stones Exhibition Banned from London Underground
description: A poster for the coming Rolling Stones exhibition at the Saatchi Gallery in London  showing a bright pink tongue on the front of a pair of womens underwear  has been banned from the London Underground until adjustments can be made to make it less explicit.

title: Comic-Con 2015: Batman v. Superman v. Fans
description: SAN DIEGO Theres something vaguely disconcerting about the logo for Batman v. Superman: Dawn of Justice, which is all over Comic-Con International tote bags here.

title: Greeks Watch and Wait for What the Future Holds: Reporters Notebook
description: The Oxi pamphlets calling for a no vote still litter the streets of Athens. But a few days after Greeks celebrated the repudiation of a bailout package that would tether them to austerity, anxiety about their nations future is as high as it has been since I started covering this story three years ago.

title: Geoffrey Zakarian Drops Out of Donald Trumps New Hotel
description: Another high-profile chef has dropped out of Donald Trumps forthcoming luxury hotel in the historic Old Post Office Pavilion in Washington, D.C., after Mr. Trumps provocative statements about Mexican immigrants.

title: Comic-Con 2015: Conan OBrien Raises the Roof
description: SAN DIEGO  Masters of the Universe, they are not (costumes notwithstanding). But the denizens of Comic-Con International, which began with a preview on Wednesday night, are surely the masters of good line behavior.

title: Alan Grayson Defends Bid for Marco Rubio Seat Amid Democratic Concerns
description: Alan Grayson, the newly minted Senate candidate from Florida, is confident, as was evident in how he began a telephone interview.

title: Republicans Yield as Confederate Flag Issue Roils Congress
description: WASHINGTON  The anguished national debate over the future of the Confederate flag exploded on the House floor on Thursday as Democrats, led by black members from the South, beat back a push by Republicans to allow Confederate symbols at national cemeteries.

title: The Rise of Sneaker Culture
description: Torontos Bata Shoe Museum brings its collection of footwear history to the Brooklyn Museum.

title: Los protagonistas
description: Estos son los cuatro jvenes cuyas vidas cambiaron totalmente cuando descubrieron que eran dos pares de gemelos que haban crecido como dos pares de mellizos.

title: The Handpulled Noodle
description: Northwest Chinese noodles in Harlem.

title: At the Handpulled Noodle, Mom Knows Best
description: Ding ding noodles do not look like noodles. A better description may be nubs, knots, lumps: on a spectrum with spaetzle and frascatelli, but rougher, more unpredictable in shape and fantastically chewy.

title: Viewfinder: Katherine Wolkoff
description: The photographers Vita Nova series twists recognizable forms like trees, weeds and spider webs into nearly abstract images.

title: With a Nod to Italian Mafia, a Notorious Crime Hub Gets a Museum
description: CASAL DI PRINCIPE, Italy  If the Uffizi Gallery in Florence is on any must-see list of Italy, then this town, known as one of Italys most notorious organized crime hubs, is the sort of place most tourists normally avoid.

title: Family of Missing Israeli Speaks Out
description: The family of an Israeli man said to be held by Hamas spoke on Thursday, appealing to the militant group and Israels government to secure his release.

title: Broadway Skills in Opera: Theyre a Puzzlement
description: In late 2009, about a year after Bartlett Sher was named resident director of Lincoln Center Theater, he seemed to be the de facto resident director at the Metropolitan Opera, as well. His acclaimed production of South Pacific was playing to sold-out houses at the Vivian Beaumont Theater, while across the plaza at the Met, audiences could take in a revival of his staging of Rossinis The Barber of Seville, or his new, fantastical production of Offenbachs The Tales of Hoffmann.

title: No Comment Necessary: George W. Bush Got $100,000 to Speak at Fundraiser for Veterans
description: Former President George W. Bush was paid $100,000 to speak at a fundraiser for the charity Helping a Hero, which aids veterans of the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan, ABC News reports. The charity also paid for his flight on a private jet, which cost $20,000.

title: South Carolina Settles Its Decades-Old Dispute Over a Confederate Flag
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  South Carolina, the first state to secede from the Union and one that has quarreled often, in the ensuing years, over matters the Civil War never quite settled, dispatched with at least one of those issues on Thursday as Gov. Nikki R. Haley signed into law a bill to remove the Confederate battle flag from the grounds of the State House.

title: Salad From the Sidewalk
description: A guide to foraging for greens in your backyard and on the street.

title: A Walk on the Wild (Edibles) Side
description: Mark Bittman samples plants growing along the sidewalks of Oakland, Calif., with Philip Stark and Tom Carlson from the University of California, Berkeley.

title: See Your Children Leading Healthy Lives? Research Suggests Parents Should Look Harder
description: Are our children really leading the healthy lives we think they are?

title: A Walk on the Wild (Edibles) Side
description: This is the first in a series of videos about sustainable agriculture and healthy eating. The series was produced in collaboration with the Global Food Initiative at the University of California.

title: F.A.A. to Drop Donald Trump-Related Navigation Codes
description: Three navigation coordination points above Palm Beach International Airport that had been named in honor of Donald J. Trump will be renamed, the Federal Aviation Administration said Wednesday.

title: 1940: French Mouthpiece Puzzling
description: The fact that a provincial French newspaper, Le Petit Dauphinois, published at Grenoble, has been quoted during the last week as the mouthpiece for the Vichy government presented yesterday a source of perplexity for New York correspondents of French papers, editors and others who are closely following developments in France. Estimates of the papers policies ranged from non-partisan to pro-Fascist.  New York Herald Tribune, July 10, 1940

title: Style Tips for Cool Dads From the Owner of Goose Barnacle
description: Goose Barnacle, a mens shop near the western tip of Atlantic Avenue in Brooklyn, is a place for new dads and former hipsters who still want to dress like sexy beasts. Since 2010, its proprietor, David Alperin, 36, who grew up around the corner, has been matching his friends and neighbors with clothes from a limited stock of hard-to-find labels.

title: Barclays Faces Toughest Test in Investment Banking
description: Barclays faces the biggest test in retooling its investment bank. Chief executives at Barclays, Credit Suisse and Deutsche Bank have now all left, meaning new leaders will tackle their respective divisions futures. All three have lost market share to Wall Street over the last few years. But Barclays shrinking broker-dealer revenue makes it the top contender for further slippage.

title: Reinventing Google for a Mobile World
description: Amit Singhal, Googles search chief, oversees the 200 or so factors that determine where websites rank in the companys search engine, which means he decides if your website lives or dies. His current challenge: figuring out how to spread that same fear and influence to mobile phones.

title: An Ice Cream Cone, a Ring, Then After 23 Years, a Promise
description: When Michael King first proposed to Tifphani White, it was not with a ring but with a Carvel vanilla ice cream cone with rainbow sprinkles. He was 18, and she was 15.

title: South Carolinas Confederate Flag Will Finally Come Down [Updated]
description: In the end, as the South Carolina legislature voted to lower the Confederate flag and store it as a mere state relic, even the most impassioned defender of the flag conceded some good was being accomplished. After numerous stalling tactics, State Representative Mike Pitts, a white lawmaker who had thundered repeatedly in defense of the flag, suddenly rose to pay tribute to a black legislator, Representative Lonnie Hosey, for his patriotism in fighting in the Vietnam War.

title: Valentinos Fall/Winter 2015 Couture
description: [Watch the live stream.]

title: Free the Hens, Costco!
description: I LIKE Costco. We backed the same presidential candidate in the past few elections, and I like its generous wages and willingness to give its employees health care. And of course I agree with it on gay rights.

title: Highlights From Confederate Flag Debate
description: On Wednesday night, South Carolinas state legislature voted to remove the Confederate battle flag from its State House grounds. The debate intensified in the days leading up to the decision.

title: Mens Fashion
description: Erik Madigan Heck reimagines pieces from 16 mens wear designers in honor of New York Fashion Week: Mens.

title: The Bumbling, Irrelevant New York Stock Exchange
description: The good news, if there is any, for the New York Stock Exchange and its parent company, Intercontinental Exchange, is that the extraordinary, nearly four-hour trading halt on Wednesday appears to have been caused by a glitch related to a recently implemented software upgrade. The issue we are experiencing is an internal technical issue and is not the result of a cyber breach, the N.Y.S.E. tweeted soon after it halted trading at 11:32 a.m. We chose to suspend trading on N.Y.S.E. to avoid problems arising from our technical issue. N.Y.S.E.-listed securities continue to trade unaffected on other market centers.

title: Stock Market Plunge in China Dents Communist Partys Stature
description: BEIJING  Yu Xilin was obsessing on Chinas plummeting stock market when he tumbled off his bicycle. But the accident did not sway his focus. While recovering in the hospital on Thursday from surgery for a broken ankle and shoulder, he was using his smartphone to track his shares.

title: Rectify Creator Ray McKinnon on How He Avoids Ratings Anxiety
description: The small-town drama Rectify has always moved at its own pleasingly slow-as-molasses pace. But with the third-season premiere, which airs tonight on Sundance, the series takes a huge storytelling leap forward.

title: Donald Trump Remarks Draw More Fallout, This Time From F.A.A.
description: The Federal Aviation Administration is renaming three navigation coordination points above Palm Beach International Airport that had been named in honor of Donald J. Trump, with a spokeswoman saying the agency chooses names that are noncontroversial.

title: A Complete Picture of L.A.
description: Contributors to Both Sides of Sunset, a new photography book that captures Los Angeles in all its gritty grandeur, explain why their images encapsulate the magic of the city.

title: Yemen Truce Deal Is Reached, U.N. Says
description: UNITED NATIONS  The Saudi-backed government of Yemen has agreed to a pause in fighting, starting Friday, so that humanitarian relief can be delivered in the country, United Nations officials said Thursday. The Houthi rebels who control large parts of Yemen have agreed to respect it as well, the officials said.

title: Was Donald Trump Right About Immigrant Sanctuary Laws?
Bronx Man Accused of Killing Rival Crew Member at Housing Project
description: A 19-year-old man from the Bronx has been charged with fatally shooting a teenager in Upper Manhattan in a dispute between rival crews, the authorities said on Thursday.

title: Vince Staples and J. Cole, Outsiders in the Middle of Hip-Hop
description: The song by J. Cole youre currently most likely to hear coming out of a car window is called Wet Dreamz. Its about him losing his virginity, certainly the highest-profile hip-hop song on that delicate subject.

title: The Total So Far for Jeb Bush and His Super PAC? $114 Million
description: KENNEBUNKPORT, Me.  Jeb Bush and his allies announced on Thursday that they had amassed over $114 million in campaign cash over the last six months for his presidential bid, dwarfing the combined fund-raising of other G.O.P. contenders.

title: Donald Trumps Comments Resonate With Some in G.O.P.
description: Donald J. Trumps views on immigration have drawn bipartisan condemnation but his surprisingly strong poll numbers are evidence that he is touching a nerve with a subset of the Republican party.

title: An Income Tax on Carried Interest Couldnt Be Avoided
description: The private equity industry has killed the idea of taxing carried interest as ordinary income. Several times. And yet it returns, relentlessly, like a Game of Thrones reanimated wight from beyond the wall.

title: Stanley Cowell and Kill West Release New Albums
description: Stanley Cowell

title: Climate Change Is Shrinking Where Bumblebees Range, Research Finds
description: Climate change has narrowed the range where bumblebees are found in North America and Europe in recent decades, according to a study published Thursday.

title: Wisecracks in Drag and Blackface in Eddie Cantor 4-Film Collection
description: Does Eddie Cantor (1892-1964), the bug-eyed street kid and star of all media, once known as the Apostle of Pep, have a future?

title: With Self/less and Other Movies, Stepping Into a New Body
description: A look at films where characters end up in bodies different from their original ones.

title: Taliban Were Authorized to Talk, Afghan Envoys Say
description: Rejecting claims that they had met with an unauthorized Taliban delegation, Afghan government envoys said on Thursday that the insurgents they held initial talks with in Pakistan this week had the blessing of the Talibans deputy leader, Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour.

title: Crash Forces Leader, Tony Martin, Out of Tour de France
description: PARIS  For the second time in this years Tour de France, and after less than a week of racing, the holder of the leaders yellow jersey was forced to abandon the race after being seriously injured in a crash.

title: Joint Chiefs Nominee Warns of Threat of Russian Aggression
description: WASHINGTON  Russias aggressive behavior and its nuclear arsenal make it the single greatest national security threat faced by the United States, Gen. Joseph F. Dunford Jr. said Thursday at a Senate hearing on his nomination as the next chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff.

title: Invoking Charleston Victims in Confederate Flag Debate
description: Representative Wendell G. Gilliard on Wednesday invoked the victims of the Charleston, S.C., shooting as he made a plea for the removal of the confederate battle flag from the State House grounds.

title: Kerry Says He Will Not Rush Iran Talks
description: Secretary of State John Kerry said on Thursday that he was not willing to rush nuclear talks with Iran, but that they could not go on forever without an agreement.

title: Russias Denial of Srebrenica Genocide
description: Twenty years after the massacre of more than 8,000 Muslim men and boys in the Bosnian town of Srebrenica, Russia has shamefully refused to call it what it is  genocide  adding to the pain of the victims families.
