description: Now that the inaugural fashion week for men is underway in New York, what better time to check out the transformative headgear on such seductive display at the Gerald W. Lynch Theater. For there is surely no better or more thrilling example of apparel that makes and unmakes a man than this gold, spiky, circular creation, which might have been designed by Alexander McQueen in a sadomasochistic mood.

title: tk
description: tk

title: The Bicycle and the Ride to Modern America
description: On May 10, 1884, midway through his 48th year, Samuel L. Clemens reluctantly confessed to age by wearing glasses for the first time. That same day, the celebrated writer better known as Mark Twain sought to reclaim his youth by mounting a bicycle for the first time.

title: Journalists Mother Calls for Bail
description: Mary Rezaian, the mother of Jason Rezaian, the Washington Post correspondent who has been imprisoned in Iran for nearly a year, called for him to be released on bail.

title: Barbarian Days: A Surfing Life, by William Finnegan
description: Most canonical accounts of surfing, from Captain Cook to Tom Wolfe, are written by nonsurfers who tend to wax gooey about the sports joys while getting its mechanics and ethos laughably wrong. Yet when surfers themselves began to write about it, in the 1960s, what they produced was usually bad in other ways  pretentious, semiliterate, purple or merely slight. It came to seem that surfing, like some pagan mystery cult, might simply defy literary representation, remaining properly understood only by initiates who were too busy surfing to learn to write.

title: The Investing Signals to Listen To? Theyre Personal, Not in the Markets
description: What happens when were driving and we reach a red light? We stop, right? When the light turns green, we hit the gas. If we dont, it usually doesnt take long for the driver behind us to start honking the horn.

title: 1915: Paris to Observe Unique July 14
description: PARIS  Although the gaiety, the jostling, laughing crowds, and the countless dancing booths which the Fourteenth of July instantly calls to mind will be absent from to-days [July 14] celebration of the French national fte, the anniversary is nevertheless to be celebrated in a memorable fashion.

title: FanDuel and DraftKings, Leaders in Daily Fantasy Sports, Are Quickly Gaining Clout
description: The business of daily fantasy sports is only a few years old, but it has become a nearly ubiquitous presence. The leaders, FanDuel and DraftKings, have created a new advertising category, spending millions of dollars on TV commercials with no end in sight. Their names and logos are seen in stadiums and arenas thanks to their many sponsorship deals.

title: The Goddess Pose, by Michelle Goldberg
description: Growing up in 1980s India, I was, for a time, placed in an all-girls school where nuns in habits gave yoga lessons to which we wore stiff-collared white shirts tucked into navy blue bloomer-like shorts. I claimed the back row in the lotus position, arms outstretched and fingers curled into a gyan mudra. I never awakened a chakra, but sometimes I fell asleep.

title: Liquid Gold Delivered From a Treasure Chest on Wheels
description: Residents call her the water lady, but she is much more than that. She listens to their desires and afflictions, then helps resolve them, if she can.

title: On Parched Navajo Reservation, Water Lady Brings Liquid Gold
description: THOREAU, N.M.  The yellow truck slogged along the red-dirt roads in this impoverished corner of the Navajo reservation last week, its belly full of water  liquid gold in a treasure chest on wheels. The trucks driver, Darlene Arviso, steered it patiently, up, down and around pockmarks chiseled on the ground by a recent downpour.

title: Poverty and Violence Plague a Colombian Port City
description: Buenaventura is the focus of an ambitious government plan to expand international trade and overcome a legacy of violence.

title: Colombian Citys New Face and Violent Underbelly Collide
description: BUENAVENTURA, Colombia  This has been called one of South Americas most violent cities, infamous for its chop-up houses, where victims are murdered and dismembered, their bodies later found on the streets or washed up in the stilt-house slums that line the shores of the polluted bay.

title: Cycles of Violence on Colombias Coast
description: On Colombias Pacific coast, Buenaventura is burdened with a violent mix of guns, gangs and drugs that leave local residents awash in danger.

title: Janet Yellens Unusual Optimism
description: I may have been hearing only what I wanted to hear. Or there may have been a non sequitur in the speech given on Friday by Janet Yellen, the chairwoman of the Federal Reserve. Or both.

title: Reaction to Russian Barracks Collapse
description: Rescue crews searched on Monday for survivors after a military barracks collapse in south-central Russia killed 23 people and wounded at least 19 others.

title: Capital Cities Spencer Ludwig Sings the Praises of the Lowly Wooden Spoon
description: I dont hate spatulas, Spencer Ludwig said, almost apologetically, as if not wanting to hurt their feelings. But when cooking, he always reaches for a wooden spoon.

title: Berkeley Breathed Publishes First New Bloom County Strip Since 1989
description: Generally, when a beloved comic strip disappears from the funnies page, it is gone for good, and its characters live on only in reprint collections and greeting cards, as parade balloons and insurance spokes-characters.

title: Numberplay Will Not Appear This Week
description: Numberplay will not appear for the next two weeks while Gary Antonick is on vacation. The series will resume on July 27.

title: Mexico Prison Break by El Chapo Is a Blow to President Pea Nieto
description: MEXICO CITY  However bruised and battered he has been, President Enrique Pea Nieto has always clung to the polished image he sold to the Mexican electorate: the perfectly coifed wunderkind who would break with the corrupt, incompetent past and get things done.

title: Prince William Starts Job as Air Ambulance Pilot
description: Prince William, second in line to the British throne, started a new job as an air ambulance pilot on Monday, describing what many parents might feel on their first day of work: a bout of the jitters and concerns over how to find a work-life balance.

title: Doctors and Nurses Often Work While Sick
description: A study of health care workers in a childrens hospital has found that 83 percent had come to work while sick at least once in the past year, even though almost all believed that working while ill can endanger patients.

title: Modern Farmer Tries a New Approach
description: Modern Farmer is back, sort of.

title: Rick Santorum Focuses on Iowa as Poll Numbers Stay Low
description: His poll numbers have been meager and he might not qualify for the early debates, but former Senator Rick Santorum is clinging to his slow-and-steady-wins-the-race mantra with one thing on his mind: Iowa.

title: How Mexicos Most-Wanted Drug Lord Escaped From Prison (Again)
description: See the route that Joaqun Guzmn Loera, a drug kingpin known as El Chapo, used to escape from Mexicos most secure prison.

title: Still Plenty of Worries for Greek Banks
description: Greek banks have been dragged back from the edge of the precipice. Had marathon talks failed to produce an agreement on Monday, Greeces four big banks would have collapsed. Instead, they will get 25 billion euros in recapitalization resources. But theres still plenty to fret about.

title: The Greek Deal Poses Dangers for Greece, and for Europe
description: For years, Greeces negotiations with its European creditors have featured moments in which all parties stare into the abyss, fear what they see and step back to reach a deal.

title: The Worst Atrocity Youve Never Heard Of
description: The ethnic cleansing unfolding in the Nuba Mountains of Sudan doesnt get much coverage. But once youve witnessed it, says Nicholas Kristof, it will haunt you.

title: The Telescope of the 2030s
description: In what they termed a call to arms, an organization of American university astronomers said last week that NASA should begin planning now to launch a sort of supersize version of the Hubble Space Telescope in the 2030s to look for life beyond Earth.

title: The Worst Atrocity Youve Never Heard Of
description: Youve heard of Darfur, and you know about the slaughter underway in Syria. But the worst ethnic cleansing youve never heard of is unfolding in the Nuba Mountains of Sudan, where the government is bombing villages, schools and hospitals and trying to keep out food and medicine.

title: Hillary Clinton Blames Republicans for Promoting Inequality
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton on Monday blamed Republicans for 35 years of policies that have exacerbated income inequality by giving more wealth to those at the top through tax cuts and corporate loopholes.

title: Eurozone Leaders Comment on Greece Deal
description: The leaders of France, Spain, Italy and Germany spoke on Monday after the announcement of an agreement between Greece and its European creditors.

title: CWST: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: New York

title: I Do Not Want to Go to Day Camp!
description: Perhaps you, too, signed your children up for some fun activities this summer. A camp offering canoeing and archery, perhaps. Nature hikes. Mountain biking. Or perhaps, as I did, you wrangled a hard-to-get spot in a camp offering circus fun, like tightropes and unicycles, for a child who loves to climb and balance. Perhaps you did this out of love, or possibly because although it is summer school vacation it is not yet summer work vacation, or possibly simply to get your child out of the house and into a healthy activity.

title: Obama Commutes Sentences for 46 Drug Offenders
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama announced Monday that he was commuting the sentences of 46 drug offenders, intensifying a campaign to overhaul the nations criminal justice system as he more than doubled the number of nonviolent criminals granted clemency during his time in office.

title: How Much Money Presidential Candidates Have Raised So Far
description: The first Federal Election Commission filing deadline for most of the presidential candidates is Wednesday, but some organizations have released their totals early. Below, the announced money raised by the campaigns, super PACs and nonprofits supporting each candidate.

title: Garciavelez: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: New York

title: Sometimes the Patients Just Not That Into Me
description: I wonder if Peter is breaking up with me.

title: Wintons Children Share Their Stories
description: Nicholas Winton organized the escape of 669 children, mostly Jews, from Czechoslovakia on the eve of World War II. After Mr. Winton died in July, The New York Times asked the original Wintons Children and their descendants to share their stories.

title: David Hart: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: New York

title: Documents: Authors and Booksellers Call for Amazon Inquiry
description: The Authors Guild, the American Booksellers Association and Authors United have sent letters and statements to the Justice Department calling for an investigation into Amazon.

title: American Booksellers Letter to the Justice Department
description: The American Booksellers Association is calling for the Justice Department to investigative Amazon for antitrust violations, contending that the companys sales tactics threaten authors and publishers.

title: Authors Guilds Call to Investigate Amazon
description: The Authors Guild is urging the Department of Justice to investigate Amazon for what it calls anti-competitive behavior in book sales.

title: Accusing Amazon of Antitrust Violations, Authors and Booksellers Demand Inquiry
description: This is a triumphant moment for Amazon.

title: Examining Tunnel Used by Drug Lord
description: Mexicos attorney general toured a building on Sunday at the end of the tunnel used by the drug lord Joaqun Guzmn Loera, known as El Chapo, to escape from a maximum-security prison.

title: Details Emerge About Victoria Taylors Dismissal at Reddit
description: Over the last week, the circumstances surrounding the dismissal of a Reddit employee, a move that led to a huge user uprising and the resignation of the sites interim chief executive, have been murky at best.

title: Lawsuit Seeks Better Protection for Fans From Foul Balls and Broken Bats
description: On the eve of baseballs All-Star Game, a proposed class-action lawsuit was filed Monday against Major League Baseball claiming it did too little to protect fans from fast-moving foul balls and splintered bats. In particular, the suit cited what it said was a need to add netting far down the first- and third-base lines.

title: Hillary Clinton Lays Out Economic Plan
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton, a candidate for the Democratic presidential nomination, laid out details of her economic plan on Monday, focusing on raising workers wages.

title: Unraveling the Relationship Between Climate Change and Health
description: Is climate change a serious threat to human health?

title: Celebrating Eid al-Fitr, the End of Ramadan, With Sweet, Traditional Treats
description: The monthlong fasts of Ramadan will end on Friday night in North America, when the new month of Shawwal arrives at moonrise, according to the Islamic calendar.

title: Little Research Is Done in Africa by or for Nurses
description: While most health care in Africa is delivered by nurses rather than doctors, little medical research is done by nurses or for them, and too much is determined by donors priorities rather than by the challenges that African nurses actually are facing, according to a new study.

title: The State of Cost-Benefit Analysis at the S.E.C.
The Marine Corps' Investigation Into Claims Surrounding Lt. Col. Kate Germano's Dismissal
description: The investigation into allegations by Colonel Germano of a hostile work environment at Parris Island found no evidence to support her claim of gender-related discrimination.

title: Treasury Flash Rally Report Is Released
description: WASHINGTON  Federal regulators on Monday said they now had a deeper understanding of one of the strangest market moves in recent Wall Street history.

title: Cyclist Fatally Struck Near Barclays Center in Brooklyn
description: A bicyclist was killed in Brooklyn during the morning rush on Monday when he was hit by an out-of-control sport utility vehicle at a major intersection near the Barclays Center, officials said.

title: Netanyahu Launches Persian Twitter Feed to Rail Against Iran Deal
description: Having made clear in English, Hebrew and Arabic that Israels government opposes the agreement over Irans nuclear program now being negotiated in Vienna, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahus office added Persian to the mix on Monday, with the launch of a Twitter feed in that language.

title: Release of Reared Rare Cambodian Turtles Holds Promise for Restoration
description: Turtles, both in the sea and fresh water, have had a terrible time in Earths age of humans, increasingly known as the Anthropocene. But once in awhile, there are signs of hope for this ancient order of reptiles, the latest being in Cambodia.

title: Following the Money: Alessandra Stanley Weighs In
description: Alessandra Stanley is gearing up to leave her post as television critic to go back to reporting. Her beat? The richest of the rich. Stanley will follow the top 1 percent of the 1 percent, as part of The Timess coverage of American economic inequality.

title: Travel Diary
description: The art worlds Helen Toomer and Eric Romano share photos from their honeymoon vacation in Peru.

title: Stonewall Inn May Be Historic, but to Regulars, Its Just a Bar
description: Unbidden, they came by the thousands.

title: Obama Commutes Sentences of 46 Prisoners
description: In a video released by the White House on Monday, President Obama commuted the sentences of 46 federal prisoners, the majority of whom were nonviolent drug offenders.

title: Okwui Okpokwasili Named Resident Commissioned Artist at New York Live Arts
description: Okwui Okpokwasili, the writer, performer and choreographer, has been named the next resident commissioned artist by New York Live Arts, the organization announced Monday.

title: Lawsuit Against General Motors Tests Attorney-Client Privilege
description: Client confidentiality is viewed as sacrosanct to lawyers. Ethical and professional standards dictate that what is said to a lawyer should not be revealed, even after a clients death.

title: Double Fault in Article on Serena Williams and Body Image?
description: When The Timess sports staff gave the green light to an article proposed by a frequent freelancer, Ben Rothenberg, intentions were good. Here was an opportunity to illuminate a pervasive problem in womens sports, the old and troubling notions of what a female athlete should look like, and to do so through the views of the athletes themselves. Mr. Rothenberg even had the tennis superstar Serena Williams on the record with thoughtful quotes.

title: Greeces Banks Are Next in Line for a European Bailout
description: FRANKFURT  Eurozone leaders acknowledged on Monday what has become increasingly obvious to everyday Athenians: Greek banks need a bailout, too.

title: A Live Video from Britains Electro-Pop Act to Watch
description: [Watch the video on YouTube.]

title: Mahmoud Abbas Appoints New Secretary General of the P.L.O.
description: The Palestinian president, Mahmoud Abbas, has appointed a confidant as the new secretary general of the Palestine Liberation Organization after ousting a man perceived to challenge his leadership.

title: Report on 2014 Treasury 'Flash' Rally
description: The Treasury Department and four other agencies released a report into an unusually sharp rise in the price of a benchmark U.S. government bond.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Re Medicare Plans to Pay Doctors for Counseling on End of Life (July 10):

title: Review: Blackout, When New York Plunged Into Darkness, Then Chaos, in 1977
description: The New York City blackout of July 1977 is a big subject. On Tuesday night, the PBS series American Experience gives it only an hour, which isnt enough.

title: Plenty Deserve Blame for Greeces Woes, but Maybe Not Goldman Sachs
description: With Greeces economy and its future in the eurozone both teetering, the usually astute Robert Reich has dredged up the sorry old trope that Goldman Sachs is to blame for everything, proving yet again that even a Rhodes Scholar and former cabinet secretary is clueless about the role Wall Street firms play for their clients.

title: Tunisian Forces Kill 3 Senior Leaders of Insurgent Group
description: TUNIS  Tunisias interior minister said security forces had killed three senior leaders of an insurgent group who were trying to establish an armed presence in the south of the country.

title: Dominique Ansel Moves From Cronuts to Dessert Tastings
description: The famous Cronut was not inventive enough for Dominique Ansel. I wanted the freedom to go back to preparing more creative plated desserts, he said. Beginning Friday, he will serve a dessert tasting in the second-floor kitchen at his West Village location, which he opened in the spring. The eight-course menu, starting at $75, will be presented at a table that descends from the ceiling on cables to eight people at each of two seatings on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. He calls the tasting U.P. for unlimited possibilities. The theme for the first six months is firsts, he said, adding, desserts that express a first word, first kiss, first dance and, my favorite, first heartbreak, and so forth. For first word he is serving a delicate meringue, like a floating island that may please a toddler, with sauces and garnishes of sweet peas and carrot cake: U.P. by Dominique Ansel, 137 Seventh Avenue South (10th Street), 212-242-5111, prepaid reservations available Mondays at noon for dates seven weeks later, dominiqueanselkitchen.com/up.

title: Another Too Big to Fail System in G.M.O.s
description: Before the crisis that started in 2007, both of us believed that the financial system was fragile and unsustainable, contrary to the near ubiquitous analyses at the time.

title: The Authors United Position Paper on Amazons Book Selling Practices
description: The group Authors United details their case against Amazon.

title: Where to Go in the North Loop of Minneapolis
description: Restored lofts, restaurants and stylish boutiques are popping up in the landmarked neighborhood.

title: A Trove of Forgotten Writings Is Found in a Periodical Edited by Dickens
description: LONDON  Previously unidentified writings by Elizabeth Gaskell; Wilkie Collins; and Eliza Lynn Linton, the first salaried female British journalist, have been discovered in a collection of a literary periodical, All the Year Round, edited by Charles Dickens between 1859 and 1870. The magazine contained a mix of nonfiction and fiction, including the serialization of Dickenss own novels, but didnt identify its authors, whose identities have largely remained a mystery.

title: Obama Wants More State Laws to Make Retirement Saving Easier
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama told a White House conference on aging on Monday that he would instruct the Labor Department to help states pass laws to make retirement saving easier, after his own proposals in Congress went nowhere.

title: Team Skys Motor Homes Cause a Stir at the Tour de France
description: PAU, France  By European standards, the two motor homes sitting behind the five-star Hotel Parc Beaumont were gigantic: 37 and 40 feet long, with pop-out sides that consumed the width of a highway lane. They were also at the center of a new round of debate over whether the Tour de France is becoming too big for its own good.

title: A Peruvian Honeymoon
description: By now its no secret that the culinary delicacies of Peru include guinea pig  but alpaca, too? It came as a surprise to Helen Toomer, the director of the Pulse Art Fair, when her husband Eric Romano, the founder of the art-fair production firm Space Productions, scarfed down the Andean camel with delight on their 10-day honeymoon to the Incan nation last month. Im of the school that Ill try anything once. I didnt like alpaca. Eric ate alpaca all the time, Toomer says. He was like, Where can we get this at home?!'

title: Bills Coach Is One More Test of N.F.L.s Personal Conduct Policy
description: The N.F.L.s revamped personal conduct policy is being tested again, this time by a coach, not a player.

title: Classical Music This Week: Sounds of Clevelands Past and P.D.Q. Bach
description: Lincoln Center Festivals music offerings start this week in earnest with the arrival of the Cleveland Orchestra for a four-concert series. In this past weekends Arts & Leisure section, I write that the ensemble has a plausible claim to being simply the best in America. Do you agree? Let me know in the comments section. Or email zach.woolfe@nytimes.com. Or tweet at @zwoolfe.

title: 50 Cent Seeks Bankruptcy Protection
description: The rapper and entertainment tycoon 50 Cent, whose real name is Curtis Jackson, might not be worth the change in his stage name. Monday morning, Mr. Jackson filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in a Connecticut court.

title: Video in Death of Palestinian Seems to Rebut Israeli Military
description: JERUSALEM  An Israeli human rights group on Monday challenged the militarys account of an episode in which a soldier shot and killed a Palestinian youth who had hurled a rock at the soldiers vehicle, saying that video and witnesses accounts contradicted the armys version of the incident.

title: Inhaled Ebola Vaccine Stops Virus in Monkeys, Study Finds
description: A single dose of a new Ebola vaccine that can be inhaled has been found to neutralize the deadly virus in monkeys, researchers reported on Monday.

title: Penn and Teller Open Strong on Broadway
description: Penn & Teller on Broadway, a new show of high-tech tricks and old-school routines from the modern magic duo, had a strong start on Broadway, according to box office data released on Monday. The show, which opened on Sunday night to mostly good reviews, grossed $1,075,289 for eight performances in its first week at the 1,634-seat Marquis Theater.

title: Go Set a Watchman, by Harper Lee: Atticus Finch, Transformed
description: To the Editor:

title: Palestinian Hunger Striker Is Freed, Then Detained Again
description: JERUSALEM  A Palestinian man who waged a 55-day hunger strike in prison to pressure the Israeli authorities to release him was detained on Monday, just a day after he was freed. The man, Khader Adnan, 36, was stopped after he tried to enter the walled Old City of Jerusalem to worship at the Al Aqsa Mosque on the holiest night of Ramadan, Jawad Boulus, his lawyer, said.

title: Review: The Red Detachment of Women, by the National Ballet of China, Soldiers On
description: China has gone through immeasurable changes since 1964, when The Red Detachment of Women was unveiled and lauded by Maos wife, Jiang Qing, as one of eight acceptable model dramas. In Red Detachment, tutus have no place; ballerinas wear military shorts, carry rifles and charge onward in jumps so heroic that you begin to imagine that Spartacus, the subject of that Soviet war horse, is just around the bend.

title: Uber Out of the Running for Here, Nokias Digital Mapping Service
description: Uber has made no secret of its global ambitions. The companys plans, however, will not include the multibillion-dollar purchase of Here, the main competitor to Google Maps.

title: Print Wikipedia Project Reaches Final Entry
description: Print Wikipedia, an effort to envision all of English-language Wikipedia as an old-fashioned dead-tree reference set, reached its conclusion just before 10 p.m. on Sunday when a handful of people gathered at a Lower East Side art gallery to watch the last of 7,600 volumes upload to the print-on-demand Web site Lulu.com  exactly 24 days, 3 hours and 18 minutes after the process began.

title: Why the Gilmore Girls Fandom Lives On
description: Art could imitate life, but why would we want it to? Life is missed opportunities, witty rejoinders left unsaid, jobs and homes and boyfriends lost to the sands of time. Write what you know, goes the saying, but maybe theres something better than what youve actually lived?

title: Walkabout: Ash Closes Indonesia Airports; Tunisia Exodus
description: Eruption Ash from Mount Raung, a volcano in East Java, Indonesia, has closed three regional airports, including one in Bali, typically a popular summer destination for Australians. (BBC News)

title: Cubas Coral Garden
description: Jardines de la Reina is a wonderland of sharks, giant groupers, schools of colorful fish, and one of the Caribbeans healthiest reefs.

title: Baltimore Symphonys Music Director, Marin Alsop, to Lead Havana Concert
description: The rapprochement between the United States and Cuba is continuing to open doors for more cultural cross-pollination: the organizers of a starry concert in Havana this fall pairing the piano virtuosos Lang Lang and Chucho Valds said on Monday that the performance would feature the American conductor Marin Alsop leading the National Symphony Orchestra of Cuba.

title: Danh Vo and Bert Kreuks Legal Battle Pits Artist Against Collector
description: ROTTERDAM, the Netherlands  In the booming international art market, Danh Vo ranks highly as an early blue chip artist, his works coveted by speculators who buy low and sell quickly for big gains. His top-selling works are castoff cardboard boxes, turned gold in every way  like a gilded Budweiser carton from 2013 called Fiat Veritas, or Let There Be Truth.

title: Pope Francis Speaks on the Papal Plane
description: Pope Francis held a news conference as he left South America on Monday in which he admitted to overlooking the middle class, and played down his role in relations between the U.S. and Cuba.

title: Public School Spring/Summer 2016 Mens Collection: The Soundtrack
description: A music mix created by Twin Shadow for mens fashion week.

title: Goats and Charles Manson Kick Off New York Fashion Week: Mens
description: Sometimes an observer can be forgiven for thinking that New York Fashion Week: Mens may be a satire scripted by Tina Fey and filmed undercover for Netflix.

title: Officials at Dewey & LeBoeuf Manipulated Income Statements, Witness Testifies
description: A scheme that ultimately brought one of the countrys biggest law firms to its knees crystallized after a steak dinner.

title: Review: An As You Like It on Asphalt, From Shakespeare in the Parking Lot
description: Ive rarely been so happy to see a messy play.

title: At New York Musical Theater Festival, a Video Game Sendup, Gospel Music and More
description: Among the small purple people of Eggplant Land, threats to life and limb are perpetually imminent: the pointy-toothed piranha plants with gaping jaws, the scowly-faced mushrooms with menacing fangs. There is also Bruiser (Andre Ward), the fire-breathing platypus, who expresses his tormented romantic feelings for Princess Poinsettia (Lesley McKinnell) by kidnapping her anew every time shes rescued by Claudio (CJ Eldred), the kingdoms strapping superhero.

title: An Instagram for Design Lovers, Artworks for Sale from the Refinery29 Staff and an Airstream on a Boho Mission
description: Every week, T rounds up five captivating online destinations you should be visiting often.

title: Hillary Clinton, Unapologetic Grandma
description: The question surfaced as soon asChelsea Clinton announced her pregnancy: Would becoming a grandmother dim Hillary Clintons presidential ambitions?

title: Hillary Clinton to Release the Names of Her Top Fund-Raisers
description: Hillary Rodman Clinton will disclose the names of the supporters raising money for her campaign, a spokesman confirmed on Monday.

title: Martin Franklin Adds 2 More Deals to a Long List
description: With two acquisitions on Monday, Martin Franklin again demonstrated the primary business skill that has led to his rise as a serial entrepreneur: deal-making.

title: Its Time to Appreciate Serena Williamss Greatness
description: WIMBLEDON, England  In a throwback move at the champions dinner Sunday night, this years Wimbledon singles champions  Serena Williams and Novak Djokovic  danced together.

title: Review: Donizettis La Favorite, a Rare Concert Performance in French at Caramoor
description: KATONAH, N.Y.  If reality television shows had been around in the 1800s, opera composers would have made an excellent subject. In many ways, their work resembled that of modern-day cooking show contestants who are presented a handful of seemingly incompatible ingredients, arbitrary restrictions and a punitive time frame in which to whip up a feast. One such concoction is Donizettis opera La Favorite, which received a rare concert performance in its original French version here on Saturday at Bel Canto at Caramoor.

title: Tania Bruguera, an Artist in Havana, Has a Great New York Week
description: For most artists, news that the Museum of Modern Art had acquired one of their pieces for the first time would be more than sufficient for a good week. But for Tania Bruguera  a New York-based Cuban artist who has been in legal limbo in Havana since December, when she was arrested to prevent her from staging a provocative open-mike performance  the week was just beginning.

title: Pentagon Moves to Allow Transgender People to Serve Openly in the Military
description: The Pentagon is moving to allow transgender people to serve openly in the military by early next year and end an outdated regulation that harms the armed forces, Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter said on Monday.

title: The Smithsonian Will Continue an Exhibition of Cosby Art Collection
description: The Smithsonians National Museum of African Art is continuing with an exhibition featuring works from the private art collection of Bill and Camille Cosby, despite the accusations by dozens of women that Mr. Cosby had drugged and raped them.

title: Fight Club
description: Underseas domination.

title: Dave Mullers Three Day Weekend Playlist
description: Im trying to exhibit enthusiasm and see if it catches, says the artist Dave Muller of Three Day Weekend, the meandering vacation-length shows he organized on bank holidays for more than a decade in the late 90s and early 00s. Like his well-known paintings of cassette stacks and record spines, the Three Day Weekends were declarations of inspiration and opportunities to sort of stir the pot again, explains Muller, who has also hand-drawn advertisements for shows by fellow artists and asked galleries if he might hang them near a sink or behind a desk, like indie band posters  as much an agitprop move as it is a reflection of the artists own deep sonic affinities. A recent Muller exhibition included a playlist provided by Iggy Pop; the drummer Don Bolles of the punk band the Germs once took over the D.J. stand from Muller, who spins at Three Day Weekend openings.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: 5 puntos claves de la visita del Papa Francisco a Amrica Latina
description: Comentaristas analizaron cada detalle del viaje, diseccionaron el lenguaje corporal del papa y trataron de descifrar las sutilezas de lo que dijo y, en algunos casos, tambin de lo que no dijo.

title: At the Bush Compound in Kennebunkport: Reporters Notebook
description: There are really two campaign trails in American politics.

title: Review: Eudora Welty and Ross Macdonald, Conjoined by a Torrent of Words
description: If theres anything left to be said about Eudora Welty, let it be this: She could make even home renovation sound remarkable.

title: Inching Near an Iran Nuclear Deal, Negotiators Go Silent
description: VIENNA  Iranian and American negotiators made significant progress on Monday toward a historic nuclear agreement and have narrowed the list of final issues, several diplomats involved in the talks said.

title: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres the latest.

title: Style at Comic-Con International
description: Looks from the event in San Diego.

title: Pictures of the Day: Greece and Elsewhere
description: Greece and More  Photos of the Day

title: July 13, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Greece, Serbia, Spain and the United States.

title: Hedge Funds Reassess China After Market Free Fall
description: It wasnt long ago that hedge funds were preparing for one of the biggest openings into China in years. In November, foreign investors were for the first time able to buy and sell shares listed in the Shanghai market directly. It was a chance to ride the great China bull run.

title: A Chilling Update on the Ticking Seismic Bomb off the Pacific Northwest Coast
description: If you live in the Pacific Northwest or have friends or family there, I encourage you to read and share Kathryn Schulzs chilling New Yorker feature digging in on the inevitable seismic disaster building day by day in the region.

title: Crown Jewel of Cubas Coral Reefs
description: JARDINES DE LA REINA, Cuba  The six-foot Caribbean reef shark came out of the water thrashing, and Fabin Pina Amargs and his crew quickly pulled it into the research boat.

title: Notorious Prison Escapes in History
description: The escape of a notorious drug cartel chieftain from Mexicos most secure penitentiary over the weekend instantly ranked as one of most audacious breakouts in the annals of penology. The escapee, Joaqun Guzmn Loera, also known as El Chapo, who vanished through a secret hole in his cells shower that led to an elaborately constructed tunnel, joined the likes of John Dillinger, Casanova and the Allied P.O.W.s of Nazi Germany immortalized in the 1963 film, The Great Escape.

title: Chris Christie Still Likes Donald Trump, Despite Comments on Immigrants
description: At a time when many Republicans are racing to distance themselves from Donald J. Trump, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey is forging an unusual path: Hes taking pains to emphasize that, although he found Mr. Trumps comments on illegal immigrants inappropriate, the real estate baron is a friend, the two are close and Mr. Trump is a good guy.

title: New Horizons Pluto Flyby
description: After nine years and three billion miles, NASAs New Horizons spacecraft zipped past Pluto and its five moons on Tuesday morning.

title: Nigeria Military Leaders, Faulted in Fighting Militants, Are Fired
description: NIAMEY, Niger  Nigerias new president, Muhammadu Buhari, dismissed all of his countrys top military officials on Monday, his spokesman announced, after weeks of mounting violence in which Boko Haram fighters have killed hundreds of civilians.

title: Carlos Campos: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: New York

title: After Pluto, What Should NASA Explore Next?
description: Once New Horizons reaches Pluto, what should be NASAs next major priority?

title: Pluto to Get a Close-Up After New Horizons 3-Billion-Mile Journey
description: LAUREL, Md.  Almost there.

title: Eric Garner Case Is Settled by New York City for $5.9 Million
description: New York City reached a settlement with the family of Eric Garner on Monday, agreeing to pay $5.9 million to resolve a wrongful-death claim over his killing by the police on Staten Island last July, the city comptroller and a lawyer for the family said.

title: Fetty Waps Tweaked Sound Yields Hit in Trap Queen
description: Last year, Fetty Wap released his debut single, Trap Queen, a serenade directed at a woman who remains true even in difficult circumstances. From its opening wink  Im like, Hey, whats up? Hello.  to its highly digitally processed cheerful boasts of bonding over illicit activities, its almost saccharine.

title: Christian Audigier, Fashion Designer, Dies at 57
description: Christian Audigier, the French fashion designer best known for the Von Dutch and Ed Hardy lines, died Friday in Los Angeles. He was 57.

title: Born Free in South Africa
description: A young South African photographer born after the apartheid era explores his country, from black and white to rich and poor.

title: Satoru Iwata, Nintendo Chief Executive, Dies at 55
description: Satoru Iwata, who as chief executive of Nintendo oversaw the introduction of gaming systems such as the Nintendo DS and the Wii, died on Saturday in Kyoto, Japan. He was 55.

title: YouTube Chief Talks Children, Mobile and Competition With Facebook
description: Mobile. Mobile. Mobile.

title: Serena Williams and Novak Djokovic Revive a Wimbledon Dance
description: Serena Williams and Novak Djokovic routinely perform superhuman feats on the tennis court.

title: The Eurozones Damaging Deal for Greece
description: In the end, after trying every possible tactic, Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras of Greece threw in the towel and accepted the toughest demands yet made by creditors to extend life support for Greece and keep it in the eurozone. That may avert an immediate catastrophe, but there is little to celebrate since it will do little to address, much less repair, the slow-moving disaster of the Greek economy.

title: Seeking a Role for the Old Bronx Borough Courthouse
description: The last stop in an art show at the old Bronx Borough Courthouse is a wooden table with a handwritten sign sitting on top that asks visitors, What would you like to see this building become?

title: G.M. Is First of Big 3 to Open Contract Talks With the U.A.W.
description: DETROIT  When American carmakers negotiated their existing contract with the United Auto Workers union four years ago, the domestic auto industry was just recovering from a deep recession.

title: Jordan Spieth Makes Overnight Trek to British Open and Tries Eye-Opening Stunt
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland  Tiger Woods loitered on the 16th green of the Old Course on Monday night, spending several minutes hitting putts to different spots. It was the last hole he was playing in his practice round, but before Woods could leave, he had one piece of unfinished business.

title: Experts Urge Sparing Use of Nonaspirin Painkillers
description: The Food and Drug Administration warned last week that the risk of heart attack and stroke from widely used painkillers that include Motrin IB, Aleve and Celebrex but not aspirin was greater than it previously had said. But what does that mean for people who take them?

title: Sides Dispute Basis of North Carolina Voting Laws as Trial Contesting Them Opens
description: WINSTON-SALEM, N.C.  A trial over North Carolinas voting laws opened in a federal courtroom here on Monday, with civil rights groups and the Justice Department arguing that the state had turned back the clock with sweeping changes to its election laws, while the state said the revisions applied equally to all and left its voting rules well within the national mainstream.

title: At Last, the Pentagon Moves to End Its Transgender Ban
description: Secretary of Defense Ashton Carter has taken an important step toward repealing the Pentagons ban on open service by transgender troops, a discriminatory policy that has cut short the careers of talented service members and forced thousands to serve in silence.

title: Clawbacks Could Backfire
description: Clawbacks are coming to corporate America.

title: Man Called ISIS Devotee, Son of Boston Police Officer, Is Arrested
description: The son of a Boston police captain, described as mentally ill and devoted to the Islamic State, plotted a series of deadly attacks with guns and homemade bombs, including a pressure-cooker explosive modeled on the bombs used at the 2013 Boston Marathon, law enforcement officials said Monday.

title: Michael Masser, Composer Who Wrote Whitney Houston Hits, Dies at 74
description: Michael Masser, a stockbroker-turned-composer whose lush melodies were recorded by Whitney Houston, Diana Ross, Roberta Flack and many other star vocalists, died on Thursday at his home in Rancho Mirage, Calif. He was 74.

title: Hillary Clinton Offers Her Vision of a Fairness Economy to Close the Income Gap
description: In the most comprehensive policy speech of her presidential campaign, Hillary Rodham Clinton on Monday presented her vision of a growth and fairness economy, an economic agenda intended to lift middle-class wages, expand social services, and increase taxes on the wealthiest Americans to combat a widening gap between rich and poor.

title: Filmmaker Joe Gibbons Gets a Year in Prison for a Robbery He Called Performance Art
description: In his 2005 avant-garde movie Confessions of a Sociopath, the filmmaker and performance artist Joe Gibbons stares into the camera and announces with a growl: Im Joe Gibbons. I dont need a job. I just take what I need. He then adds, in a more buoyant tone, Im just kidding about that.

title: Clerical Error Played Role in Gun Sale to Dylann Roof
description: WASHINGTON  Law enforcement authorities in South Carolina said on Monday that a jail clerk there had made an error when entering information into a computer system about a February drug arrest of the man who is charged in the killing of nine people in a historically black church in Charleston last month.

title: A New Account of Watchmans Origin and Hints of a Third Book
description: When HarperCollins delivered the stunning news in February that another novel by Harper Lee had surfaced, questions quickly arose about how and where the discovery was made, and why Ms. Lee had not sought to have the book published previously. In the months since, those questions have only grown murkier and more perplexing.

title: DArmy Bailey, 73, Activist Who Founded Museum Where Dr. King Was Shot, Dies
description: DArmy Bailey, a lifelong civil rights crusader who successfully campaigned to transform the forlorn motel where the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. was assassinated in 1968 into a civil rights museum, died on Sunday in Memphis. He was 73.

title: Zack Greinke Says Hes Been Better, but Hitters May Disagree
description: CINCINNATI  Before he would trust the scouting acumen of Clayton Kershaw, Zack Greinke had to test him. Greinke, the National Leagues starting pitcher in the All-Star Game on Tuesday, does not need to evaluate amateurs to earn his paycheck from the Los Angeles Dodgers. But he takes his hobby seriously, and even a teammate as accomplished as Kershaw might not have an eye for talent.

title: Roach Motel Economics
description: So we have learned that the euro is a Roach Motel  once you go in, you can never get out. And once inside you are at the mercy of those who can pull your financing and crash your banking system unless you toe the line.

title: Rhode Island Judge Vacates Conviction in Grisly 1982 Murder
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I.  In 1982, a 22-year-old woman, a former homecoming queen, was found dead in the basement of a triple-decker apartment, bludgeoned so violently that emergency medical workers initially assumed there had been a shooting, shocking the industrial city of Woonsocket, where she lived.

title: Puerto Rico Faces Its Creditors in Early Debt Resolution Talks
description: If a meeting on Monday between Puerto Rico and its creditors is any indication, restructuring the islands $72 billion in debt could be a long process.

title: Hoping Dustin Johnsons Memory Is Shorter Than His Missed U.S. Open Putts
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland  Dustin Johnsons first formal news conference since his rushed exit from the United States Open was set to begin, but there was a problem with the audio. Johnson sat at the dais Monday for a couple of awkward minutes staring blankly at the crowd, his smile dimming with each sweep of the clocks second hand.

title: New York City Public Housing Has Pileup of Repairs, Comptrollers Audit Finds
description: Comptroller Scott M. Stringer is recommending investing in technology to track repairs in New York Citys public housing similar to the CompStat program that the Police Department uses to map and respond to crime.

title: Trading College for Apprentice School
description: A look inside two employer-oriented apprentice programs, which are increasingly seen as an alternative route to a secure middle-income job.

title: Iowa: Town Backs Off Plan to Raffle Chance to Use a Taser
description: It had the ingredients of an all-American fund-raiser. Leaders in the small Iowa town of Van Meter, needing money for a new police car, decided to sell $5 raffle tickets, with the winner to be chosen at this summers street dance. But the raffle prize a chance to have a Taser stun gun used on a city official raised eyebrows far beyond Van Meter, home to about 1,300 people and one full-time police officer.On Monday, after a bout of criticism and national attention, the towns police chief said that corporate donors had agreed to help buy a cruiser, and that no one would be stunned with a Taser atSaturdaysstreet dance. Were much better off, said the chief, William Daggett. What we wind up with is the ability to do more than we could to begin with.

title: A New Look at Apprenticeships as a Path to the Middle Class
description: NEWPORT NEWS, Va.  With its gleaming classrooms, sports teams and even a pep squad, the Apprentice School that serves the enormous Navy shipyard here bears little resemblance to a traditional vocational education program.

title: Glumping the Pond
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  There comes a point in every parents life where, after having acceded to the unrelenting nightly wheedling of Just one more Dr. SEUSS book, pleeeaaasse? you just have to put your foot down and say no.

title: Infant at Unlicensed Day Care Is Taken to a Hospital and Dies
description: A 3-month-old boy under the care of an unlicensed day care in Manhattan died on Monday, the police and regulators said.

title: Sheldon Silvers Son-in-Law Pleads Guilty in Ponzi Scheme Case
description: A son-in-law of Sheldon Silver, the former State Assembly speaker, pleaded guilty on Monday to running a $6 million Ponzi scheme, according to court filings.

title: CUNY Exhibition Documents Lives of Black Africans in Early Dominican Republic
description: Scholars at the City University of New York are using clues left in 16th-century manuscripts and Spanish records to track the lives of the earliest black Africans in the Dominican Republic.

title: Roy C. Bennett Dies at 96; Writer of Popular Songs
description: Roy C. Bennett, who with his partner, Sid Tepper, wrote songs that were recorded by a wide roster of midcentury pop singers, including the titles Red Roses for a Blue Lady, Kiss of Fire and The Naughty Lady of Shady Lane, died on July 2 in Queens. He was 96.

title: Voices From Wisconsin on Scott Walker
description: Supporters of Gov. Scott Walker shared their thoughts on his Republican bid for president at Waukesha County Expo Center in Wisconsin.

title: Phil Jackson Satisfied With Knicks Crop of Free Agents
description: LAS VEGAS  Phil Jackson, addressing reporters for the first time since he made his first significant foray into free agency as the Knicks president, said the team had been able to solidify its defense and add leadership by signing veterans like Robin Lopez and Arron Afflalo, giving him hope that the Knicks could show improvement next season.

title: Citizenfour Filmmaker Says U.S. Harassed Her
description: WASHINGTON  The documentary filmmaker Laura Poitras on Monday filed a lawsuit against several United States government security agencies, seeking disclosure of documents about what she portrayed as regular harassment of her by airport security officials between 2006 and 2012.

title: Scott Walker Declares His Candidacy
description: The Wisconsin governor announced that he is running for president, joining an already crowded Republican field.

title: Ukraine Premier, in White House Visit, Hails Economic Progress
description: WASHINGTON  The prime minister of Ukraine reassured President Obama on Monday that his embattled government was making important progress in overhauling the countrys troubled economy and meeting the terms of a shaky cease-fire with Russia.

title: Sympathy for Greeks Inspires Outraged Commentary Tagged #ThisIsACoup
description: The strict terms of the deal imposed on Greece by fellow members of the eurozone on Sunday inspired hundreds of thousands of comments on social networks deriding the agreement as the equivalent of a coup against the left-wing government of Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras.

title: Nationwide and Across the Ocean, a First Glimpse of Watchman
description: Uncertainty swirls around the discovery of Harper Lees new novel Go Set a Watchman. An admired protagonist has turned from gentle hero to vehement racist. But as Monday turned into Tuesday, none of that seemed to lessen the anticipation for fans of Ms. Lees first published novel, To Kill a Mockingbird.

title: The Business of Cosmetic Surgery
description: Say "plastic surgery" in the U.S. and images of blown-up bosoms and wrinkle-free foreheads typically come to mind. But in medicine, as in fashion, trends come and go. While many Americans are still going under the knife for implants and face-lifts, a more specialized form of cosmetic improvement has also taken root, where ample backsides and strategically injected fillers are the new normal, and where, for a small premium, interested parties can replace their own features with those of their favorite celebrity or fashion doll. And it's not just women and Beverly Hills CEOs taking part. In increasing numbers, average Joes  and even their pets  are getting in on the action, forking over thousands of dollars to enhance everything from their pecs to their poker face. Here, a peek at the shiny new face of cosmetic surgery.

title: How Public School Turned George Lewis Jr. Into a Model
description: For George Lewis Jr., better known as the chief creative force behind the musical act Twin Shadow, playing a sold-out show in front of thousands is one thing  but modeling clothes, well, thats a whole different story. Im more uncomfortable with the idea, now more than ever, Lewis says. I know pretty much nothing about what actual modeling is. Lewis may feel more at home on the stage than the runway, but that hasnt stopped the dapper rock star from collaborating with the designers Dao-Yi Chow and Maxwell Osborne on their fashion label Public School. Twin Shadows latest partnership with the brand, which debuted this morning at New York Fashion Week: Mens for the spring/summer 2016 collection, featured both new music from the artist  and Lewiss first time walking in a fashion show.

title: Of Darkness and Light
description: For Ts ongoing series, the artist Yinka Shonibare shines a ray of hope on the poet Natalie Diazs allegory of drug addiction and despair in the Mojave Desert.

title: FanDuel to Announce It Has Raised $275 Million More
description: As fantasy sports continue to pick up steam  and draw big new entrants like Yahoo  one of the industry leaders is betting that it will continue to grow.

title: Todd Frazier Wins Home Run Derby at Home and at the Buzzer
description: CINCINNATI  Todd Frazier won the Home Run Derby in his home park on Monday night, introducing the term buzzer-beater to a sport that once had no clock.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I believe that at its heart, America is a nation of second chances. And I believe these folks deserve their second chance.

title: Whats on TV Tuesday
description: 9 P.M. (Pop) A PERFECT MURDER (1998) Steven (Michael Douglas), a reptilian Wall Street bond salesman about to lose his shirt, plots to kill his wife, Emily (Gwyneth Paltrow, above, with Mr. Douglas), a United Nations interpreter, and inherit her fortune in Andrew Daviss update of Dial M for Murder, the play by Frederick Knott (and the film by Alfred Hitchcock). Viggo Mortensen portrays Emilys lover, whom Steven offers $500,000 to do the deed or be exposed for the con man and gigolo he really is. The creepiest aspect of A Perfect Murder is that there really is no contest between love and money, Stephen Holden wrote in The New York Times. The movie is right in tune with the icy Darwinian mood fostered by the booming late-90s economy.

title: Corrections: July 14, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Player Ratings: U.S. (1) vs. Panama (1)
description: In its final group-stage game at the Concacaf Gold Cup, the United States national team came out flat and was forced to rally for a draw against a motivated Panama squad. In all three games at the tournament, Coach Jurgen Klinsmanns squad has been outplayed early, and with the knockout stage set to begin this weekend, there is little margin for error.

title: Born Free in South Africa
description: With bold confidence, Sipho Mpongo, born in 1993, a year before apartheid ended, declares himself part of the new age of South Africa. His parents, like many of their generation, fought for freedom. And though he came of age in a nation claiming to be democratic, he knows better than anyone that moving past decades of state-sanctioned segregation takes time.

title: Deal Reached on Iran Nuclear Program; Limits on Fuel Would Lessen With Time
description: VIENNA  Iran and a group of six nations led by the United States reached a historic accord on Tuesday to significantly limit Tehrans nuclear ability for more than a decade in return for lifting international oil and financial sanctions.

title: Our Drone War Burnout
description: SAN FRANCISCO  A MAN bleeds profusely from a leg shattered by a missile. He drags himself slowly across a field until he dies in the dirt. These images from Heather Linebaughs dreams play back endlessly, even in her waking hours.

title: Access to Air-Conditioning
description: To the Editor:

title: The New Old Liberalism
description: Well, Hillary Clinton hasnt gone crazy. At a time when some in her party are drifting toward Bernie Sanders/Occupy Wall Street-style rhetoric, Clinton delivered her first major economic address of the campaign. It was solidly liberal  very solidly  but in tone and substance it was well within the general election mainstream. If any Republicans were hoping that Clinton would make herself unelectable by wandering into the class warfare fever swamps, they can forget about it.

title: Psychologists Role in Torture After 9/11
description: To the Editor:

title: The Popes Apology
description: To the Editor:

title: Shale Gas and Climate Change
description: Every columnist has his or her go to sources, people we rely on for their deep understanding of a particular subject, and a mode of thinking about that subject we find persuasive. For me, one such person is Michael Levi, a senior fellow for energy and the environment at the Council on Foreign Relations.

title: Summer Jobs for Teenagers
description: To the Editor:

title: To Prevent Sexual Assault, Start Early
description: With the issue of sexual assault becoming more visible on campuses, colleges are trying a variety of approaches to addressing the problem. One recent study of Canadian universities found that teaching female freshmen risk assessment and self-defense techniques reduced their risk of being assaulted. Other experts have argued that such programs need to reach all young people, including boys, much earlier than college.

title: Should Americans Work More? To Hit 4 Percent Growth, We Would Have To
description: Jeb Bush said last week that Americans would need to work longer hours if were going to meet his ambitious target of 4 percent real annual economic growth  nearly double the average growth rate the Congressional Budget Office expects in the future. Then he clarified his remarks to say he was talking specifically about the 6.6 million American workers with part-time jobs who say they would like to work full time.

title: Greece Misses Another I.M.F. Payment
description: FRANKFURT  Greece missed another payment to the International Monetary Fund late Monday, slipping further into the debt morass that has devastated the economy.

title: Our Man in Charleston, by Christopher Dickey
description: Great Britain abolished its slave trade in 1807, sending the Royal Navy to blockade the coast of Africa and intercept slavers in an effort to shut down the commerce altogether. In 1833, it did away with slavery itself in all its empire. And yet when war over slavery broke out in the United States in 1861, the British government remained neutral, even though it was led by Lord Palmerston  who, according to Christopher Dickey in Our Man in Charleston, believed himself to be the leader of Christendom in its opposition to the slave trade. This meant that Liverpool shipyards could sell heavily fortified merchant vessels to the Confederates (easily converted into war ships) and London investors could buy cotton bonds, which helped finance the secessionist war.

title: Review: Oreo, a Sandwich-Cookie of a Feminist Comic Novel
description: Fran Rosss first and only novel, Oreo, was published in 1974, four years after Toni Morrisons The Bluest Eye and two years before Alex Haleys Roots. It wasnt reviewed in The New York Times; it was hardly reviewed anywhere.

title: Water Crisis Brings Out Puerto Ricos Creative Side
description: SAN JUAN, P.R.  On an island that is flirting with default, fending off comparisons to Greece and losing its people to the mainland, the biggest problem most people face is something more elemental  one of the worst droughts in Puerto Ricos history.

title: In the Shadow of the Old Course
description: The 144th British Open will be played on the celebrated Old Course at St. Andrews, Scotland, where some find the New Course every bit as challenging.

title: New Course of St. Andrews, Built in 1895, Is No Rival for the Old
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland  Old, old, old. It always seems to be about the old at St. Andrews, from the university, founded in 1413, to the ruins of the 12th-century cathedral to, above all, the Old Course, the ancestral home of golf and the site this week of another British Open.

title: Obamas Leap of Faith on Iran
description: VIENNA  In his opening to China more than 40 years ago, Richard M. Nixon made a huge Cold War gamble that he could forge a working relationship with a Communist country that had built a small arsenal of nuclear weapons and clearly had long-term ambitions for global power.

title: A New Stream of Oil for Iran, but Not Right Away
description: HOUSTON  The nuclear agreement with Iran opens the way for a flood of new oil eventually to pour onto world markets, setting up a potential windfall for energy giants.

title: Tuesdays Travel News: Dining in Peru; Jewelry in Bali
description: Our weekday morning digest that includes consumer news, deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.

title: Tips on Traveling in Europe This Summer
description: If youre planning on vacationing in Europe this summer, recent headlines may have prompted some travel questions. Does the weakened euro, partly the result of the fiscal crisis in Greece, affect whether you should put charges on your credit card in euros or in dollars? Is it legal and safe to use Uber in the wake of protests by taxi drivers throughout Europe, particularly in France where drivers have recently blocked roads to airports and set tires on fire? Do the International Air Transport Associations efforts to implement more universal carry-on guidelines  a move welcomed by a number of international airlines  mean the time has come to buy a new, smaller rollaboard bag?

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Intersection | Buenos Aires, Argentina
description: Calu Rivero, an Argentinian actress and It-girl, takes us around the trendy Palermo SoHo neighborhood in Buenos Aires.

title: Christine and the Queens, and the Opposite of Sex
description: While her musical peers straddle wrecking balls and shoot fireworks from their bras, the gamine 27-year-old French singer offers an awkward, androgynous and totally rocking alternative.

title: An Eco-Warrior and Cowgirl Meet in Buenos Aires
description: Palermo Soho, the trendy Buenos Aires shopping area, is a center of style in South America. The neighborhoods cobblestone streets, lined with high-end boutiques, European-style cafes and addictive gelato parlors, draw in stylish residents. You have a lot of classy people, wearing all black or total jeans, said Calu Rivero, an Argentine actress who used to live in the area. Today I saw a girl in all red and said, Youre so beautiful!  Ms. Rivero was recently there wearing jeans and a jacket from Etiqueta Negra, an Argentine label, and shoes from Stella McCartney. She pointed out that the shoes were fake leather because shes a self-proclaimed eco-warrior girl. (This interview has been edited and condensed.)

title: Cinema on the Edge to Take Chinese Movies to New York
description: Last August, Li Xianting, the organizer of the Beijing Independent Film Festival, received an unexpected visit from dozens of police officers and local officials at his offices in Songzhuang, a village on the eastern outskirts of Beijing. They confiscated documents, computers and films and temporarily detained two of the events organizers, effectively shutting down one of Chinas most prominent independent film festivals.

title: New York Today: A Twist in the Tale
description: Good morning on this marshy Tuesday.

title: Iran Deal Denounced by Netanyahu as Historic Mistake
description: JERUSALEM  Furiously denouncing the accord to limit Irans nuclear program on Tuesday as a historic mistake, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said that Israel would not be bound by the agreement and warned of negative repercussions in a region already riven with rivalries and armed conflict.

title: Chinese Police Say 3 Killed by Officers Were Xinjiang Terrorists
description: HONG KONG  The police in the northeastern Chinese city of Shenyang said on Tuesday that they had shot and killed three men who they said belonged to a terrorist organization and had lashed out with knives and shouted jihadist slogans when officers tried to enter their apartment.

title: A Better Restitution for Darfur
description: NORTHAMPTON, Mass.  It is now a year since the guilty plea by BNP Paribas, the French banking giant, to charges by the Department of Justice that it had done clandestine business with the governments of Sudan, Iran and Cuba, countries that were subject to economic sanctions. Over the period covered in the indictment, from 2004 to 2012, the amount that was criminally laundered came to more than $8.8 billion, which determined the size of the penalty.

title: I.A.E.A. Head Confirms Iran Nuclear Plan
description: Yukiya Amano said the agreement set out a clear sequence of activities, including technical expert meetings.

title: Today in Politics: Once Wary of Hillary Clinton, Congressional Democrats Open Their Arms
description: Good Tuesday morning from Washington, which will be analyzing the nuclear deal the Obama administration just made with Iran. The deal comes as President Obama is scheduled to deliver a big speech, while on the campaign front, Gov. Scott Walker, an opponent of the Iran deal, has joined the crowd running for the Republican nomination. But first, Hillary Rodham Clinton will be returning to the Capitol to court a group she was unable to win over in 2008.

title: Can Anyone Draw Unbiased Districts in Florida?
description: Is Republican bias in Floridas congressional districts really the fault of the legislature?

title: Hiding From Animals
description: Im walking beside a hedge of tangled dog roses in a nature preserve in eastern England, toward a hide, a building whose purpose is to make me disappear. This one is a rustic box with bench seats and narrow slits in the wall. Half-hidden by branches, it looks like a small, weather-beaten wooden shed. Ive made myself disappear in hides for as long as I can remember; structures like this are found in nature preserves all over the world, and they seem as natural here as trees and open water. Even so, a familiar, nervous apprehension flares up as I reach for the door, so I pause for a few seconds before opening it and walk inside, where the air is hot and dark and smells of dust and wood preservative.

title: How Privilege Became a Provocation
description: This spring, the novelist Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie put a new spin on the commencement speech, that most staid of genres. Speaking at Wellesley College, she didnt emphasize how the graduates had been helped by their education, but how they had been hindered by it. She invoked their privilege  and her own  to describe how privilege blinds. As a highly educated woman, she told them, she hadnt always been alert to the nuances of people who were different from her. Privilege blinds, because its in its nature to blind, she said. Dont let it blind you too often. Sometimes you will need to push it aside in order to see clearly.

title: Calvin A. Ramsey on How Black Travel Has Changed Since Jim Crow
description: The playwright and author Calvin Alexander Ramsey (left), 65, was raised in the South and now lives in New York City. He is the author of Ruth and the Green Book, a childrens book published in 2010, and the play The Green Book, first produced in 2005 and published last year in book form. He is working on a documentary called The Green Book Chronicles. His work was inspired by Victor Hugo Green, who from 1936 to 1964 published the Jim Crow-era Negro Motorist Green Book (its title was modified over time, eventually abbreviated as the Green Book) listing locations catering to African-American travelers in the United States, Canada, Mexico and Bermuda.

title: Was My Patient Stalking Me?
description: On that snowy day when Guy walked into my office for the first time, he took off his coat, nodded his head and said softly, Like you, I am not used to this weather. I wasnt sure what exactly he was referring to, and I looked at this unfamiliar man, waiting for an explanation. I was born in the same city you were born in, he continued, almost whispering.

title: Indian Stampede Kills at Least 27 at Religious Festival
description: MUMBAI, India  At least 27 people were killed on Tuesday in a stampede in southern India, just hours after the start of a religious festival, an official said.

title: Black Children in U.S. Are Much More Likely to Live in Poverty, Study Finds
description: WASHINGTON  Black children were almost four times as likely as white children to be living in poverty in 2013, a new report has found, the latest evidence that the economic recovery is leaving behind some of the United States most vulnerable citizens.

title: Accord is Bad Mistake, Netanyahu Says
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel said the nuclear agreement would enable Iran to continue its aggression and terror throughout the region.

title: For Frdric Weis, Knicks Infamous Pick, Boos Began a Greater Struggle
description: LIMOGES, France  On the morning when Frdric Weis tried to kill himself, he dreamed about owning a beach house. A beach house had been Weiss dream for a long time. In France, in Spain, in Greece  wherever his career as a 7-foot-2 professional basketball player took him. He liked the sand, he liked the surf. A beach house was a good dream.

title: Morning Agenda: The New Greek Bailout
description: THE NEW GREEK BAILOUT | While Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras of Greece is trying to get his Parliament to agree to the latest bailout deal, Greek banks are in need of a bailout of their own. The European Central Bank has kept them running for months with emergency loans, but it wont provide any additional cash  it is waiting for Parliament to approve Mondays bailout deal. This means Greek banks may not open this week and could soon run out of cash, Jack Ewing writes in The New York Times. Every day that the banks stay closed adds to their problems and the eventual cost of an overhaul, Mr. Ewing notes.

title: Dance This Week: Francisca Benitez, Yvonne Rainer and More
description: Greetings, dance fiends, its time to nail down your dance card for the week. As we know, this takes extra effort in the summer when pickings are slim, but heres a plan that even involves a couple of open-air theaters. (Sightseeing is optional.)

title: What Are the Consequences of Our Cultural Obsession With Newness?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Siddhartha Deb and Anna Holmes discuss what we gain and lose in the onrush of the new.

title: Just What, Exactly?
description: Ive inveighed before about weasel words that present some description as noteworthy without specifying what is actually noteworthy about it. My favorite (or least favorite) example is in recent memory  the biggest sports upset in recent memory. Whose memory? How recent? If we think back just a little further, will we remember a bigger one? The phrase really suggests something like, Off the top of our heads we cant think of a bigger one, but we dont have time to check.

title: Obama Comments on Iranian Nuclear Deal
description: The president spoke on Tuesday about the agreement between Iran and world powers, saying it was a comprehensive long-term deal with Iran that prevents it from obtaining a nuclear weapon.

title: JPMorgans Profit Rises 5% as Its Expenses Fall
description: JPMorgan Chase said on Tuesday that second-quarter earnings rose 5 percent from a year ago as the bank increased loan business and reduced expenses.

title: Celebrating the Pluto Flyby
description: Scientists, engineers and journalists celebrated the culmination of more than nine years of work at Johns Hopkins Applied Physics Laboratory in Maryland.

title: Seeking a Long-Lost Woman
description: Dear Diary:

title: Republican Lawmakers Vow Fight to Derail Nuclear Deal
description: WASHINGTON  Before Congress had even begun its official review, Republican leaders vowed Tuesday to kill President Obamas nuclear accord with Iran, setting up a fierce fight to save the presidents signature diplomatic achievement.

title: The Challenges in a Deal for Micron
description: Micron Technology would be a less than super deal for China.

title: Wells Fargos Earnings Slip in Second Quarter
description: Wells Fargo, a bank known for its machine-like ability to increase its profits and beat Wall Street expectations, reported mixed results on Tuesday.

title: A Table That Prizes Form as Well as Function
description: Both impressive restraint and extravagance are embodied in the Elliott, designed by Rodolfo Dordoni for Minotti: not the sort of coffee table youll see strewn with sunglasses and car keys or crowded with a fussy tablescape. Its a modern jewel box that stands alone, a hybrid of stripped-down geometry and lavish surfaces. Its sides are polished, electroplated gold, their tint the lustrous honey of a gentlemans wedding ring; the top is a solid slab of the palest rose marble veined with fine ribbons of mauve. Inside is a rich stained matte oak, with a low shelf to hold books or whatever else you want to half-conceal in the darkness. A descendant of the stainless steel box tables that once characterized industrial chic, the Elliott, in a single gesture, sums up the way we now covet simplicity: a unity of form and function, fashioned from exquisite materials.

title: NASAs New Horizons Spacecraft Sends Signal From Pluto to Earth
description: LAUREL, Md.  After a long day celebrating the arrival of NASAs New Horizons spacecraft at Pluto and wondering about its fate while it was out of radio contact, mission controllers finally received confirmation Tuesday night that the spacecraft had performed its scientific tasks.

title: Daily Report: Writers and Booksellers Seek U.S. Antitrust Inquiry Into Amazon
description: This is a triumphant moment for Amazon, David Streitfeld reports.

title: Review: The Jim Gaffigan Show and Impastor, Comedies About Liars and Religion
description: When a nostalgia-driven outlet like TV Land sets about exploring riskier and more challenging content, as one of its executives recently put it, you might wonder what specifically that means. On Wednesday night, the picture clarifies with the premieres of two comedies. It means, apparently, new shows that feel like the vintage series TV Land loves to rebroadcast, but with gay characters and the occasional penis joke.

title: Teenager Who Survived Plane Crash Tried to Free Relatives
description: Stranded by a plane crash in the dense woods of northern Washington, a 16-year-old girl made her way over steep, timber-filled terrain for two days before finding a road on Monday where she was picked up by a passing motorist.

title: Readers Turn on Bernie Sanders: Idealism vs. Pragmatism (Just Win?)
description: This article was initially published as a letter to subscribers of The Upshots newsletter. You can sign up for the email here to get this and all of the best of The Upshot.

title: You Is the New Me
description: PARIS  The animated movie Inside Out opens with a question: Do you ever look at someone and wonder, What is going on inside their head?  The filmmakers go on to show exactly whats going on inside the head of an 11-year-old American girl named Riley.

title: Verizon to Add Vice Content to Its Coming Mobile Video Service
description: Verizon Communications is adding Vice Medias youth-oriented entertainment content to its roster of programs that will be available on its mobile-first video service that is expected to start this year.

title: Protesters Seek Return of Body of Tibetan Monk Who Died in Jail
description: HONG KONG  The death of a Tibetan spiritual leader in a Chinese jail has led to a violent protest by Tibetans demanding the return of his body to his family, according to news reports and an advocacy group.

title: 1915: Greeks Persecuted in Turkey
description: LONDON A despatch from Athens states that the Greek Parliament, which was to have met on July 20, will not be convoked till August. According to information published in Athens the systematic persecution of the Greeks in European and Asiatic Turkey is being carried out on a plan suggested by the Germans. The Ottoman authorities are acting with methodical cruelty and leaving no stone unturned in their efforts to exterminate Greek influence. Greek women and children are being taken away to villages in the interior, where they are forced to become Mohammedans.  The New York Herald, European Edition, July 15, 1915

title: Text and Video: Obamas Address on the Iran Nuclear Deal
description: Following is the full transcript, as provided by the White House, of President Obamas remarks Tuesday morning on the nuclear deal with Iran.

title: First Draft Focus: Hillary Clinton Meets With Democrats
New York Gambles on a Fashion Week of Mens Wear
description: At a news conference Monday afternoon to kick off New York Fashion Week: Mens, Diane von Furstenberg, the president of the Council of Fashion Designers of America, charted the recent evolution of male sartorial consciousness. By way of example, she cited Steven Kolb, her friend and colleague, who stood beside her at the Skylight Clarkson Sq event space in Lower Manhattan.

title: Jordan Spieth Is Clear Favorite in Next Leg of the Grand Slam
description: As Jordan Spieth prepares for the British Open with two majors under his belt, excitement is increasing over a 21-year-old going for a Grand Slam. And it is not just excitable fans who have high hopes for Spieth. Normally coolheaded bookmakers and gamblers give him a real chance as well.

title: The Face of the Base
description: Joe Weisenthal asked me why Donald Trump is riding so high in the polls; as he said, my answer was subtle and nuanced.
