title: Celebrating New York Fashion Week: Mens With Stylish Guys, Champagne and BLTs
description: Its not a fashion week if there isnt a party.

title: Review: Exploring Captivity in Handels Alcina and Mozarts Entfhrung at Aix-en-Provence Festival
description: AIX-EN-PROVENCE, France  Two new opera productions at the Aix-en-Provence Festival  this summer  Handels Alcina, directed by Katie Mitchell, and Mozarts Die Entfhrung aus dem Serail (The Abduction From the Seraglio), staged by Martin Kusej  appeared similar in prospect. Each was to offer an 18th-century work in a distinctly 21st-century style, with captivity as a theme.

title: Scenes of Frances Bastille Day Parade
description: France celebrated Bastille Day on Tuesday with President Franois Hollande, and Mexican President Enrique Pea Nieto, watching a parade of military hardware.

title: A Reporters View: Covering the Bush Donor Retreat
description: Nick Confessore, who covers campaign finance for The Times, tells of his experience covering the Bush donor retreat in Kennebunkport, Me., and mixing crab cakes with lots of texting.

title: A Foster Parent, Contemplating an Unknowable Future
description: I cleaned out my wallet this week. It was full and unorganized with receipts and notes and scraps of paper threatening to spill out each time I opened the top flap.

title: Student Leaders Charged Over Hong Kong Protest
description: Two student leaders of Hong Kongs pro-democracy movement were charged on Tuesday with obstructing the police during a protest last year of a Chinese policy white paper asserting Beijings complete authority over Hong Kong.

title: Iran Reaches Nuclear Deal With World Powers
description: Tehran and a group of six nations led by the United States negotiated an accord to significantly limit Irans nuclear ability for more than a decade in exchange for lifting international sanctions.

title: 2 Studies Back Guidelines for Wider Use of Statins
description: Two studies published Tuesday lend support to controversial new cholesterol guidelines that could vastly increase the number of Americans advised to take cholesterol-lowering drugs called statins.

title: What Economics Can (and Cant) Do
description: This interview, the sixth in a series on political topics, discusses philosophical issues concerning economic policy. My interviewee is Daniel Hausman, professor of philosophy at the University of Wisconsin-Madison. He is the author of Preference, Value, Choice and Welfare.  Gary Gutting

title: Full Remarks: Obama on Iran Deal
description: The president spoke on Tuesday, calling an accord between Iran and world powers a comprehensive, long-term deal with Iran that prevents it from obtaining a nuclear weapon.

title: Faithocrats
description: One of the ideas floating around in the aftermath of the sack of Athens has been that of, in effect, deposing Syriza from outside and installing a technocratic government. It wouldnt be the first time in this dismal saga, and I wont be surprised if it happens, for a few months anyway.

title: Republican Candidates Express Strong Opposition to Iran Deal
description: If there were any questions about where the 2016 crop of Republican presidential candidates stood on a nuclear deal with Iran, they were laid to rest on Tuesday after the agreement was announced.

title: What Key Players Are Saying About the Iran Nuclear Deal
description: A guide to international reaction to the historic accord.

title: Micron Technology Is Said to Be Takeover Target of Chinese Company
description: HONG KONG  It is either the first step in the largest takeover of an American company by a Chinese one or a new chapter in the emerging technological cold war between the two countries.

title: Arab World Split Over Iran Nuclear Deal
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The agreement between world powers and Iran over its nuclear program provoked sharp reactions Tuesday across the Arab world, with some hoping the diplomatic success would reduce tensions and others fearing it would empower Iran and increase instability.

title: Rebelle
description: A deep wine list and seasonal food with French flair in NoLIta.

title: Restaurant Review: Rebelle in NoLIta
description: The night was humid, and I was drinking cold ros at the black-veined marble counter that faces the kitchen of Rebelle. The couple on my left had ros in their glasses, too. I did what one member of the pink wine fellowship does when encountering other members, and offered them a taste.

title: Taiwan Contributing $1 Million to Eisenhower Memorial in Washington
description: The memorial to honor Dwight D. Eisenhower is receiving $1 million from the government of Taiwan, the Eisenhower Memorial Commission announced Tuesday.

title: Cakes, Fools and Fruit Puddings
description: From a series for T in which the artist Leanne Shapton makes new artworks from pictures in old books.

title: Tempest in a British Teapot: Complaints About Clenched Buttocks in Mr. Turner
description: LONDON  Timothy Spalls clenched buttocks in Mike Leighs Mr. Turner were the subject of 19 letters of complaint to the British Board of Film Classification, according to the organizations annual report, published Tuesday.

title: Shepard Fairey Turns Himself In to Detroit Police
description: The artist Shepard Fairey has turned himself in to the authorities in Detroit, where he faces felony charges of malicious destruction of property, The Detroit Free Press reported Tuesday.

title: Bipartisan Group Sues to Close New Yorks Corporate Donation Loophole
description: ALBANY  An eclectic group of liberal and conservative interests and individuals filed suit on Tuesday against the State Board of Elections, seeking to overturn a two-decade-old decision that critics say has unleashed an unending torrent of money into New York politics.

title: Lotte World Tower Rises, and Leery Koreans Watch
description: SEOUL  For people hiking in the hills around Seoul, it is an unmistakable sight: the Lotte World Tower taking shape like a gigantic bamboo shoot.

title: 1940: Churchill Vows to Fight
description: LONDON From the capital of the island fortress, standing alone against a Europe almost completely conquered by the Nazis, Prime Minister Winston Churchill cheered the British people and their well-wishers with an international broadcast tonight in which he said that Fuehrer Adolf Hitler for the first time, faced a great nation whose will was equal to his own. From the terrors that the Nazis may unleash, once the battle of Britain is joined at full strength, Churchill did not flinch. He repeated that every town and village in the island would be defended.  New York Herald Tribune, July 15, 1940

title: Public School: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: New York

title: A Reading of Alacrn  Scorpion  Cut by Natalie Diaz
description: The poet reads her verse on drug addiction and family.

title: Missing From New Yorks Gun Control Law
description: New Yorks Gov. Andrew Cuomo has repeatedly counted his 2013 gun control law as one of his greatest legislative trophies. He maneuvered the legislature into passing the NY-Safe Act shortly after the slaughter of children and teachers at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Connecticut. I am proud to be a New Yorker today, he bragged after the bill signing.And not just because New York has the first bill, but because New York has the best bill.

title: World Leaders React to Nuclear Deal
description: President Hassan Rouhani of Iran, Secretary of State John Kerry and other world leaders spoke on Tuesday after an agreement was reached with Iran on its nuclear program.

title: NASA Learns Pluto is Larger Than Thought
description: S. Alan Stern, the principal investigator for NASAs New Horizons mission, said on Tuesday that Pluto has turned out to be larger, and therefore less dense, than had been previously thought.

title: Notable N.F.L. Suspensions in the Roger Goodell Era
description: N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell has suspended players for a variety of infractions, both on and off the field.

title: Hillary Clinton Spends Day at Capitol, Courting Democrats and Praising Iran Deal
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton took her presidential campaign to Capitol Hill on Tuesday, where she made overtures to Congressional Democrats and spoke cautiously  and with a potential eye toward the future  about the Iran nuclear deal announced earlier in the day.

title: Chop Sueys Next Wave
description: Mark Bittman takes a tour through the history of Chinese-American cuisine.

title: Chop Sueys Next Wave
description: This is the second in a series of videos about sustainable agriculture and healthy eating. The series was produced in collaboration with the Global Food Initiative at the University of California.

title: El Chapo Guzmns Escape in Mexico Adds to Strains With U.S.
description: MEXICO CITY  Hours after the worlds most infamous drug lord, Joaqun Guzmn Loera, escaped Mexicos highest security prison over the weekend, the United States offered everything it has  marshals, drones, even a special task force  to help recapture him.

title: Hillary Clinton Discusses Iran Deal
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton, a candidate for the 2016 Democratic presidential nomination, spoke on Tuesday about the nuclear accord between the United States and Iran.

title: Summer Reading Contest Winner, Week 3 | Ben Afflecks Missed Opportunity
description: ISIS. Taylor Swift. Robot dogs. Greece. Same-sex marriage. Fireflies. Leap Seconds. The Common Core.

title: Stampede at Religious Festival Kills 29
description: K. Chiranjeevi, a member of Indias National Congress, blamed government failures for the death of 29 people in the southern state of Andhra Pradesh.

title: A.C.L.U. Asks Court to Stop Part of N.S.A.s Bulk Phone Data Collection
description: WASHINGTON  The American Civil Liberties Union on Tuesday asked a federal appeals court to partly shut down the National Security Agency program that collects Americans phone records in bulk, which resumed last month after a lapse of several weeks. The move sets up a potential conflict between the regular court system and the nations secret spy court over whether the program is legal.

title: An Iran Nuclear Deal That Reduces the Chance of War
description: The final deal with Iran announced by the United States and other major world powers does what no amount of political posturing and vague threats of military action had managed to do before. It puts strong, verifiable limits on Irans ability to develop a nuclear weapon for at least the next 10 to 15 years and is potentially one of the most consequential accords in recent diplomatic history, with the ability not just to keep Iran from obtaining a nuclear weapon but also to reshape Middle East politics.

title: Mixed Grill, the American Way
description: Gotta save room for mixed grill, a character says in Jonathan Franzens 2001 novel, The Corrections, a little ominously. The meal stood then as a kind of metaphor for American ennui, a groaning board of fire-roasted meats that was delicious until it was not. Browning meats on a grille of chrome and hellish coals, Mr. Franzen writes. The eternal broiling, broiling of the damned.

title: Evan Williams, Ex-Chief of Twitter, Talks About Its Future
description: Evan Williams is the chief executive of Medium, an online publishing platform. But who wants to talk about that?

title: If Marble Could Talk
description: A sculpture by the Renaissance artist Tullio Lombardo has given birth to a multimedia installation at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, on exhibit through August 2.

title: The Marine Corps Command Investigation Into Allegations of a Hostile Work Environment
description: This investigation, initiated at the request of Lt. Col. Kate Germano, did not find evidence of her allegations of gender bias and a hostile work environment at the recruit training regiment.

title: Burnside Biscuits Brings a Southern Accent to Queens
description: Burnside Biscuits The blocklong triangular building that houses the restaurant was formerly Athens Cafe. Now it has been given a Southern accent, taking its name from Ambrose Burnside, a Union general who fought in the South in the Civil War. The new owner, Euripides Pelekanos, who is the chief executive of the Bareburger chain, has put Sam Crocker in charge of the kitchen. Mr. Crocker, a French Culinary Institute graduate, was most recently at Il Buco Alimentari. For his moist yet crisp fried chicken, he brines local birds in tea and lemon. And he has perfected big, cloudlike duck-fat biscuits to serve alongside it, or to split for sandwiches. Mr. Crocker had a hand in outfitting the kitchen with a handsome Italian wood-burning oven for roasting vegetables like carrots and broccoli. A pickle plate, pimento cheese and moon pies are also on the menu. Theres a big bar area, a counter facing the open kitchen and ample outdoor seating: 32-07 30th Avenue, Astoria, Queens, 917-832-7822, burnsidebiscuit.com.

title: Union Square Hospitality Buying Stake in Tender Greens Chain
description: The Union Square Hospitality Group, the gastronomic empire assembled by the New York restaurateur Danny Meyer, is making a minority investment in Tender Greens, a growing chain of restaurants based in California.

title: With Daddy Deploying, a Childs Nightmares Echo a Mothers Fears
description: Monsters under the bed are one thing. You grab a flashlight, lift the dust ruffle, and prove that there is nothing to be afraid of. But what happens when the nightmares are based on rational fears? How do you tell a 4-year-old everything will be O.K. when you cant guarantee that it will?

title: Eric Garners Family Says Settlement Will Not Stall Push for Police Reform
description: The releases were signed by the relatives of Eric Garner and delivered late on Monday to the New York City comptroller  seven signatures on nearly identical two-page forms, line after line with none of the import of the moment apart from one number: $5.9 million.

title: The Pause of 2014
description: Part of the background to the sack of Athens is the widespread belief among Europes austerians that, despite everything that has happened, they are in the process of being vindicated. After all, growth has resumed in the GIIPS countries  in fact, even Greece was growing until Syriza came to power and scared away the confidence fairy.

title: Garner Family Reacts to Settlement
description: The family of Eric Garner spoke on Tuesday about the $5.9 million settlement it received from New York City to resolve a wrongful-death claim. Mr. Garner was killed by the police last July.

title: Roasted Zucchini Makes a Fresh Parmesan Dish
description: There are certain summer fruits and vegetables  tomatoes, sweet corn, figs  to which the phrase you can never have enough applies. Zucchini is probably not one of them. By now, those who get baskets from Community Supported Agriculture groups may be searching for more things to do with the zucchini and the rest of the summer squash that is arriving weekly. It will be piled high at my farmers markets for weeks to come.

title: Cash in Athens: Reporters Notebook
description: I just returned from taking my daily cash allowance of 50 euros out of my bank ATM here in Athens.

title: Twitter Shares Jump After Faked Bloomberg Report
description: Takeover rumors about Twitter surface with seeming regularity every couple of months. But one on Tuesday showed a new level of sophistication in an effort to pump up the companys stock.

title: Republicans Race to Condemn the Iran Deal
description: The Republican presidential candidates fell all over themselves today trying to see who could condemn the nuclear deal with Iran the most quickly and in the most cataclysmic terms. It made no difference whether they actually knew anything about the deal, about Iran, about nuclear arms, or about foreign policy in general. They had their attacks ready, just as they have had and will have to anything President Obama does or wants.

title: In Blow to Erdogan, Turkish Court Halts Closing of Schools Tied to His Rival
description: ISTANBUL  In a blow to the government, Turkeys highest court has overturned a law that would have closed thousands of preparatory schools linked to an influential Muslim cleric and rival of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

title: BB&Ts Deal for Susquehanna Resulted in Big Payout to Executives
description: The top executives at the American bank BB&T seem to have become greedy. The Federal Reserve last week approved the companys $2.5 billion purchase of Susquehanna Bancshares, one of the banking industrys biggest transactions in years.

title: Art Basel Hires Armory Show Director to Run Its Miami Fair
description: Art Basel is appointing Noah Horowitz, currently the executive director of the Armory Show in New York, to be its new director of the Americas, running Art Basel Miami Beach.

title: Iran Celebrates Nuclear Deal, Tempered by Cynicism and Hard-Liner Warnings
description: TEHRAN  Weary of sanctions and isolation, many ordinary Iranians rejoiced on Tuesday over a historic nuclear agreement with world powers led by the United States, the main enemy for nearly four decades.

title: Unlicensed SoHo Day Care Is Shut After Death of Infant Boy
description: The day care that Lee Towndrow and Amber Scorah chose for their 3-month-old son, Karl, seemed like a good match in a city where child care can cost as much as college tuition and waiting lists seem to offer only discouragement.

title: Chris Froome Crushes Tour de France Field in Stage 10
description: LA PIERRE-ST.-MARTIN, France  As always, the arrival of the Tour de France in the mountains was expected to sort out the potential winners. But on the particularly and relentlessly steep climb to the ski resort here, Britains Chris Froome may have narrowed that group just to himself.

title: Martin OMalley Pledges to Go Further Than Rivals on Overhauling Immigration
description: Surrounded by immigrants from several countries, Martin OMalley, the Democratic presidential hopeful, pledged on Tuesday to go further on overhauling the immigration system than any other candidate, in a clear effort to present a contrast with Hillary Rodham Clinton.

title: Town Revisits Its Mockingbird Past
description: Harper Lee's hometown of Monroeville, Ala., takes stock of its relationship to the writer and her work.

title: For Rickie Fowler and Jordan Spieth, Opposite Approaches to British Open
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland  Every summer, just before the British Open, the debate begins anew: Do players who come to Europe a few weeks early to play some extra links-style golf have an advantage over those who remain in the United States to practice there?

title: Thom Brownes Fashion Fun House, With Gray Suits
description: The Man in the Gray Flannel Suit has been invoked so often where Thom Browne is concerned (and he does, in fairness, make a great many gray suits, some of them flannel) that at New York Fashion Week: Mens, Mr. Browne gave in. For his presentation Tuesday morning, in the basement of a studio space on West 27th Street, he erected a mirrored cube of an office and showed gray suits  reflected so many times in the mirrored walls, ceiling and floor that they seemed to number in the thousands.

title: Review: Marga Gomezs Pound Mocks Depictions of Lesbians on Film
description: Marga Gomez spins a comic fantasia on depictions of lesbians in the movies in her new solo show, Pound, presented at Dixon Place as part of the theaters annual celebration of queer culture. As she reminds us early on, Ms. Gomez herself once played a lesbian  or so she conceived her character for her three lines of dialogue  in the 1998 film Sphere. She and Queen Latifah played characters who worked in an underwater biodome. Both of our characters are attacked by sea creatures, she recalls, and we die in the first 30 minutes because they always kill the lesbians of color first. Also, we should have stayed in the biodome.

title: The P.L.T.
description: Crucial elements in Eli Zabars summer sandwich of seasonal tomatoes, prosciutto and lettuce are a thick layer of mayonnaise and ample amounts of salt.

title: Tsipras Is Seen as Retaining Greeks Approval While Selling Tough Bailout Deal
description: ATHENS  Outside Parliament here Monday night, a small crowd had gathered to protest the bailout deal that Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras was bringing home from Brussels, when a woman tried to burn the flag of his left-wing Syriza party.

title: The Nuclear Agreement With Iran
description: To the Editor:

title: Donald Trump Is Tied With Jeb Bush for Lead in National Poll
description: Donald J. Trumps surge in the polls shows no signs of abating.

title: Congress Reacts to Iran Deal
description: Congressional leaders from both parties spoke on Tuesday about the nuclear accord between the United States and Iran.

title: Harper Lees Go Set a Watchman Brings Division and Curiosity to Monroeville, Ala.
description: MONROEVILLE, Ala.  Amy Burchfield, an English teacher, drove about nine hours from Arkansas to stand in line late on Monday night here in the town that Harper Lee made famous in To Kill a Mockingbird.

title: Duckie Brown: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: New York

title: Who Got What They Wanted in the Iran Nuclear Deal
description: Here is a look at what Iran and the United States wanted, and what they got.

title: 3 Leave Jobs Over Psychologists Involvement inTerrorism Interrogations
description: WASHINGTON  The nations largest professional organization for psychologists announced a management shake-up on Tuesday. The action came days after a scathing report concluded that top officials of the group had colluded with government officials during the George W. Bush administration to assure that the organizations ethics rules did not bar psychologists from involvement in harsh interrogations about terrorist activity.

title: Thomas Robinson, a Nets Newcomer, Will Have Knee Surgery
description: Thomas Robinson, a 24-year-old forward who joined the Nets this month on a two-year contract, will undergo arthroscopic surgery Wednesday to repair a small tear in the meniscus of his right knee.

title: Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders Meet Again  in the Senate
description: Hillary and Bernie. It could be a buddy sitcom if the two werent in a battle for the soul  and presidential nomination  of the Democratic Party.

title: Iranians Celebrate Nuclear Deal
description: Iranians took to the streets on Tuesday night to celebrate the nuclear accord between the United States and Iran.

title: Harper Lees Go Set a Watchman
description: In 1992, a law professor named Monroe Freedman published an article in Legal Times, a magazine for practitioners. He asserted that Atticus Finch, the iconic hero of Harper Lees novel To Kill a Mockingbird, ought not be lauded as a role model for attorneys. Lee had portrayed Finch as zealously representing a black man, Tom Robinson, despite intense disapproval from many whites. Whats more, Robinson was accused of having raped a white woman. Not only did Finch ably defend Robinson in court; one evening he also faced down a mob that sought to abduct the defendant from jail in order to lynch him.

title: Living in Tarrytown, N.Y.
description: Tarrytown, N.Y., a hilly 5.7-square-mile village of around 11,000 residents, is situated the Hudson River about 25 miles from Midtown Manhattan.

title: Yemens Houthis Lose Aden Airport in New Fighting
description: AL MUKALLA, Yemen  Southern fighters battling Houthi rebels seized control of the international airport in Yemens port city of Aden on Tuesday, dealing the Houthis their most significant defeat in the city since they stormed it more than three months ago, witnesses and security officials said.

title: Celebrating Plutos Flyby
description: NASAs New Horizons spacecraft completes its pass by Pluto, soon to reveal a new world to humanity.

title: I.M.F. Demands Greece Debt Relief as Condition for Bailout
description: FRANKFURT  The International Monetary Fund threatened to withdraw support for Greeces bailout on Tuesday unless European leaders agree to substantial debt relief, an immediate challenge to the regions plan to rescue the country.

title: Pictures of the Day: Iran and Elsewhere
description: Iran and Elsewhere  Pictures of the Day

title: Sizing Up Hillary Clintons Plans to Help the Middle Class
description: Could President Hillary Clinton restore the American middle class?

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week.

title: In Store
description: TenThousandThings now carries more than just jewelry.

title: Rand Paul Supports Outreach to Iran, but Opposes Deal
description: Republican presidential candidates and members of Congress did not hold back their anger over the Obama administrations nuclear deal with Iran on Tuesday. With one exception.

title: What You Get for  $900,000
description: Homes on the water in Vermont and Oregon, and a brick house in Kentucky

title: Go Set a Watchman Sparks a Flurry of Varied Reader Reactions
description: Marie Tae McDermott is a news assistant and comment moderator.

title: Scott Walker Says He Would Kill Iran Deal and Seek Crippling Sanctions
description: LAS VEGAS  Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin branded himself a fighter and winner over a dozen times here on Tuesday in the first event of his presidential campaign, and said that if elected he wanted to take the fight directly to Iran in the wake of the just-finalized treaty over its nuclear program.

title: Health Laws Contraceptive Coverage Isnt Burden on Religion, Court Rules
description: WASHINGTON  A federal appeals court Tuesday handed the Obama administration another victory in its effort to guarantee coverage of contraceptives under the Affordable Care Act, rejecting a challenge by the Little Sisters of the Poor, an order of Roman Catholic nuns.

title: Women Who Dye Their (Armpit) Hair
description: Destiny Moreno, who is 17, drove to a Sally Beauty Supply near her Seattle home last September with a newly hatched plan. She peppered a grandmotherly employee with questions about hair bleaches, developers and dyes, and the woman asked matter-of-factly if she were coloring her hair.

title: French Lessons
description: DIsplays of power honored Bastille Day, a signal moment in the French Revolution.

title: Review: Court Is Chaitanya Tamhanes Unsparing Look at Justice in India
description: The wheels of justice grind slowly and mercilessly in Court, Chaitanya Tamhanes quiet, devastating critique of the antiquated Indian legal system. As it follows the case of Narayan Kamble (Vira Sathidar), a 65-year-old folk singer and social activist accused of inciting what is presumed to be the suicide of a sewer worker in Mumbai, the film conjures an absurdist nightmare of bureaucratic incompetence, indifference and social inequity.

title: July 14, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Iran, Russia, Germany and Spain.

title: Super PACs Buy Cable Ads to Raise Rick Perrys National Profile
description: The outside groups backing the Republican candidates for president have raised tens of millions of dollars, and theyve already begun spending them, buying millions of dollars worth of early advertising to highlight their candidates records.

title: Review: Jellyfish Eyes, a Childrens Film From Takashi Murakami
description: Its no surprise that the Japanese artist-impresario Takashi Murakami has directed a feature-length film that combines human actors and animated characters. After all, Mr. Murakami is a polymath trained in anime as well as in Nihonga, Japans rigorous traditional painting style, and has been moving between high and low art for over two decades. He is known for multipurpose cartoon creatures, among them petal-rimmed smiley faces and mushrooms dotted with wide, baby-doll peepers that he calls jellyfish eyes. These and other signature motifs have appeared in labor-intensive paintings, in large polychrome sculptures evoking a highbrow Disneyland and on skateboards and limited-edition Louis Vuitton handbags.

title: Celgene Agrees to $7.2 Billion Deal for Receptos
description: The biotechnology company Celgene agreed on Tuesday to pay $7.2 billion in cash to acquire Receptos, which is developing a potentially promising drug for autoimmune diseases.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: A Villa Outside Marrakesh
description: Located in Palmeraie, a wealthy suburb of Marrakesh, the home sits on a 3.7-acre site planted with a vegetable garden and palms.

title: Invisible Green Triumphs
description: Like a number of commentators, Ive been struck by how people on the right know, just know, that Obamacare has been a dismal failure. More than 15 million Americans have gained coverage, costs are well below predictions, and employment growth has accelerated since the job-killing law went into effect  but they know none of that, because all they hear from their preferred information sources is tales of disaster.

title: Getty Center to Recreate the Cave Temples of Dunhuang
description: Next summer, visitors to the Getty Centers hilltop compound in Los Angeles will be able to duck into reproductions of Chinese caverns lined in colorful Buddhist deities as part of an exhibition, Cave Temples of Dunhuang: Buddhist Art on Chinas Silk Road.

title: Friedman Interviews Obama: The Strengths of the Iran Deal
description: In a conversation with Thomas L. Friedman, President Obama explains what he thinks the United States gained from the nuclear deal with Iran.

title: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres the latest.

title: Obama Makes His Case on Iran Nuclear Deal
description: Only hours after the conclusion of an agreement with Iran to lift oil and financial sanctions in return for curbs on Irans nuclear capabilities, President Obama is a man who evinces no second thoughts whatsoever about the deal he struck. In a 45-minute interview in the Cabinet Room, the president kept stressing one argument: Dont judge me on whether this deal transforms Iran, ends Irans aggressive behavior toward some of its Arab neighbors or leads to dtente between Shiites and Sunnis. Judge me on one thing: Does this deal prevent Iran from breaking out with a nuclear weapon for the next 10 years and is that a better outcome for America, Israel and our Arab allies than any other alternative on the table?

title: Bills Aaron Kromer Placed on Leave During Attack Inquiry
description: The Buffalo Bills put their offensive-line coach, Aaron Kromer, on indefinite paid leave on Tuesday, two days after he was arrested on suspicion of punching and threatening a boy in Florida.

title: Friedman Interviews Obama on Iran: Russias Role
description: President Obama describes Russias crucial role in achieving the nuclear deal.

title: New York Stock Exchange System Failure Draws Attention to Staff Cuts
description: When the New York Stock Exchanges systems went down during the trading day last week, few longtime employees who had helped lead the exchange during past technical problems were on hand.

title: Rising Star of Syrian Soccer Tells of Perilous Escape From Civil War
description: OBERSTAUFEN, Germany  Mohammed Jaddou performs a special trick when the ball is at his feet. On the training field of F.V. Ravensburg, a team that plays in the fifth tier of German soccer, Jaddou, the captain of Syrias under-16 national team, flicks the ball deftly to his chest, rolling it perfectly up onto his face.

title: Review: Momix Shoots for Astonishment With Alchemia
description: Optical illusions and other neat-looking tricks, achieved by a lithe cohort of dancer-athletes and an extensive design team, have long been the selling points of Momix. Established three decades ago by Moses Pendleton, a founding member of the equally spectacle-oriented Pilobolus, the company specializes in teasing the eye through lighting and video effects, often exploring themes related to nature. (Recent entries in its globally touring repertoire include Botanica, about the seasons, and Lunar Sea, about the moon.) Even if theres not much choreographic substance, theres cool stuff to see.

title: Not the Usual Suspects at the Public School Show
description: There they were, their heads hovering around the line marking 6 feet, arrayed like perps in a jailhouse lineup. They wore solemn-colored sportswear, in black, white or blue: varsity jackets and shorts, rib-cuffed track pants and sleek tailored jackets.

title: One Way to Reform Reddit: Give Users a Share in Profits
description: Imagine youve just been hired as the manager of an aging local sandwich shop. Lets call it Breaddit. Congratulations.

title: Taiwan Turns Light on 1947 Slaughter by Chiang Kai-sheks Troops
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan  It took Faith Hong about a half-hour to blast through a century of history and a lifetime of propaganda.

title: Todd Snyder: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: New York

title: The Name Atticus Acquires an Unwelcome Association
description: When Oscar Boykin and his wife, Liz, heard that a new Harper Lee novel was to be released, populated by the same characters as To Kill a Mockingbird, they envisioned a tsunami of baby boys named Atticus storming the country, and their own son, Atticus, who is 9 months old, would no longer stand out.

title: Rob Manfred, Pointing to Growth, Says He Is Open to Expansion
description: CINCINNATI  Rob Manfred began the All-Star news media luncheon on Tuesday the way his predecessor, Bud Selig, often did, citing examples of baseballs health: competitive balance in the pennant races, strong attendance, thriving local television ratings and, perhaps most significant, the rising use of the At Bat app.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: RECENT SALE

title: A Conversation With Mark Gilbreath
description: Mr. Gilbreath, 48, is the founder and chief executive of LiquidSpace, an online booking platform that offers short-term work and meeting spaces nationwide as well as in Canada and Australia. The company, based in San Francisco, opened for business in 2011.

title: Friedman Interviews Obama on Iran: Nixon
description: President Obama on what he learned from Richard Nixon about diplomacy.

title: An Iron Fist Against El Salvadors Gangs
description: As gang violence in El Salvador creeps to levels not seen since that countrys civil war, Manu Brabo found civilians calling for police and the military to take a hardened stance, despite troubling memories.

title: Former Winemaker Pleads No Contest in California Court
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Jeffry James Hill, a former Napa Valley winemaker and vineyard manager who was accused of stealing grapes and misrepresenting the origin of wines he sold to consumers and to other winemakers, pleaded no contest on Tuesday to one count of grand theft.

title: Lawyers, Funds and Money in Toxic Irish Stew
description: An unfolding scandal in Northern Ireland has cast a harsh light on what can happen when a private equity firm goes trolling for distressed assets and a big return. It is a toxic mix of money, lawyers, politicians and the continued wreckage of the financial crisis.

title: For a Therapist in Afghanistan, Empathy Is Good Medicine
description: KHAMZARGAR, Afghanistan  As one of only five female therapists in the northeastern Afghan province of Kapisa, Farkhunda Shahab struggles to soothe the anguished.

title: Friedman Interviews Obama on Iran: 2016
description: President Obama on his doubts about Republican support for the deal and what it means for the next president.

title: Meet Miip, the Ad Monkey in Your App
description: Naveen Tewari, chief executive of InMobi, thinks the 1.2 billion people who see ads served by his companys mobile ad network are tired of being bombarded with generally irrelevant marketing messages. He says advertising should be friendly, more tour guide than tout, and help people discover new products and services that they actually want to buy.

title: Rachel Dolezals Brother Cleared in Sex Case
description: Prosecutors in Colorado have dropped child sexual assault charges against the estranged brother of a former N.A.A.C.P. chapter president who came under criticism for falsely identifying herself as a black woman.

title: Illinois: Lawyer for Hastert Will Seek to Have Charges Dismissed
description: A lawyer for J. Dennis Hastert, a former speaker of the House of Representatives, told a federal judge in Chicago on Tuesday that he would seek to have the charges against Mr. Hastert dismissed. Mr. Hastert, Republican of Illinois, is accused of lying to the F.B.I. and structuring bank withdrawals to cover up payments for past misconduct. Though the indictment did not specify the misconduct, it has been widely reported that it involved sexual acts with a male student while Mr. Hastert was a high school teacher and coach in Yorkville. Thomas C. Green, a lawyer for Mr. Hastert, blamed the federal government for apparent leaks about the misconduct that he called an 800-pound gorilla in the case. The case is due back in federal court in October.

title: Truck Driver Was Probably at Fault in Crash That Killed 10, N.T.S.B. Says
description: The National Transportation Safety Board on Tuesday determined that a fatal crash last year in California between a FedEx truck and a bus that left 10 people dead was probably caused by the driver of the truck, who witnesses described as being unresponsive behind the wheel before the accident. But the agency said that after examining the drivers medical records and work history, it found it unlikely that fatigue or a medical condition were factors in the crash. A toxicology report also ruled out drugs or alcohol, the N.T.S.B found. The agency recommended that new buses have a second escape door and that passengers be given safety briefings. The fiery collision occurred April 10, 2014, in Orland, about 100 miles north of Sacramento. The bus was carrying 44 high school students from Southern California on a trip to Humboldt State University.

title: Iran Accords Complexity Shows Impact of Bipartisan Letter
description: A bipartisan group of nuclear and Middle East experts, including five of President Obamas former senior advisers on Iran, wrote a public letter last month describing the emerging nuclear deal with Iran as weak. They called for a number of improvements, and described the strengthening as a bare-minimum requirement to win their support for the complicated accord.

title: Amazon Dreams Up a Sale in a Calendar Bursting With Them
description: Rollback. Doorbuster. Blowout prices. Do those words mean anything anymore?

title: Joan Sebastian, Mexican Singer and Songwriter, Is Dead at 64
description: Joan Sebastian, a Mexican singer and songwriter whose sultry ballads won a total of 11 Grammy and Latin Grammy Awards and made him one of the top-selling Latin musicians, died on Monday at his ranch in Juliantla, Mexico. He was 64.

title: A Grand Ramp Inside Grand Central
description: Each day, commuters hurry down a ramp hall at Grand Central Terminal with a few stopping to admire the view.

title: Marchionne, Chief of Fiat Chrysler, Backs Away From G.M. Bid
description: Four months after his proposal to merge with General Motors was rejected, Sergio Marchionne, the chief executive of Fiat Chrysler Automobiles, said Tuesday that he had no plans to make another offer.

title: Obama Calls for Effort to Fix a Broken System of Criminal Justice
description: PHILADELPHIA  President Obama on Tuesday called for a sweeping bipartisan effort to fix what he called a broken system of criminal justice that has locked up too many Americans for too long, especially a whole generation of young black and Hispanic men.

title: Middle East Allies See Heightened Peril in Newly Empowered Tehran
description: WASHINGTON  Even in the final months of talks to peacefully resolve the conflict over Irans nuclear program, events across the Middle East showcased the acrimony between Washington and Tehran. The United States dispatched warships to the Persian Gulf, backed Saudi airstrikes against Iranian allies in Yemen and struggled to keep American air power from unintentionally helping Irans proxies in Iraq and Syria.

title: Pete Rose Drama Plays Out on Baseballs Biggest Stage
description: On the Fox Sports 1 set at Great American Ball Park on Monday afternoon in Cincinnati, Frank Thomas asked Pete Rose: Pete, do you feel like Dorothy? Theres no place like home? Quick to take, chew and run with the bait, Rose said: No place like home, baby. I was born three miles from here. Thats where I was born. Peter Edward Rose.

title: Greek Crisis Dulls Appetite for Euro in Countries Waiting to Adopt It
description: WARSAW  Once, it was an exclusive club that nearly all of Europe aspired to join. Now, in the wake of Greeces latest financial crisis and the hard-line response from many of the Continents powers, becoming a partner in the European common currency seems less and less appealing to many of the countries lined up for their chance.

title: Among All-Star Pitchers, Envy Flows With Esteem
description: CINCINNATI  Beneath every striped cap, somewhere in the psyche of each player in the All-Star Game on Tuesday, were two competing emotions.

title: Airbag Flaw Investigated at ARC Automotive
description: Federal safety regulators are investigating airbag inflaters made by ARC Automotive, a Tennessee supplier that uses the same explosive compound that has plagued inflaters made by Takata, public documents posted Tuesday showed.

title: What Obama Says the Iran Nuclear Deal Means
description: In an exclusive interview with Thomas L. Friedman, the president explains why he has no second thoughts about the accord with Iran.

title: David Aronson, Expressionist Artist, Dies at 91
description: David Aronson, an Expressionist artist whose vivid paintings, charcoal drawings and sculptures captured the tension between his Orthodox Jewish upbringing and the biblical injunction against making graven images, died on July 2 in Natick, Mass. He was 91.

title: Both Sides Deliver Closing Arguments in Colorado Shooting Trial
description: CENTENNIAL, Colo.  A photograph of a 6-year-old girl, smiling and waving to the camera, flashed on screen in the quiet courtroom, and then, the sound of screams and gunshots filled the air. It was a 911 call from inside a midnight movie screening that in July 2012 turned into a scene of chaos, bloodshed and enduring loss, one of the worst mass shootings in recent years.

title: Louis Oosthuizen Is Coming Off a Streak That Stirs Memories of 2010
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland  If this weeks British Open groupings were like dinner seating arrangements, Tiger Woods and Louis Oosthuizen would have been tempted to switch their place cards so they were not near each other. Woods and Oosthuizen have combined to win the past three British Opens contested at the Old Course here, so perhaps in a nod to their shared history at St. Andrews, they will play the first two rounds together this week.

title: CUNY Medical School to Open in 2016
description: A new medical school run by the City University of New York will open with its first class in fall 2016 after receiving preliminary accreditation, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos office announced on Tuesday.

title: Russia Quickly Maneuvers to Capitalize on Iran Nuclear Deal
description: MOSCOW  Sergey V. Lavrov, the Russian foreign minister, lost no time in talking about the accord on Irans nuclear program. He was on television minutes after the deal was clinched, and even before the formal news conference had begun, announcing the landmark agreement to the audience back home and emphasizing the many potential benefits, strategic and economic, that it holds for Russia.

title: 2010 Meeting With F.B.I. Agents Is Focus at Senator Thomas Libouss Trial
description: WHITE PLAINS  One Thursday morning in 2010, two unexpected visitors arrived at Senator Thomas W. Libouss office in the State Capitol. They were agents from the Federal Bureau of Investigation, and they wanted to speak with him.

title: Iran Reaches Nuclear Deal With World Powers
description: Tehran and a group of six nations led by the United States negotiated an accord to significantly limit Irans nuclear capability for more than a decade, in exchange for lifting international sanctions.

title: Ovadia & Sons: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: New York

title: Building Collapses in Bedford-Stuyvesant
description: Several pedestrians were injured when a vacant four-story building at 1438 Fulton Street in Bedford-Stuyvesant crumbled on Tuesday afternoon. Tayleen Rosario said she and four co-workers at Fulton Dental Plaza next door scrambled to evacuate their patients. It felt like an earthquake; it was chaos, Ms. Rosario, 26, said.

title: TurboTax Drops Cloud Backup Option for Desktop Users
description: If you used the desktop version of TurboTax during the most recent tax filing season and backed up your return online, you may want to make sure you have a copy of it stored on your computer.

title: Working With an Anchor
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  This crossword by Bruce Haight is one of those puzzles that might be easier to crack if you solve it on a computer with a keyboard in front of you, and its not because the puzzle contains any technical complexities. Its because the answers would be right in front of your eyes.

title: Obama at N.A.A.C.P. Annual Convention
description: A day after commuting the prison sentences of 46 nonviolent drug offenders, the president pushed for criminal justice reform.

title: Rag & Bone: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: New York

title: Patience Fades as Squibb Park Bridge in Brooklyn Remains Shut
description: On Monday afternoon, Nakeeba Burge, who lives in Flatbush, Brooklyn, drove to Brooklyn Heights, planning to zigzag down the Squibb Park Bridge to Brooklyn Bridge Park and spend a mild summer evening enjoying the recreational piers, lawns, native flower gardens and even a small beach.

title: Growth in China Holds Steady, and Better Than Expected, at 7%
description: HONG KONG  Chinas slowing economy appeared to stabilize somewhat in the second quarter, defying signs of weakness in the countrys traditional industrial base and more recent turbulence in its stock market.

title: Mayor de Blasio Seeks to Strike a Balance at a Memorial for Eric Garner
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio spoke slowly on Tuesday night, committed to getting the words right inside a modest Staten Island church.

title: N.B.A. Decides to Stand Pat on Free Agency and Free Throws
description: LAS VEGAS  DeAndre Jordan drew a disproportionate share of the spotlight this week during meetings here for the N.B.A.s competition committee and the leagues Board of Governors.

title: The I.M.F. Is Telling Europe the Euro Doesnt Work
description: It reads like a dry, 1,184-word memorandum about fiscal projections. But the International Monetary Funds memo on Greek debt sustainability, explaining why the I.M.F. cannot participate in a new bailout program unless other European countries agree to huge debt relief for Greece, has provided the Emperor Has No Clothes moment of the Greek crisis, one that may finally force eurozone members to either move closer to fiscal union or break up.

title: For the Costellos, a Gentle Chaos
description: The family abandoned the frenzy of New York City for a slower pace. But life in a storied pink house in the Garden District of New Orleans is its own kind of crazy.

title: Garza Marfas Chicago Connection
description: The only place you can see and buy the entire line of Garza Marfa furniture is at the companys showroom in Marfa, Texas  until now: from July 17th through August 29th, Chicagos Kruger Gallery will mount a show of Jamey Garza and Constance Holt-Garzas collection.

title: All-Star Game 2015: An A.L. Homer to Start, and the N.L. Is Finished
description: CINCINNATI  Every chance he gets, it seems, Mike Trout validates his standing as the best player in baseball. He did it again on Tuesday, becoming the first player to win the Most Valuable Player Award in the All-Star Game two years in a row.

title: Video Accuses Planned Parenthood of Crime
description: WASHINGTON  Abortion opponentson Tuesdayrenewed their campaign against Planned Parenthood, with immediate impact among Republicans in Congress and the presidential race, after the release of a video that surreptitiously captured an official fromthe group explaining how it provides fetal parts to medical researchers.

title: Fight Over Manhattan Apartment and Surveillance Cameras Lands Tenants Guardian in Court
description: As her legal guardian, Arthur Schwartz is responsible for the care and well-being of a 91-year-old woman named Ruth Berk.

title: Looking Beyond Controversy as Readers in Manhattan Welcome Harper Lees Watchman
description: A rapt crowd at the 92nd Street Y in Manhattan, many attendees clutching copies of Harper Lees new novel, Go Set a Watchman, to their chests, displayed no interest in the controversies that have swirled around the book  not the unanswered questions about its provenance and publication or the shocking revelation that Atticus Finch, the crusading lawyer of To Kill a Mockingbird, was now a racist in Watchman.

title: Another Case Tied to Brooklyn Officers in Gun-Planting Inquiry Is Dropped
description: As an investigation into gun arrests by a group of police officers in a Brooklyn precinct nears its conclusion, another of the cases they helped bring has been dropped.

title: Dressing the Part at Comic-Con
description: Images of some of the attendees of San Diego Comic-Con 2015.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday
description: 1 A.M. (FX Movie Channel) CHASING MAVERICKS (2012) Rick Hesson (Gerard Butler), a surfer in Santa Cruz nicknamed Frosty, teaches Jay Moriarity (Jonny Weston), a legend in the making, the way of the waves  specifically, the monster crushers in Northern California on a break known as Mavericks. Curtis Hanson and Michael Apted shared the directing duties on this film, based on a true story that begins in 1987 and is lent authenticity by the real surfers Greg Long, Peter Mel and Zach Wormhoudt. When the movie works, its buoyancy can be infectious and persuasive, particularly in the surfing scenes and in the mesmerizing shots of the heaving, churning ocean and waves, Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times. The film, she added, invites you to gaze into this watery abyss, to ponder its mysteries as well as those of the swimmer whose image brackets the movie and evokes John F. Kennedys observation: We are tied to the ocean. And when we go back to the sea, whether it is to sail or to watch, we are going back from whence we came.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: The reality is that it is a painful agreement to make, but also necessary and wise. And we might think of it as just the end of the beginning of a long struggle to contain Iran.

title: Corrections: July 15, 2015
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: A Gap Lingers in Taiwans Wartime Memory
description: This month, after a military parade featuring troops riding motorcycles and mountain bikes, Apache attack helicopters flying in formation and shirtless frogmen waving paddles from the backs of trucks, President Ma Ying-jeou of Taiwan told a handful of World War II veterans that their contribution to defeating Japan was not forgotten.

title: Raising An Iron Fist Against El Salvadors Gangs
description: The images from El Salvador are like a flashback from that countrys brutal civil war: Heavily-armed special troops fanning out through nighttime streets, where corpses lay in pools of blood as bystanders look on. This time, their targets are not guerrilla forces and their civilian sympathizers, but gang members, who have killed so many rivals and civilians alike that the countrys monthly death toll is rising to levels not seen since the end of the 12-year civil war in 1992.

title: Pluto, My Oddball Friend
description: To the Editor:

title: Cruelty Toward Hens
description: To the Editor:

title: One Step Toward Justice in the Garner Killing
description: The resolution was swift and fair. Just days before the first anniversary of Eric Garners killing by the police, New York City has reached a $5.9 million settlement with his family. This does not mean the story is over. A federal civil rights investigation is continuing, as are inquiries by the citys Civilian Complaint Review Board and state officials. The Police Department has not said what has come of its own investigation.

title: Haste, Hustle and Scott Walker
description: In the formal announcement of his presidential campaign on Monday, Scott Walker mentioned God right away, introduced himself as a preachers son and invoked religion repeatedly, as he has throughout a perpetual candidacy that stretches back to his college days, when he told the Marquette University yearbook: I really think theres a reason why God put all these political thoughts in my head.

title: Germanys Destructive Anger
description: A DEAL has finally been reached that could keep Greece in the eurozone. Few are happy with the outcome. Weve heard a lot about how the Greeks feel humiliated. But weve heard less about German anger, and we know they are angry. Finance Minister Wolfgang Schuble was reported to have started yelling during Saturday nights negotiations. France and Italy have both made huge loans to Greece, but neither country has expressed hostility to Greece. Why is Germany so angry?

title: North Carolinas Voting Law Goes on Trial
description: It would have been bad enough if the North Carolina Legislature, in a misguided effort to streamline voting procedures, had passed a law that ended up having discriminatory effects. But what happened was far worse than that.

title: Overregulating Life in Greece
description: IN dominating the debate over how to address the Greek crisis, Germany has shown that economic success brings political influence, which it wielded last weekend to brush away requests from France and Italy for more lenient treatment of their neighbor.

title: Lessons From the BP Spill in the Gulf
description: To the Editor:

title: Segregated Schools in the Suburbs
description: To the Editor:

title: Shanghai Disney Plans Unveiled: Big on Pirates, but No Space Mountain
description: SHANGHAI  The Walt Disney Company unveiled on Wednesday the designs and attractions at the mega-resort that is expected to open here in Shanghai in the spring, its first theme park in mainland China.

title: How Obama Should Sell the Iran Deal
description: LONDON  IN the long run-up to Tuesdays nuclear agreement with Iran, the Obama administration repeatedly suggested that the accord was part of a larger strategic shift in Washingtons approach to Iran. Past experience with arms control debates during the Cold War demonstrates that this is a big mistake that could jeopardize hard-won security gains.

title: Tarrytown, N.Y., Steeped in History
description: While Tarrytown and the construction of the new Tappan Zee Bridge are intertwined in the news these days, this village rich in Revolutionary War history and culturehas always been apopular spotin the Hudson Valley for its river views, its historic houses and its many activities.

title: Re-Re-Re-Reintroducing Hillary Clinton
description: Afew minutes before my meeting with Hillary Clinton on the Fourth of July, during my drive to the Mount Washington hotel in Bretton Woods, N.H., where she was staying, I passed a moose near the side of the road. At first I thought it was fake, one of those life-size cutouts that you sometimes see of big land mammals or, on occasion, famous politicians. But the specimen proved to be real and spectacular, antlers and all. I had never seen a moose before. It was thrilling, and I felt compelled to tell Clinton about it within seconds of my arrival. Oh, really? Wow, Clinton exclaimed with a big smile as she poured herself a cup of coffee. She might have been humoring me, but still seemed genuinely excited by my sighting and seized on it as a point of connection.

title: Review: Netflixs Tig Notaro Documentary, Tig, Recalls a Time of Uncomfortable Laughs
description: In early 2012, the comic Tig Notaro was hospitalized with a bacterial infection that nearly destroyed her digestive tract. The next week, her mother died.

title: Rare or Well-Done
description: Two poetries are now competing, Robert Lowell said in 1960, a cooked and a raw. The cooked, as Lowell saw it, was the university poetry of the midcentury, served on platters borrowed from Auden and sprinkled with croutons chipped from Eliots Four Quartets. This was a poetry of pedantry meant to be digested by a graduate seminar. Raw writing, on the other hand, involved blood-dripping gobbets of unseasoned experience offered up (again, as Lowell saw it) by the Beat poets for their coffeehouse constituency. This was crude stuff, a poetry of scandal.

title: Obamas Iran Deal Pits His Faith in Diplomacy Against Skepticism
description: WASHINGTON  On one thing, at least, both sides in the fierce debate over President Obamas nuclear accord with Iran agree: He will go down in history because of it. The disagreement relates to how. As a peacemaker or an appeaser?

title: An Oasis of Tranquillity, in Grand Central Terminal
description: Nothing has happened.

title: At Comic-Con, Bring Out Your Fantasy and Fuel the Culture
description: SAN DIEGO  A critic at Comic-Con International feels less like a fish out of water than like an excluded middleman. The local currency is not skepticism but enthusiasm, and though there is plenty of room in the cavernous halls of the convention center for disappointment and disagreement, irony is thoroughly banished. Thank you all for being so amazing, a woman said to a panel of television actors during a Q. and A. session, and the questions usually rise to about that level of toughness. The crowds gather under the signs of sincerity and celebration. Who needs critics to spoil the fun? Why would you walk through the Southern California summer sun in armor and body paint, or roast slowly on the grass while waiting to see a movie trailer, unless you really meant it?

title: As Jade Helm 15 Military Exercise Begins, Texans Keep Watch Just in Case
description: CHRISTOVAL, Tex.  Despite the Internet chatter about trains with shackles and Walmart stores being closed to be used as detention camps, this small West Texas town on Wednesday seemed to be surviving the start of Jade Helm 15, the military exercise that some people fear is actually a ruse for a federal takeover of the state.

title: Oskar Grning, Ex-SS Soldier at Auschwitz, Gets Four-Year Sentence
description: LNEBURG, Germany  In what is likely to be among the last chances to bring justice for the Holocaust, a German court convicted a 94-year-old former SS soldier of colluding in mass murder, and delivered an unstinting depiction both of the horrors of Auschwitz and the depths of German guilt.

title: Heading Ban for Youth Soccer Wont End Head Injuries
description: Would soccer be safer if young players were not allowed to head the ball?

title: Wednesdays Travel News: Wine in Oregon; Quicker Antarctica Tours
description: Our weekday morning digest that includes consumer news, deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Bring Your Own Bag, Treat Yourself to Ice Cream
description: When people bring reusable bags to the grocery store  and actually remember to take them in from the car  they are more likely to take another environmentally-friendly step and buy more organic products than they might otherwise have.

title: Ex-SS Soldier at Auschwitz Sentenced
description: A German court on Wednesday convicted Oskar Grning, a 94-year-old former SS soldier, of complicity in the murder of 300,000 Jews during World War II.

title: China Says Detained Tourists Were Watching Terrorist Propaganda
description: BEIJING  A group of foreign tourists, including a veteran anti-apartheid activist from South Africa, have been held in a northern Chinese jail since last Friday after the police accused them of watching terrorist propaganda videos in their hotel, according to family members and consular officials.

title: New York Today: Give Me a Sign
description: Good morning on this sleepy Wednesday.

title: Google Maps Changes Name on Disputed South China Sea Shoal
description: The shoal has no fresh water, human population or even any land to speak of  its highest point is less than six feet above water at high tide. But it has multiple claimants, and they have given it many names: Scarborough Shoal, Huangyan Island, Democracy Reef, Panatag Shoal and Bajo de Masinloc.

title: The Error in Theres Nothing More We Can Do
description: Theres nothing more we can do.

title: Today in Politics: After Obamas Long Battle for Iran Deal, the Tough Fight Begins
description: Good Wednesday morning from Washington, where Hillary Rodham Clinton and Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont had a pleasant meeting on Capitol Hill, and where everyone is talking about the Iran nuclear deal. Now that the marathon sessions with Iranian officials have proved fruitful, President Obama must pitch it all over again.

title: Alice Waterss Perfect Aioli
description: In Berkeley, where I currently live, Alice is a one-name celebrity, like Madonna. This is completely justifiable. In her lifetime, there has probably been no more important American in food than Alice Waters.

title: Can I Post a Photo of a Bad Driver?
description: During a torrential downpour one afternoon, my son and I were driving behind a dangerous driver who swerved very carelessly over the median and roadside lines several times. It was clear over the miles we were behind this person that he or she was distracted  and, I suspect, a teenager, based on the type of car. Before the driver turned off the road, I had my son take a photo, which I posted to a local forum on social media. The post said that this driver was dangerous and included the plate number. My goal was to alert others and hopefully let a parent know that his or her teenager was driving recklessly. A controversy erupted, split evenly between those for and against. The police wont do anything unless they see it happening, so I did not phone them. I could never live with myself if the driver went on to cause an accident and I did nothing. Was my action justified? NAME WITHHELD

title: On Staten Island, Savoring Flavors of Sri Lanka
description: Staten Island has historically been known for its Italian and Irish heritage, and more recently Russians and Liberians. However, in the last decade, the Sri Lankan population growth in the borough has created a Little Sri Lanka in the Tompkinsville and St. George neighborhoods.

title: Morning Agenda: I.M.F. Demand Threatens Greek Deal
description: I.M.F. DEMAND ENDANGERS GREEK DEAL | The International Monetary Fund threatened to withdraw support for the Greek bailout deal unless European leaders agree to substantial debt relief, Jack Ewing reports in the New York Times. This challenge to the new bailout agreement came on Tuesday, one day before Greeces Parliament was scheduled to vote on whether to accept the new bailout conditions. The I.M.F. is crucial to the bailout  it would provide funding and supervise Greeces compliance with terms.

title: Who Will Pay the Political Price for Affordable Housing?
description: For generations, working- and middle-class opponents of anti-discrimination laws have argued that more affluent whites support such laws without having to bear any of the costs.

title: Barclays Deputy Chairman Michael Rake Is Preparing to Depart
description: LONDON  Michael Rake, the Barclays deputy chairman and senior independent director, is preparing to leave the banks board this year and take over as chairman of Worldpay, a British payment processor.

title: When a Fictional Hero Falls
Greece, ItsBack to the Wall, Adopts Austerity Steps
description: ATHENS  Under threat from the nations creditors to move quickly or lose any chance of obtaining a desperately needed new bailout package, Greeces Parliament approved painful new austerity measures early Thursday, virtually guaranteeing that life would get harder for millions of Greeks.

title: Online Grocery Shopping: Easy for You, Maybe Not for the Earth
description: I stopped using AmazonFresh after we got a lemon  quite literally.

title: Varied Views (Dark, Light, in Between) of Earths Anthropocene Age
description: Last month, the Breakthrough Institute, a scrappy research organization focused on the interface of environment, energy, technology and economics, organized a spirited dialogue around its Ecomodernist Manifesto  an 18-author essayarguing that knowledge and technology, applied with wisdom, might allow for a good, or even great, Anthropocene.

title: Bank of America More Than Doubles Quarterly Profit to $5.3 Billion
description: Bank of America, seeking to get on with the business of banking after legal and mortgage troubles, said on Wednesday that its second-quarter profit more than doubled from a year ago, easily surpassing analysts expectations.

title: Banks in Europe to Face New Stress Tests in 2016
description: LONDON  European banks are set to face another round of stress tests next year as regulators examine the ability of the regions lenders to survive a financial crisis or severe economic downturn.

title: Sniping Intensifies Between Donald Trump and Jeb Bush
description: Donald J. Trump and former Gov. Jeb Bush have been deadlocked in recent polls and sniping between the two Republican presidential candidates is getting increasingly personal.

title: Janet Yellen Warns Congress Against Adding to Feds Oversight
description: WASHINGTON  Janet L. Yellen, the Federal Reserve chairwoman, told lawmakers on Wednesday that proposals to increase congressional oversight of the central bank could cause collateral damage to the broader economy.

title: The Pros and Cons of Coffee Loyalty Cards
description: Dear Diary:

title: From Yum to Yuck
description: Earlier this year, a video called Korean Girls Taste American Snacks appeared online. It featured the reactions of young women as they sampled popular American junk food like Pop-Tarts and smores-flavored Goldfish crackers. Most werent fans of the tastes and textures  one participant recoiled while eating the Goldfish, saying it was akin to eating belly fat. The video attracted millions of viewers, spawning dozens of news articles and enchanting the users of Reddit.

title: Lawyer Hails Landmark Auschwitz Ruling
description: Cornelius Nestler, a lawyer for the plaintiffs in the trial of a former SS soldier who worked at Auschwitz, said the case established that all those who helped run the camp were partly responsible.

title: El Chapo May Have Used Bird to Test Escape Tunnel Air
description: MEXICO CITY  To plot his escape from the most secure prison in Mexico, Joaqun Guzmn Loera, the drug kingpin known as El Chapo, is believed to have relied on countless little birds to whisper information into his ear and help whisk him to freedom.

description: GRAND ISLE, VT.
