description: Cosmic pieces inspired by the clean lines and optimistic design of Art Deco.

title: U.S. Program Will Connect Public Housing Residents to Web
description: The Obama administration on Wednesday announced a program to connect thousands of public housing residents across the nation to the Internet at low prices or free, part of a broader effort to close the so-called digital divide and help low-income Americans succeed in a technology-driven society.

title: Off-Duty New York Police Officer Robbed of Gun After Attack
description: Never losing your gun is among the most basic obligations of police work, impressed on officers in training and, if not learned there, then soon made clear in station house war stories about misplaced weapons.

title: Macedonias Prime Minister to Resign, Paving Way for April Elections
description: SKOPJE, Macedonia  Prime Minister Nikola Gruevski of Macedonia, reeling from a long-running scandal over the wiretapping of thousands of people, has agreed to step down by Jan. 15 to pave the way for new elections in the spring.

title: Angry Germans
description: Jacob Soll writes about the destructive anger he saw at a German conference on euro issues; I can second that observation.

title: Douglas Gordon Takes Ax to Wall of English Theater
description: LONDON  The artist Douglas Gordon, the director of Neck of the Woods at the Manchester International Festival, used an ax on Saturday night to hit a wall of the Home theater, where the play is running through Saturday.

title: Daily Report: Micron Technology Is Said to Be Takeover Target of Chinese Rival
description: It is either the first step in the largest takeover of an American company by a Chinese one or a new chapter in the emerging technological cold war between the two countries, Paul Mozur and Quentin Hardy report.

title: Real Estate in Morocco
description: A SEVEN-BEDROOM VILLA OUTSIDE MARRAKESH

title: Plane Lands on New Jersey Highway, and Drivers Capture the Moment
description: New Jersey weekend drivers had some unexpected traffic on Sunday.

title: An Unsustainable Position
description: Everyone is talking about the IMFs new update to its debt sustainability analysis, which says that Greeces attempt to surrender is doomed to failure without massive debt relief. Thats surely the right conclusion.

title: Scott Walker Using Harley-Davidson to Burnish Fighter Image
description: LAS VEGAS  He could have been any one of the roughly 400 people gathered here. Clad in a black Harley-Davidson shirt, slim jeans with a slight fray and bike-ready boots, the only aspect distinguishing Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin from the rest of the crowd was he was holding the microphone, and running for president.

title: The Iran Deal in 200 Words
description: A short overview of highlights from the Iran nuclear pact.

title: Mike Trouts Back-to-Back All-Star M.V.P. Awards Are a Baseball First
description: Mike Trout is making the All-Star Game look easy.

title: Wet Hot American Summer: First Day of Camp Continues the Comedy on Netflix
description: How famous did Wet Hot American Summer make Michael Showalter? Underwear famous.

title: Rolling Out Hillary Clinton, a Candidate Many Already Know
description: Mark Leibovich, the chief national correspondent for The New York Times Magazine, looks at the meticulously managed rollout of Hillary Rodham Clinton, a candidate whom voters think they know already.

title: Syriza Discusses Bailout Debate
description: Comments by members of Syriza on Wednesday morning indicated a split opinion within the party, as they arrived at the Greek parliament to debate a bailout.

title: An Artists Process: Niele Toroni
description: The Swiss painter explains his work as he installs his first institutional solo show in New York.

title: Cooling of Chinas Stock Market Dents Major Driver of Economic Growth
description: HONG KONG  As the usual drivers of economic growth have faltered in China, the stock market euphoria has helped pick up the slack, driven by a slate of businesses feeding off the frenzy.

title: Footage of the Moment El Chapo Escaped
description: Closed-circuit video shows the moment Joaqun Guzmn Loera, the drug lord known as El Chapo, disappeared from his cell. Additional video shows the tunnel he used to escape.

title: What Campaign Filings Wont Show: Super PACs Growing Sway
description: WASHINGTON  Presidential contenders provided a glimpse inside their campaign war chests on Wednesday, releasing financial statements that offered the first detailed accounting of how the candidates were raising and spending hundreds of millions of dollars in pursuit of elected office.

title: Public Urination in New York Becomes Test Case for Policing
description: Evidence pools beneath rows of pay phones, between parked cars, outside bars where last call has come and gone.

title: After Years of Drought, Wildfires Rage in California
description: How dry conditions, dead trees and a lengthy drought set the stage for one of the worst fire seasons on record.

title: Cicely Tyson and George Lucas Among Expanded Class of Kennedy Center Honorees
description: WASHINGTON  Cicely Tyson has always heeded her mothers words: Dont expect anything, and you wont be disappointed.

title: A Syrian Parody Features the Civil War, and Is Stalked by It
description: GAZIANTEP, Turkey  The worst day on the set of Banned in Syria, the actors agreed, was when the sniper struck in June. A location scout was preparing for the days filming when a single bullet killed him instantly.

title: In Santa Fe, City, Sky and History
description: At roughly 7,000 feet above sea level, Santa Fe, N.M., offers visitors a culturally diverse experience, steeped in the history of the American West. The relatively dry climate (with cool mornings and nights) and above-average air quality attract many outdoor enthusiasts to the area, which has nearly 1.5 million acres of national forest. With a compact downtown dominated by pueblo-style architecture and the Sangre de Cristo Mountains in the background, Santa Fe has preserved its inviting, small-town feel.

title: Investing in the Awesome, No Strings Attached
description: Chatter about New York these days is all about how the city has changed. It is full of banks, franchises and billionaires condo towers blocking the sun from Central Park. Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. compared one of its airports to something in a third world country. Its official ambassador is Taylor Swift. It is not a very awesome place to be.

title: Scott Walker, in South Carolina, Skirts Gun Control and Flag Issues
description: NORTH CHARLESTON, S.C.  Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin, in his first visit to South Carolina since nine people died in the church shootings, chose to address the massacre by praising the people of the Charleston region for their unity rather than discussing the gun control issues or the Confederate battle flag debate that arose afterward.

title: 1915: Roumania Remains Defiant
description: LONDON The Roumanian Government continues firmly to refuse the authorization asked by Berlin and Vienna for munitions for Turkey to pass across Roumanian territory and, as a consequence, extremely strained relations now exist between the Balkan State and the Central Empires. A Bucarest telegram says that the Austro-German Governments some days ago attempted to bully Roumania in the matter, and it was when the latter emphatically refused to be a party to the smuggling operations that Austria prohibited the export of sugar to Roumania, and consequently one thousand wagonloads of sugar were held up.  The New York Herald, European Edition, July 16, 1915

title: Just 10 Things From the New TenThousandThings Store
description: The designers behind TenThousandThings, David Rees and Ron Anderson, didnt just set up shop in a new address  moving out of a Meatpacking storefront and into a TriBeCa studio and showroom late last month  but also expanded their inventory to include more than just jewelry (despite their already cult following). Theyve stayed true to their all-natural-everything ethos, adding organic pieces for the home (wooden chairs, glass sculptures, clay pottery), indie fragrances for the body and various accessories, like leather goods, that embody the TenThousandThings spirit. Many were created in collaboration with longtime friends, and everything feels right at home in the earth-toned interiors. Here, a look at 10 items from the the brands new outpost, where the floor and shelves are made, naturally, of neatly stacked bricks.

title: Teenager Who Survived Plane Crash Leaves Hospital
description: A teenager who survived a plane crash in Washington State left the hospital on Tuesday as searchers located wreckage.

title: 1965: Wiretaps Curbed by President
description: WASHINGTON  President Johnson has issued specific orders to federal departments and agencies prohibiting wiretapping and the use of electronic snooping except when national security is involved and approval is given by the attorney general. The White House action was reported today [July 15] by press secretary Bill D. Moyers after newsmen asked about the presidents reaction to disclosures by a Senate subcommittee inquiry that Internal Revenue Service agents have used wiretaps in investigations.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, July 16, 1965

title: Daily Report: How to Reform Reddit
description: Imagine a sandwich shop called, I dont know, Breaddit, writes Farhad Manjoo, in this weeks State of the Art column.

title: Video Games Could Be Good For Your Mind
description: Video games have come a long way since the 90s, when they were routinely derided as at best a waste of time and at worst a cause of violence. Theyre increasingly accepted as art or at least as sophisticated entertainment, and now they may be poised to take on a new role: helping players understand and manage mental-health problems.

title: Indonesians Who Helped Make Documentaries Face Uncertainty
description: In the Oscar-nominated 2013 documentary The Act of Killing and now in a companion film, The Look of Silence, an especially chilling moment comes during the closing credits: In lieu of names, dozens of crew members are listed only as anonymous.

title: SONiC Festival Featuring Young Composers Is Returning to New York
description: The cool kids of contemporary music are coming back. The SONiC: Sounds of a New Century music festival is returning to New York in October with nine days of 21st-century music by more than 60 composers under the age of 40, the organizers announced Wednesday.

title: Annie Baker and Sam Gold: A Writer and Director Going Steady on the Job
description: After seven years together, plenty of couples might start to take each other  or at least the occasional orange slice  for granted. Not the director Sam Gold and the playwright Annie Baker.

title: Yellen on Interest Rate Increase
description: Janet L. Yellen, the chairwoman of the Federal Reserve, spoke to a Congressional panel on Wednesday about the effect of international events on interest rates.

title: Digital Social
description: A festival in Sweden where participants collaborate on the same giant network for 72 hours.

title: Military Exercises and Paranoia in West Texas: A Reporters Notebook
description: CHRISTOVAL, Tex.  A few years ago, a man named Crockett Keller wearing a wide-brimmed cowboy hat reached for the butt of his holstered gun as I approached him for an interview outside his cabin in a small Texas town. He had received death threats after he declared in an ad for one of his gun classes that he refused to teach liberals and Muslims. Once we sorted things out  I was looking to see if you were armed, he said  Mr. Keller put his weapon in his truck and agreed to talk.

title: WME-IMG to Acquire Wall Group, an Agency for Stylists
description: Since buying the IMG agency one and a half years ago, William Morris Endeavor has sought to round out its offerings and become the premier place for talent and events.

title: Skull Stolen From the Grave of F. W. Murnau, Director of Nosferatu
description: The skull of the film director F. W. Murnau  best known for Nosferatu, his 1922 Expressionist take on Bram Stokers Dracula  has been stolen from a cemetery outside of Berlin.

title: A Look at the Trailer for Joy, Starring Jennifer Lawrence
description: If the casting aint broke, dont fix it. That seems to be the philosophy for the director David O. Russell, who, for the third consecutive movie, works with Jennifer Lawrence, Robert De Niro and Bradley Cooper. The titles of those films are getting shorter each time as well, from Silver Linings Playbook to American Hustle to, now, Joy, starring Ms. Lawrence in a role inspired by the entrepreneur Joy Mangano, the creator of the Miracle Mop among other inventions.

title: Niele Toronis Five Decades of Interval Training
description: Switzerlands political reputation as a global mediator may be well earned, but when it comes to the nations gold mine of artists, a kind of creative isolationism is still in effect  rarely do they exhibit outside of Europe. But this summer, Niele Toroni, a Swiss painter born in Muralto (the Italian-speaking border region nestled in the high peaks of Locarno), lands at the Swiss Institute for his first-ever solo institutional show in New York. At 78, Toroni has formed an everlasting bond to repetition, and abides by a pact he made in 1967 proclaiming autonomy, or painting free of representation. His Travail-Peinture method never wavers: He makes strokes with a number 50 paintbrush at 30-centimeter intervals. Toroni is a marquee name in the French minimalist BMPT group (Daniel Buren, Olivier Mosset, Michel Parmentier, Toroni), and his faithfulness to conceptualism is particularly Zen. The painter, who has resided in Paris since 1959, is often asked why he is doing the same thing, explains Clment Delpine, the assistant curator of Swiss Institute, in a video premiering exclusively here at T. You have to understand that in his mind hes not doing the same thing. It varies in shape, width, varies depending the pressure. As the video slyly reveals, repetition neednt be redundant.

title: Labor Scrutiny for FIFA as a World Cup Rises in the Qatar Desert
description: When a law firm hired by Qatar, the site of the 2022 World Cup, issued a report last year urging reforms in the treatment of migrant construction workers there, human rights groups expected the tiny oil-rich Persian Gulf nation to respond quickly.

title: Tailoring Retirement Plans to Companies With a Handful of Workers
description: Will Hurley, a serial entrepreneur in Austin, Tex., wants to upend Wall Street. Hes starting with a decidedly unsexy part of the financial landscape: small-business retirement planning.

title: Excerpt: Southpaw
description: The boxing movie by Antoine Fuqua stars Jake Gyllenhaal as a prizefighter.

title: 36 Hours in Pittsburgh
description: Beyond Pittsburghs pretty downtown, transformation and momentum reign, with former industrial areas giving way to restaurants, shops and art venues.

title: 36 Hours in Pittsburgh
description: Sometimes gritty, always hilly, Steel Citys charms are often hidden below the surface. While the revitalization of downtown Pittsburgh has earned lots of attention, lately much of the action is found farther out, in once-overlooked neighborhoods like Lawrenceville and East Liberty. Here, old-school stalwarts mingle with artsy young people, helping to create a city that serves as a canvas for the kind of urban dreams that more crowded and expensive cities cant foster. Its a place where abandoned buildings reveal art museums in the making, where decaying industrial sites prove ripe for urban exploration, where residential streets hide kitchens turning out remarkably fresh, local food. Best of all, if you arent afraid of a few slopes, it can be easily explored by bike or even on foot.

title: Pet Care Can Help Children Manage Type 1 Diabetes
description: Older children with Type 1 diabetes often want to manage the illness themselves, but they can run into problems if they take multiple daily insulin injections but dont check their glucose and take insulin before each meal and before bed. Would it help, a Dallas physician wondered, if she gave patients a pet they had to feed twice a day  and they developed a habit of checking their glucose at the same time?

title: Dylan McDermott to Star in Baby Doll at the McCarter Theater
description: Dylan McDermott (The Practice) will star in a new stage adaptation of Baby Doll, based on the steamy 1956 film written by Tennessee Williams, at the McCarter Theater in Princeton this fall, the theater announced on Wednesday.

title: Memoirs
description: VISITING HOURSA Memoir of Friendship and MurderBy Amy Butcher249 pp. Blue Rider, $26.95.

title: Jeb Bushs Latest Attack on Obama Makes No Sense
description: It should be obvious by now that Republican candidates for public office are uneasy talking about race, ethnicity and gender. But even by that standard, Jeb Bush and Donald Trump plummeted to some pretty disturbing new lows this week.

title: Kids in the Kitchen: 1st Birthday Mini-Shortcakes With Berries
description: Ive always been fond of the saying Character is who you are in the dark, but after this last project, Id like to suggest an amendment: Character is who you are when baking with a 3-year-old.

title: Video Feature: Before the Music Festival, Know the Lineup and the Lyrics
description: Visitors to music festivals like Lollapalooza or Pitchfork often have three goals: enjoying great live music, having fun with friends and staying safe and secure. In a crowd of thousands, this can be difficult, but there are plenty of apps that can help.

title: History Lessons for Euro Debtors
description: When the financial crisis struck, there were widespread calls for new economic thinking; surely, many believed, the drastic events showed that there was something terribly flawed about economic analysis. In fact, however, the crisis itself, and even more the developments that followed, have been anything but puzzling. Again and again, things have played out pretty much the way you would have expected if you (a) understood and took seriously basic Hicks/Keynes macroeconomics and (b) paid attention to the relevant economic history.

title: From Apes to Elephants, Wolves to Whales, a Tour of Animals Minds and Emotions
description: Regular readers of Dot Earth will already know the work of Carl Safina, who for decades has meshed conservation science, campaigning and communication in a career devoted to building a durable relationship between human beings and the rest of Earths living things.

title: Secret Grand Jury Testimony From Ethel Rosenbergs Brother Is Released
description: More than six decades later, the prosecution of Ethel Rosenberg remains one of Americas most controversial criminal cases: Her conviction  and eventual execution  for joining in her husband Juliuss espionage conspiracy rested largely on trial testimony from her younger brother.

title: The Rapper Young Thug Is Arrested in Georgia
description: The Atlanta rapper Young Thug was arrested Wednesday morning by United States Marshals in Georgia for making terroristic threats against a mall security guard, Jim Joyner, a supervisor for the Marshals Southeast Regional Fugitive Task Force, said.

I hope my designs give a physical feeling of freedom. We have our own shop in Antwerp, and I notice that when people wear the clothes for the first time, they start moving and almost dancing in front of the mirror.

The show becomes the first of the young 2015-16 Broadway season to recoup, something only about 25 percent of shows on Broadway do each year.

title: Renewal Projects, Down to the Sidewalks, Highlight Social Divides
description: Like so many New York neighborhoods, Tompkinsville on Staten Island can almost seem like an island of its own. A half-mile walk from the St. George Ferry Terminal, the neighborhood has a park, which is hardly more than a traffic triangle with a few trees and a small fountain. Mothers with baby strollers and small children linger just outside it. Theres a Dominican restaurant on a corner and a taxi company up the block, next to a beauty supply shop with a box outside it containing plastic flowers, a makeshift memorial.

title: At Tour de France, Chris Froomes Dominance and Leaked Data Attract Scrutiny
description: PIERREFITTE-NESTALAS, France  The Tour de France has seen it before, and not all that long ago. A team leader and teammates rub out the rest of the field on a difficult mountain climb and yet seem remarkably fresh at the finish.

title: Plutos Portrait From New Horizons: Ice Mountains and No Craters
description: LAUREL, Md.  The first close-up image of Pluto has revealed mountains as tall as the Rockies, and an absence of craters  discoveries that, to their delight, baffled scientists working on NASAs New Horizons mission and provided punctuation for a journey nine and a half years in the making.

title: How Bush and Trump Are Opposites on Ideological Consistency
description: Candidates running for president spend a lot of their time soliciting donations. But they are also donors. Where they put their money is a pretty good litmus test of their ideology.

title: Eli Zabars Recipe for the Perfect Summer Sandwich Is Fast, Easy and Full of Mayonnaise
description: Eli Zabar likes to keep things local. I grew up on Riverside and 84th and I lived there when I first opened E.A.T, and I was frustrated by the commute from Riverside Drive and 84th to Madison Avenue and 81st. It was horrible, he says about the trek from the Upper West Side to his Upper East Side grocery and pastry shop. Now, the man whose celebrated meats, produce and highly coveted gift baskets have made him New Yorks most famous grocer lives on the Upper East Side, comfortably at the center of his culinary empire there  which includes a fine-dining restaurant, three markets, three delis, one wine shop and a recently opened wine bar, none of which function completely independent of the others. A bustling bakery across the street from the Vinegar Factory, his decommissioned factory-turned-grocery, churns out all the shops breads and pastries, while a greenhouse on the markets roof produces a bounty of fruits and vegetables to be sold downstairs. We had all these ovens and we had all this heat that we were sending out into the atmosphere. I thought if I could harness that heat, we would have solved one of the main costs of doing greenhouse growing in the winter, when there isnt any heat and you have to pay for it. We had all this free heat and we were going to use it, Zabar explains, of the gardens that sit on the roofs of his 91st Street bakeries.

title: Dashcam Video of Gardena Police Shooting
description: A federal judge ordered police in Gardena, Calif., to release video of a police shooting from 2013, ending a years-long legal battle.

title: Asked About Cosby Scandal, Obama Weighs In on a Sexual Violence Discussion
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Wednesday said bluntly that the actions described in accusations that the comedian Bill Cosby drugged women for sex would constitute nothing less than rape, and he said the country should have no tolerance for such actions.

title: Public School After-Party Hits All the High Notes
description: By some standards, the mark of a great party is the arrival of the police. And in that regard, Public Schools after-party Tuesday evening didnt disappoint: Two officers arrived at the Gilded Lily on West 15th Street around 1 a.m., only to leave minutes later after a cursory look around the room.

title: Review: The Soundless Gestures of Francisca Benitezs Dance on the High Line
description: The artist Francisca Benitez has a way of turning boundaries into art. In a 2008 work, Property Lines, New York, she invaded private spaces by making graphite rubbings of those demarcations on New York City sidewalks. The act of transferring the markings onto paper was something of a secret performance. More recently, she has explored boundaries in relationship to communication with a focus on sign language and gesture. Its helpful to know that Ms. Benitezs father is deaf, and while she didnt grow up signing, she has since immersed herself in that world.

description: The designers clothing looks right at home amid one of Romes most celebrated collections.

title: U.S. Steps Up Airstrikes in Afghanistan, Even Targeting ISIS
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The American military has intensified its airstrikes in Afghanistan in recent weeks, expanding them to include a bombing campaign against Islamic State militants who defeated the Taliban in fighting over a sliver of territory in the eastern part of the country.

title: I.M.F. Report Shines Uncomfortable Light on Greeces Financing Gap
description: FRANKFURT  The International Monetary Fund said what everyone knew but would not admit when it laid out in gory detail late Tuesday how Greece could be crushed by its staggering debt unless creditors agreed to lighten the load.

title: Black Dancers, White Ballets
description: MISTY COPELANDS elevation to principal dancer with American Ballet Theater is a tremendous accomplishment for her as a ballet dancer and as an African-American ballerina. Neither her talent nor her achievement should be underestimated. But even as she reaches the apex of her art in the role of Odette/Odile in Swan Lake, her promotion poses complicated questions about black artists in classical ballet.

description: Facing regulatory pressure related to its governance and lending practices, the subprime auto lender Santander Consumer USA has appointed Blythe Masters, a former longtime executive at JPMorgan Chase, its chairwoman.

description: CANTON, Ohio  Tim Walsh fancies himself as something of a football connoisseur. He regularly attends Giants home games, follows players with the eye of a scout and hopes to one day work in the sport.

title: Review: Max Beerbohm, The Prince of Minor Writers and a Gentle Contrarian
description: Its only in retrospect that we can recognize the 1980s as a great decade for contrarians and curmudgeons, for cheerful and sophisticated loathers of every sort of vanity and humbug.

description: Marlene Sanders, one of the first women to break into television journalism, where she compiled a stellar rsum as a reporter in the field and an Emmy-winning writer and producer of documentaries, died on Tuesday at a hospice in Manhattan. She was 84.

description: LEXINGTON, S.C.  Scott Walker worked off little sleep on Wednesday during the first barnstorming trip of his presidential campaign.

title: Searching for El Chapo From the Sports Desk
description: From my desk, I caught snippets of conversation that affect my new job as deputy sports editor in The Timess New York office. A columnist discussed plans for a future column with an editor; off in the distance, the name of retired baseball commissioner Bud Selig hung in the air after being uttered in another conservation. On a big-screen television tuned to ESPN, something about Dez Bryant and a contract flicked by.

description: After three months of hearing objections from commuters and transit advocates, the board of New Jersey Transit on Wednesday unanimously approved a fare increase and service changes just as they were proposed in April.

title: Review: Boston Symphony Chamber Players Balance Acoustics and Expression
description: Amplification at classical open-air concerts is never ideal. Usually the loss in sound quality is a compromise worth making to allow large audiences to take in a performance, especially in a setting like Central Park, filled as it is with auditory distractions. But on Tuesday, during the Boston Symphony Chamber Players debut performance at the Naumburg Orchestral Concerts, the sound  from where I was sitting  was sometimes so awkward it appeared comical.

There were also lots of drag queens and people with painted faces.

title: For Detroit Artists, Almost Anything Goes
description: DETROIT  The Chicago artist Nick Cave was playing Santa Claus. Mr. Cave, known for his Soundsuits, costume-like sculptures that blend movement and noise, had enormous boxes delivered last Saturday to local dancers, a choreographer and a D.J. rehearsing here. The surprise contents would inspire their dance performance a week later, as part of Here Hear, Mr. Caves four-month-long exhibition and free performance series throughout Detroit. Vibrant Soundsuits emerged from the boxes. Its wearable! cried Erika Stowall, a dancer.

title: Review: Charles Busch in That Girl/That Boy Shares Songs and Stories
description: Ranking high on the list of pleasures to be savored in Charles Buschs new show, That Girl/That Boy at 54 Below is an appearance of his greatest character, Miriam Passman, a diva in her own mind who teaches a master class in cabaret performance at the Learning Annex. Miriam is an archetypal scrounger in an echelon of cabaret peopled by outrageously self-important know-it-alls with voracious egos and meager talents. She sings the worst version youve ever heard of Heres to Life and grouses about getting in trouble with the Internal Revenue Service for claiming $40,000 in expenses for nightclub work that has earned her a tiny pittance.

title: Violent Protests in Greece Before Vote
description: Protesters clashed with the police in Athens as Greeces prime minister, Alexis Tsipras, considered elements of the new bailout deal.

title: A Window Into Pluto, and Hopes of Opening Other Doors
description: LAUREL, Md.  During the early hours of July 14, Eastern time, a series of radio waves went out from giant antennas in Canberra, Australia, and Goldstone, Calif., in the direction of a collection of stars known as the teaspoon in the constellation Sagittarius.

title: Jordan Spieth Plans to Win It, or Lose It, His Way
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland  The soundtrack to Jordan Spieths final practice round before Thursdays start of the British Open featured raindrops falling on umbrellas and cameras clicking on his backswing.

title: Mayor de Blasio, in Italy Next Week, Will Address a Vatican Conference
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio is Italy-bound for the second summer in a row.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Trainwreck
description: Judd Apatow narrates a sequence from the film Trainwreck, with Amy Schumer, Bill Hader and LeBron James.

title: Michael Bastians Preppy Bel Air Look
description: The notices were posted: This area is under surveillance.

title: A Gatekeeper of New Yorks Night Life
description: On a recent Wednesday evening outside Happy Ending, a sceney Lower East Side bar, a throng of fashionable would-be revelers awaited appraisal.

title: During Mens Fashion Week, Media Connections Play a Part
description: In the clubby, cavernous Polo Bar, Ralph Laurens power-broker brasserie on East 55th Street, Victor Cruz of the New York Giants was chatting about patella surgery with the stylish gadabout Nick Wooster, while David Lauren engaged David Granger, the editor of Esquire.

title: Finding Identity Through Cosplay in Russia
description: Russians who engage in cosplay  costume play  show little of the exuberance common at gatherings in Japan and the United States. Mariya Kozhanova, a photographer, sought out to find out why.

title: Hydrating Masks for Thirsty Hair
description: As with most of my beauty gripes, I blame age for the latest affront  hair as parched as a California farm. As we age, the amount of oil we produce decreases in the skin and hair, Kenneth Beer, a dermatologist in West Palm Beach, Fla., confirmed. This makes the hair shaft more brittle. Tack on visits to the saltwater pool at the McCarren Hotel in my neighborhood, and my hair was thirstier than a hangover. But hunting for hair masks proved bewildering. Some were so heavy I could have substituted mayonnaise for the same drizzled-oil effect. Others were so subtle that any daily conditioner would have done the job at half the price. But a select few impressed. Below, three deep-conditioning options that admirably tame and hydrate without weighing down strands.

title: Another Ebola Fatality Is Reported in Liberia
description: MONROVIA, Liberia  A young woman who died hours after being admitted to an Ebola treatment unit on Sunday became the second Ebola fatality since Liberia was declared free of the virus on May 9, government officials said on Wednesday.

title: Carl Icahn Calls BlackRock a Very Dangerous Company
description: It was billed as a debate over the merits of shareholder activism, with two lions of Wall Street facing off: Carl C. Icahn, the billionaire investor, and Laurence D. Fink, the chief executive of BlackRock, one of the worlds largest money management firms.

title: The Doting Dad Side of Dan Abrams
description: On a dazzling Friday afternoon, Everett Floyd Abrams, 3, was racing down the sidewalk in the West Village, neatly steering past pedestrians. Pedaling a pint-size bike with training wheels, his duckie-blond hair nearly hidden by his helmet, he was headed west on Grove Street.

title: Mens Fashion Underdogs of Los Angeles Try to Conquer New York With Rocks and Rope
description: Its probably fair to say that every designer showing at New York Fashion Week: Mens has a goal in mind. For Joe Sadler and Derek Buse, the guys behind CWST, a fledgling label started two years ago in Los Angeles that was presenting for the first time during a major mens fashion week, the goal was twofold: raise their profile, and rewire New Yorkers concept of West Coast style.

title: Man Charged With Murder of Two Sisters Missing Since 1975
description: It was one of those cases that haunts a community. Two sisters vanished while walking home from a mall in a quiet suburb of Washington, and a widespread search yielded nothing. As months turned to years, and then decades, hopes of learning what happened to the girls dwindled.

title: Duckie Brown and Michael Kors Make the Case for American Fashion at New York Mens Shows
description: It is too soon to trumpet another golden age, as journalists rushed to do the last time New York designers gathered under one tent for a week of shows and presentations dedicated to mens wear.

title: Fantasyland in the Flower District
description: Lasting Art carries items including fake flowers and champagne glasses, making it easy for customers to find nearly any quirky party items they might need in one place.

title: Robert Broadbent, Force Behind Rock Hall of Fame, Dies at 94
description: Robert Broadbent, a retailing executive who was instrumental in luring the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame to Cleveland in 1986 and then in raising the money to finance it, died on Monday in Vero Beach, Fla. He was 94.

title: How Yales Youngest Can Be Dinosaur Detectives
description: It was a good time to be a Dinosaur Detective at Yale Peabody Museums summer camp, in New Haven, this month for a couple of reasons.

title: Hillary Clinton Reports Raising Almost $47 Million for Primary Campaign
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton raised $46.7 million for her primary campaign, more than half of it from women, according to campaign officials and reports filed on Wednesday with the Federal Election Commission.

title: At Rogers Mansion, 367 Years of Southampton History in a House
description: Walls didnt talk to Emma Ballou, but maps, deeds and other documents did, as she researched the history of a single home in Southampton for If These Walls Could Talk: Meet the Families of the Rogers Mansion.

title: Matchy-Matchy Prints: Not Just for Sleeping
description: Plus: Denim cutoffs patched and trimmed with Hawaiian shirts; modern leather necklaces that give a nod to traditional craft and sporty lace-up espadrilles from Assembly.

title: A Review of My Name Is Asher Lev at Penguin Rep Theater in Stony Point
description: Among all the warm scenes around family dinner tables, there is one so familiar, classic and painful that it should have its own name. Theres the child bordering adulthood, expressing independent thinking that doesnt fit into his parents worldview, and the confused parents, quizzing their offspring on those ideas while fearing that their own values are being rejected. The love between the parties doesnt assuage the anguish; it heightens it.

title: Wyoming, Long on Pride but Short on People, Hopes to Lure Some Back
description: LARAMIE, Wyo.  Residents of Wyoming often brag about its status as the nations least populated state, boasting of its traffic-free highways and starry night sky  and taking pride in the fact that its cattle outnumber people by two to one.

title: Mexico Auctions Oil Blocks in Attempt to Increase Production
description: Nearly 80 years after kicking out foreign oil companies, Mexico reversed course on Wednesday, auctioning 14 exploration blocks in an effort to attract international energy giants and increase the countrys slumping production.

title: Pro-Israel Billionaires From Both Parties Aid Menendezs Defense Fund
description: Senator Robert Menendez of New Jersey, who was indicted in April on corruption charges, raised nearly $1.6 million for his legal defense fund in the second quarter of the year, including from some of the countrys most prominent pro-Israel billionaires, according to a disclosure report filed this week.

title: Syria Increasingly Disintegrates in Crucible of War
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Syria is falling apart, as warring groups carve it into de facto fiefs, and it is increasingly hard to see how its disintegration can be reversed.

title: White House LobbyingDemocrats and Independents to Support Iran Nuclear Deal
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Angus King, the prudent independent from Maine who caucuses with Democrats, flipped through his copy of the nuclear agreement with Iran on Wednesday, pointing to scores of notes in the page margins. The first step for me is to read the agreement word for word, Mr. King said, noting that he also would seek to consult with a former weapons inspector and a nuclear physicist or two.

title: Video of 2013 Police Shooting of Unarmed Man Renews Familiar Questions
description: A video of the fatal shooting by police officers of an unarmed man in Gardena, Calif., is once again raising unsettling questions about whether a police shooting was justified  and illustrating the power of video to dispute the accounts of officers.

title: Putin Flexes Diplomatic Muscle on Iran
description: MOSCOW  For a man often portrayed in the West as the swaggering bully leader of a renegade state, in need of containment and isolation, President Vladimir V. Putin has spent the last few days asserting himself at the center of international diplomacy  even receiving surprising credit from President Obama for his help in securing Tuesdays landmark accord to contain Irans nuclear program.

title: U.S. Offers to Help Israel Bolster Defenses, Yet Iran Nuclear Deal Leaves Ally Uneasy
description: WASHINGTON  When President Obama called Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Tuesday to discuss the nuclear deal with Iran, the American president offered the Israeli leader, who had just deemed the agreement a historic mistake, a consolation prize: a fattening of the already generous military aid package the United States gives Israel.

title: House Republicans to Investigate Planned Parenthood Over Fetal Tissue
description: WASHINGTON  House Republican leaders on Wednesday announced a congressional investigation of Planned Parenthood, a day after anti-abortion activists released a video of an unsuspecting official from the organization explaining how it provides fetal tissue to researchers.

title: Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei Urges Careful Scrutiny of Iran Deal
description: TEHRAN  In his first comments after the announcement of the nuclear accord between Iran and world powers, Irans supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, said Wednesday that the agreement needed careful scrutiny.

title: David M. Raup, Who Transformed Field of Paleontology, Dies at 82
description: David M. Raup, an iconoclastic and influential paleontologist who challenged accepted tenets with data-based analyses of fossil finds, died on July 9 in Sturgeon Bay, Wis. He was 82.

title: Viewing for All-Star Game Falls to Second-Lowest on Record
description: Viewership of baseballs All-Star Game on Tuesday night fell about 4 percent from last year to 10.91 million, the second-lowest on record, according to Nielsen.

title: Consensus Gives Security Council Momentum in Mideast, but Question Is How Much
description: UNITED NATIONS  Within days, diplomats here say, the Security Council is expected to unanimously endorse the agreement reached in Vienna that aims to contain Irans ability to build a nuclear bomb.

title: Lawrence Summers to Join Board of Hyperdata Start-Up
description: SAN FRANCISCO  An app called Premise is used to take pictures of food around the world, or to note the price of local goods.

title: Clearing Hurdles to Iran Nuclear Deal With Standoffs, Shouts and Compromise
description: VIENNA  One by one, the roadblocks to a nuclear accord between Iran and the United States had been painstakingly cleared. But as the negotiations went into their third week in the neoclassical Coburg Palace hotel this month, a major dispute lingered over whether a ban on Irans ability to purchase conventional weapons and missile technology would remain in place.

title: Authorities Shut Down Darkode, a Marketplace for Stolen Personal Data
description: A hacking forum used as a marketplace for stolen personal information and as a training ground for people intending to target more victims has been dismantled, federal authorities said on Wednesday. At least 70 members of the password-protected site, Darkode, were charged, arrested or searched in a crackdown that included law enforcement agencies in 20 nations, United States officials said.

title: Nuclear Pact Raises Kins Hopes of Freedom for 3 Held in Iran
description: Relatives of three Americans imprisoned in Iran expressed optimism on Wednesday that the nuclear agreement reached in Vienna had removed a significant political obstacle to the United States governments efforts to secure their release.

title: Kazakhstan Expands Visa-Free Travel Program
description: MOSCOW  Kazakhstan said on Wednesday that it would expand a visa-free travel program to 19 countries and principalities for visitors staying up to 15 days, after the success of a pilot project.

title: Pluto Flyby Stirs Emotions
description: Carter Emmart, director of astrovisualization at the American Museum of Natural History, shares his thoughts on the Pluto mission.

title: Sunil Gulati, U.S. Soccer Leader, Misses a Hearing and Draws Ire From Congress
description: WASHINGTON  Congress turned its attention to world soccer for several hours Wednesday afternoon as a Senate subcommittee convened a hearing to examine what the United States Soccer Federation had known about widespread corruption within FIFA, the sports global governing body.

title: Nonprofit Groups Sue Over Airport Body Scanners
description: A group of nonprofit organizations filed a lawsuit Wednesday seeking to force the Transportation Security Administration to complete the rulemaking process for the use of body scanners in airports, a step that would potentially allow citizens to challenge aspects of the rule in court. The agency failed to complete the rulemaking process before the equipment went into use in airports, and it retroactively submitted a proposal and asked for public comment four years ago after receiving an order from a judge. But the agency has yet to release a final rule.

title: Trainwreck (With Movie Trailer): Judd Apatow Narrates a Scene
description: How do you make a scene funny? Putting Amy Schumer and Bill Hader in front of the camera and Judd Apatow behind it is a good start.

title: Jason Pierre-Pauls Status Unclear as Giants Fail to Reach Deal
description: A little more than a week after Giants defensive end Jason Pierre-Paul injured his hand in a fireworks accident, which resulted in the amputation of his right index finger, the team let the deadline pass for signing Pierre-Paul to a long-term contract.

title: Tim Coppens: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: New York

title: Review: Scenes From an Execution Features Jan Maxwell as a Difficult Artist
description: Please, oh please, say that this isnt goodbye.

title: Spa Treatment
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  It took me a while to get this one, but when I did, I guffawed. But I had to finish the puzzle first, and then I had to stare at it for a while.

title: Closing Arguments Are Made in State Senator Sampsons Conspiracy Trial
description: State Senator John L. Sampson leaned on his longtime cronies when he was in legal trouble, but in the end he was undone by the friends sense that he had betrayed their loyalty to protect himself, prosecutors said in closing arguments on Wednesday at the legislators federal conspiracy trial.

title: Tunisia Hosts Security Meeting With Group of 7 to Discuss Terrorism Threat
description: TUNIS  The Tunisian government hosted a security meeting with officials from the Group of 7 industrialized nations on Wednesday to discuss ways that they can further help the country deal with the growing threat of terrorism, officials here said.

title: Alexandre Plokhov: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: New York

title: Bill Clinton Concedes His Crime Law Jailed Too Many for Too Long
description: WASHINGTON  Former President Bill Clinton on Wednesday disavowed part of the anti-crime legislation that he long considered one of his top accomplishments, concluding that it went too far in sending even minor criminals to prison for way too long.

title: Puerto Rico, Running Short of Cash, Misses a Debt Service Deadline
description: A financing unit of the Puerto Rican government on Wednesday failed to make a $93.7 million money transfer to service a debt, underscoring recent warnings by Gov. Alejandro Garca Padilla that the commonwealth, which is seeking a negotiated moratorium on its $72 billion of debt, is fast running out of cash.

title: Governor Cuomos Fund-Raising Is Not Affected by His Low Favorability Rating
description: Although Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos popularity may have slipped in recent months, and his political future is uncertain beyond 2018, his fund-raising abilities remain strong.

title: Hillary Clinton Lags in Engaging Grass-Roots Donors
description: Hillary Rodham Clintons presidential campaign has been slow to harness the fund-raising power of the Democratic Partys legions of grass-roots donors, according to reports filed Wednesday, a weakness that her campaign is racing to combat.

title: A Hotel Staffed by Robots in Japan
description: A new hotel in southwestern Japan forgoes human workers in favor of robots.

title: Tsipras Addresses Greek Parliament
description: Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras of Greece spoke to the legislative body after it had approved new austerity measures.

title: Former President George Bush Breaks Bone in Neck
description: Former President George H. W. Bush broke a bone in his neck in a fall at his home in Kennebunkport on Wednesday, his official spokesman said. Mr. Bush, the 41st president, was in stable condition, but he will have to wear a neck brace, the spokesman, Jim McGrath, said on Twitter. The former commander-in-chief has a form of Parkinsons disease and uses a wheelchair. In December, he was hospitalized in Houston for treatment of shortness of breath. He turned 91 last month and is the oldest living former president.

title: Billy Reid: Spring 2016 Menswear
description: New York

title: Ted Cruz Criticizes Republican Rivals on PBS
description: Senator Ted Cruz of Texas has been an outspoken opponent of what he calls Republican-on-Republican violence, and has promised not to engage in the medias game of throwing rocks and attacking other Republicans.

title: Nostalgic, Carefree Pictures of the Design Collective As Four
description: In this weekly series, Ts photo editors share the most compelling visual projects theyve discovered.

title: The Nonsensical Allure of Rainbow-Hued Hair
description: To keep hair the color of peonies or larkspur requires constant care and commitment: dyeing, then re-dyeing, then re-dyeing, like Sisyphus as drawn by Lisa Frank. Pastels fade much faster than darker shades, sometimes in two or three washes. And yet the rage for hair that glistens like sugary cake-icing has never been more intense. Locks of celestial rose, aquamarine and lavender drifted down the fall 2015 runways. At the Gucci show last spring, the model Marjan Jonkmans platinum mop was dip-dyed a cherry-blossom hue, and paired with a baroque floral suit. At Louis Vuitton, Fernanda Hin Lin Ly walked out in a huge fluffy white coat and tresses the color of bubble gum, looking like a severe interpretation of Princess Lolly of Candyland. The princesses of pop musicKaty Perry, Miley Cyrus, Rita Ora, Demi Lovatohave all experimented with neon lavender, sea-foam green and soft periwinkle. Perry might trace her love of the palette to the artist and confectioner Will Cotton, who depicted the singer lounging on a bed of pale pink cotton-candy clouds in the cover art for her 2010 album Teenage Dream.

title: Hillary Clintons Hillblazers List Is a Whos Who of Big Donors
description: While Hillary Rodham Clinton has called for reining in a dysfunctional campaign finance system, she has nonetheless shown a time-tested ability to attract money from rich and powerful supporters around the country.

title: EBay Is Said to Be Near Sale of Enterprise Unit for $900 Million
description: SAN FRANCISCO  EBay is close to selling its Enterprise unit for roughly $900 million to a consortium led by the private equity firm Permira, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.

title: Community Board Approves Redevelopment Plan for Brooklyn Public Library Branch
description: A controversial proposed redevelopment plan for the Brooklyn Public Librarys Brooklyn Heights branch, which includes the construction of affordable housing, received a community boards approval, with provisions, at a heated meeting on Wednesday evening.

title: First Draft Focus: Protesters Greet Obama With Confederate Flags
Whats on TV Thursday
description: 8 P.M. (Nickelodeon) KIDS CHOICE SPORTS 2015 Russell Wilson, the Seattle Seahawks quarterback, hosts this awards ceremony, broadcast from Pauley Pavilion at the University of California, Los Angeles, and honoring young viewers favorite sports stars. Serena Williams, Stephen Curry, LeBron James, Carmelo Anthony, Marshawn Lynch, J. J. Watt, Danica Patrick, Dale Earnhardt Jr., Lindsey Vonn, Mike Trout and Gabby Douglas are nominated in categories including best male and female athletes, clutch player of the year, the dont-try-this-at-home award, biggest cannon and sickest moves. Derek Jeter will be honored with the Legend Award. And three kids will be given a chance to win $50,000 each during a Triple Shot Challenge.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I dont think any one of us could have imagined that this could have been a better toy store.

title: Corrections: July 16, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Japan Moves to Allow Military Combat for First Time in 70 Years
description: TOKYO  Defying broad public opposition and large demonstrations, Prime Minister Shinzo Abe won a crucial vote in Parliament on Thursday for legislation that would give Japans military limited powers to fight in foreign conflicts for the first time since World War II.

title: Finding Identity Through Cosplay in Russia
description: Thousands of people shouldered into the San Diego Convention Center last week, often sporting the outlandish costumes that are the hallmark of the hobby known as cosplay, short for costume play. A California weekend spent indulging a love for anime, Dr. Who, Star Wars and the like  it was a chance to see and be seen. In short, a frolic.

title: Summer Jobs That Enrich Teenagers
description: To the Editor:

title: The 77 Blackout in New York
description: To the Editor:

title: Sovereignty for Tibet
description: To the Editor:

title: Dalai Lama Gets Mischievous
description: The Dalai Lama, who may be the only octogenarian spiritual leader with a profoundly mischievous streak, has a suggestion for Chinas Communist leaders: Take up reincarnation.

title: Britains Military and ISIS
description: To the Editor:

title: Debtors Unfairly Excluded From Protection
description: The large debt loads that weigh heavily on Americans and the American economy  in mortgages, student loans, and most recently, the bonds of Puerto Rico  have one thing in common: They cannot be restructured in bankruptcy. Creditors cannot be compelled by the court to reduce such debts, leaving insolvent borrowers at the mercy of lenders.

title: Atticus Finch Offers a Lesson in Southern Politics
description: Atlanta  GO SET A WATCHMAN, released to much fanfare this week, may have been an apprentice work for Harper Lees classic 1960 novel, To Kill a Mockingbird, but, in a way, the earlier book seems more sophisticated. It offers a subtle and surprising exploration of racial politics, and not merely because of the racist comments of Atticus Finch, one of the most beloved figures in American literature.

title: What Marriage Equality Means for Transgender Rights
description: IN 1996, a San Antonio window washer named Jonathan Littleton died at 35 of a misdiagnosed blood clot. His wife, Christie Lee Littleton, filed a medical malpractice suit under a statute accessible only to surviving spouses.

title: Trump Builds One Brand and Damages Another
description: Donald Trump is exactly what the Republican Party deserves.

title: Rendezvous With Pluto
description: There was something wonderfully childlike in the delight of scientists and the public at the rendezvous of the New Horizons spacecraft with that most distant and mysterious of the planets, Pluto, even if it was reclassified a few years ago as merely a dwarf planet. But there was nothing childish in the extraordinary science and engineering required to send half a ton of highly sophisticated instruments hurtling through space at speeds of up to 47,000 miles an hour for three billion miles.

title: With Washingtons Complicity, Egypt Cracks Down on Critics
description: For decades, Egypts authoritarian leaders used the Emergency Law to oppress and intimidate government critics under the guise of national security. In coming weeks, officials are expected to pass a new, similarly repressive law that would give authorities even more sweeping powers to continue cracking down on government critics and censor the press.

title: Caitlyn Jenner Says Shell Push for Acceptance of Transgender People
description: Caitlyn Jenner said on Wednesday that she planned to use the attention that had come with her public transition to being a woman to push for acceptance of transgender people across the world.

title: E.U. Opens Antitrust Investigations Into Qualcomm
description: The European Commission announced two antitrust investigations on Thursday into the chip maker Qualcomm, the latest in a number of recent competition inquiries aimed at United States technology giants.

title: A Ride Home From Prison
description: This short Op-Doc documentary profiles a former prisoner who guides men released from life sentences in California through their first hours of freedom.

title: A Ride Home From Prison
description: When California voters amended the states harsh three-strikes law in 2012, they ensured that nonviolent third offenses would no longer lead to life sentences. Significantly, they made about 3,000 people serving those life sentences suddenly eligible for release. Since then, more than 2,000 have emerged after years in prison into worlds dramatically transformed from those they left behind.

title: A Jackson Heights Apartment Courtesy of a Kind Aunt
description: Two years ago, after graduating from college, Diana Regal poked around on Craigslist looking for a good place in which to live. She considered Brooklyn, where some of her friends had moved. But when she checked out a roommate share in Astoria, Queens, she fell in love with the lively neighborhood, with its interesting street life and cornucopia of ethnic food.

title: Review: Ant-Man, With Paul Rudd, Adds to a Superhero Infestation
description: I wish I could assure you that no insects were harmed in the writing of this review, but that would be a lie.

title: You Just Got Out of Prison. Now What?
description: Two men were sitting in a parked car, waiting to pick someone up. Carlos Cervantes was in the drivers seat. He was 30, with glassy green eyes  quiet by nature, but with a loaded, restrained intensity about him. He had picked up Roby So at home in Los Angeles around 3 oclock that morning, and theyd made it here, to this empty parking lot in front of the Richard J. Donovan Correctional Facility, on the outskirts of San Diego, just after 6. Now, the sun was rising over the bare, brown mountains in the windshield. A hummingbird zipped around an air-conditioning unit outside. Already, theyd been waiting close to an hour.

title: Caitlyn Jenner Accepts Courage Award
description: Caitlyn Jenner accepted the Arthur Ashe Courage Award at the ESPYs on Wednesday night while urging acceptance for others who are transgender.

title: European Finance Officials Agree in Principle on New Greek Bailout
description: BRUSSELS  European finance officials pledged support and money for Greece on Thursday, even as the prospects of reaching a final bailout deal were clouded by political uncertainty in Athens and German doubts about the need to preserve Greek membership in the eurozone.

title: Getting the Diagnosis Right
description: Recently I had one of those bursting-at-the-seams types of days in the clinic. Every scheduled patient showed up, plus a few extras. Everybody seemed to have burning concerns that needed immediate attention. One patient had newly diagnosed thyroid disease, but the medication was making her feel worse not better. Another was having strange twinges in his lower abdomen. One woman had been having muscle aches in her arms for the past month, and now had the same aches in her legs. Another patient was experiencing a drilling-like pain in his lower back that spread up to his neck and scalp. One man had a cough that just wouldnt clear up. A woman was concerned because the soles of her feet felt like they were on fire. Another patient said she simply had no energy and could hardly get through her day.

title: Obama, in Oklahoma, Takes Reform Message to the Prison Cell Block
description: EL RENO, Okla.  They opened the door to Cell 123, and President Obama stared inside. In the space of 9 feet by 10 feet, he saw three bunks, a toilet with no seat, a night table with books, a small sink, prison clothes on a hook, some metal cabinets and the life he might have had.

title: Are Ideals of Canine Beauty Making Our Dogs Fat?
description: Obesity has become so common in canines that even show dogs are overweight.

title: Thursdays Travel News: New Hotels; Whiskey Tours in Colorado
description: Our weekday morning digest that includes consumer news, deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.

title: In Estonia, a Hotel Keeps Its Promise
description: It was late afternoon and the colors of Muhu Island in Estonia were at their most kinetic: Neon-green mosses clinging to tawny cottages seemed aglow against the deepening blue sky. Its an enchanting hour, one that would be best spent inhaling the crisp late-summer air and watching the sleepy island inch languorously from day into night. But I hadnt figured that out yet. I was determined to find something to do. Which explains how I found myself at an accordion concert.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: A Social Parasites Sophisticated Mimicry
description: An ant colony is an insect fortress: When enemies invade, soldier ants quickly detect the incursion and rip their foes apart with their oversize mandibles.

title: New York Today: Rethinking a Messy Minor Offense
description: Good morning on this sun-drenched Thursday.

title: WikiLeaks Shows a Saudi Obsession With Iran
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  For decades, Saudi Arabia has poured billions of its oil dollars into sympathetic Islamic organizations around the world, quietly practicing checkbook diplomacy to advance its agenda.

title: The Door to Iran Opens
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel calls it a historic mistake that permits Iran a sure path to nuclear weapons. A minister in his government, unable to resist outrageous hyperbole, calls it one of the darkest days in world history. Jeb Bush, doing the tired Chamberlain-Obama number, dismisses it as appeasement.

title: The Art of Changing a City
description: BOGOT, Colombia  Between 1995 and 2003, I served two terms as mayor of Bogot. Like most cities in the world, Colombias capital had a great many problems that needed fixing and few people believed they could be fixed.

title: Teens Hooked on Screens
Hotel Review: Les Sources de Caudalie in Bordeaux
description: From 280 euros, $300 at $1.07 to the euro.

title: Restaurant Report: Stateside in Seattle
description: After working with Daniel Boulud in New York and Jean-Georges Vongerichten in New York, Paris and Shanghai, Eric Johnson moved to Seattle to be near family, enjoy the outdoors and start his own restaurant. The result is Stateside, which opened in December in a former parking garage, where the chef is bringing together those culinary experiences with his travels in Asia by artfully recreating French-Vietnamese dishes.

title: Sue Grafton: By the Book
description: The author of the Kinsey Millhone mysteries, including, most recently, X, has trouble passing up books about Anne Boleyn: I keep hoping for a different ending. So far, no luck.

title: Philip Zimbardo Thinks We All Can Be Evil
description: In 1971, you conducted a psychological experiment at Stanford. You split your 21 student-subjects into guards and inmates, with you as the superintendent, and had them run a prison out of a basement. You had to abandon the experiment after six days, because it spiraled violently out of control. Now, 44 years later, there is a movie about it. Do you like it? Im delighted with it. It conveys for the first time to a general public what this kind of experiment is like. There is another movie called Experimenter, about Stanley Milgrams research, which also premiered at Sundance, and the second half is confusing. At one point, Milgram walks out of his lab, and behind him is a huge elephant. I saw the director at Sundance, and I said, Why did you have an elephant? He said, People like elephants.

title: Power in Numbers
description: The best historical analogy for the hackathon might be the 18th-century custom of the barn-raising. Despite the technological abyss separating the two rituals, they are structurally akin: Each is a social observance in which a lot of people focus their collective will on an undertaking too great for any individual to carry out alone. Though the informal practice of hackathons arose slightly earlier, the first use of the portmanteau name dates to 1999, when Sun Microsystems and the freeware operating system OpenBSD each staged events under that banner to write very specialized pieces of software very quickly.

title: Thinking About Taking Out a Mortgage? Dont Obsess Over the Fed
description: When people learn that I have spent many years writing about the Federal Reserve, there is almost always one question I get: Are mortgage rates going up or down?

title: Epiphanny Princes Arrival Raises Libertys Hopes of Returning to W.N.B.A. Playoffs
description: Epiphanny Prince had just finished her second practice with the Liberty this month when she griped to a staff member.

title: Today in Politics: A Close Look at Donors, War Chests and Burn Rates
description: Good Thursday morning from Washington, where both the Obama administration and Republicans are charting their next moves on the Iran nuclear deal. But the focus now shifts back to the campaign trail, where the deadline to file financial disclosure forms offered a glimpse into the money coming in and going out of the campaigns.

title: Mind and Body, Wracked
description: LONDON  Rory Kinnear has shown such a sustained gift over time for inhabiting the life of the mind that it comes as something of a surprise to find that his new play, The Trial, gives this terrific actor a bodily workout as well.

title: Morning Agenda: Greece Adopts Austerity
description: GREECE ADOPTS AUSTERITY | Life is likely to get tougher for millions of Greeks. With the threat of losing the bailout package, Greeces Parliament approved painful new austerity measures early on Thursday morning, Suzanne Daley and James Kanter report in the New York Times.

title: Pushing Forward an Abstract Art Drive That Began a Century Ago
description: Zaha Hadid was born in Baghdad in 1950 and has become one of the worlds most renowned avant-garde architects from her studio in London. But she says that another city first ignited her creativity: St. Petersburg.

title: Germanys Tone Grows Sharper in Greek Debt Crisis
description: BERLIN  Despite bitter opposition in many quarters to the austerity-first policies Germany has imposed on Europes poorer nations, Chancellor Angela Merkels government has hung on to its role as champion of integration on the Continent through deft use of diplomacy and the countrys economic clout.

title: Scott Walker 2012 Campaign Inquiry Ended by Wisconsin Court
description: CHICAGO  The Wisconsin Supreme Court on Thursday ordered an end to an investigation into whether Gov. Scott Walkers recall campaign in 2012 illegally coordinated with conservative groups, removing a potentially thorny issue from his budding run for the Republican presidential nomination.

title: Barclays Deputy Chairman to Stay Until New C.E.O. Is in Place
description: LONDON  Barclays moved on Thursday to clarify how long Michael Rake, its deputy chairman and senior independent director, would continue to serve on its board.

title: Emmy Nominations 2015
The Most-Viewed Fitting Room in China
description: Read in Chinese |

title: Blackstones Profit Slumps in Quarter
description: After a series of blockbuster quarters, profit at the Blackstone Group has slowed. But even in a quarter with weaker results, Wall Streets biggest private equity company is larger than ever as the total money it manages has swelled to $333 billion.

title: British Open 2015: Jordan Spieth and Dustin Johnson Bring the Old Course to Its Knees
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland

title: In Versace, Caitlyn Jenner Makes a Statement at the ESPYs
description: If her first red-carpet appearance (at the ESPY Awards on Wednesday night) is anything to go by, the brouhaha surrounding Caitlyn Jenners appearance in a bustier on the cover of Vanity Fair, which produced a multitude of editorials about what being a woman looks like, has not swayed her style choices.

title: Looking for Mr. Fusion
description: Dear Diary:

title: Litigation Costs Drag Down Goldman Sachss Earnings
description: Goldman Sachs said on Thursday that its profit was reduced nearly by half in the second quarter, as it wrestled with volatile markets and had to put aside more money to deal with investigations stemming from the financial crisis.

title: EBay Reports Sale of Enterprise Unit as Earnings Beat Estimates
description: EBay is sailing into the split of its two businesses  PayPal payments and its online marketplace  with a reassuring show of strength as its second-quarter financial performance surpassed Wall Street forecasts.

title: PartnerRe and Axis Capital Unveil Sweetened Terms for Merger
description: LONDON  The Bermuda insurance companies PartnerRe and Axis Capital Holdings said on Thursday that they had agreed to sweeten the terms of their proposed merger, including increasing the size of a special dividend payable to PartnerRe shareholders.

title: Citigroup Earnings Climb 18 Percent in Quarter
description: Citigroup, the banking behemoth plagued by years of uneven performance and regulatory issues, exceeded Wall Streets expectations for a second consecutive quarter.

title: Cara Delevingne, Ready to Conquer Hollywood, Immerses Herself in Paper Towns
description: There was a point in my life where I literally lived through a camera.

title: Benefits, and Some Resistance, as New York Cracks Down on Nail Salon Abuses
description: At the Westchester County nail salon where Anna Patricia Moreno works, the owner has started allowing manicurists to take lunch breaks.

title: Magna International to Buy Getrag of Germany for $1.9 Billion
description: LONDON  The Canadian auto parts maker Magna International said on Thursday that it had agreed to acquire one of the worlds largest suppliers of automotive transmissions, the Getrag Group, for 1.75 billion euros, or about $1.9 billion.

title: Understanding Pluto Through Paint
description: Tuesday was an exciting day for science, as the New Horizons spacecraftcollected detailed images of Pluto as well as data on its surface temperature and composition. But was also a big day for art.

title: F.B.I. Investigating Police Accounts of Black Womans Death in Custody
description: Days after a black woman from suburban Chicago was found dead in a Texas jail cell, her friends and family are contesting police statements that she killed herself.

title: Scott Walker 2012 Campaign Inquiry Ended by Wisconsin Court
description: The Timess Monica Davey reports that the Wisconsin Supreme Court has just ruled that a criminal investigation into coordination between conservative groups and Gov. Scott Walkers 2012 campaign cannot continue.

title: 1940: Rome Reports Bombing Haifa
description: ROME  Italian bombers have scored direct hits on oil refineries and storage tanks in Haifa, Palestine, starting great fires which could be seen clearly from a distance of 120 miles by the airmen as they were on their way back safely to their bases, a communique announced today. This is interpreted here as a major military triumph in the African war. The nations press gives prominence today to an article printed in New York in which Admiral Yates Stirling jr, U.S.N. (retired), said that all the high cards in the Mediterranean are in the hands of Italian air power.  New York Herald Tribune, July 17, 1940

title: Manual Cinema Presents the Semi-Gothic Ada/Ava
description: Manual Cinema is all about revealing the work that goes into its art, but it hasnt always been that way. For years, this Chicago shadow-puppetry collective performed backlit, hidden from the audience behind a single screen, creating shows that involved live actors and musicians but had the look of movies made by hand.

title: Driven | 2016 Volvo XC90 Inscription
description: The XC90 may cause owners of American, German and Japanese brands to renounce their automotive citizenship and go Swedish.

title: Video Review: Volvo Finally Updates the XC90 and Creates a Swedish Gem
description: AT the turn of the century, Volvo determined it was no longer hip to be square and began designing vehicles with  gasp!  curves in the sheet metal. Swoopy, spacious and safe for seven, the first-generation XC90 crossover quickly became a favorite with families north of the middle-class income boundary.

title: Candidates Will Hail a Ride, but Not Necessarily the Uber Labor Model
description: SAN FRANCISCO  On the presidential campaign trail, Jeb Bush proclaims that Uber fulfills the American dream of self-sufficiency, while Hillary Rodham Clinton suggests Uber raises hard questions about the financial security of a modern job. Rand Paul extols Uber for revealing the obsolescence of government regulation, while Martin OMalley argues that it exposes the need for new labor laws.

title: George W. Bush Helped Put U.S. on Path to Talks With Iran
description: Republicans have been criticizing President Obamas nuclear deal with Iran, but those with longer memories recall that it was one of their own who set the United States on the path toward negotiations.

title: An Artists Life in Cannes
description: Charlotte di Carcaci on the years Picasso spent in the Mediterranean.

title: Review: Trainwreck Delivers the Full Amy Schumer Experience
description: Amy Schumer is my kind of superhero  she stops haters dead. As fans of her Comedy Central show, Inside Amy Schumer, know, theres almost nothing that anyone can say about women, her included, that she hasnt already said herself. Her powers of deflection are the perfect approach in a neofeminist moment in which women are calling out sexists, sometimes against vicious pushback. Think that shes not thin enough or pretty enough? She intercepts hateful slurs like those and turns them into ferocious comedy gold that exposes chauvinism as the absurdity it is. She cant be stereotyped away as a sourpuss who just needs to chill out, lie back and smile. Shes already smiling, and shes killing it, joke after joke.

title: TLC Cancels Duggar Reality Series 19 Kids and Counting
description: TLC said on Thursday that it was canceling its reality series 19 Kids and Counting. The decision arrives several weeks after a magazine report revealed that one of the stars of the show had been investigated on suspicion of molesting underage girls. The shows cancellation was first reported by The Associated Press, and the announcement was made less than two hours before the unveiling of the nominations for Emmy Awards, an event that will dominate the attention of the television industry for the rest of the day.

title: ESPY Awards Red Carpet
description: Current athletes like Stephen Curry and members of the U.S. womens soccer team, and former athletes like Derek Jeter and Caitlyn Jenner were honored Wednesday.

title: Verbatim: John McCain Says Donald Trump Has Fired up the Crazies
description: Senator John McCain, Republican of Arizona, expressing fear in an interview with The New Yorker that Donald J. Trump has activated extreme elements in the Republican Party with his inflammatory remarks about Mexican immigrants. Mr. McCain has been a longtime proponent of immigration reform.

title: What to Do This Weekend
description: Need help finding something to do?

title: Mourning and Seeking Answers Where Malaysia Airlines Jet Fell to Earth
description: ROZSYPNE, Ukraine  A year ago, in this village deep in the sunflower-field outback of eastern Ukraine, bodies fell from the sky, and residents are still grappling to make sense of what happened.

title: Mitch McConnell Casts Doubt on Houses Plan for Transportation Bill
description: WASHINGTON  More than 30 times over the past six years, Congress has mustered the money only for short-term extensions of the federal highway trust fund, the equivalent of repeatedly putting $5 of gas in an empty tank.

title: Extraordinary Creatures, and Some Elusive Ones, at Festival dAix-en-Provence
description: AIX-EN-PROVENCE, France  It took just a matter of minutes and a staircase or two late Tuesday night to go from artistic austerity to sensory overload.

title: E.C.B. Head Details Increased Greek Loan
description: Mario Draghi, the president of the European Central Bank, announced on Thursday that emergency loans to Greece have been increased by 900 million euros.

title: Obama Fund-Raisers Hold Brooklyn Event for Hillary Clinton
description: A group of former fund-raisers and aides to President Obama  including his former advisers Julianna Smoot and Alyssa Mastromonaco  will host a fund-raiser for Hillary Rodham Clintons campaign this month, according to an invitation for the event.

title: Daily Report: E.U. Investigates Qualcomm for Antitrust Violations
description: The European Commission announced two antitrust investigations on Thursday into the chip maker Qualcomm, the latest in a number of recent competition inquiries that have focused on United States technology giants, Mark Scott writes.

title: City Hall and Uber Clash in Struggle Over New York Streets
description: For months, the clash has seemed inevitable: the professed disrupters of municipal transportation policy and the chief executive of the countrys largest city government, tussling over who should rule the roads of New York City.

title: 1965: Spacecraft Relays First Images of Mars
description: PASADENA, Calif.  Americas Mariner-4 spacecraft has discovered that the Mars atmospheric blanket is a mere whisp of gas eight times thinner than some scientists had predicted.

title: Protests Against Japans Security Bill
description: Demonstrators spoke out against legislation that could send Japanese troops to fight abroad for the first time since World War II, but Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said the bill was necessary.

title: A Long Hardwood Journey
description: You know that were not running the correct out-of-bounds play, right? That our defensive press is a mess? That were close to another loss?

title: Scott Walker Sees the South as Pivotal to the Nomination
description: ATLANTA  Georgia may not be one of the all-important first four states to vote in the 2016 presidential nominating process starting in February, but Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin, a Republican candidate, made a quick pit stop here on Wednesday night to say hell compete hard in the March 1 primaries in the state and several others.

title: The Secret to a Good Scream
description: Screams are unmistakable, universally recognizable as distress calls. A new study has found that all human screams are modulated in a particular way.

title: Dylann Roofs Past Reveals Trouble at Home and School
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  The young man accused of the terrible crime was a bug-eyed boy with a bowl haircut who came from a broken home and attended at least seven schools in nine years. Many afternoons, he would sit silently on the curb in front of his roomy yard and, when he tired of it, move to a different curb. He helped neighbors with their yard work, but they still found him strange.

title: Lives Grow Longer, and Health Cares Challenges Change
description: If youre living with multiple ailments, youre not alone.

title: Egypt ISIS Affiliate Claims Destruction of Naval Vessel
description: CAIRO  A militant group affiliated with the Islamic State said it destroyed an Egyptian naval vessel on Thursday, posting photographs on social media of a missile exploding in a ball of fire as it slammed into the vessel.

title: Emmy Award Nominations Announced
description: The 67th annual Primetime Emmy Awards nominations were announced on Thursday by the actress Uzo Aduba and the television presenter Cat Deeley.

title: A Rally for Bernie Sanders May Wind Up in Your Living Room
description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont is coming soon to a house party near you, albeit digitally.

title: The Whitney Embraces Dancenoise, a Brash 80s Performance Duo
description: Combat boots and nudity, fake blood and a barrage of props. Dancenoise was feminism and showbiz rolled into one.

title: Living With Cancer: Curses and Blessings
description: Like someone with bipolar disorder, I see-saw between irritability and elation, depression and euphoria. As a cancer patient, I cycle through curses and blessings at a hectic rate.

title: Review: The Wild Party, With Sutton Foster as a Louche Jazz Baby
