description: PAUL MATUSKA is the closest thing the American West has to a water cop, and his beat includes Needles, Calif., a beleaguered desert town midway between Flagstaff, Ariz., and Los Angeles.

title: Deleting Facebook Comments in Mobile Apps
Stuff We Liked
description: This article was initially published as a letter to subscribers of The Upshots newsletter. You can sign up for the email here to get this and all of the best of The Upshot.

title: U.S. Sought El Chapo Extradition Before Escape
description: MEXICO CITY  Less than three weeks before Joaqun Guzmn Loera, the infamous drug kingpin known as El Chapo, escaped from Mexicos highest security prison, the United States issued a formal request for his extradition, according to a statement by the Mexican attorney general late Thursday night.

title: Daily Report: Reddit Proposes New Content Rules as a Founder Steps In as Chief
description: The return of a founder to a company is a well-worn story line in Silicon Valley, Mike Isaac reports.

title: When Using a Health Savings Account, Know What Is Eligible
description: HEALTH savings accounts are becoming more prevalent, but its not always easy for consumers to know what items they can purchase with funds from the accounts.

title: 1940: The Dutch Dont Like Nazis
description: BUDAPEST  The first two months of German occupation of the Netherlands has brought about one almost national passive demonstration against the invaders and has seen a steadily growing resentment against the Nazi forces. The phlegmatic Dutchman, who takes his time making up his mind and who thought everything would continue normal despite the presence of German troops, is slowly coming to the conclusion that German protection of his neutrality is not exactly a blessing. There were immediate repercussions of this spontaneous outburst of anti-German feeling. Although the defenseless Dutch knew better than to actively oppose German occupation, they have shown a decidedly menacing attitude toward members of the local Nazi organization. New York Herald Tribune, July 18, 1940

title: Brussels Making a Strong Bid for Art
description: BRUSSELS  Julien Meert, a 32-year-old painter from Brussels, remembers the moment when he realized his hometown had become a major spot on the international art map. It was when Almine Rech arrived, he said, referring to the eminent Paris gallery, whose eponymous founder, married to a grandson of Picasso, opened a branch here in 2007. Mr. Meert was still in art school and immediately understood hed have to compete with major players, even in his own backyard. I thought, cest fini, he said. Now its another game. I have to be brave.

title: Review: Egypts Boy King Mans Up for a Spike Mini-Series
description: Tutankhamen, according to the best guesses of archaeologists, historians and forensic scientists, was a sickly, inbred monarch with a club foot who died of natural causes as a teenager and was physically incapable of standing up straight, let alone going into battle.

title: Mexico at Midnight, the Perfect Match of Villains and Foils in Golden Age Film Noir
description: A fake clairvoyant is outmaneuvered by the fetching widow he hopes to blackmail; a meek manicurist plots to replace her wealthy twin sister; an arrogant athlete is tricked into framing himself.

title: Teenager Accused of Raping 82-Year-Old Woman Is Arrested
description: A teenage rape suspect who had eluded the police since they said he attacked an 82-year-old woman at her Brooklyn home on Monday was taken into custody early Friday.

title: Perfectly Reasonable Question: How Letter Writers Are Described
description: A reader, Stephen J. Hendel, has inquired, very reasonably, about identification lines on published letters to the editor, with a specific example in mind.

title: Project Runway Gets More Emmy Awards Nominations Than Ever
description: I know were all superexcited about the broadcast-network-crushing 24 Emmy nominations for Games of Thrones, and Jon Hamms last chance to win a best actor award for being Don Draper after seven previous opportunities. But lost in the furor has been the fact that Project Runway, the fashion reality TV show, snagged four Emmy nominations  outstanding reality competition program, outstanding host for a reality or reality competition program, outstanding cinematography for reality programming and outstanding picture editing for reality programming  more than ever before.

title: Ultrarich Keep Contemporary Art Market Bustling
description: LONDON  This has been, by any reckoning, a momentous first half of the year for the art market.

title: At Zappos, Pushing Shoes and a Vision
description: On a sizzling June morning in Las Vegas, 10 Zappos.com employees sat in an air-conditioned conference room decorated with Star Wars memorabilia and a mural of Darth Vader. They had gathered for a weekly meeting to discuss new internal software, the sort of routine get-together that keeps corporate America humming.

title: Andrew Rosenthal on the Republican Race to the Bottom
description: Andrew Rosenthal, editorial page editor, spoke to Times Insider about how the wide range of Republican presidential candidates is degrading the discourse on the campaign trail.

title: Can You Name All the G.O.P. Candidates?
description: Republican voters have a wide field of presidential candidates to chose from. The Timess Patrick Healy asked voters what they think of having so many choices.

title: A Huge Republican Field Creates Opportunity, as Well as Volatility
description: From Jeb Bushs vantage point, having 14 Republican rivals gives him a chance to look even-keeled and experienced among an array of attention-seekers and newcomers. For Marco Rubio, the older, whiter faces let him stand out as young, Hispanic  different. Donald J. Trump looks like a truth-teller (or a hothead) compared with the typically buttoned-up politicians running, while Scott Walker wants to come across as the most electable of the hard-right conservatives in the race.

title: Witnesses Detail Nigerian Market Bombing
description: Two witnesses described a bombing by suspected Boko Haram militants at a market in the Nigerian city of Gombe on Thursday.

title: Gin Makers Journey: From Tanqueray to Small Batch
description: Its a bit like independent filmmakers getting Jack Nicholson to star in their debut feature.

title: Inquiry Focusing on Chattanooga Gunmans Trip to Jordan in 2014
description: CHATTANOOGA, Tenn.  Federal investigators on Friday dug into the background and travels of the 24-year-old gunman who they say killed four Marines in an attack on two military sites here, focusing on a seven-month trip he made last year to Jordan and scouring his electronic trail in search of a motive for the killings.

title: Lucien Smith Refocuses On Art Amid the Spectacle
description: In 2014, the artist Lucien Smith saw his work sell for $389,000 at auction. He landed a solo show at one of the most blue-chip galleries on the Upper East Side, and became a poster child for what was then referred to pejoratively as Zombie Formalism. He appeared on multiple lists documenting Bright Young Things and witnessed his father publicly call him a coward. Any way you slice it, thats a lot for a 25-year-old who had only been selling his work for four years.

title: Stowaways, Violence and Sickness at Sea: An Editors Perspective
description: The Outlaw Ocean series was a deep collaboration, with many parts of the newsroom working with Ian Urbina on a quest to reveal lawlessness on the high seas. The hope for the project was to take readers inside that lawlessness, using video, photography, mapping and design tied closely together.

title: No More Sea Blindness: Covering Stowaways on a Lawless Ocean
description: In a typical year, a ship sinks every four days. From 2,000 to 6,000 mariners die in accidents annually, and more than 500 are held hostage, many of them tortured. Before I began reporting on lawlessness at sea for the series The Outlaw Ocean, I had no idea how dangerous it is to be a mariner.

title: Swindlers Target Older Women on Dating Websites
description: AT first, the constant attention seemed sweet and very special.

title: Japanese Premier on Scrapping Stadium
description: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan said on Friday that the government would start over on plans for an Olympic stadium for the 2020 Summer Games in Tokyo because of spiraling costs.

title: Clinton Campaign Spending: Big, and Different
description: Hillary Rodham Clintons initial primary campaign spending total, $18.7 million, is a lot of money. And she is using it very differently from her rivals.

title: 3 in France Accused of Plotting a Beheading at a Naval Base
description: PARIS  As countries across Europe attempt to stop disaffected citizens and residents from leaving to fight with Islamist extremists in the Middle East, they are facing a new problem: Some of those people are instead striking at home.

title: The Weekly Health Quiz: Fat Dogs, Indulgent Shoppers and Online Symptom-Checkers
description: Take the Quiz

title: The Scene
description: Sneaker lovers convened for a dance party last night to celebrate a new exhibition, The Rise of Sneaker Culture, at the Brooklyn Museum.

title: Ukraines Explosive YouTube Stars
description: In Luhansk, two men leverage YouTube fame to shed light on and report about the realities of life in Ukraines conflict-torn East.

title: In Bleak Ukraine City, a Duos Odd Experiments Win a Niche Online
description: LUHANSK, Ukraine  THE microwave was a loaner, left for repairs by a family that fled last years shelling and never came back. With a few tweaks and the judicious use of a soup can, it had been weaponized, shooting microwave rays capable of blowing up a boombox.

title: Michael Grimm, Former Congressman, Is Sentenced to 8 Months
description: He spoke of his service to his country, his remorse for breaking the law, and the humiliation he has suffered because of it. Then the former congressman, Michael G. Grimm, asked for mercy from the court.

title: One-Film Wonders: Hits Without Follow-Ups
description: James William Guercio never knew from one-hit wonders when he was producing Grammy winners by Chicago. But he did have a single cinematic dalliance, now included in the One-Film Wonders series at Anthology Film Archives: Electra Glide in Blue, a 1973 police story for the Easy Rider set, starred Robert Blake as an Arizona motorcycle cop trying to solve a murder. More than an artifact, the movie is also beautiful, thanks to the immense vistas shot by Conrad L. Hall (In Cold Blood, Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid).

title: At Terminal 5, a Triple Bill of Courtney Barnett, Speedy Ortiz and Torres
description: A little while ago  10 years?  it felt almost right to say, for those who like to cross things off lists, that singer-songwriter guitar rock had sunk to the bottom of the ocean. As is always the case regarding absolute statements about art, this was wrong, and women were especially good at demonstrating why. And so, an exceptional triple bill at Terminal 5 on July 22: Courtney Barnett, Speedy Ortiz, Torres  three singer-songwriters (Speedy Ortiz is led by Sadie Dupuis) deep in the zone. Ms. Barnett, from Australia, generates endless graffiti about insecurities and irritations to a steady but flexible meter; Ms. Dupuiss words are rich and sanded-down and wry, as if designed to be read on a page; Mackenzie Scott, a.k.a. Torres, wants you to feel a philosophical chill, putting contemplative space around her best thoughts or repeating them.

title: Arlene Shechet Has a First Museum Retrospective in Boston
description: In the early 1990s, when a lot of New York artists were making art about gender, racial identity and the devastation of AIDS, Arlene Shechet was producing worked that looked like no other: hand-molded plaster sculptures of seated Buddhas. Rough-textured, splashed with color, her art was very much a meditation on change and loss, but added an extra element: a sense of emotional resolution.

title: Delusion of the Fury, a Dream, Carried Out by Ensemble Musikfabrik
description: A menagerie of alien-looking instruments will fill the stage at City Center on Thursday and Friday at 8 p.m. as the German new-music mavens Ensemble Musikfabrik together with the director Heiner Goebbels bring to life Delusion of the Fury by the maverick West Coast composer Harry Partch.

title: On TV Ones Runaway Island, Characters Find Healing
description: Shows like Empire and black-ish received a lot of attention this past season for bringing more diversity to network prime time, but lower-profile cable outlets have showcased strong minority characters for years. Among those is TV One, which describes its programming as designed to entertain and inform a diverse audience of adult black viewers. On July 25 at 8p.m., it offers its latest made-for-TV movie, Runaway Island.

title: Taye Diggs Takes Over in Hedwig
description: There was a time when it was hard to imagine anyone other than John Cameron Mitchell starring in Hedwig and the Angry Inch. As the book writer and charismatic original Off Broadway star, he created something that seemed distinctly his. That the role of Hedwig, the German transgender rock singer, has been capably filled and even reinvented, most smashingly by Neil Patrick Harris in the current Broadway production, takes nothing away from Mr. Mitchell. If anything, it means hes created a prime musical theater showcase for any man or woman (Ally Sheedy once played the part) willing to strut, pose and belt while wearing fishnet stockings. Replacing Darren Criss, who kicked up a bit of controversy improvising and then apologizing for a joke about Bruce Jenner, the latest performer is Taye Diggs, the first African-American to play the role in New York. Mr. Diggs  who starred in the original Rent and filled in earlier on long-running Broadway hits, including Wicked and Chicago  has charm to burn, the kind that has lit up many movie scenes. But now he has a chance to let loose a more flamboyant side. You can see how he stacks up, starting Wednesday. (Belasco Theater, hedwigbroadway.com)

title: New York, French Canadian and German Energy at Jacobs Pillow
description: Two internationally minded companies are bounding into the Jacobs Pillow Dance Festival. Daniil Simkins Intensio makes its debut there with works by Alexander Ekman (Sweden), Jorma Elo (Finland), Annabelle Lopez Ochoa (Colombian-born, Belgian-based), and the New Yorker Gregory Dolbashian. Mr. Simkin, a dancing whirlwind from American Ballet Theater, says that his troupe, drawn from Ballet Theater and Les Ballets Jazz de Montral, takes its name from a linguistic union of intention and intensity. So expect energy.

title: Vegan Ice Cream From Van Leeuwen Artisan Ice Cream
description: If youre the kind of ice cream lover who thinks the more butterfat and egg yolks in a pint the better, youll be tempted to skip the vegan chapter of the new Van Leeuwen Artisan Ice Cream cookbook (Ecco, 2015). Why contemplate vegan roasted banana ice cream when there is a recipe for the original dairy-rich version 60 pages earlier?

title: Homes for Sale in New Jersey and New York State
description: This weeks homes include a three-bedroom in Pleasantville, N.Y., and a six-bedroom in Absecon, N.J.

title: Homes for Sale in New York and New Jersey
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in the New York City region:

title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: Barbarian Days
description: This week, William Finnegan talks about Barbarian Days: A Surfing Life; Alexandra Alter has news from the publishing world; Peter Moore discusses The Weather Experiment; questions from readers; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

title: Their Relationship, At Least, Wasnt Hard Work
description: After the wedding of Bridget Nugent and Dean Reineking, a reception was held at the brides parents home, which was repaired after being hit by Hurricane Sandy.

title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: Barbarian Days
description: This week, William Finnegan and Peter Moore.

title: When Impact Investing Stays Local
description: BY the mid-1990s, the Houghton family, whose wealth is derived from the glass and ceramic material manufacturer Corning, was into its sixth generation. Many of the cousins felt they had lost touch and were drifting away from the family.

title: Bridget Nugent and Dean Reineking: Embracing an Adventure of a Lifetime
description: Growing up in Massapequa, N.Y., Bridget Nugent lived less than a block from the Great South Bay, in a Victorian house with a conch-shell-like turret, several balconies, a wide front porch and 75 windows, many with pale blue or yellow stained-glass panes, like weathered sea glass you might find on the beach.

title: Factory Fire Burns in Northern England
description: Several people were injured and four were believed to be missing after an explosion caused a fire at a wood mill in Cheshire, in northern England, on Friday.

title: Wilcos Surprise: A New Album for Free Download
description: Wilco, the always-tinkering alternative rock band from Chicago, became the latest act to release a surprise album when it made 11 new songs available for free download on its website on Thursday night.

title: What the Country Owes Harriet Tubman
description: American capitalism is deeply implicated in slavery. The traffic in human beings produced profits, not just for plantation families, but for bankers, merchants, manufacturers and insurance companies that issued policies on slaving vessels and the lives of the people who were carried in their holds.

title: Paperback Row
description: CALIFORNIA, by Edan Lepucki. (Bay Back/Little, Brown, $16.) A couple expecting their first child confront a feral, apocalyptic reality and future. After Cal and Frida are driven from a dystopic Los Angeles into the wilderness, they attempt to eke out a life of security.

title: Death and Mr. Pickwick, by Stephen Jarvis
description: You dont normally wish a novel would come with a bibliography, but Stephen Jarviss new book practically begs for one. Death and Mr. Pickwick makes some eyebrow-raising claims: that Charles Dickenss The Pickwick Papers was so widely circulated that only the Bible, Shakespeare and perhaps the Book of Common Prayer can better its circulation; that for a century or more Samuel Pickwick, the books genial bumbling hero, was the most famous character in fiction there has ever been; and that Dickens didnt name or invent Samuel Pickwick.

title: Inside the List
description: Secret Agent Man: The English Spy, Daniel Silvas latest espionage thriller to feature the art restorer and Israeli agent Gabriel Allon, drops out of the top spot in its second week on the hardcover fiction list, falling to No. 4. Meanwhile, a real-life spy story has climbed onto the hardcover nonfiction list: The Billion Dollar Spy, by the journalist and Pulitzer Prize-winning author David E. Hoffman, is new at No. 13. Hoffmans book traces the Cold War exploits of Adolf Tolkachev, a Soviet military engineer who for years passed secrets to the C.I.A. He put the documents in his coat, Hoffman told NPR this month, and he walked out of that top-secret institute at the lunch hour back to his apartment, which was a 20-minute walk, and he took out a camera and he photographed the pages and then he went back to work and put them back in the file. And he did this for years. One way the book brings its subject to life, as Scott Shane noted in his review for The New York Timess daily Arts section, is through the detail that Tolkachev asked his American handlers to pass along rock n roll for his teenage son, including Led Zeppelin, Pink Floyd and the Beatles. My son, as many of his contemporaries in school, has a passion for Western music, he explained in one letter. I too, in spite of my age, like to listen to this music.

title: North Korea Confidential and North Korea Undercover
description: He was the Tammany Hall boss of North Korea, the man who dispensed favors and stayed close to the ruling Kim family, so close he married the daughter of the nations founder. He got rich by selling commodities to China: low-end coal and probably the more valuable rare earths. He ran the Ministry of Peoples Security. Those gilded connections did not shield one of North Koreas most powerful men from the wrath of the young new leader, the 30-something Kim Jong-un, and for reasons that no one outside the inner sanctums of Pyongyang knows, Jang Song-thaek suffered a bloody downfall.

title: Editors Choice
description: THE UNRAVELING: High Hopes and Missed Opportunities in Iraq, by Emma Sky. (PublicAffairs, $28.99.) The Briton who was the political adviser to American Gen. Ray Odierno from 2007 to 2010 offers an important and disturbing memoir.

title: Let Me Explain You, by Annie Liontas
description: Annie Liontass debut novel, Let Me Explain You, opens with a type of communication that many of us know intimately: an email from a parent. This one follows many of the comedic conventions of the form. There is the gnomic subject line, the unorthodox punctuation, the needlessly formal greeting and sign off. There is a reckless use of the cc function, and a CASUALLY idiosyncratic RELIANCE on THE CAPS lock KEY.

title: Foul Players
description: Whatll it be today? A knotty puzzle mystery? A fast-paced police procedural? Something more high-toned, with a bit of wit? With the British author Peter Lovesey, theres no need to make those agonizing decisions, because his books have it all. Take DOWN AMONG THE DEAD MEN (Soho Crime, $27.95), his new mystery featuring Peter Diamond, detective superintendent of the Bath constabulary. The story opens on a light note, with a professional car thief (call him Driveaway Danny) updating his skills with a remarkable gizmo that prevents a car from being locked  only to discover that the silver BMW hes stolen has a body in the trunk.

title: Rise, by Karen Campbell
description: The Scottish writer Karen Campbells new novel begins with its heroine, Justine, making a panicked escape from the Glasgow home she shares with her psychotic pimp-cum-boyfriend, Charlie Boy. On a randomly chosen bus, heading in the general direction of Oban, she tries not to fidget, but her legs itch desperately  because her jeans are lined with stolen 10 and 50 pound notes.

title: The Wolf Border, by Sarah Hall
description: The English zoologist Rachel Caine doesnt have relationships: Just sex. Her mother had been the same way. When Rachel finds herself pregnant after one drunken night with Kyle, her longtime friend and colleague at a wolf recovery program in the Idaho wilds, she cant face the situation  at least not as a couple. Her panicked flight brings her back home to the Lake District, to help with a powerful aristocrats quixotic scheme to reintroduce gray wolves to Britain. Her own reintroduction proves just as complicated and dangerous.

title: The Pinch, by Steve Stern
description: If your name is Stern and you seek literary attention, the evidence suggests you ought to consider a pseudonym. When Richard Stern  the brainy, digressive Chicago novelist and story writer who was better known for being unknown than for anything he wrote  died two years ago, his burden passed to Steve Stern, a fellow chronicler of Jewish experience via deeply schooled stories that cant seem to get reviewed without reference to the author being not as well known as he should be.

title: A Summer Reading List Inspired By Both Coasts
description: Book/Shops New York location at 2 Bond Street turns one this week. Tucked into a bright corner inside the mens clothing store CHCM, its less a bookshop and more a shop about books. More interesting, perhaps, than its hard-to-find titles are its bibliophilic oddities: a Spanish book brush for dusting, Absorene Paper & Book Cleaner for maintenance and hand-sewn canvas book sleeves for travel. Minimal yet lively graphic prints (related to reading, of course) hang on the wall of the shop  which is lined with unique, morsel-size slotted bookshelves, all designed in-house.

title: Pluto: Love at First Sight
description: Were like inmates in an asylum, its bedlam, said the New Horizons co-investigator William McKinnon, describing scientists and engineers reactions to the first New Horizons photos.

title: Reggaes Summer Flirtation
description: A look at the desire for a reggae or reggae-like worldwide pop hit between Memorial Day and Labor Day.

title: Judges Rebuke Limits on Wiping Out Student Loan Debt
description: On a typical day in her last job, Janet Roth left home at 4 a.m. each day and drove 40 miles to a tax preparation office in Glendale, Ariz. When she finally got back home, she had less than an hour before starting her 6 p.m. shift decorating cakes at Walmart. She worked until midnight, giving her just a few hours to sleep before starting all over again.

title: They Told You So: Economists Were Right to Doubt the Euro
description: The continuing saga of Greece and its creditors is more tragic than comic. But watching it, I am reminded of that old line about the recurring travails of Laurel and Hardy: Well, heres another nice mess youve gotten me into! For the problems facing Europe today are not sui generis. They are merely the latest installment of a story that has been unfolding for many decades.

title: The Neverlanders, a Disney Social Club
description: One group of tattooed, vest-wearing fanatics discusses the magic of the Happiest Place on Earth.

title: Footage May Show Flight 17 Crash Debris
description: Video obtained by News Corp. Australia purportedly shows the direct aftermath of the crash of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17, which was shot down over eastern Ukraine one year ago, killing 298 people.

title: On the Market in New York City
description: This weeks properties are found on the Upper East Side, the Lower East Side and in Ditmas Park.

title: OMI Soars With Cheerleader Remix and Aims to Keep Riding High
description: Dont call OMI a reggae artist.

title: Popcast: Reggaes Summer Flirtation
description: Omi, a 28-year-old Jamaican singer, has the No. 1 song in the country: Cheerleader, in the Felix Jaehn remix version,a mildly island-y song of serene monogamy in the light electronic dance genre called Tropical House. The song has rolled through Europe and the rest of the English-speaking world for the last two years: six-times platinum in Sweden, four times platinum in Australia, regular old platinum in Britain. Omi doesnt have an album or a fan base, really; Cheerleader is his only song, unless you count the original version, released in 2012, decidedly more reggae.

title: Homes for Sale in Brooklyn and Manhattan
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in New York City:

title: The Law That Keeps People on Death Row Despite Flawed Trials
description: One of the more curious rulings the Supreme Court handed down last month, overshadowed by its landmark health care and same-sex-marriage decisions, concerned a death-row inmate named Hector Ayala. In 1989, Ayala was charged with participating in the execution-style murder of three men in an auto-body shop in San Diego, an apparent result of a heroin deal gone bad. During jury selection for the trial, prosecutors struck all seven of the prospective jurors who were black or (like Ayala) Hispanic.

title: Shut Down Rikers Island
description: A CASUAL reader of the news these days might conclude that there is real hope for Rikers Island, New Yorks cesspool of a jail complex, located swimming distance from La Guardia Airport in the East River.

title: Job at Hillary Clintons Super PAC Didnt Assure a Campaign Post
description: In Hillary Rodham Clintons thick campaign finance report for the first three months of her 2016 race, more than 300 people were paid for work on her second national run.

title: Eric Garner Is Remembered One Year After His Death
description: Held aloft in her mothers arms, Legacy Garner, the 15-month-old daughter of Eric Garner, opened a wooden bird cage Friday morning and released a white rock dove.

title: Deutsche Bank Executives Conduct Faulted in Agency Report
description: FRANKFURT  In September 2012, the co-chief executives of Deutsche Bank held a news conference here to announce an ambitious plan to make sure that the ethical lapses of the past, which had damaged the banks reputation and led to huge fines, would never happen again.

title: Republican Doublethink on Mass Shootings: Scott Walker Edition
description: Governor Scott Walker of Wisconsin, who recently joined the Republican primary carnival in an official way, says the government should reauthorize the Patriot Act in response to the murder of four Marines in Chattanooga, Tenn., by a 24-year-old gunman.

title: Big Ticket | 1 East 62nd Street
description: The palatial triplex penthouse that Joan Rivers called home for more than a quarter of a century until her death sold for $28 million.

title: Penthouse Owned by Joan Rivers Sold for $28 Million
description: The palatial triplex on the Upper East Side that Joan Rivers called home for more than a quarter of a century until her death last year  where she had honed her caustic comedy routines, entertained celebrities, and, by her own telling, even encountered a belligerent ghost  sold for $28 million and was the most expensive closed sale of the week, according to city records.

title: Storm Clouds Over the Smith River
description: A trip down Montanas beloved Smith River explores whats at stake if a proposed copper mine becomes reality.

title: Eminem Collaborates on the Album for the Film Southpaw
description: DETROIT  There were more arcade games than people inside Eminems studio on a recent summer afternoon, and the crunch of N.F.L. highlights  not music  filled the silence. At work in the unmarked, gray suburban building, the rapper born Marshall Mathers held a pen and a tattered Detroit Lions composition book, writing in solitude for no project in particular.

title: Donald Trumps Appeal? G.O.P. Is Puzzled, but His Fans Arent
description: LACONIA, N.H.  There are many, many things Donald Trump would like you to know about how he would run the country. As he told a standing-room-only crowd here the other night, turning America around would be a lot like running the Trump National Doral golf club in Miami, which he bought when it was in bankruptcy in 2012.

title: A Look at The Revenant Trailer, Featuring Leonardo DiCaprio
description: What do you do after winning the best picture Oscar for a visually audacious, star-driven comedy? How about a visually audacious, star-driven drama? That looks to be the case with The Revenant, the new feature from Alejandro G. Irritu.

title: Amazon Says Prime Day Beat Black Friday in Sales Numbers
description: Despite a much-derided  product lineup and clunky wait-lists, Amazon said on Friday that it sold more products during its Prime Day sale this week than Black Friday last year, and that more new members tried its Prime subscription service than on any single day in the retailers 20-year history.

title: Errant Ball Hurts on Both Sides of Rope
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland  Ernie Elss gallery at the Old Course on Thursday morning included John Jones, who was in the vicinity of the first fairway, but not too close, when Els struck his opening shot at the British Open. Jones attended the tournament as Elss guest, but to say he did not pay a price for his ticket would be skirting the truth.

title: Honoring the International, Adaptable Eggplant
description: Eggplants are arriving at the market in all shapes, sizes and hues. Some are pear-shaped, fat, shiny and black; others are thin, footlong and dark purplish. There are bright fuchsia eggplants and eggplants with magenta and white striations. Some are pale violet; some pale green. Some are truly egg-shaped and ivory white. And there are tiny round pumpkin-colored ones no bigger than an inch in diameter.

title: As Chattanooga Death Toll Rises, Mourning Deaths on Home Soil
description: Gunnery Sgt. Thomas Sullivan was in the Marine Corps for 18 years, survived truck bombs and a rain of mortars during one of the biggest assaults of the Iraq war, earned a Combat Action Ribbon and two Purple Hearts, and was expecting to retire soon. Instead he was ambushed on home soil, in a suburban Chattanooga, Tenn., office park.

title: What Is Known About the Chattanooga Gunman
description: Investigators have identified Mohammod Youssuf Abdulazeez as the gunman who killed four Marines in attacks on two military sites in Chattanooga, Tenn. on Thursday.

title: Dropping $100 for a Day at Jacob Riis, the Peoples Beach
description: Standing in line at Pier 11, where Wall Street terminates at the East River, on a Sunday morning in July can make you feel old and dull and limited, at once socially and idiomatically. Your shoe game is strong, a young woman tells a friend who has arrived just in time to board the ferry that is scheduled to leave at 11:30. The shoes in question are flat-heeled gladiator sandals in coral suede. The woman wearing them is tired. We started with bottomless brunch and drank all day and I didnt get home until midnight, she says. Another friend caroused more aggressively, not landing at home until 7 oclock, and the feeling is that she will not rouse for the beach.

title: Brooklyn Townhouses, Suburban Style
description: A company known for building large-scale projects at rapid speed across Brooklyn is significantly downshifting for its latest development.

title: Kerry Says U.S. Pressed Iran on American Prisoners
description: Secretary of State John Kerry defended the Obama administrations work to free Americans held in Iran on Friday, saying he had raised the issue at every meeting in final bargaining over the nuclear dispute and was very, very hopeful.

title: Exclusive | 38 Mathews Road, Wainscott, N.Y.
description: An 18,000-square-foot house with more than 2,000 feet of frontage on secluded Georgica Pond is about to go on the market.

title: A Sprawling Hamptons Estate Offered at $95 Million
description: A sprawling, 18,000-square-foot house in Wainscott, N.Y., with more than 2,000 feet of frontage on secluded Georgica Pond, and interiors enhanced with custom millwork, Cotswold stone and state-of-the-art technology, is about to go on the market for $95 million.

title: Greg Van Avermaet Holds Off Top Sprinter to Win Tour de France Stage
description: RODEZ, France  The Tour de France had what the organizers call a transition stage Friday, a bridge from the Pyrenees to the Alpine stages.

title: A Party to Celebrate a Shared Love of Sneakers
description: Last week, the Brooklyn Museum opened The Rise of Sneaker Culture, a sweeping exhibition that includes 150 pairs of sneakers  from 1920s Keds to Nikes first pair of Air Jordans. Last night, in honor of the show, the museum hosted an evening of revelry: a sneaker drive thrown by Heeling Soles and a dance battle, capped off with one big party. The photographer Amy Lombard captured the scene, which included a set from DJ collective I Love Vinyl, a choreographed dance and many, many pairs of shoes.

title: Public Enemy? At Home in Mexico, El Chapo Is Folk Hero No. 1
description: CULIACN, Mexico  When Jos Antonio Sevilla and his three brothers learned that the notorious drug trafficker known as El Chapo had escaped from prison, they jumped out of their chairs and shouted with glee.

title: Pakistan Arrests Senior Officials of Karachi Political Party
description: KARACHI, Pakistan  Two senior officials with the Muttahida Qaumi Movement, the party that has dominated politics in Karachi for decades, were arrested Friday in the latest push by the Pakistani military to curb what it calls the partys criminal activities, the authorities said.

title: NASA Discusses Pluto Flyover
description: S. Alan Stern, the principal investigator for NASAs New Horizons mission, said on Friday that the second close-up views of Pluto show mountains made of ice and a crater-free surface.

title: Eid Al-Fitr Prayers in a Brooklyn Park
description: On Friday, Manal Abu Samaha and her daughters Aber Kawas and Magdolyn Kawas attended prayers in Bensonhurst Park in Brooklyn for Eid al-Fitr, a holiday that signifies the end of Ramadan.

title: Profile in Style
description: India Hicks

title: What I Love | Dana Brandwein Oates and Daniel Oates
description: A ceramist and a furniture designer and their home in Sharon, Conn.

title: How John Mattera, Shipwreck Explorer, Spends His Sundays
description: I find shipwrecks, John Mattera said the other day, when asked to describe what he does for a living. No, really, thats what he does: search for sunken treasure. Mr. Mattera, 53, a former nightclub owner, bodyguard, moneylender and Staten Island tough guy, is a subject of Robert Kursons new book, Pirate Hunters: Treasure, Obsession and the Search for a Legendary Pirate Ship, about a quest for 17th-century booty in the seas around the Dominican Republic. Its a yarn with plenty of guns and danger and breathless prose. Between dives, Mr. Mattera stays closer to home, doing research and writing and  along with his wife, Carolina  raising their three children, ages 8 months to 4, in the Great Kills section of Staten Island. His daughter from his previous marriage lives nearby.

title: An App to Help You Win the Parking-Ticket War
description: Driving in New York City is known to be difficult, but it only gets worse when you have to find a place to park. In a memorable episode of Louie, Louis C.K. ultimately gives up on deciphering a group of contradictory parking signs. When he comes back later, his car is being destroyed by city workers.

title: Argentina Mourns Victims of 1994 Bombing
description: A ceremony was held on Friday, the 21st anniversary of an attack on a Jewish community center in which 85 people were killed.

title: Share Your Medicare Experiences
description: New York Times health care reporters would like to hear from readers about their experiences using Medicare and Medicaid.

title: Book Review Podcast: Barbarian Days: A Surfing Life
description: In The New York Times Book Review, Thad Ziolkowski reviews William Finnegans Barbarian Days: A Surfing Life. Mr. Ziolkowski writes:

title: David Brock, Key Hillary Clinton Ally, to Work More Closely With Her Campaign
description: In the world of outside supporters to Hillary Rodham Clinton, no one has a more visible, and singular, role than David Brock, her former critic-turned-guardian.

title: J. Crews New Arrival, Caitlyn Jenner in Versace and Sam Smith for Balenciaga
description: All the weeks fashion news thats fit to reprint.

title: Country Living for the Creative Couple
description: When Dana Brandwein Oates and Daniel Oates leave their studios to meet for lunch at the converted cowshed where they live in Sharon, Conn., they dont put their work away. They sit at a Shaker-style table made by Mr. Oates, a furniture designer, and eat off gossamer-like plates that Ms. Oates, a ceramist, handcrafted for the couples company, dbO Home.

title: Lasting Art, a Flower Store Where Everything Is 100% Fake
description: Now that its summer, the sidewalks of West 28th Street between Sixth and Seventh Avenues have been transformed into miniature forests as merchants display their wares for weekend shoppers. Rows of tiny succulents, potted perennials and even small, graceful Japanese maple trees are neatly lined up at the curb along both sides of the street. Long serving both professional floral arrangers and civilian plant lovers, these stores are what remain of the New Yorks once expansive floral district.

title: Summer-Squash Casserole
description: Sam Sifton makes a squash casserole that is the perfect accompaniment to a grilled chicken or weekend roast.

title: Summer-Squash Casserole, Plain but Ritzy, All in One
description: Why dont you just cook something that tastes really good?

title: Recalling Marlene Sanders, a Force in TV Journalism
description: In 2000, Cynthia McFadden, the senior legal and investigative correspondent for NBC News, attended a party given by her friend Jeffrey Toobin, a staff writer for The New Yorker and legal analyst for CNN. There, Ms. McFadden was catching up with Mr. Toobins mother, Marlene Sanders, the pioneering television reporter. She asked for her advice on managing motherhood and a career.

title: Review: Monchichi, a Love Story in Different Languages
description: BECKET, Mass.  A ballerina and a b-boy fall in love. It sounds like the setup for a sentimental American movie about people with radically different backgrounds connecting. But what if she is German, with a Korean mother? And what if he is French, with Spanish and Catalonian parents? That sounds not just like a European variation but also one with potentially less predictable complications.

title: Merger Vote at Samsung Is Not the End for the Lee Family
description: The Lee family behind Samsung must be breathing a heavy sigh of relief. Its plans for an $8 billion merger of two Samsung affiliates, Samsung C&T and Cheil Industries, was narrowly approved on Friday by shareholders. The move came despite strong opposition from by Elliott Management, the hedge fund led by Paul E. Singer.

title: A Courtyard Idyll Beside the High Line
description: Tenth Avenue in the 20s is not usually thought of as an idyllic spot, but Alta Linea, in the tree-lined courtyard of the High Line Hotel (itself once part of the General Theological Seminary), makes it work with al fresco tables under white umbrellas, strings of white lights and lanterns in the trees and a bubbling fountain. The frozen Negronis ($14) might help, too.

title: Pro-Israel Aipac Creates Group to Lobby Against the Iran Deal
description: The pro-Israel group Aipac has formed a tax-exempt lobbying group to oppose the nuclear deal reached this week with Iran.

title: Review: Vinegar Tom and Judith Examine Woman as Myth
description: Woman, says the woman dressed as a man in a bowler hat, is an imperfect animal. Thats because, as her vaudevillian partner points out, the female of the species was formed from a bent rib.

title: From the Vault of the Museum at Fraunces Tavern: A Drinks Kit
description: Every patriotic New Yorker worth his or her weight in saltpeter knows that the 253-year-old Fraunces Tavern (the actual edifice was built in 1719) is the site where, in 1783, a war-weary George Washington bade a tearful farewell to his troops. Six years later the former commander in chief retook the title as Americas first president in the countrys first capital.

title: Mens Wear Designers Lead the Pack for the CFDA/Vogue Award
description: It may have been just a coincidence, but it was somehow fitting that the nominees for this years CFDA/Vogue Fashion Fund Award were announced on Wednesday, right in the middle of the mens wear shows being held in New York.

title: Jerrod Carmichaels Comedy, and Tourism, Call for Reflection
description: Jerrod Carmichael slipped into the glass atrium of the Whitney Museum of American Art recently with 45 minutes to spare before closing time. The 27-year-old comic was in New York to promote his coming NBC sitcom, The Carmichael Show, and, after a long day of interviews, was taking in a few sights before heading back to Los Angeles.

title: Home Sales Around the New York Region
description: Information on sales in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: Letting Our Emojis Get in the Way
description: For some emoji enthusiasts, theres always room for a new icon on the keyboard.

title: New Yorks Marrying Man, 11 Times a Day
description: The bride, delayed in Midtown Manhattan traffic, had finally arrived, and Gino Filippone was just about to read the vows in Central Park when a tree-pruning crew started up its chain saws nearby.

title: Stirring Others to Action With Civil Rights Films
description: WASHINGTON  Septuagenarians from the era of the civil rights movement slowly climbed the steps of Metropolitan A.M.E. church here, some receiving kisses on the cheek from the young man at the door. They mingled with other generations  throngs of government workers, young law students inspired by recent protests, and even a few lesser-known legends of that struggle.

title: The Revolt Against Tourism
description: COPENHAGEN  AS we glide under a bridge on the city canal tour, our guide announces that we have entered a quiet zone. This is a residential area, she says, nodding toward balconies where Danes are enjoying coffee  or maybe wine. Ill resume talking in five minutes.

title: 50-Million-Year-Old Fossilized Sperm in Antarctica
description: The oldest known fossilized sperm, discovered inside a worm cocoon in Antarctica, is 50 million years old, a new study reports.

title: Officials Discuss Chattanooga Shooting
description: Edward W. Reinhold, the special agent in charge of the F.B.I.s Knoxville division, said on Friday that the shooting is being investigated as an act of terrorism

title: Bernanke Isnt Serious
description: By which I mean that he isnt Serious. His latest on Greece and the euro suggests that the deeper problems lie not in Greek fecklessness but in the refusal of the core  basically Germany  to allow either monetary or fiscal policies that would offset the downdraft from austerity in the periphery. He even questions the sacred status of structural reform:

title: Faith and Feasting Worldwide as Ramadan Draws to a Finish
description: Eid-al-Fitr, observed from Romania to Thailand to Brooklyn, marks the conclusion of Ramadan, Islams month of fasting, prayers and contemplation.

title: Faith and Feasting Worldwide as Ramadan Draws to a Finish
description: Eid-al-Fitr, observed from Romania to Thailand to Brooklyn, marks the conclusion of Ramadan, Islams month of fasting, prayers and contemplation.

title: Germany Risks Its Reputation With Idea of Greece Exiting Eurozone
description: LONDON  For decades, Germany saw its role as the financier and beneficiary of European unity, a combination of penance for the past and self-interest. The rest of the Continent came to rely on it as the country that could be trusted to keep its great experiment moving forward.

title: Military Recruiting Centers Keep Their Doors Open After Deadly Attack
description: WASHINGTON  For military recruiters, the shootings in Chattanooga, Tenn., on Thursday exposed an unavoidable risk of their jobs: They must work in the open.

title: At New York Fashion Week: Mens, California Was the Muse
description: In the language of recovery programs, folks who try to run from their problems by constantly changing location are pulling a geographic. Returning to New York after more than a decade away, the mens fashion week that finished up Thursday took a generally sober approach to the buzzed and almost giddy excitement that has lately attached itself to mens wear.

title: A Play on Words
description: All of us who have ever been (or had) a sulky teenager who considers time spent adjacent to adults an impossible drag can imagine that being taken to a play on the life of the American founding father Alexander Hamilton might represent a special kind of hell. The suspicion that your parents may be trying to inject history or culture straight into your brain adds fuel to the offense. That it is a musical performed in rap does little to mitigate the insult. Hip-hop politics?! Please!

title: My Digital Cemetery
description: SAVANNAH, GA.  MY digital address book lists 2,743 contacts. This is not because Im popular or extroverted; Im neither. Its because this collection of names stretches back two decades, the oldest contacts tracing to a 1996 Palm Pilot and preserved through transfers involving more devices than I care to remember. It covers life in four cities and work on countless reporting projects. The idea of organizing and pruning this slow-motion data dump is by now unthinkable.

title: From White Sharks to Tigers, Can We Get Comfortable with Carnivores?
description: From Cape Cods coastto South Asias Sunderbans, communities are grappling with an unnerving consequence of trying to build a good Anthropocene, the term increasingly applied to Earths age of humans, in which weve become a powerful influence on everything from the climate system to evolution.

title: A Swedish Ad Campaign, for Kalles Kaviar, Tests the Worlds Gag Reflex
description: Kalles Kaviar is Swedens answer to Marmite.

title: Ta-Nehisi Coatess Visceral Take on Being Black in America
description: BALTIMORE  Between the World and Me, Ta-Nehisi Coatess meditation on being a black man in America, has had an almost frictionless glide straight to the heart of the national conversation.

title: Trumpism
description: Not surprisingly, Rick Perlstein, our foremost expert on the rise of movement conservatism, has the best take so far on the Trump phenomenon. As he says, nobody should be surprised to find that there are a lot of Republicans who are mad as hell and wont take it any more:

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week.

title: Turmoil Deepens in Brazil as House Speaker Splits From Dilma Rousseffs Coalition
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Brazils scandal-plagued political establishment was thrown further into turmoil on Friday when the embattled speaker of the lower house of Congress announced that he was breaking from a coalition with the governing Workers Party, ratcheting up pressure on President Dilma Rousseff.

title: Friday Night Music: Lake Street Dive, Nobody Knows
description: Its been a week, at least in Europe, for a special version of Murphys Law: Anything policymakers can do wrong, they will. So nobody knows what theyre doing here:

title: First Draft Focus: The Week in Political Pictures
description: A presidential first behind bars, Scott Walker joins the race and the 2016 campaign rolls along.

title: First Draft Focus: The Week in Political Pictures
Burundi President Presses On in Disputed Re-election Effort
description: CIBITOKE, Burundi  Despite widespread international condemnation, bitter opposition within his own country and the threat of violent revolt, President Pierre Nkurunziza struck a defiant tone at a campaign rally Friday on a mountaintop near where government forces recently battled rebels.

title: Suge Knights Motion to Reduce Bail Is Denied
description: LOS ANGELES  The motion to reduce bail is denied.

title: Joining Obama on Cell Block B
description: EL RENO, Okla.  As we made our way through the heavy metal door of Cell Block B, someone called out.

title: Inside Ts Summer Entertainment Issue
description: Ts latest issue is all about entertainment. On the cover is Lin-Manuel Miranda, the Broadway visionary whose groundbreaking musical, Hamilton, recasts an oft-overlooked American founding father as a hip-hop renegade. We talk to the Tony-winning dramaturge, as well as the cadre of collaborators and confidants (including Stephen Sondheim and Questlove of the Roots) who helped bring his vision to life. We also swing by the happiest place on Earth  Disneyland  where one father revels in the power of suspended disbelief. And lest we forgot that other kind of entertaining  at which photographer Paul Costello and his wife, Sara Ruffin Costello, are so adept  we visit the couples home in New Orleanss Garden District for a lesson in Southern hospitality. Elsewhere in the issue, T gets familiar with Christine and the Queens, a French music sensation who relies on originality, rather than sex, in her bid for pop stardom; Liesl Schillinger makes the case for modest summer suppers in an age of Carrara countertops and Instagram-worthy cooking; Alice Gregory explores the 50-year-old planned community of Sea Ranch, Calif., where the Modernist housing and embrace of nature are surprisingly of the moment; and the filmmaker Errol Morris and the actress Parker Posey try out 3D wallpaper, a healthy tequila drink and an adult coloring book  with predictably amusing results. See all stories from this issue >>

title: The Whites of Our Eyes
description: SEVERAL years ago, while browsing the campus bookstore, one of us, Professor Segal, encountered a display table filled with Squirtles. A Squirtle is a plush-toy turtle manufactured by the company Russ Berrie. They were adorable and she couldnt wait to take one home.

title: Cycling May Turn Armstrong Into a Sympathetic Figure Yet
description: In his profile photo on Twitter, Lance Armstrong is standing, arms crossed, behind a sign that says PAIN in big red letters.

title: CVS and Walmart Canada Are Investigating a Data Breach
description: CVS and Walmart Canada said on Friday that a data breach at a Canadian information technology vendor may have leaked credit card information from their online photo processing websites, possibly compromising data on millions of users.

title: Pluto Terrain Yields Big Surprises in New Horizons Images
description: In addition to soaring ice mountains, Plutos mixed bag of terrains includes smooth plains that are crisscrossed by enigmatic troughs, photographs from NASAs New Horizons mission show.

title: Review: In Biophony, Ballet Matches Exotic Sound
description: BECKET, Mass.  For city dwellers at least, a visit to the Jacobs Pillow Dance Festival is a trip to the countryside, a visit to nature. The forest and verdant grounds you pass through on your way to its theaters are as crucial to the experience as anything that happens inside the buildings. This week at the festival, however, there is also nature within the Ted Shawn Theater: the sounds of wind and rain, chirping crickets, belching frogs, swarming bees. And also, less endemically: barking baboons, trumpeting elephants, screaming killer whales.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Pictures of the Day: China and Elsewhere
description: China and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Spring Awakening Revival Requires Signing in Lieu of Singing
description: This is what a song sounds like in American Sign Language: breath, the smack of skin on skin, perhaps footsteps when dancing is involved.

title: Coal Country Under Siege
description: In the face of global warming concerns and cheaper natural gas, coal production has dropped 15 percent in the United States since 2008. As the industry crumbles, West Virginias economy has been hit hard.

title: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres the latest.

title: July 17, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from China, Romania, Thailand and Greece.

title: N.S.A. Summer Camp: More Hacking Than Hiking
description: ARLINGTON, Va.  This is not your typical summer sleepaway camp.

title: Review: In The International, Those Who Treat a Massacre as Entertainment
description: She never says Bosnia, never says massacre, never tells us the year the soldiers came to her village on her neighbors wedding day. Irene (Carey Van Driest), the woman at the center of Tim Ruddys The International, begins her story by savoring joy: memories of the life she and her family had before that brutal interruption.

title: Finding Stillness in Surfer Portraits
description: After an overcast day disrupted her shoot of ocean landscapes, photographer Joni Sternbach refocused her camera on surfers to create tintype portraits.

title: Psychiatrys Identity Crisis
description: AMERICAN psychiatry is facing a quandary: Despite a vast investment in basic neuroscience research and its rich intellectual promise, we have little to show for it on the treatment front.

title: Evening Hours | Footloose in the City
description: Summer nights bring out the dance spirit.

title: Measuring a Legacy, a Year After Unrest in Ferguson
description: New York Times reporters would like to hear readers views on the legacy of the fatal shooting of Michael Brown in Ferguson, Mo., last August, which set off violent protests and sparked countless conversations about race and police conduct. What do you see as the lasting effects of the events in Ferguson?

title: Bill Cunningham | Mens Fashion Week
description: Mens Fashion Week After a long hiatus, a formal New York mens fashion week returned.

title: Bill Cunningham | Mens Fashion Week
description: After a long hiatus, a formal New York mens fashion week returned. Attendees, including athletes, flung themselves into a new expression of American sportswear, a strong counter to the more-dominant preppy look. Guests wore inventive footwear, topknots and wide-brim hats.

title: Yahoo Files for Alibaba Spinoff, Though Tax Issues Linger
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Yahoo filed formal documents late Friday to spin off its 15 percent stake in Alibaba, the Chinese e-commerce giant, in the fourth quarter of this year.

title: John Varvatos After-Party
description: Gina Gershon and Christian Slater help the designer John Varvatos celebrate his mens wear show with a party at the Electric Room.

title: Rubiks Unbound
description: There are more ways to solve the puzzle than most people know.

title: ISIS Has Fired Chemical Mortar Shells, Evidence Indicates
description: The Islamic State appears to have manufactured rudimentary chemical warfare shells and attacked Kurdish positions in Iraq and Syria with them as many as three times in recent weeks, according to field investigators, Kurdish officials and a Western ordnance disposal technician who examined the incidents and recovered one of the shells.

title: Struggling to Survive
description: Shrinking exports and Americas growing reliance on hydraulic fracturing and renewable energy have left coal producers in trouble.

title: Life After Prison, While Sober, Single and Scared
description: She walked out of Rikers Island and lit a cigarette in the parking lot, joking with the correction officers arriving for work. Look whos out, they said to her. Stay out of trouble, Laurie.

title: Coal Miners Struggle to Survive in an Industry Battered by Layoffs and Bankruptcy
description: WAYNE, W.Va.  There is pain across the nations coal fields, but here in West Virginia, the disruption is particularly acute.

title: The Republican Fetish With Water Bottles
description: The National Park Service has a cautious, sensible policy that allows parks to ban the sale of plastic water bottles. Those that do so are required to provide easily accessible filling stations at which visitors can replenish their own containers  or fill reusable bottles sold at park concessions  with fresh, potable water.

title: Taxi of Tomorrow Will Be New York Citys Standard Cab Starting Sept. 1
description: The Taxi of Tomorrow will become the standard cab on New York Citys streets starting on Sept. 1, the citys Taxi and Limousine Commission announced on Friday.

title: 19 Police Officers in the Bronx Are Charged With Downgrading Crimes
description: Nineteen New York City police officers assigned to a station house in the Bronx face disciplinary action after being charged on Friday by department lawyers with wrongdoing, including incorrectly classifying crimes and downgrading criminal complaints, the police said.

title: Breaking Up
description: The end of a relationship may be awful and embarrassing, but it makes for good photos.

title: King Salman of Saudi Arabia Meets With Hamas Leaders
description: CAIRO  King Salman of Saudi Arabia met Friday with top political leaders of the Palestinian militant group Hamas, in the most striking example yet of the new kings willingness to work with Islamist organizations long considered foes.

title: Cars Ablaze as Drivers Flee on Interstate 15
description: The brush fire in Southern California that engulfed more than 3,500 acres of land on Friday and jumped a highway left a scene of charred cars and motorists trudging along a desolate landscape, like something out of The Walking Dead, according to post on Twitter.

title: First Draft Focus: 110-Year-Old Veteran Visits the Oval Office
Young Medics Were Lured by Briton to Join ISIS
description: LONDON  Among the growing number of unlikely Britons leaving for Syria to join the Islamic State have been schoolgirls, mothers and, in March and June this year, two groups of medical students and young doctors recruited by a former medical student from northeastern England, the BBC reported on Friday.

title: Time to Act on Sudan

description: To the Editor:

title: Puerto Rico and the District of Columbia
description: To the Editor:

title: Who Goes to Our National Parks? We All Do
description: To the Editor:

title: Gawker Retracts an Article After Criticism, and Gets More Brickbats From Its Staff
description: The news and gossip website Gawker removed an article about an executive at a prominent media company after widespread condemnation Friday from its readers and others, the first time the site has formally retracted a story for reasons other than legal or factual, according to a statement.

title: Republicans Setting Sights on Same-Sex Marriage Law
description: WASHINGTON  Days after a showdown over the Confederate battle flag, House Republicans are barreling toward a new confrontation on another contentious issue: How should Congress respond to the Supreme Courts decision to legalize same-sex marriage?

title: Understanding the Options at the End of Life
description: To the Editor:

title: Israel: Netanyahu and Abbas Talk by Phone After Year
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel called his Palestinian counterpart on Friday on Eid al-Fitr, the first time the two leaders have spoken in more than a year. Mr. Netanyahus office released a statement saying that the prime minister had told President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority that the citizens of Israel want peace and that Israel would continue to act toward regional stability. Palestinian news agencies reported that Mr. Abbas responded that it was important to reach a peace accord in the coming year. In the 13 months since the two men last spoke, in June 2014, Israel fought a devastating war with Palestinian militants in the Gaza Strip, and Mr. Abbas led the Palestinian Authority to join the International Criminal Court and pressed for Palestinian statehood through other international forums.

title: Baby, Its Cold Inside!
description: To the Editor:

title: Bill Arnsparger, Architect of Feared Dolphins Defenses, Dies at 88
description: Bill Arnsparger, the architect of the unheralded No Name Defense that propelled the Miami Dolphins of the early 1970s to the only unbeaten and untied season in N.F.L. history and two consecutive Super Bowl championships, died on Friday at his home in Athens, Ala. He was 88.

title: Iraq: Dozens Killed in Car Bombing at End of Ramadan
description: At least 50 people were killed in a suicide car bombing in a central marketplace in eastern Iraq on Friday, as people shopped for Eid al-Fitr, the Muslim holiday that marks the end of the holy month of Ramadan, the authorities said. The attack took place in the heart of Khan Bani Saad township, a mostly Shiite area about a dozen miles from Baquba, the capital of Diyala Province. At least 90 people were wounded, and some reports said that as many as 80 may have died. There was no immediate claim of responsibility for the bombing, although the Islamic State has carried out a number of bombings in predominantly Shiite areas of Iraq.

title: Residents Sue Seattle, Saying New Trash Rules Violate Privacy
description: SEATTLE  Environmental goals about garbage in this and other like-minded cities increasingly come down to three words: Throw less away. So Seattle residents are given different bins to put out on the curb  one for yard and food waste, another for recycling  and are encouraged to use ever-tinier cans for the stuff that really is trash.

title: Adam Scott Gets British Open Lift From Compatriots Blessing and Caddies Savvy
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland

title: U.S. Agency Rules for Gays in Workplace Discrimination
description: WASHINGTON  The United States Equal Employment Opportunity Commission has ruled that workplace discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation is illegal under federal law, setting the stage for litigation aimed at striking down such practices.

title: The Real Barrier for Women Marines
description: IN her role as leader of the Marine Corps all-women boot camp at Parris Island, S.C., Lt. Col. Kate Germano was known as a demanding and at times blunt commander. She was also effective. Under her leadership, performance in physical fitness and rifle tests improved significantly, and so did retention rates for female recruits. Colonel Germano drove her recruits based on the belief that women would not be taken seriously as Marines until they could meet the same performance standards as men. That belief is widespread, and it is ingrained in Marine culture.

title: New York Parking Alert: Alternate-Side Parking Rules Suspended This Weekend
description: Because of Eid al-Fitr, alternate-side street-cleaning regulations will be suspended in New York City on Saturday and Sunday. Other regulations will remain in effect.

title: British Open Fans Bid Tom Watson a Final Farewell
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland  In a race against darkness, men, women and children spilled from the grandstands and cheered and clapped for Tom Watson as he finally surrendered to Father Time.

title: Heres a Way to Control Guns
description: NEARLY three years ago, in the days after the mass killings at Sandy Hook Elementary School, President Obama went to Newtown, Conn., to speak at a vigil for the victims. He spoke movingly, and seemed to embody the nations outrage and its determination to reduce the number of people killed with guns in America. Do not lose heart, he told the families of the victims. He said he would use whatever power this office holds.

title: Capitalism for the Rest of Us
description: IN her most detailed economic policy address so far, Hillary Rodham Clinton said Monday that she wanted to give workers the chance to share in the profits they help produce through a two-year tax credit that would encourage profit-sharing. As social scientists who have studied the issue for years, we were glad to see it get attention.

title: Yoichiro Nambu, Nobel-Winning Physicist, Dies at 94
description: Yoichiro Nambu, a particle physicist at the University of Chicago whose mathematical description of the phenomenon known as spontaneous symmetry breaking helped explain the interaction of subatomic particles, contributed to the prediction of the Higgs boson, or God particle, and earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 2008, died on July 5 in Osaka, Japan. He was 94.

title: Maine: Ex-Convict Arrested in Rampage That Killed Two
description: A man with a long criminal history shot five people, two fatally, during a nightlong spree before being apprehended on Friday near the Canadian border, the police said. The man, Anthony Lord, 35, faces murder and kidnapping charges. Mr. Lord is also suspected of starting a barn fire, stealing weapons and two vehicles, assaulting one person and leading officers on a chase. The authorities did not have a motive. Mr. Lord is a registered sex offender in Maine. The Bangor Daily News reported that he had been convicted of theft and domestic violence assault, among other charges. Lt. Sean Hashey of the Maine State Police said the sequence began Thursday night with a fire at a barn in Benedicta. Early Friday, a man was beaten in nearby Silver Ridge Township, and his truck and weapons were stolen. Later, Kyle Hewitt, 22, was shot dead and Kim Irish, 55, was wounded at the residence where the barn burned. Mr. Lord, the police said, left the scene with Ms. Irishs daughter, Brittany Irish, 22. Another man, Carlton Eddy, who drove by the scene, was shot in the shoulder. Police later received a call about a shooting at a woodlot in Lee, about 40 miles south of Benedicta. Kevin Tozier, 58, was killed and Clayton McCarthy, 54, was injured there. A truck was stolen from that scene, and officers searching for it found Mr. Lord and Ms. Irish at his relatives home in Houlton.

title: Texas: Officer Placed on Desk Duty After Woman Is Found Dead in Cell
description: A police officer who arrested a woman who later was found hanged in her cell has been placed on desk duty after a preliminary review by the Texas Department of Public Safety. The department said it found violations of procedures regarding traffic stops and the departments courtesy policy in the arrest of the woman, Sandra Bland, on July 10. The officer was not named. Ms. Bland was arrested after a traffic stop in Prairie View on charges of assaulting a public servant and was found hanged three days later. The Harris County medical examiner ruled her death a suicide, but family and friends dispute that. They said Ms. Bland, who was black, was a vocal opponent of police brutality and they have accused the local police of a role in her death.

title: In Argentina, an Anguished Anniversary for Jewish Center Bombing
description: BUENOS AIRES  Argentines filled the streets outside the rebuilt headquarters of a Jewish community center here on Friday, 21 years after a van loaded with explosives was driven into the building, killing 85 people in one of the deadliest anti-Semitic attacks since World War II.

title: Lin-Manuel Miranda to Sit Out Performance of Hamilton, Even With Obama in Audience
description: When President Obama makes his scheduled visit to Saturdays matinee of Hamilton at the Richard Rodgers Theater, seated somewhere in front of him will be another V.I.P.: the shows star and creator, Lin-Manuel Miranda.

title: Stars on Baseballs Horizon
description: After three billion miles and nearly 10 years of travel, the New Horizons spacecraft has finally flown by Pluto. When it first left Earth, I was wrapping up 15 seasons of professional baseball, completing my fight to hold on to my job and health, as the next generation of players ushered aging veterans out of the game.

title: Pakistan: Senior Political Officials Arrested in Karachi
description: Two senior officials with the Muttahida Qaumi Movement, the party that has dominated politics in Karachi for decades, were arrested Friday in the latest push by the Pakistani military to curb what it calls the partys criminal activities, the authorities said. The Pakistan Rangers, the paramilitary force that provides law enforcement for the city, sealed off all roads leading to the partys fortified headquarters a few hours after midnight, the authorities said. A spokesman for the Rangers said the party officials were charged with arranging and facilitating hate speeches against the people of Karachi. The raid and arrests were the latest blow to Altaf Hussain, the partys embattled leader, who has controlled the fortunes of Karachi, Pakistans largest city and its economic and commercial hub, for nearly a quarter-century while operating from self-imposed exile in London.

title: Limiting Uber Wont End Congestion
description: Anybody who spends time in a car or bus in Manhattan knows that traffic congestion isnt getting better and, indeed, may be getting worse. The average daytime speed of cars in Manhattans business districts has fallen to just under 8 miles per hour this year, from about 9.15 miles per hour in 2009.

title: 2-Week Quest for Minutes, Eyes and Contracts
description: LAS VEGAS  Scott Morrison, the coach of the D-League Select team at the N.B.A. summer league, delivered a pregame speech on Thursday that was mostly boilerplate. He reviewed opposing personnel, advising his defenders to avoid leaving their feet on pump fakes. But he also reminded them that it was the playoffs, so the stakes were higher.

title: Followed Doctors Orders
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  I wonder what time Joe Krozel has lunch every day. Thats a strange and random thing to have on your mind, right? I just dont know what might have put that idea in my head.

title: Minor L.I.R.R. Collision Disrupts Service
description: Two Long Island Rail Road trains were involved in a minor collision at Jamaica Station in Queens on Friday night, disrupting service during the evening rush but causing no injuries, the Metropolitan Transportation Authority said.

title: At a Mosque, Grief Mixes With Fear of Revenge
description: CHATTANOOGA, Tenn.  Just beyond a massive strip mall, with its Best Buy and Hobby Lobby, Abdul Baasit, the imam at the Islamic Society of Greater Chattanooga, found himself preaching on Friday about a nightmare.

title: A Death Penalty Advocates Sad Argument
description: The modern American death penalty has few advocates as aggressive and outspoken as Dale Cox. He is the acting district attorney of Caddo Parish, La., a poor region in one of the nations poorest states. From 2010 to 2014, prosecutors in Caddo Parish won more death sentences per capita than anywhere else in the country.

title: Abraham Foxman to Retire After 28 Years of Fighting Anti-Semitism
description: Is Abraham H. Foxmans retirement good or bad for the Jews?

title: From Times Square to the Capitol, Apache Protestors Fight U.S. Land Swap with Mining Company
description: Heres aDot Earth postcard from Kieran Suckling, the executive director of the Center for Biological Diversity, who has been traveling with a group of protestors from the San Carlos Apache tribe in southeastern Arizona. The protestors, from a group called Apache Stronghold, oppose a land swap between the federal government and a subsidiary of the giant Rio Tinto mining company that they say threatensOak Flat, a part of Tonto National Forest that they consider sacred.

title: Helen F. Holt, Who Elevated Elder Care Across the U.S., Dies at 101
description: Helen F. Holt, who led the federal governments effort to establish and standardize modern long-term care facilities for the elderly in the pre-Medicare era, died on July 12 at her home in Boca Raton, Fla. She was 101.

title: Brush Fire Jumps Southern California Freeway, Burning Cars
description: LOS ANGELES  Flames from a nearby brush fire on Friday afternoon quickly overtook a stretch of a packed highway that leads from Southern California to Las Vegas, causing pandemonium on a stretch of road that is routinely gridlocked at that time.

title: An Unsteady Force Emerges in the Mets Offense
description: ST. LOUIS  Kirk Nieuwenhuis spent the All-Star break escaping baseball for a few days in Newport Beach, Calif., relaxing on the beach with his wife, Bethany, and their German shepherd, Barkley, named after Charles Barkley.

title: Bernie Sanders Presses Hillary Clinton on Her Views on Banks
description: CEDAR RAPIDS, Iowa  Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont edged closer on Friday to directly attacking Hillary Rodham Clinton, pointedly asking whether the Democratic presidential front-runner would support measures to break up the countrys largest financial institutions and reinstate a firewall between commercial and investment banking.

title: Lezly Ziering, Dancer Who Rescued Roller-Skating in Central Park, Dies at 82
description: Lezly Ziering, a professional dancer who in midlife set his art on wheels, reinventing himself as a skater, teacher, coach and promoter and achieving the fame of a guru within New York Citys roller-skating subculture, died on Thursday at his home in Manhattan. He was 82.

title: No Sentimentality, or Hits, From Robinson Cano in Return as Alex Rodriguez Lifts Yankees
description: As Robinson Cano stood at his locker late Friday afternoon, he said returning to Yankee Stadium  where he flourished as a power-hitting second baseman  was no longer a big deal. He has been gone for more than a year, so playing here is no different from playing anywhere.

title: Mets Rally Falls Short; Collins Is Ejected in 7th
description: ST. LOUIS  When Jacob deGrom took the field earlyFridayafternoon, his Mets teammates stopped and applauded him. After having watched his electric three-strikeout inning in the All-Star game, they felt proud, the way parents might when their children ventured out and flourished.

title: Whats on TV Saturday
description: 5:15 P.M. (TCM) LOLITA (1962) An aging intellectual (James Mason) falls in love with a teenager (Sue Lyon) in Stanley Kubricks adaptation of the novel by Vladimir Nabokov. Because of the novels depiction of pedophilia Lolita was considered unfilmable until Kubrick and Nabokov came up with a screenplay that could pass the Production Code Administration and the Legion of Decency, opening the door to other cinematic treatments of sexual perversion. How did they ever make a movie of Lolita? Bosley Crowther asked in The New York Times. They didnt. But once the reader has been advised not to expect the distractingly sultry climate and sardonic mischievousness of the book, he added, it must be said that Mr. Kubrick has got a lot of fun and frolic in his film.

title: Shinzo Abes Military Plan Draws Sharp Response From Readers
description: The government of Japan moved forward this week with its controversial plan to reverse its 70-year ban on sending its military forces to fight in conflicts abroad, and many Japanese as well as others in the region cried out in anger.

title: Ayatollah Khamenei, Backing Iran Negotiators, Endorses Nuclear Deal
description: TEHRAN  Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, the supreme leader of Iran, voiced support on Saturday for his countrys nuclear deal with world powers while emphasizing that it did not signal an end to Irans hostility toward the United States and its allies, especially Israel.

title: Corrections: July 18, 2015
description: NEW YORK

title: Quotation of the Day
description: You expect this kind of thing at war, but not here, and they never had a chance to fight back.

title: China Releases 9 Tourists Accused of Watching Terrorist Video at Hotel
description: BEIJING  Nine foreign tourists who were detained in northern China this month after the police accused them of watching illegal videos in their hotel have been allowed to return to their home countries, according to the South African government and an aid group that worked for their release.

title: A New Cadre of Experts Helps Women Navigate Their Divorces
description: The women are architects, film industry executives, skin care consultants, product managers at tech companies, psychologists. They have worked in finance, publishing and television, though some had scaled back or left the work force when their children were born.

title: Andal Ampatuan Sr., Suspect in Philippine Massacre, Dies During Trial

title: The Dodgers Departed Long Before Brooklyn Bounced Back

title: Counting All the DNA on Earth
