title: Republicans Look to Penalize Sanctuary Cities That Shield Illegal Immigrants
description: WASHINGTON  Slamming the Obama administration for failing to penalize cities that shield illegal immigrants, congressional Republicans on Tuesday started to pursue legislation that would withhold federal funds from these so-called sanctuary cities.

title: E. L. Doctorow Dies at 84; Literary Time Traveler Stirred Past Into Fiction
description: E. L. Doctorow, a leading figure in contemporary American letters whose popular, critically admired and award-winning novels  including Ragtime, Billy Bathgate and The March  situated fictional characters in recognizable historical contexts, among identifiable historical figures and often within unconventional narrative forms, died on Tuesday in Manhattan. He was 84 and lived in Manhattan and Sag Harbor, N.Y.

title: AT&Ts Bid for DirecTV Advances With Conditional Approval Order by F.C.C. Chief
description: AT&Ts proposed $48.5 billion takeover of the satellite company DirecTV is on the path to receiving a regulatory green light after Tom Wheeler, the chairman of the Federal Communications Commission, circulated a final order on Tuesday to approve the deal with conditions.

title: Yemen: Ship Loaded With Food Aid Reaches Aden
description: A ship full of aid chartered by the World Food Program, the United Nations antihunger agency, berthed Tuesday in Yemens southern port of Aden, the agency reported. It was the first vessel chartered by the agency to reach Aden since the Yemen conflict escalated nearly four months ago, when a Saudi Arabia-led bombing campaign began against Yemens Houthi rebels. In a statement, the World Food Program said the vessel, the MV Han Zhi, was loaded with 3,000 metric tons of food, enough to feed 180,000 people for one month. Muhannad Hadi, the agencys regional director, called the ships safe arrival a major breakthrough for our humanitarian response in Yemen, which has been frustrated by extremely limited access to the country, the poorest in the Arab world. The World Food Program has made repeated attempts to send ships to Aden but until Tuesday all had been blocked because of fighting. More than half of Yemens population of 24 million is thought to urgently need food assistance.

title: Health Care Tax Faces United Opposition From Labor and Employers
description: At the paper mill in Longview, Wash., Kurt Gallow and his wife, Brenda, are worrying about his companys proposed new health care plan, which would require workers to pay as much as $6,000 toward their families medical bills.

title: What About Cecils Unnamed Cousins?
description: The outcry over the killing of Cecil the lion suggests a strategy for saving the many other lions that are threatened by hunters. What if they too had names?

title: Jurors Get Case in Trial of New York State Senator Thomas Libous
description: WHITE PLAINS  State Senator Thomas W. Libous used his influence to arrange a high-paying job for his son, then tried to conceal his actions when interviewed by F.B.I. agents, federal prosecutors said Tuesday.

title: Obamas Plan for Guantnamo Is Seen Faltering
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama is enjoying a winning streak lately, with the Supreme Court reaffirming his signature health care law and Iran agreeing to curbs on its nuclear program. But one longstanding goal continues to bedevil him: closing the wartime prison at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba.

title: Limits at Gawker? Rules at Reddit? Wild West Web Turns a Page
description: Facing the abrupt resignations of two of his top editors on Monday and a potential revolt inside his newsroom, Gawker Medias founder and chief executive, Nick Denton, tapped out a long memo to his editorial staff.

title: Mixed Support for Donald Trump at Towers With His Name
description: Walker Lewis admits he would never have moved into Trump Tower, at 721 Fifth Avenue in Midtown Manhattan, five years ago if it were not for his wife, who already owned an apartment there on the 43rd floor.

title: Titans Clash as Donald Trumps Run Fuels His Feud With Rupert Murdoch
description: In the rarefied world of New York moguls, Rupert Murdoch never thought much of Donald J. Trump.

title: Assembly Speaker Takes the Pulse Beyond Albany
description: CICERO, N.Y.  It would have been tough to imagine a year ago that Carl E. Heastie would be lying in the middle of a gigantic car dealership in central New York having his blood drawn. But New York politics is unpredictable that way.

title: WithPlanned Parenthood Videos, Activist Ignites Abortion Issue
description: WASHINGTON   David Daleiden would only reluctantly talk about himself: I dont think Im the story, he said by phone on Tuesday. But he is the man behind the story and the hidden camera  the anti-abortion activist who has provoked a storm with his video stings alleging that Planned Parenthood clinics are selling tissue from aborted fetuses for profit, a charge the group denies.

title: Police Video Shows Sandra Blands Arrest
description: Waller County, Tex., officials released video from a dashboard camera showing Ms. Blands arrest in a traffic stop. She was later found dead in a jail cell. This footage includes vulgar language.

title: If Nothing Changes
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Thank goodness for revealers, especially in midweek puzzles. Revealers help pull together a theme that looks, at first glance, like a list of disparate items.

title: Colorado: Immigrant Leaves Sanctuary After 9 Months
description: A Mexican immigrant who lived for nine months in the basement of the First Unitarian Church in Denver to avoid deportation left the sanctuary Tuesday and returned to his home nearby, after immigration authorities notified him that they would not carry out his removal. Advocates have highlighted the case of the man, Arturo Hernndez Garca, 42, as a test of an enforcement program the Obama administration started this year to focus deportations on serious convicted criminals. Mr. Hernndez Garca, who has been in the United States without papers for 15 years and owns a small construction business with six employees, was identified by immigration agents as a result of his arrest on a criminal charge; he was later acquitted. Officials declined to cancel his deportation order but said they would not act on it.

title: Federal Report Says Many Doctors Use False Addresses for Medicare
description: Federal investigators said Tuesday that thousands of doctors and other health care providers had signed up to bill Medicare using questionable addresses like mailbox rental stores, vacant lots and a fast-food restaurant. The investigators, from the Government Accountability Office, said Medicare officials did not adequately verify the addresses that providers listed as their practice locations. The use of invalid addresses is an indicator of potential fraud, the investigators said in a report to Congress. The Medicare agency revised its screening procedures last year and weakened its internal controls, making it easier for some potentially ineligible providers and suppliers to qualify for Medicare payments, the report said. Medicare officials said they had revoked billing privileges for almost 28,000 providers and suppliers in the last few years.

title: Ferguson Is Expected to Hire Black Police Chief
description: FERGUSON, Mo.  Nearly a year after the shooting death of a black teenager by a white police officer, the City of Ferguson is expected to hire a new, interim police chief who is black, a city official here said on Tuesday.

title: Yes, They Found It in a Box
description: What Pet Should I Get?, a new book by Dr. Seuss, is a surprising addition to his beloved collection of childrens books. The manuscript was discovered in a box, along with these flashcards.

title: New Dr. Seuss Drawings Emerge Before Books Publication
description: Next week, for the first time since 1990, readers will get a fresh dash of whimsy from Theodor Seuss Geisel, better known as Dr. Seuss, with the publication of a long-lost manuscript, What Pet Should I Get?

title: Group Petitions to Save a Prehistoric Fish From Modern Construction
description: TARRYTOWN, N.Y.  The Atlantic sturgeon is among the oldest of fish species, dating from the time of the dinosaurs. It is the longest-living fish in the Hudson (up to 60 years), the largest (up to 14 feet) and the strangest-looking, with bony plates that make it look armored.

title: Despite Pollution Warnings, an Official Will Jump Into Onondaga Lake
description: As head of the Department of Environmental Conservation, Joseph Martens oversaw the decision to ban hydraulic fracturing for natural gas in New York State.

title: Mets Scoring Drought Ends With a Late Deluge
description: WASHINGTON  Trailing by a run in the seventh inning Tuesday, the Mets had runners on second and third with no outs and the bottom of their lineup coming to bat. In their last 76 at-bats with runners in scoring position, they had gotten a hit in only five instances. The odds of their scoring did not seem good.

title: Dean Skelos and His Son Face New Bribery Charges
description: It should have been a standard conversation, right out of the human resources playbook: Adam Skelos, a new employee, had regularly skipped work in his very first week, logging about one hour during the previous four days.

title: Case for New Trial for Johnny Hincapie in Subway Murder Centers on Witnesses
description: Mariluz Santana was standing on a subway platform in Manhattan in September 1990 when she witnessed six young men rob some tourists from Utah, an infamous crime in which Brian Watkins was fatally stabbed as he tried to protect his mother.

title: Brendan Ryans Rare Start for Yankees Leads to the Tiebreaking Hit
description: When Brendan Ryan was growing up in Los Angeles, he began to notice that whenever he went to a baseball tryout, a parade of players lined up to take ground balls at shortstop.

title: Bill Cosby Legal Team Complains of Smear
description: Bill Cosbys lawyers fought back Tuesday, asserting in a legal filing that he has been damaged by news media accounts that they said inaccurately portrayed him as having testified that he used powerful sedatives to drug women so he could molest them.

title: Red Bulls Knocked Out of U.S. Open Cup in Penalty Kicks
description: Lloyd Sam tied the game at 1-1 four minutes into second-half stoppage time on Tuesday, but the Red Bulls nonetheless went on to lose, 4-3, in penalty kicks to the visiting Philadelphia Union in the United States Open Cup quarterfinals.

title: Elio Fiorucci, Whose Disco-Era Temple of Fashion Changed Retail, Dies at 80
description: Elio Fiorucci, the fashion designer and retail visionary whose stores in Milan, London and New York encapsulated the flamboyance of the disco era and anticipated many later retail innovations, died on Monday at his home in Milan. He was 80.

title: Planters as Pleasing as Whats Inside Them
description: The Seattle-based furniture and interiors designer Trey Jones was inspired to create a debut collection of planters when he realized he was looking for something that didnt yet exist. I was searching for planters to go with a client project, Jones says. I couldnt find any that worked for the space, so I started to design one.

title: E. L. Doctorow: 1931-2015
description: The acclaimed American novelist and playwright E. L. Doctorow gives some writing tips. He died Tuesday in Manhattan at the age of 84 due to complications from lung cancer.

title: Tall Task in the Bronx
description: A crew of three at Yankee Stadium is responsible for keeping the rooftop banners of the 30 major league teams in their proper order based on the standings.

title: The Face of the Business
description: The ethicists consider the importance of keeping up appearances in an office.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday
description: 9 P.M. (Syfy) SHARKNADO 3: OH HELL NO! (2015) Theyre back  and wreaking havoc along the Eastern Seaboard, from Washington to Florida. David Hasselhoff and Bo Derek join Ian Ziering (as the chainsaw-wielding, shark-gutting Fin Shepard, now the recipient of a presidential medal) and Tara Reid (his wife, April). There are cameos by Mark Cuban (the president), Ann Coulter (the vice president), the former House representatives Michele Bachmann and Anthony Weiner, and Kathie Lee Gifford, Hoda Kotb, Frankie Muniz and Jerry Springer. When the original Sharknado ripped through the summer of 2013 on Syfy, many viewers no doubt thought that its climactic scene, the greatest in made-for-TV B-movie history, would never be topped, Neil Genzlinger wrote this week, reviewing the third iteration in The New York Times. They were wrong. He added, It will leave everyone who sees it speechless.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: It is designed to break a mans will to live.

title: Corrections: July 22, 2015
description: NATIONAL

title: Regulators Approve Merger of CIT and OneWest in $3.4 Billion Deal
description: Federal banking regulators have approved CIT Groups acquisition of OneWest bank, completing one of the largest deals in the financial services industry since the mortgage crisis.

title: An Abandoned Factorys Clinton Connection
description: Michael Borek talks for a living, as a freelance Czech interpreter for the United States government. So it shouldnt come as a surprise that when he isnt working, he relishes silence. He has spent years searching for and photographing old and dilapidated things, like abandoned industrial sites.

title: Certified Humane Farms
description: To the Editor:

title: Work More? Well, No
description: To the Editor:

title: Grading Nail Salons
description: To the Editor:

title: Clean Energy, Not Fracking
description: To the Editor:

title: The Case for a Tax on Financial Transactions
description: WASHINGTON  LIKE it or not, the campaign season is upon us, and that almost certainly means somebody is going to try to buy your vote with a tax cut  even though average federal tax rates are already low in historical terms, our tax code remains tilted in favor of the wealthy, and our children, neighborhoods and infrastructure desperately need public investment.

title: Drugs, Talk Therapy and the Brain
description: To the Editor:

title: A Milestone for Justice in Africa
description: On Monday, a landmark trial began that could herald a new era of justice and accountability in Africa. The former president of Chad, Hissne Habr, is being tried over atrocities committed during his rule in a new court set up in Senegal under the legal principle of universal jurisdiction for crimes against humanity.

title: Backing Up Our Wager With Iran
description: From the minute Iran detected that the U.S. was unwilling to use its overwhelming military force to curtail Tehrans nuclear program  and that dates back to the George W. Bush administration, which would neither accept Irans right to a nuclear fuel cycle nor structure a military or diplomatic option to stop it  no perfect deal overwhelmingly favorable to America and its allies was ever going to emerge from negotiations with Iran. The balance of power became too equal.

title: Giving Doctors Grades
description: ONE summer day 14 years ago, when I was a new cardiology fellow, my colleagues and I were discussing the case of an elderly man with worsening chest pains who had been transferred to our hospital to have coronary bypass surgery. We studied the information in his file: On an angiogram, his coronary arteries looked like sausage links, sectioned off by tight blockages. He had diabetes, high blood pressure and poor kidney function, and in the past he had suffered a heart attack and a stroke. Could the surgeons safely operate?

title: To Trump or Not to Trump?
description: Bob Kerrey served in the Senate with John McCain, is also a Vietnam veteran and has run for president, so he has been asked incessantly over recent days to appear on television and weigh in on Donald Trumps vile besmirching of McCains military record.

title: The Campaign of Deception Against Planned Parenthood
description: A hidden-camera video released last week purported to show that Planned Parenthood illegally sells tissue from aborted fetuses. It shows nothing of the sort. But it is the latest in a series of unrelenting attacks on Planned Parenthood, which offers health care services to millions of people every year. The politicians howling to defund Planned Parenthood care nothing about the truth here, being perfectly willing to undermine womens reproductive rights any way they can.

title: Cleaning Up the Port Authority
description: The bizarre traffic jam engineered two years ago at the George Washington Bridge by an associate of Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey provided dramatic evidence that the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey was badly in need of an overhaul. The authority controls the airports, tunnels, bridges and other facilities essential to the regional economy. Over the years it has become politicized and dysfunctional.

title: Medicare to Try a Blend of Hospice Care and Treatment
description: Most older Americans close to death have to make a difficult choice: continue with traditional medical treatment or switch to hospice care, which focuses not on a cure but on easing their remaining days.

title: Replacing the Irreplaceable
description: The famous East Indian fable of the mustard seed reminds us that no one is immune to tragedy. A grieving mother goes to the gods in her despair and demands that her dead son be resurrected and returned. The gods agree  if she can bring them a mustard seed from a house that has lost neither child nor parent, spouse nor sibling nor friend. The desperate mother roams door to door, returning empty-handed  and with a new understanding of the inevitability of loss.

title: Out-Faking the Fakers: Chinese Librarian Proud of Forged Masters
description: Read in Chinese |

title: Is This the End of Christianity in the Middle East?
description: There was something about Diyaa that his wifes brothers didnt like. He was a tyrant, they said, who, after 14 years of marriage, wouldnt let their sister, Rana, 31, have her own mobile phone. He isolated her from friends and family, guarding her jealously. Although Diyaa and Rana were both from Qaraqosh, the largest Christian city in Iraq, they didnt know each other before their families arranged their marriage. It hadnt gone especially well. Rana was childless, and according to the brothers, Diyaa was cheap. The house he rented was dilapidated, not fit for their sister to live in.

title: The China Challenge, by Thomas J. Christensen
description: China has major incentives to avoid unnecessary conflict, Thomas J. Christensen writes. But the United States has no experience tackling the least appreciated challenge: persuading a uniquely large developing country with enormous domestic challenges and a historical chip on its national shoulder to cooperate actively with the international community.

title: Men of War, by Alexander Rose
description: In 1976, John Keegan, a highly regarded military historian, published The Face of Battle, a famous account of what ordinary English soldiers experienced on the battlefields of Agincourt, Waterloo and the Somme. In Men of War, Alexander Rose, the author of Washingtons Spies, sets out to do something similar for the American soldiers who fought in what he arbitrarily calls the three most iconic battles in American history  Bunker Hill, Gettysburg and Iwo Jima.

title: Underage Models Return to the Runway and Reignite a Debate
description: Its a Cinderella story. A fairy tale. A total Cinderella moment.

title: Conservative Airwaves Grapple With Donald Trump, Aiding His Rise
description: The Republican Partys internal war over the rise of Donald J. Trump is playing out among candidates and campaign operatives, but nowhere is it being heard more loudly than on commuters car radios.

title: Afghan Security Forces Struggle Just to Maintain Stalemate
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  After suffering setbacks and heavy casualties at the hands of the Taliban in 2014, Afghan security forces came into this year with what Afghan and Western officials acknowledge were relatively modest goals: hang on till the end of the fighting season without major collapses.

title: A Hudson Yards Garden Will Grow With Concrete, Coolant and High-Power Fans
description: Any gardener will understand the challenges faced by the designers of the Public Square at Hudson Yards: Ensuring there is abundant water. Providing nutrient-rich soil. Finding a balance between sunlight and shade. Insulating the bottom of the planting beds from blasts of 150-degree heat rising out of an active train yard directly below.

title: Ai Weiwei, Chinese Artist and Provocateur, Is Given Back His Passport
description: HONG KONG  The Chinese artist Ai Weiwei said he was given back his passport on Wednesday after being barred from traveling abroad since he was detained in 2011 in Beijing.

title: How Walking in Nature Changes the Brain
description: Editors note: Though this article was first published last summer, were featuring it again because its always a good idea to get outside and into nature.

title: Tuesdays Travel News: Faster Border Crossing to Canada; Kabuki Shows in Las Vegas
description: Our weekday morning digest that includes consumer news, deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.

title: At VidCon, Small-Screen Stars and Big-Time Fame
description: They should post a sign in Anaheim, Calif., this week warning adults: Keep out! Screaming teens everywhere.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get the briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: New York Today: Rome in a Day
description: Good morning on this bright Wednesday.

title: Transforming the Fight Against Poverty in India
description: NEW DELHI  Transferring cash to poor families, on the condition that their kids attend school and get vaccinations, has been shown to be an effective way to reduce poverty and improve human health and well-being. Latin America is widely recognized as the pioneer of large-scale conditional transfer programs, starting with Mexico in the late 1990s and expanding across Brazil over the past decade.

title: Today in Politics:  On Crowded Stage, All Roles Now Seem to Be Cast
description: Good Wednesday morning from Washington, where President Obama continues to press for several favored deals, policies and initiatives. Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin is traveling to Tennessee, an important variable in his electoral math. But the newest name to be added to the contender list on Tuesday might have represented the final big announcement of the nominating race.

title: The Sweetness of Mexico
description: I dont know that Ive ever seen an Italian restaurant with an Aztec name, so I looked twice at Xochil Pizzeria, the O sporting a floppy chefs hat, to make sure Id read the sign correctly. I chuckled, turning to say something about it to Fany Gerson, but then realized that Fany Gerson might not be the most probable name for a Mexican woman, either.

title: Should I Ask My Secretary to Fix Her Teeth?
description: I have a small law practice with several employees. My secretary, who is the face of the firm to every client or prospective client who walks through the door, fell last December and knocked out eight front teeth. Since then she has not had them replaced or had dentures made. She comes to work with no front teeth, which is not the face I want put forward. She has health and dental insurance through my office, but she says shes too nervous about surgery and hates going to the dentist, so shes not going to do anything. Can I require her to fix her teeth or get dentures as a condition of continued employment? NAME WITHHELD, NEW YORK

title: In Chicago, the West Loop Leaves Its Gritty Past Behind
description: Over the past two decades, the West Loop, an industrial area in Chicago just west of the downtown Loop, has gradually shifted from meatpacking operations, commercial storage and food distribution to loft residences and restaurants. Its low-rise brick warehouses with unobstructed views of the downtown skyline were seen as attractive and affordable for restaurants and residents willing to put up with truck traffic from wholesalers. But in the past year, the area has rapidly developed as not just a place to taxi in for a trendy meal, but to stay a while.

title: New Data on 2 Alzheimers Drugs Alters Hope and Expectation
description: New data released on Wednesday raised hopes somewhat that an experimental Alzheimers drug from Eli Lilly & Company might be effective. At the same time, other results were released on Wednesday that could reduce expectations a bit for a similar drug being developed by Biogen.

title: Aurora Gunmans Mental State Poses Test for Jury Weighing Death Penalty
description: DENVER  For jurors weighing the fate of the man who killed 12 people in a Colorado movie theater, guilt may have been the easy part. It took less than two days of deliberation before they rejected defense arguments that the gunman, James E. Holmes, was legally insane when he carried out the 2012 shooting rampage.

title: The Unquiet Sky
description: Musing over a fireplace in Avignon in 1782, the inventor Joseph-Michel Montgolfier had a brain wave. What if the force lifting the embers from the fire could somehow be controlled and used to carry heavier things, even people? It could be a way for Spanish troops to finally take the hitherto impregnable fortress of Gibraltar. Joseph and his brother tienne immediately set to experimenting with hot air, which they believed had a special property called levity, and by late 1783, tienne was able to ascend in the Montgolfier balloon.

title: Manna or Mammon in Silicon Valley?
Morning Agenda: AT&T Gets Green Light
description: AT&T GETS GREEN LIGHT | AT&T is a step closer to becoming the largest television distributor in the United States. The Federal Communications Commission has given its proposed $48.5 billion takeover of the satellite company DirecTV conditional approval, Emily Steel reports in DealBook. The Justice Department has also said it would not challenge the acquisition.

title: Livestock Farmers Attack Supermarket
description: Protesters in Brittany demonstrated against the retail prices of meat, continuing weeks of actions intended to draw a response from the government.

title: Dodgers Joc Pederson Hits Homers That Travel, but He Has a Long Way to Go
description: ATLANTA  Joc Pederson is already an indispensable All-Star for a first-place team. He hits the longest home runs in the major leagues, reaches base often and plays center field better than anyone for the Los Angeles Dodgers in many years.

title: A Sleek Home at British Museum for Ferdinands Gift
description: LONDON  The Waddesdon Bequest, a sumptuous donation of Renaissance and Baroque gold, silver, rock crystal, amber, enamels, ivory, majolicas and sculptures left to the British Museum by Baron Ferdinand Rothschild (1839-98), is the only collection of its kind to be kept together within the museum. Now, thanks to a donation from the Rothschild Foundation, the bequest has at last found a suitably stylish and permanent room at the museum.

title: A Find in Britain: Quran Fragments Perhaps as Old as Islam
description: LONDON  The ancient manuscript, written on sheep or goat skin, sat for nearly a century at a university library, with scholars unaware of its significance.

title: More Than Their Mothers, Young Women Plan Career Pauses
description: Beginning in college, years before she planned to have children, Yi Gu began strategizing about how to have a career that was flexible enough to fit in family responsibilities.

title: Lily Rabe and Hamish Linklater: A Midsummer Nights Couple
description: Hamish Linklater was singing. Lily Rabe was not listening.

title: Classical Music This Week: Harry Partch and Mozarts Son
description: Classical Music This Week: Harry Partch and Mozarts Son

title: To Link or Not to Link? Gawker and More
description: When The Times wrote about the latest inside-the-media-bubble cause clbre recently, its report included no hyperlink to the very subject of the story: Gawkers nasty and pointless violation of an individuals privacy. (It amounted to Married Man With Famous Brother Tries to Hire Gay Escort.)

title: Lively Morgue Tumblr 542  544
description: Lively Morgue Tumblr 542  544

title: Reflexologists Are Squeezed by Cheaper Competitors and State Rules
description: For Lisa Freemantle, a 53-year-old former teacher, reflexology seemed like the perfect second career.

title: St. Jude Medical to Buy Thoratec for $3.4 Billion
description: St. Jude Medical said on Wednesday that it had agreed to buy a fellow medical device maker, the Thoratec Corporation, for about $3.4 billion in cash.

title: E. L. Doctorow in The Times
description: In 1960 in The New York Times Book Review, Wirt Williams reviewed a first novel by a philosophy major. The book was Welcome to Hard Times by E. L. Doctorow, the award-winning author who died on Tuesday at 84. Williams called Mr. Doctorows debut taut and dramatic, exciting and successfully symbolic.

title: A Well-Meaning Umbrella Throw
description: Dear Diary:

title: $1.2 Million Homes in California, Massachusetts, and Louisiana
description: WESTPORT, MASS.

title: Is This a Selfie?
description: ALL selfies are photos. Not all photos are selfies. This distinction is lost on many  including brands on Twitter, television news anchors, your parents, and lets be real, newspapers  which have used the word selfie to describe group photos, buildings, scenery and more. Its time to clear up what exactly a selfie is.

title: Verification Process in Iran Deal Is Questioned by Some Experts
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administrations claim that the Iran nuclear accord provides for airtight verification procedures is coming under challenge from nuclear experts with long experience in monitoring Tehrans program.

title: 30 Seconds With Chelsea Defender Gary Cahill
description: Chelsea, which won the Premier League title in May, will open its preseason Wednesday night with a friendly against the Red Bulls in Harrison, N.J. Defender Gary Cahill, who joined Chelsea in 2012 and won the Champions League in his first season, answered questions last week about European soccers ever-shrinking summer break, his former teammates Frank Lampard and Steven Gerrard, and the pressure (and pleasure) of playing for Manager Jos Mourinho. This interview has been edited and condensed.

title: On Day 3 of Delays, New Jersey Transits Shortfalls Are Painfully Clear
description: For the third day in a row, electrical problems in century-old rail tunnels under the Hudson River on Wednesday stymied the commutes of tens of thousands of New Jersey Transit riders, illustrating again the shortcomings of the regions languishing infrastructure system.

title: Home Depot to Buy Interline Brands for $1.6 Billion in Cash
description: Home Depot said on Wednesday that it had agreed to acquire Interline Brands, a supplier of maintenance and repair products to businesses, property managers and contractors, for $1.6 billion in cash.

title: House Hunting in New Brunswick, Canada
description: A FOUR-BEDROOM HOUSE ON A RIVER NEAR ST. JOHN, NEW BRUNSWICK

title: Excerpts of Obama on The Daily Show
description: President Obama teased Jon Stewart during an appearance on The Daily Show on Tuesday, but the two also tackled serious issues like the Iran nuclear deal.

title: Suicide Bomber in Suruc Is Said to Be a Turk With Possible Ties to ISIS
description: ISTANBUL  The suicide bomber who killed at least 32 people at a cultural center in southeastern Turkey has been identified as a Turkish citizen who is believed to have had ties to the Islamic State, a senior government official said Wednesday.

title: Con prstamos y exigencias, China expande su influencia en Amrica Latina
description: Por Clifford Krauss y Keith Bradsher

title: Daily Report: Apples Amazing Quarter Isnt Good Enough for Wall Street
description: Apples profit soared 38 percent and revenue rose 33 percent in its fiscal third quarter, as sales of iPhones continued to surge, Brian X. Chen reports.

title: Keeping Dictation on a Mac Private
description: Q. Why do you have to be online for the text dictation function to work in Mac OS X Yosemite?

title: Washington Post Files U.N. Petition to Seek Release of ReporterJason Rezaian
description: The Washington Post sought to raise pressure on Irans government on Wednesday over its year-old incarceration of Jason Rezaian, the newspapers Tehran correspondent, filing an urgent petition with a United Nations human-rights panel to seek his immediate release.

title: The Shadow of Death
description: Christianity was born in the Middle East, but with the rise of ISIS and other extremist movements across the region, its very survival there hangs in the balance.

title: For Aaron Nola in Debut, an Odd Baseball First
description: With more than a century of baseball history, it is not often that you see something that has never happened.

title: Tejay van GarderenWins Esteem, Only to Lose Speed and Abandon the Tour de France
description: BARCELONNETTE, France  At the beginning of this years Tour de France, the American Tejay van Garderen was irritated that he was generally not ranked among the favorites to win the race.

title: British University on Quran Fragments
description: Fragments of a Quran manuscript found at the University of Birmingham in England are believed to be from one of the oldest surviving copies of the Islamic text.

title: Suicide Bombing at Afghan Market Kills Dozens
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A suicide attack on Wednesday that targeted Afghan security forces in a crowded market in the northern province of Faryab left about two dozen people dead and dozens more wounded, officials said.

title: Sharing News on WhatsApp, an International Desk Experiment
description: One person responded with a thumbs up. Another with an emoji of two hands clapping. A third wrote: Thanks for the updates. Your efforts make Pope visit feel closer.

title: Greece Approves Second Set of Changes Needed for Bailout
description: ATHENS  Under the threat of yet another deadline, the Greek Parliament approved a second package of policy changes early Thursday that the countrys creditors had said must be in place before the detailed negotiations for a bailout of 86 billion euros could begin.

title: Fire Ravages New Jersey Warehouse
description: Aerial video shows firefighters in North Brunswick, N.J., battling a massive warehouse fire that broke out early Wednesday.

title: Chris Christie Donor List Includes High-Profile Names
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey released a list on Wednesday of dozens of Republican donors and business executives who will raise money for his presidential campaign, seeking to demonstrate that he will have the financial wherewithal to compete in the partys crowded field.

title: De Blasio, Inspired by Francis, Describes an Evolving Relationship With Faith
description: VATICAN CITY  His mother rejected her Catholic faith, and he grew up attending no church, a skepticism that, for Bill de Blasio, has endured to this day. As a young activist, he demanded change from the Vatican, aiding a reform movement that church leaders once denounced as a threat.

title: Romans Put Little Faith in Mayor as Their Ancient City Degrades
description: ROME  The grass in some public parks sways knee high. Disgruntled subway workers have slowed service to a crawl. Fire has rendered the citys largest airport crammed and chaotic. The arrests of public officials pile up, revealing mob infiltration of the city government.

title: Turmoil in Chinas Stock Markets Takes a Psychic Toll
description: The symptoms, medical experts say, appear suddenly and often linger for months: insomnia, irritability, depression and an obsession with tracking stock prices.

title: 1890: Shocking Tales of Buffalo Bill
description: NEW YORK  While that delightful dilettante of the plains, Buffalo Bill, is fascinating the crowned heads of Europe and reclining in luxury, some of the most famous of his Sioux warriors are straggling home, telling shocking tales of ill treatment and starvation. White-Horse- Kills-the-Weasel and Bear Pipe arrived in the steerage from Berlin. After devouring the first square meal they say they have had for months, they told of suffering which, though not directly attributable to Buffalo Bill, involves his agents seriously. The Indians say the food served to them was not fit for dogs.  The New York Herald, European Edition, July 23, 1890

title: The Historic Charm of Brooklyn Heights
description: Convenience to Manhattan might have been the original impetus for the growth of Brooklyn Heights, but the neighborhood continues to attract residents for other reasons as well, including its leafy streets, its abundant historic buildings and the expanding Brooklyn Bridge Park.

title: Living in Brooklyn Heights
description: Convenience to Manhattan, leafy streets, abundant historic buildings and the expanding Brooklyn Bridge Park are major neighborhood draws.

title: Paul Gebhard, Sex Researcher Who Worked With Kinsey, Dies at 98
description: Paul Gebhard, who with his mentor Dr. Alfred C. Kinsey broke American taboos by shifting sexual discourse from the bedroom to the living room and even beyond, died on July 9 in Columbus, Ind. He was 98.

title: Celebrated Bass-Baritone Plans a Surprise Debut at Conducting
description: VERBIER, Switzerland  It was a sad day for the classical music world, in 2012, when the great German bass-baritone Thomas Quasthoff announced his retirement from the concert stage at 52. Blessed with a rich, strong, beautiful voice, Mr. Quasthoff not only had established a major career against seemingly insuperable odds, but also had risen to the top of his profession.

title: The Half-Lives of Others (Wonkish)
description: What about Ireland? Thats what some people have been asking me; theyre under the impression that Ireland is a success story for austerity, and that this success is somehow a refutation of the broadly Keynesian account of the economy Ive been giving. So I guess some clarification is in order.

title: Verbatim: Marco Rubio Says the President Has No Class
description: Senator Marco Rubio of Florida on Fox News, comparing President Obama to Donald J. Trump.

title: Annoying Euro Apologetics
description: Are there good arguments against the proposition that the creation of the euro was an epic mistake? Maybe. But the arguments Ive been hearing lately are really bad. And theyre also deeply annoying.

title: A Road Trip in Mexico Gone Wrong
description: When my father heard I would be vacationing in Mexico and planned to rent a car, he told me, Just dont get lost in the desert down there. A week later, I was lost in the desert in Mexico.

title: Nicki Minaj: Black Women Rarely Rewarded for Pop Culture Contributions
description: The rapper Nicki Minaj reacted on Tuesday to not being nominated for MTVs coveted Video of the Year award by saying that the cultural contributions of black women are often overlooked, raising the specter of racism in the music industry, and setting off a Twitter debate that drew thousands of people  including Taylor Swift.

title: Chinas Missing Rights Lawyers
description: Profiles of some of Chinas most prominent civil rights advocates detained in a nationwide campaign.

title: Hillary Clinton Shows Weakness in Head-to-Head Polling Against Top Republicans
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton is showing some signs of weakness against potential Republican rivals in three swing states, according to a poll from Quinnipiac University that could raise concern within the Democrats campaign.

title: China Targeting Rights Lawyers in a Crackdown
description: BEIJING  More than 200 lawyers and associates have been detained, with 20 still in custody. Some have been paraded on television making humiliating confessions or portrayed as rabble-rousing thugs. A blast of commentaries in newspapers run by the Communist Party has accused them of subversion and swindles.

title: Slain Troops in Chattanooga Saved Lives Before Giving Their Own
description: CHATTANOOGA, Tenn.  Marines and sailors risked their lives for one another in Chattanooga last week, trying to distract the gunman who assaulted a naval center, helping people scale a fence for safety and returning fire at the attacker, law enforcement officials said Wednesday.

title: In Apple Watch Debut, Signs of a Familiar Path to Success
description: Asking if the Apple Watch will become a hit or a flop is a bit like asking if my 2-year-old daughter is destined to go to Yale or to jail. Interested parties can speculate on the basis of thin evidence  she learned to walk pretty early, though on the other hand, she still thinks cats say bow wow  but youth is inherently unpredictable, and anyone venturing a long-term forecast based on short-term performance runs the risk of looking quite silly.

title: Britain Plans to Cut Subsidies for Renewable Energy
description: LONDON  The British government on Wednesday announced plans to curb the costs of subsidies for renewable forms of energy like solar power, arguing that the industry could survive without the support.

title: Twitters Ill-Timed Frat Party
description: At a time when women are struggling for an equal place in Silicon Valley, Twitter has acknowledged that a Twitter Frat House party was not the best idea.

title: World Music Institute Festival Expanding in New York
description: The World Music Institute, a nonprofit organization that works to present traditional and contemporary international music and dance in the United States, announced the lineup on Tuesday for its first season under its new artistic director, Par Neiburger.

title: Prototype Festival Announces 2016 Lineup
description: The Prototype: Opera/Theater/Now festival, which has established itself as an important presenter of innovative new operas and musical works in New York, will return in January with the world premiere of Angels Bone, an opera about angels and human trafficking, by Du Yun with a libretto by Royce Vavrek, the festivals organizers announced Wednesday.

title: Writing Waves
description: For two years, between the fall of 2008 and the summer of 2010, I surfed nearly every day. At the time I was in my late 20s and living in San Francisco and in the sixth year of writing a bad novel about a young, disaffected man and his mentally disabled brother. Surfing, with all its repetition, physicality and mantras about having fun, offered me a ritualistic distraction from my disastrous writing life. I was already far too old and heavy-footed to ever have a chance at getting good, but I have an addictive personality and a relatively high tolerance for boredom, both of which are requisites for anyone who tries to learn to surf as an adult.

title: Jason Segel Makes a Career U-Turn as David Foster Wallace in The End of the Tour
description: For a while there it seemed that the coming David Foster Wallace movie was truly ill starred. Not only had it drawn the wrath of Wallaces estate and his widow, but the casting of Jason Segel in the lead role  surely a stunt, Wallaces fans said  had also unleashed howl after incredulous howl.

title: Stories From the Road
description: Authors recount memorable moments on tour.

title: Bill Cosby Team Begins Public Defense Campaign
description: Bill Cosbys legal team pressed forward on Wednesday with a vigorous public defense of the entertainer, arguing that while Mr. Cosby acknowledged embarrassing personal details in a legal deposition 10 years ago, he admitted to no crime, a fact they say has been lost in the recent wave of media coverage.

title: Bill Simmons to Join HBO, Going From Free Agency to Freedom
description: Bill Simmonss move to HBO, which was announced Wednesday after he had spent nearly three months in limbo, takes him to a premium network that can give him even more freedom to speak his mind than ESPN did and a chance to develop a strong TV presence.

title: Spotify Gains Access to Beatport Music and Videos
description: Spotify has struck a deal with the electronic music site Beatport that will bring it new music and video content, the latest step in its intensifying competition with Apple over streaming music.

title: Questions After Unarmed Ohio Man Is Killed in Traffic Stop
description: Officials in Ohio are investigating how a confrontation with a University of Cincinnati police officer on Sunday led to the shooting death of an unarmed black man.

title: Ryan Roches Guide to the Best of Upstate New York
description: When I first moved to New York City, I never would have believed that Id eventually long for the countryside again, says the designer Ryan Roche, laughing. But with little ones and living in Brooklyn, my day-to-day just wasnt very peaceful. I grew up in Idaho in a really small town, with horses and wide open space and lots of fresh air, and I wanted to get back to my country-girl roots. So in 2008, she and her family packed up the contents of their fourth-floor walk-up in Bushwick, and moved into a 17th-century stone farmhouse in the historic town of Hurley, N.Y.

title: Jose Antonio Vargas on Donald Trump, Rachel Dolezal and His MTV Documentary, White People
description: Jose Antonio Vargas is a Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist and immigration activist. His new documentary White People, which airs tonight on MTV, follows Mr. Vargas as he travels the country speaking to young people about issues of race, particularly what it means to be white and experience white privilege. Because, Mr. Vargas said, You cannot have a conversation about race in this country and not include white people in it.

title: Transport Groups Three Days to See, Inspired by Helen Keller
description: If I can get such pleasure from mere touch, how much more beauty must be revealed by sight. So wrote Helen Keller in an essay in The Atlantic Monthly in 1933, in which she imagined what she might choose to look upon were she given the use of her eyes for 72 hours. Now the Transport Group is trying to achieve the reverse effect, by imagining itself into the mind of Keller in a play that shares its title with that of the Atlantic article, Three Days to See.

title: On View
description: Alice Anderson discusses the copper wire works in her new show.

title: John Thain Clears Way for Regional Bank Mergers
description: John A. Thain is leading the way for regional bank deal making in the United States.

title: A Public Vow of Love, Doubling as an Act of Defiance
description: Dressed in flashy suits, custom made to match the blue and yellow of the Ukrainian flag, Taras Karasiichuk and Mykola Maslov stood before a clerk at the Manhattan marriage bureau on July 1 and spoke their wedding vows.

title: Dylann Roof, Charleston Shooting Suspect, Is Indicted on Federal Hate Crime Charges
description: WASHINGTON  The gunman who killed nine people at a South Carolina church in June plotted his attack for months, choosing his target because it was a nationally known historically black church, Attorney General Loretta E. Lynch said on Wednesday as she announced federal hate crime charges against him.

title: Donald Trumps Income and Wealth Are Shown in Filing but Are Hard to Pinpoint
description: Donald J. Trump earned just $14,222 in salary. He owes at least $265 million in debt. He is paid about $250,000 per speech. And he received $110,000 from a pension with the Screen Actors Guild.

title: Patricia Crone, Questioning Scholar of Islamic History, Dies at 70
description: Patricia Crone, a scholar who explored untapped archaeological records and contemporary Greek and Aramaic sources to challenge conventional views of the roots and evolution of Islam, died on July 11 at her home in Princeton, N.J. She was 70.

title: Prince Royce, a Bachata Star, Talks About His First English Album
description: For the last few years, Prince Royce has had a productive career as bachatas runner-up, thriving in the long shadow cast by the genres biggest star, Romeo Santos. He sings with swagger and sweetness, and over three albums, hes demonstrated the continued vitality of bachata, a ballad-driven style born in the Dominican Republic.

title: New York Plans $15-an-Hour Minimum Wage for Fast Food Workers
description: The labor protest movement that fast-food workers in New York City began nearly three years ago has led to higher wages for workers all across the country. On Wednesday, it paid off for the people who started it.

title: Italy Arrests 2 Men Accused of Planning Terrorist Attacks
description: ROME  The Italian police on Wednesday arrested two men accused of plotting attacks on national landmarks in Italy and of posting threatening messages online in support of the Islamic State.

title: MacArthur Foundation to Close Offices in Russia
description: MOSCOW  The MacArthur Foundation is closing its offices in Russia after more than 20 years of grant-making here, becoming the latest casualty of new restrictions meant to limit the influence of foreign organizations in Russia.

title: Caitlyn Jenner Is the Subject of I Am Cait, a Show About a New Reality
description: Why did I decide to do a series? Caitlyn Jenner ponders in a trailer for I Am Cait, debuting on Sunday at 8 p.m. Eastern on E! Im telling my story. People dont understand looking into the mirror and nothing seems right. Putting on clothes that you just really dont identify with. This is about getting to be who you really are.

title: Aktion! Art and Revolution in Germany, 1918-19 Captures German Expressionism
description: Aktion! Art and Revolution in Germany, 1918-19 is the latest exhibition to be drawn from the rich holdings of the Robert Gore Rifkind Center for German Expressionist Studies at the Los Angeles County Museum of Art.

title: 3 Spanish Journalists Missing in Syria and Feared Abducted
description: BAGHDAD  Three Spanish journalists have been missing for several days in northern Syria, according to a Spanish journalism organization, amid growing fears that they may have been abducted.

title: U.N. Official Quits Amid Scrutiny of Response to Sex Abuse Accusations
description: UNITED NATIONS  The first high-ranking United Nations official to have been informed of accusations of child sexual abuse by French soldiers in the Central African Republic last year, who took no action at the time, has resigned from her post, United Nations officials confirmed on Wednesday.

title: Mostly Mozart Festival and the Knights Feature Don Quixote
description: As usual, the Mostly Mozart Festival kicks off with Louis Langre conducting the festival orchestra in an all-Mozart program on Tuesday. The soprano Erin Morley, known for her chiseled coloratura, performs two insertion arias, Vorrei spiegarvi, oh Dio and No, che non sei capace, that Mozart wrote for a Don Quixote opera by the now long-forgotten Pasquale Anfossi. The stalwart pianist Emanuel Ax takes on the sunny Piano Concerto No. 14 in E flat; the exuberant Symphony No. 34 rounds out the program.

title: Arena Builds and Crumbles a Temporary Civilization Through Dance
description: The beauty of ancient sites lies partly in their decay. We call them ruins with affection; its the pillar intact and the pillar crumbled, side by side, that tell a compelling story. The multidisciplinary dance artist Walter Dundervill is something of an archaeologist of self-made worlds where grace sits at the edge of destruction. He layers historical references on top of one another, places them in colorful, immersive environments of his own design and populates them with splendidly clad characters. Then he starts excavating.

title: Which Was Bigger: The Greek or American Bailout?
description: A comparison of the Greek and American bailouts and their economic impact.

title: Don Cheadles Biopic of Miles Davis to Close New York Film Festival
description: Don Cheadles directorial debut, Miles Ahead, in which he also stars as the jazz legend Miles Davis, will make its world premiere as the closing night selection of the New York Film Festival, which runs this year from Sept. 25 through Oct. 11. Mr. Cheadle also wrote the script for the film, which focuses on Daviss hermit-like life in the late 70s, holed up in his apartment on Manhattans Upper West Side. The film stars Emayatzy Corinealdi, who played the lead role in Ava DuVernays 2012 film Middle of Nowhere, and Ewan McGregor as the journalist Dave Brill.

title: Ikea to Offer Repair Kits for Furniture at Risk of Tipping
description: Two childrens deaths and several injuries caused by furniture that tipped over have prompted Ikea to offer free repair kits for an estimated 27 million chests and dressers.

title: Employee Held in Paris National Library Theft
description: PARIS  The French police have detained a low-level employee of the National Library of France in connection with the disappearance of a collection of 43 engravings by 16th-century artists valued at up to 172,000 euros (about $190,000).

title: In Hollywood, Its a Reboot by Any Other Name
description: To Hollywood, reboot is a four-letter word.

title: U.S. Should Send Troops to Fight ISIS, John Kasich Tells New Hampshire
description: GREENLAND, N.H.  The day after he announced his presidential campaign, Gov. John R. Kasich of Ohio told New Hampshire voters on Wednesday that the United States government should rally support for sending troops to fight the Islamic State.

title: Israeli Troops Kill Palestinian During West Bank Clash
description: TEL AVIV  A young Palestinian man was shot and killed by Israeli troops during an operation in a West Bank town early Wednesday, the Israeli military said.

title: App Smart | Grill Like a Pro
description: Summer is the time for grilling. Several new apps can help you cook your burgers to perfection.

title: Video Feature: Summertime, and the Grilling Is Easy, With Help
description: Its summer, the perfect time for the sizzling sun to be joined by sizzling sounds from your grill. But since grilling is an art, and its easy to ruin a piece of meat on the flames, you may be seeking a little help from the right recipe apps to help cook up some mouthwatering feasts and avert a barbecue disaster.

title: Californias Big Groundwater Problem
description: California struggles to measure how much water its heaviest users draw from its rivers and streams. Now a ProPublica report highlights another problem: The state, along with parts of Arizona, isnt accounting for the fact that pumping groundwater can deplete surface water too.

title: Bernie Sanders Proposes Federal Minimum Wage of $15 an Hour
description: Speaking before hundreds of striking federal contract workers outside the Capitol, Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont unveiled legislation Wednesday that would raise the national minimum wage to $15 an hour.

title: Union Square Cafe Will Take Over City Crab Space
description: Union Square Cafe, the restaurant that brought the farm-to-table movement to New York City and has helped transform American fine dining since it opened in 1985, has found a new home in its Manhattan neighborhood despite worries that it would have to leave.

title: Lindsey Graham Destroys Cellphone After Donald Trump Discloses His Number
description: A meat cleaver, a blender, a golf club, some lighter fluid and a roof: Senator Lindsey Graham used them all to destroy a cellphone, a day after Donald J. Trump read his number out loud at a campaign rally.

title: Banamex USA Fined for Lack of Safeguards Against Money Laundering
description: Federal and state banking regulators have fined a Citigroup unit over its failure to employ adequate safeguards against illicit financial transactions or other suspicious activities.

title: 36 Hours in Siem Reap
description: Beyond Angkor Wat, Siem Reap has its own allure, with enticing dining options, stylish shops, genial residents and a laid-back river town ambiance.

title: Patrick Stickles Gets Very Specific
description: Patrick Stickles, the lead singer of the Brooklyn via New Jersey punk band Titus Andronicus, calls his new album  a 29-track, 93-minute, five-act rock opera about his manic depression called The Most Lamentable Tragedy (Merge)  precious and belabored. He means it lovingly, with a realistic amount of self-deprecation, long a key tenet of his songwriting.

title: 36 Hours in Siem Reap, Cambodia
description: A decade ago Siem Reap was the place where you stayed, ate and grabbed a beer or two between explorations of Cambodias 12th-century temple complex Angkor Wat. Now the city that Angkor made is something of a destination itself, luring visitors with a lively and varied dining scene, stylish hotels, genial residents and a laid-back river town ambience. Add a growing community of Cambodian and international artists, performers and designers reviving traditional arts and experimenting with new means of creative expression (the Angkor Wat International Film Festival celebrated its fourth year in February; the Angkor Photo Festival runs in December) and youve got an ideal short-break city, whether or not the temples are on your agenda. (Plan on using dollars in Siem Reap, where most prices are quoted in American currency. Small bills come in handy for incidentals like tuk-tuk rides and bottled water.)

title: F.B.I. Discusses Chattanooga Shooter
description: Edward W. Reinhold, the special agent in charge of the F.B.I.s Knoxville, Tenn., office, said on Wednesday that it was too early to tell if the shooter in Chattanooga had been radicalized.

title: Sean and Sara Watkins Celebrate a Debut Album, Watkins Family Hour
description: Sean and Sara Watkins have been known for most of their lives as two-thirds of Nickel Creek, the expansive, pop-literate bluegrass band. But since 2002, they have also parlayed their sibling chemistry into the Watkins Family Hour a residency at the Los Angeles club Largo, anchored by Mr. Watkins on flatpicking acoustic guitar, Ms. Watkins on fiddle, and a heavyweight supporting cast including the singer Fiona Apple and the keyboardist Benmont Tench. To celebrate the release of its oak-solid debut album, Watkins Family Hour (Family Hour/Thirty Tigers), the whole crew will settle in Tuesday through Thursday at City Winery, with guest vocalists including Tift Merritt, Michael Daves and Ashley Monroe.

title: Listen to Me Marlon Lets Brando Talk
description: Marlon Brando has been dead 11 years, but he lives eerily on in Listen to Me Marlon, which begins a two-week run on July 29 at Film Forum. The movie creates a fitful biography of Brando using hundreds of hours of audio recordings he made and a weird holographic head of the actor. With Brandos somewhat trippy observations as a guide, it looks at career highlights as well as the personal calamities that seemed to follow the man, like the suicide of his daughter Cheyenne.

title: Conjoined Twins Born in India
description: A doctor in India discussed the condition of conjoined twins sharing a liver who were born in the countrys northwestern Rajasthan state.

title: Boeing Lowers Profit Outlook on Tanker Charge in 2nd Quarter
description: Boeing on Wednesday lowered its profit guidance for 2015 and said that a pretax $835 million charge to cover problems developing a refueling plane for the Air Force had helped drag down second-quarter earnings from core operations 14 percent.

title: The Wedding Trip
description: Taras Karasiichuk and Mykola Maslov came from Ukraine to New York to walk the streets hand in hand, to steal a public kiss: little things that are nearly impossible at home.

title: Farewell Is in View for Jennie Somogyi, a City Ballet Lifer
description: Jennie Somogyi, who as a child played Marie in George Balanchines The Nutcracker at New York City Ballet and then went on to become a celebrated principal dancer with the company, performing major roles and battling her way back from several serious injuries, plans to retire this fall, the company announced on Wednesday.

title: From the Mouth of an Artist Whose Own Fiery Hair Is Her Inspiration
description: There have been moments in the career of Alice Anderson when it felt as though her flame-red hair might just eclipse her. It is, after all, the artists constant inspiration, fantastically rendered time and again by her deft hands in copper wire. But her new show, Memory Movement Memory Objects, deflects the focus from her own physiognomy and out into the wider world  albeit in a familiarly burnished hue. In a throwback to childhood days spent playing with bobbins and unpicking hems, the London sculptor has turned again to the threadlike medium of copper wire to painstakingly mummify some 100 everyday objects as disparate as record players and human bones  but has left the work of covering a 1967 Ford Mustang to the shows visitors. In her own words, she tells T the significance of a sample of these precious, tightly bound treasures, which are on view at the Wellcome Collection in London beginning today.

title: Dr. Seuss and the Book Review Remind Us of the Joys of Childhood Reading
description: This week, for the first time ever, the Book Review featured a picture book on its cover  a book that, for all of its 32 pages, holds fewer words than the first page of an average novel.

title: Saudi Arabia Approves of Iran Nuclear Deal, U.S. Defense Chief Says
description: JIDDA, Saudi Arabia  Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter gave a surprisingly upbeat assessment on Wednesday of American relations with Saudi Arabia, asserting that the kingdom welcomed the international nuclear deal reached with its regional rival, Iran.

title: Taxi Mogul, Filing Bankruptcy, Sees Uber-Citibank Plot
description: Evgeny Freidman, the taxi mogul, warned New York officials this spring that he was too big to fail and asked for a bailout of the taxi industry. He didnt get one. So, on Wednesday, he filed a petition to put many of his taxi medallion-owning companies into bankruptcy.

title: De Blasio Administration Dropping Plan for Uber Cap, for Now
description: The de Blasio administration has backed away from its fight with the app company Uber, agreeing on Wednesday to drop for now its plan to place a cap on the number of vehicles Uber operates in New York City.

title: Actors: Share Your Special Skill
description: Are you an actor with an unusual skill or an eye-popping expertise? The New York Times would like to hear about your talents.

title: New York Seeks Information on Wall Street Messaging Platform
description: New Yorks top financial regulator is asking questions about whether a new messaging platform being developed by Wall Street banks could make it easier for traders to conspire to manipulate prices and commit misdeeds.

title: Washington Post Editor Discusses Rezaian
description: The Posts executive editor, Martin Baron, spoke after filing a petition with the United Nations in the hopes that the U.N. will pressure Iran to release the correspondent Jason Rezaian.

title: Review: In Among the Ten Thousand Things, Julia Pierponts First Novel, a Family Struggles
description: Reading Among the Ten Thousand Things, Julia Pierponts sharp, knowing dissection of an unraveling marriage, I kept thinking of Tolstoys overused remark that All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way. Along with There are no second acts in American life, it has got to be one of the least-true famous literary observations out there.

title: Review: Jessie Joness Solo Album
description: JESSIE JONES

title: Thomas Libous, New York State Senator, Is Convicted of Lying to F.B.I.
description: WHITE PLAINS  State Senator Thomas W. Libous, who became one of the most powerful lawmakers in Albany but had his life upended by cancer and a corruption case, was found guilty on Wednesday of lying to agents from the Federal Bureau of Investigation who were examining his sons hiring at a politically connected law firm.

title: Attorney General On Hate Crime Charges
description: Loretta E. Lynch, the United States attorney general, announced on Wednesday that Dylann Roof will face federal hate crime charges in the shooting deaths of nine Charleston church members.

title: Early Robert Venturi House in Philadelphia Is for Sale
description: The future of yet another post-Modernist building hangs in the balance. A house in the Chestnut Hill section of Philadelphia that the architect Robert Venturi designed for his mother, and which is known as theVanna Venturi House, is on the market for the first time since 1973.

title: With Door to Important Win Open, Mets Hit a Wall
description: WASHINGTON  The Nationals had the tying runs on first and second with one out in the bottom of the eighth inning of a 3-1 game when Mets Manager Terry Collins first wondered if he should change pitchers. Bobby Parnell was on the mound, having surrendered a walk and a single, and Collins sent word to his bullpen to have Jeurys Familia, the teams closer, start warming up.

title: Donald Trump, Stealing Spotlight With Caustic Comments, Eclipses His Rivals
description: The month of July once held great potential for Republican presidential candidates hoping for momentum to carry them into the first primary debates.

title: Royal Caribbean Cruise Ship Has Small Fire in Jamaica
description: Royal Caribbean said that one of its cruise ships, Freedom of the Seas, had experienced a brief fire on Wednesday morning as it was pulling into the port of Falmouth, Jamaica. The company said the fire, which took place in a mechanical room, had been rapidly contained and extinguished.

title: Durand
description: Images

title: Review: New Albums From Midnight Ramble Veterans, Including Amy Helm
description: AMY HELM

title: Stock Downturn Hits Chinese Investors in the Heart, Not Just the Wallet
description: HONG KONG  Farmers turned village community centers into makeshift trading floors. Young workers quit low-paying jobs to play the market full time. Retirees started investment clubs, counseling one another on stock picks.

title: Qualcomm Reports Lower Earnings and Says It Will Cut Jobs
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Qualcomm had one of the best playbooks in tech, but it looks like the game is changing.

title: Coca-Cola Profit Up 19%, Despite Lower Sales
description: How long will consumers continue to pay more for less soda?

title: Airline Upgrades Are Reaching Economy Passengers
description: Passengers at the rear of airplanes have had little to cheer for a long time, and the Justice Departments recent inquiry into allegations of collusion between carriers to control capacity, and in that way fares, has done little to improve relations. Still, several carriers have quietly restored or added a few creature comforts in economy class.

title: A Panoply of Products to Improve the Daily Commute
description: Whether you are commuting to work by train, car or bike, the trip can become monotonous. But with the right mix of technology, there are plenty of ways to keep the travel time from dragging. Here are some notable gadgets to make your daily commute less of a grind.

title: Orange Peel Bakery
description: Julianne Vanderhoop makes raspberry bars with an almond crust.

title: Andy Kindler Gives the Funny Business Its Annual Review
description: Look out, Jerry Seinfeld. You are in Andy Kindlers cross hairs.

title: To Push a Runner, Friends Give a Tough-to-Beat Gift
description: It was unusual, as birthday presents go: When their Ironman competitor pal turned 30, a group of friends in New York City hired an elite distance runner to take him on a workout, flying her in from Arizona for a showdown on a Manhattan track.

title: Review: Antigona, From Noche Flamenca, Pairs Rhythmic Dance With Greek Drama
description: Flamenco paired with ancient Greek tragedy? Its the kind of idea that makes the brow furrow. But in Soledad Barrio and Noche Flamencas dark and explosive Antigona, this odd-couple match makes an Aha! kind of sense, uniting two fierce and stylized forms to tell the story of a sisters defiance of a king in defense of her dead brother.

title: Abbotts Chief Supports Mylans Bid for Perrigo
description: Several analysts and investors were surprised last month when Abbott Laboratories said that as a shareholder in Mylan it would support its fellow drug makers quest to buy a rival and avoid a takeover by another company.

title: Starbucks Joins With Lyft on Loyalty Program
description: Starbucks said on Wednesday that it would team up with Lyft, the ride-hailing start-up, in an arrangement that would give Lyft customers incentives to earn perks through Starbucks loyalty program.

title: Lets Go for a Skywalk
description: Do look down.

title: The Performer and Baker Kristin Worrall Shares a Recipe for Her Very Dramatic Vampire Kupcakes
description: Blogs may be bored of cupcakes, but the performer, sound designer and former Jean-Georges pastry chef Kristin Worrall doesnt care  though, she explains, she did try to elevate them a bit when baking 200 exclusive Vampire Kupcakes for the upcoming premiere of the experimental theater troupe Radioholes Tarzana! this weekend, which caps off Mass Live Arts third season. Hes pretty sweet, though he looks a little evil, she says with a laugh of the Kupcake, a delectable confection of ganache, raspberry curd and chocolate Swiss buttercream. The blood filled treats, with eyes and fangs made of royal icing, are an integral aspect of the performance  even if their role takes place off stage. Theyre for audience members only, served with milk as the Radiohole actors thrash about onstage. Theres a lot of drinking, sweat, saliva and skin  not the most palatable stuff, Worrall says of the performance. Radiohole, their aesthetic is super punk, I would say. Its a crazy experience, its a feast for all the senses  including cupcakes.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres the latest.

title: Aalto Resort 2016
description: Select pieces from the collection designed by Tuomas Merikoski.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Our nightly rundown will get you caught up on the big stories.

title: Way Cleared for Shell to Start Drilling in Arctic Ocean
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration cleared the way on Wednesday for Shell to start drilling in the Arctic Ocean this summer, but the safety restrictions it is imposing could slow the pace at which rigs strike oil.

title: Review: Orpheus Chamber Orchestra Gets Personal in Central Park
description: The trees started rustling ominously, and the sky darkened as the Orpheus Chamber Orchestra performed the first movement Presto of Haydns Symphony No. 1, a sense of urgency reflected in its bristling rendition at the Naumburg Bandshell on Tuesday evening. A few drops fell during the lilting Andante, and a handful of umbrellas sprouted amid the large crowd of listeners.

title: With Caitlyn Jenners New Show, a Reality Producer Tries to Tame the Antics
description: LOS ANGELES  I Am Cait, the new E! reality series starring Caitlyn Jenner, begins at 4:32 a.m. with Ms. Jenner wide-awake. Looking exhausted, she stares into a camera and agonizes over the stress in becoming a sudden role model for transgender people everywhere. I hope I get it right, she says, twice.

title: Review: In I Am Cait, Caitlyn Jenner Documents a Changing Self
description: As Caitlyn Jenner continues to live out her well-documented gender transition, theres one area in which she has returned to her heyday as Bruce Jenner, Olympic champion. Once again shes a polished, effective pitchwoman, selling acceptance and transgender pride as capably as she once sold breakfast cereal.

title: Review: Ashley Monroe Releases The Blade
description: ASHLEY MONROE

title: Irish Haven in Brooklyn
description: One of the last of the original stevedore Irish pubs in Sunset Park.

title: What Was Legal in Sandra Blands Arrest
description: A legal analysis of the arrest by Brian T. Encinia, a Texas state trooper, of Sandra Bland.

title: Connecting With Syrian Refugees
description: A project to explore connections among strangers on social media led one couple to get Syrian refugees to answer questions from curious strangers.

title: How to Add a Sporty Pop to Your Midsummer Look
description: Tevas get a big lift this summer with striped flatforms, Stefan Grosse applies her love of tennis to clothing that looks good off the court and more.

title: This Place
description: Matthew Griffin married Raymie Wolfe in June in White Pine, Tenn., where the men were denied a marriage license two years earlier under state law.

title: Tom Brokaw Joins Eisenhower Memorial Commissions Advisory Panel
description: Even as the fate of a memorial to President Dwight D.Eisenhowerremains uncertain, the TV anchor and author Tom Brokaw has joined the advisory committee of the commission in charge of getting it built on the National Mall in Washington.

title: Dispute Over Sandra Blands Mental State Follows Death in a Texas Jail
description: HEMPSTEAD, Tex.  A 28-year-old woman whose arrest this month during a traffic stop ended with her hanging death in a county jail cell told officials that she tried last year to kill herself, the Texas sheriff who oversees the jail said on Wednesday. But the jailers did not put her on suicide watch, and her familys lawyer said that relatives had no evidence that she had ever tried to commit suicide or struggled with depression.

title: Pictures of the Day  Burundi and Elsewhere
description: Burundi and More: Pictures of the Day

title: July 22, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Burundi, the West Bank, England and Portugal.

title: Five Views of 2 World Trade Center
description: A look at Bjarke Ingels Groups design for 2 World Trade Center, the final building overlooking the site where the twin towers were destroyed.

title: Penny Skateboards Find a Niche
description: When Lauren Waxenberg, 9, isnt around, theres one toy of hers that her dad, Scott, likes to borrow: a tiny, pink, plastic skateboard with purple wheels.

title: Amanda Brooks and Kate Betts Turn Literary With New Memoirs
description: There may be no better setting for Horatio Alger tales than the fashion industry (from rags to rag trade), but in fact such stories are relatively rare. This is made plain in two new memoirs by women whose career paths were paved, if not with diamonds, with single strands of pearls.

title: Caffeine Inhalers Rush to Serve the Energy Challenged
description: In a culture that has already infused caffeine into everything including popcorn, cookies, lip balm, hot sauce, ice cream and, yes, personal lubricant, its not surprising that some people may find the simple act of sipping  coffee, tea, whatever  to achieve a buzz painstakingly backward.

title: Shopping Events and Sales Happening This Week in New York
description: Escape from the heat at the Dover Street Market New Beginning, the fashion emporiums biannual seasonal changeover, when pieces from brand-new lines are added to its roster. Those include an Alyx zip boot ($825) by the onetime Kanye West creative director Matthew Williams and Saturn earrings by the French jewelry designer Charlotte Chesnais. The earrings have interlocking circles inspired by the planets rings ($550). At 160 Lexington Avenue.  On Thursday, the 70s-inspired accessories label Madison Harding will open a weeklong pop-up in NoLIta, where youll find cute vintagey bits like a whipstitch-edged pouch ($65) and calf-suede covered platforms ($165) as well as Me and You cotton tees ($48) and signed copies of Petra Collinss book Babe ($29.95). At 252 Mott Street.  On Friday from 11 a.m. to 6 p.m., and every Friday for the rest of the summer, Into the Gloss will host Summer Fridays at Glossier, where you can shop the full range of products from the beauty blogs in-house line, like Coconut Balm Dotcom skin salve ($12), and chill out in an Escape Room installation by the artist Grace Villamil. Bonus: Juice Press is on tap. At 123 Lafayette Street, penthouse.

title: Jonathan Franzen and Mavis Staples Among Highlights at 92nd Street Y
description: The New York debut of Jonathan Franzens new novel, an 80th birthday party for the chef Jacques Ppin, a joint concert by Mavis Staples and Joan Osborne, a talk by Chelsea Clinton and appearances by a gaggle of comedians, models and actors in a self-reflective mode will be among the highlights of the 92nd Street Ys 2015-16 season.

title: Six Designers You Should Get to Know From Mens Fashion Week
description: Meet John Elliott, Jackson McKeehan of Boyswear and others.

title: Did Mens Fashion Week Work? Michael Kors and Others Say Yes
description: The metrics will determine whether the long-planned New York Fashion Week: Mens was the success its organizers hoped for. Yet immediate reaction to the first consolidated mens wear week since 2001 suggested an industry in an unexpectedly buoyant mood.

title: Fire Risk Prompts Fiat Chrysler to Recall 350,000 Vehicles
description: Fiat Chrysler is recalling about 350,000 Journey sport utility vehicles, including about 144,000 in the United States, because a plastic engine cover could come loose, contact a hot exhaust and cause a fire, the automaker said on Wednesday. Three fires in Chile resulting in one minor injury prompted the automakers investigation, a spokesman for Chrysler, Eric Mayne, said in an email. He said eight vehicles in the United States have had the problem, but while there was heat damage, there were no fires. The recalled vehicles are the four-cylinder models of the 2011-15 Dodge Journey, and a sibling sold outside North America as the Fiat Fremont.

title: 1965: Home Resigns as Tory Leader
description: LONDON In a surprise move, Sir Alec Douglas-Home today stepped down as leader of the opposition Conservative party. The likeliest successor to the 62- year-old Sir Alec, who was prime minister for a year, is one of two younger men  Edward (Ted) Heath, 49, or Reginald Maudling, 48. Sir Alecs resignation gives the go-ahead to the Conservatives to be an up-to-date, hard-hitting organization open to all classes. Mr. Heath and Mr. Maudling never went to Eton or other fancy prep schools and are immune from the charge that only the rich run the Conservative organization.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, July 23, 1965

title: I.R.S. Targets Tax Dodge by Private Equity Firms
description: The Internal Revenue Service on Wednesday proposed a rule aimed at ending a common and lucrative practice among private equity firms that allows them to artificially lower their partners personal income tax bills.

title: John Kasich Looks to Stand Out From Bigger Names in 2016 Race
description: GREENLAND, N.H.  Gerry Sedor can remember when Gov. John R. Kasich of Ohio was a Republican congressman, working with the Democratic Clinton administration in the 1990s to balance the federal budget.

title: University of California System Set to Raise Minimum Wage to $15 an Hour
description: LOS ANGELES  The University of California system will raise the minimum wage for its employees and contract workers to $15 an hour, university officials announced on Wednesday, the latest in a string of recent victories for labor leaders here who have fought to increase workers pay.

title: Fox News Memo Details Qualifying Guidelines for the First Presidential Debate
