description: As the Republican Party frets about how Donald Trump could affect its first presidential debate, each of the 16 presidential campaigns on Wednesday received critical guidelines from Fox News, the cable channel that will host and broadcast the August 6 debate.

title: Wariness as Auto Industry Eyes Mexico for Growth
description: DETROIT  The unlikely comeback of the American auto industry has generated tens of thousands of new jobs at Fiat Chrysler, Ford and General Motors.

title: From an Undocumented Boyhood to a Doctorate
description: As Dan-el Padilla Peralta toggled fluidly between worlds for much of his life  ancient and modern, poor and privileged, Dominican and American  there were times when he managed to forget he was a child without a country.

title: Daily H.I.V. Drug Regimen Is Effective in African Women, Study Says
description: Taking an antiretroviral drug daily shielded 76 percent of young African women assigned the drug  a particularly hard group to protect  against H.I.V. infection, researchers said Wednesday as they reported the results of a three-nation clinical trial.

title: Anthem Said to Be Close to Deal to Buy Cigna for $48 Billion
description: The American health insurance market might soon become even smaller.

title: Redesigning New York
description: The Timess architecture critic, Michael Kimmelman, spoke with the Danish architect Bjarke Ingels about three of his projects in New York. They spoke at the Cities for Tomorrow conference on July 20.

title: Bjarke Ingels Is Reshaping the Architecture of New York City
description: When it comes to New Yorks urban future, Bjarke Ingels may be the most important architect you have never heard of.

title: Small Exporters Back Obama on Export-Import Bank
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Wednesday met with small exporters to make his case that Congress should quickly reauthorize the Export-Import Bank, even as legislative turmoil in the Senate threatened supporters strategy for reviving the bank, which helps finance sales of American products abroad.

title: YouTubes Historical Footage Expands, Both Serious and Silly
description: The Associated Press and British Movietone, a newsreel archive, are uploading nearly 17,000 hours of historical footage to YouTube, making available a mix of monumental and offbeat news coverage dating to 1895.

title: Campaign for Congressional Backing of Iran Nuclear Deal Begins
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama formally began his lobbying campaign in Congress on Wednesday to secure the Iran nuclear deal, deploying three cabinet secretaries to the Capitol for classified briefings.

title: Jamaica Shocks U.S. and Advances to Gold Cup Final
description: For the first time since 2003, the United States will miss the final of the Gold Cup, the biennial championship soccer tournament of North America, Central America and the Caribbean. The United States, winner of three of the last five editions of the tournament, which is held every two years, fell to Jamaica, 2-1, in a stunning semifinal game Wednesday night in Atlanta.

title: Kenya Trip Takes Obama Back to a Complex Part of Himself
description: WASHINGTON  The first time Barack Obama visited Kenya, the land of his father, he was hoping to fill a great emptiness he felt inside, to figure out who he was and where he fit in the world.

title: Questions About the Sandra Bland Case
description: I have so many questions about the case in which Sandra Bland was arrested in a small Texas town and died in police custody. These are questions that ought to be easy to answer, questions that I suspect many others may share. Here are just some of my areas of inquiry.

title: Social Security Disability Benefits Face Cuts in 2016, Trustees Say
description: WASHINGTON  Eleven million people face a deep, abrupt cut in disability insurance benefits in late 2016 if Congress fails to replenish Social Securitys disability trust fund, which is running out of money, the Obama administration said Wednesday.

title: Steven Gerrard and Giovani dos Santos Arrive Amid Season of Change for Galaxy
description: PASADENA, Calif.  For Bruce Arena, the Los Angeles Galaxys coach, this season has been one of changes. More are coming. So Arena was in no mood Tuesday night to spend time breaking down the nuances of an exhibition game, even if it was a rare chance to test his team against the visiting European champion, Barcelona.

title: Armed and Determined, Civilians Look to Prevent Another Chattanooga
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.   As parents shopped for baby clothes and children played arcade games at stores in an indistinct strip mall here, some 10 heavily armed civilians stood outside the military recruitment center, guarding the recruiters inside.

title: Ten Impressionist Masterpieces at the Philadelphia Museum of Art
description: A number of standouts demand a closer look in Discovering the Impressionists, a show at the Philadelphia Museum of Art.

title: Paul Durand-Ruel, the Paris Dealer Who Put Impressionism on the Map
description: PHILADELPHIA  Casual observers might suppose that mega-galleries like Larry Gagosians and David Zwirners are a distinctively 21st-century phenomenon. But the gallery of Paul Durand-Ruel, the Paris dealer who put Impressionism on the international map, preceded them by more than a century and a half. His fascinating and instructive story is the subject of Discovering the Impressionists: Paul Durand-Ruel and the New Painting, a gorgeous exhibition at the Philadelphia Museum of Art here.

title: Bank of America Replaces Its Chief Financial Officer as Part of a Shake-Up
description: Bank of America, which has struggled to generate consistent profits even as other banks have begun to prosper, is broadly overhauling its top leadership, including the abrupt replacement of its chief financial officer, Bruce Thompson.

title: Andrew Miller Gives Yankees a Spark, a Year After His Jolting Trade
description: When Andrew Miller was traded from Boston to Baltimore last year at the nonwaiver trading deadline, he was not sure what he was walking into. The experience, with the incessant rumors about where he might land, had jangled his nerves.

title: Mouthful
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  Well, this one confused me for a couple of reasons.

title: Review: Threesome, at 59E59 Theaters, Examines Sexual Inequality
description: A bawdy sex comedy somersaults into a dark exploration of the treatment of women in Muslim (and American) culture in Threesome, an enterprising if not always persuasive play by Yussef El Guindi, about a less-than-successful evening of erotic adventuring and its uncomfortable aftermath.

title: Shortfall Remains as M.T.A. Pays $1 Billion to Capital Plan
description: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority said on Wednesday that an improved financial outlook at the agency would allow it to reduce the size of the funding gap in its capital plan.

title: Ivan Nova Helps Yankees Early Lead Stand Up
description: When Yankees second baseman Stephen Drew fielded a routine grounder and threw cleanly to first baseman Mark Teixeira for the final out of the fifth inning, pitcher Ivan Novaaggressively slapped his glove several times.

title: Court Rejects New York Citys Efforts to Restrict Sex Shops
description: On a stroll through the Times Square of today, a visitor can slurp a bowl of gumbo at Bubba Gump Shrimp Company, buy a tube of mascara at Sephora and snap a selfie with a fleet of Elmos.

title: Sister of Sandra Bland Discusses Video
description: Sharon Cooper spoke at a news conference Wednesday, during which she said she felt that the officer in the dashboard video released Tuesday was simply picking on her sister, point blank, period.

title: Vera Stern, Arts Advocate Who Helped Save Carnegie Hall, Dies at 88
description: Vera Stern, an arts administrator who, with her husband, the violinist Isaac Stern, helped rescue Carnegie Hall from demolition in 1960, died on Tuesday at her home in Manhattan. She was 88.

title: Photos that Capture New Jerseys Doo-Wop Motels, After the Tourists of Summer Have Gone
description: In this weekly series, Ts photo editors share the most compelling visual projects theyve discovered.

title: Trained by a Medicine Man on Marthas Vineyard, One Baker Gives Rise to an Honest Community
description: There could be nothing twee about a bakery whose owner learned pie-making from a Medicine Man  as did Julianne Vanderhoop, a member of the Wampanoag Tribe of Gay Head in the Marthas Vineyard town of Aquinnah, and the woman behind Orange Peel Bakery. Located in the islands hilly, windswept, Western parts and open year-round, it is the only place within 15 miles to get sustenance after the tourists leave in late summer and the nearby stores shut their doors until spring. And she makes perhaps the best pastries, tarts and breads on the island  like wheat berry and cranberry, and rosemary and olive oil loaves, which are sold at local supermarkets and some farmstands.

title: Stillbirths Now Outnumber Deaths Among Infants, Study Finds
description: For the first time, stillbirths have slightly outnumbered deaths among infants before their first birthdays, a new report has found, ending a long period in which infant deaths were higher.

title: Drug Prices Soar, Prompting Calls for Justification
description: As complaints grow about exorbitant drug prices, pharmaceutical companies are coming under pressure to disclose the development costs and profits of those medicines and the rationale for charging what they do.

title: Most Undocumented Immigrants Will Stay Under Obamas New Policies, Report Says
description: Under new immigration enforcement programs the Obama administration is putting in place across the country, the vast majority of unauthorized immigrants  up to 87 percent  would not be the focus of deportation operations and would have a degree of protection to remain in the United States, according to a report published Thursday by the Migration Policy Institute, a nonpartisan research group in Washington.

title: Netmarble Takes Stake in SGN, Extending Asias Reach Into U.S. Mobile Games
description: Nowhere are mobile video games more popular  or lucrative  than in Asia. And now Asian companies are making big bets that they can spread some of their expertise in mobile gaming to the United States.

title: Player Ratings: Jamaica (2) vs. United States (1)
description: The United States was eliminated from the Gold Cup on Wednesday night after a stunning upset by Jamaica. The loss means the Americans will face off against the tournaments winner in October for an opportunity to claim Concacafs spot at the 2017 Confederations Cup.

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 10 P.M. (Encore) LEGENDS OF THE FALL (1994) Kodak moments abound  and John Toll earned an Oscar for best cinematography  in Ed Zwicks adaptation of the Jim Harrison novella about three dashing brothers from Montana (from left, Aidan Quinn, Brad Pitt and Henry Thomas, with Julia Ormond), circa World War I, in love with the same woman (Ms. Ormond). A bandanna-wearing Anthony Hopkins is their father, a retired Army colonel trying to make sense of it all. But its Mr. Pitt, thundering into the movie on horseback with his cowboy arrogance and wearing a rakish grin as big as all outdoors who steals the show, Janet Maslin wrote in The New York Times. Mr. Pitts diffident mix of acting and attitude works to such heartthrob perfection its a shame the films superficiality gets in his way.

title: Sandra Bland's Jail-Booking Screening Form
description: The Waller County sheriffs office released late on Wednesday the 15-page jail-booking screening form, which included questions about Ms. Blands mental health. Ms. Bland, who was found hanged in a jail cell, told officials that she tried last year to kill herself, the sheriffs office said.

title: Beijing Police Vanquish Foreigners Clad as Spartans
description: Read in Chinese |

title: Corrections: July 23, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: At least they listened to us. Were breathing little by little.

title: Connecting With Syrian Refugees
description: Were awash in connectivity, sometimes overwhelmed by it. Yet the simple idea of connection  and exploring its possibilities on social media  fascinated Marieke van der Velden and her partner and collaborator, Philip Brink. They were frustrated by what they saw as the limits of Facebook  how, despite its seemingly infinite reach, most users really connect only with people they already know.

title: Credit Suisse Swings to Profit in Second Quarter
description: LONDON  The Swiss bank Credit Suisse said on Thursday that it had returned to profit in the second quarter as it benefited from stronger results in the Asia-Pacific region, despite weakness in its investment bank.

title: Starving on the Streets
description: Nicholas Kristof travels to South Sudan, where a famine brought on by drought and civil war threatens five million people.

title: Does Legal Same-Sex Marriage Presage Polygamy?
description: To the Editor:

title: Lawlessness on the High Seas
description: To the Editor:

title: Israel, Dont Level My Village
description: SUSIYA, West Bank  IN 1948, as Israeli forces closed in on his village of Qaryatayn, my grandfather carried my father in his arms to Susiya, about five miles north, in the South Hebron Hills area.

title: On Retirement, Whats Good for California Could Be Good for the Country
description: Congress has foolishly refused to act on President Obamas plan to enroll new workers automatically in individual retirement accounts. That intransigence is extremely shortsighted. Fully half of working families in the United States will face reduced standards of living in retirement, according to the Center for Retirement Research at Boston College. Making it easier to enroll in I.R.A.s is one way to help those who do not have retirement benefits at work.

title: Can Mass Shootings Be Predicted?
description: To the Editor:

title: Russias Empty Gesture on the Downed Malaysian Jet
description: A year after Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 was shot down over eastern Ukraine, killing all 298 people aboard, Russia has asked the United Nations Security Council and the International Civil Aviation Organization to take a more active role in investigating the incident and bringing those responsible to justice.

title: More Logging Wont Stop Wildfires
description: IN the fall of 2013, shortly after fire swept across 257,000 acres of forest and shrub lands near Yosemite National Park in Californias Sierra Nevada, Republicans in the House of Representatives approved a bill that would have suspended environmental laws to increase logging in our national forests in the name of fire prevention and restoration.

title: Amount Spent on Political Campaigns: Nothing Short of Obscene
description: To the Editor:

title: Socialism, American-Style
description: THE great 20th-century conservative economist Joseph Schumpeter thought the left had overlooked a major selling point in pressing the case for public  i.e., government  control over productive capital. One of the most significant titles to superiority, he suggested, was that public ownership produced profits, which means not having to depend on taxes to raise money.

title: Russia and the Downed Malaysian Plane
description: To the Editor:

title: A City for the Poor, Rich and In Between
description: A year and a half into his mayoralty, its now Bill de Blasios New York. So is the city starting to look like the one he promised to build, one where the poor and the working class can afford to live?

title: Starvation as a Product of War
description: AWEIL, South Sudan  One gauge of the famine looming in South Sudan is that people are simply collapsing from hunger.

title: A Religion Case Too Far for the Supreme Court?
description: The court of Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. has been one of the most religion-friendly Supreme Courts in modern history. Nearly every religious claim presented to the court has emerged a winner, from explicitly sectarian prayer at town board meetings, in last years closely divided Town of Greece decision, to beards for Muslim inmates in a prison system that banned facial hair  a unanimous decision that defied the courts tradition of deference to prison officials and their rules.

title: LeasePlan, a Dutch Fleet Manager, to Be Sold for $4 Billion
description: LONDON  LeasePlan Corporation, one of Europes biggest automobile leasing and fleet managers, said on Thursday that its owner, Global Mobility Holding, had agreed to sell the Dutch company to a group of investors for 3.7 billion euros, or about $4.04 billion.

title: U.S.-Trained Iraqi Troops Deployed to Help Retake Ramadi From ISIS
description: BAGHDAD  Around 3,000 newly American-trained Iraqi troops, along with 500 trained Sunni tribal fighters, have been deployed to help in an expected government offensive to retake the Sunni stronghold of Ramadi from Islamic State militants, Pentagon officials said during a trip to Baghdad on Thursday.

title: Permanence on the Upper West Side
description: When Alexis Fishman arrived in New York around eight years ago, she sublet briefly on the Upper West Side, moving a few times until she settled into a rented studio in Crown Heights, Brooklyn.

title: Its the End of the World as She Knows It
description: Ninety-nine percent of the worlds population has been wiped out. From Stephen Kings The Stand to Peter Hellers The Dog Stars, this is the number most favored by authors of dystopian and post-apocalyptic fiction. Its a clean way of conveying that we shouldnt expect anyone to receive concerned calls from mom and dad but also an efficient means of narrowing the stage of human violence.

title: Ted Cruz Is More of a Spider-Man Guy
description: Your new book is called A Time for Truth: Reigniting the Promise of America. A few months ago you were in the news for warning a little girl that the world is on fire. Do you believe setting things on fire is good or bad? Both. I am a passionate believer in the fire of liberty. Indeed, I have encouraged young people to become arsonists, spreading the fire of liberty. Now that said, the world being on fire is not a good thing.

title: Navigating a Bureaucratic Maze to Renew Food Stamp Benefits
description: Three months after Delbert Shorters food stamps were cut off, he still does not know why.

title: A Descent Into the Thrall of Human Trafficking
description: A multimillion-dollar people-smuggling business has sent roots deep into an impoverished corner of Bangladesh.

title: A Bangladeshi Town in Human Traffickings Grip
description: SHAH PORIR DWIP, Bangladesh  From his shop overlooking a pier on this island near the border with Myanmar, Mohammad Hossain watched the human smuggling business swell.

title: Not Telling Your Doctor You Use Acupuncture and Chiropractic
description: People with chronic back, neck or joint pain commonly seek acupuncture and chiropractic care for relief, but many dont tell their doctors about it, a new study reports.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: (Want to get the briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Thursdays Travel News: Alaska Airlines; New Service to Orlando
description: Our weekday morning digest that includes consumer news, deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.

title: New York Today: A High-Wire Act
description: Good morning on this clear Thursday.

title: Personalities Clashing Over How to Handle New Greek Bailout
description: BRUSSELS  To many Greeks, the debt the country has amassed is the evil fruit of austerity policies, imposed from the outside, that asphyxiated its economy and trampled on its sovereignty.

title: Erison and the Ebola Soccer Survivors
description: Refusing to live in Ebolas shadow, Erison Turay and others in Sierra Leone found new strength and solidarity on the soccer field.

title: E.U. Opens Antitrust Case Against Major U.S. Studios and Sky UK
description: BRUSSELS  Along with the proliferation of web-based television services and pressure to make movies available for download sooner, Hollywood studios are facing a new challenge to decades-old business practices: European regulators.

title: Nikkei to Buy Financial Times From Pearson for $1.3 Billion
description: For about a year, senior executives at The Financial Times and its parent company, Pearson, had quietly discussed selling the respected, salmon-colored newspaper.

title: Sailing Beyond the Rule of Law
Today in Politics: Donald Trump, Unafraid to Cross the Line, Takes His Pulpit to the Border
description: Good Thursday morning from Washington, where the Senate is set to discuss Iran, and President Obama is packing for Kenya with plans to do the same. And as Donald J. Trump prepares to speak at an event near the Mexican border, the cameras will be watching. And so will his rivals.

title: Letter of Recommendation: New Balance 990s
description: The first time I even considered buying a pair of New Balances, I was 27, bronzed and lean, standing in a frigid sporting-goods store in Biloxi, Miss., having walked there from New York. The year was 2007. Four months earlier, I had experienced that spiritual crisis stereotypical of young people  the one in which you cant seem to square the scope of your ambitions with the limits of your daily life, which in my case was spent in a Midtown Manhattan cubicle. So I packed a bag and said goodbye to everyone I loved, including my wife, who was ecstatic to see me go.

title: Why Is It So Hard to Get a Great Bagel in California?
description: One day in February, a notice appeared on the website San Francisco Eater. An unknown outfit called Eastside Bagels was hosting a pop-up at a Mission District bar called Dear Mom. One morning only: actual New York bagels, with schmear, lox or pastrami. Doors open at 11:30 a.m.

title: A Visit to Padang, Indonesias Food Paradise, During Ramadan
description: The afternoon market on the grounds of Imam Bonjol Stadium in Padang, Indonesia, lasts just one month a year and looks like a nibblers paradise. Padang is known across Indonesia for its cuisine and it showed: mountains of fried noodles studded with shrimp chips and whole fried eggs; heaps of snails spiced with turmeric; mounds of tiny silvery anchovies with green chiles; beef long-simmered in coconut milk to become tender rendang; es campur, an icy dessert full of unfamiliar fruits and fluorescent cubes of gelatin.

title: Comcast Results Buoyed by Strong Performance in Film Division
description: Dinosaurs, fast cars and an a cappella singing group helped propel a 7.3 percent rise in earnings at Comcast during the second quarter as the media conglomerate benefited from the release of a blockbuster slate of films in its entertainment division.

title: Morning Agenda: Bank of America Shake-Up
description: BANK OF AMERICA SHAKE-UP | The lenders chief financial officer Bruce Thompson, has been abruptly replaced as part of a leadership overhaul, Michael Corkery reports in DealBook. He will be replaced by his deputy Paul Donofrio, a longtime Bank of America executive. Mr. Thompson had been mentioned as a possible successor to the chief executive, Brian T. Moynihan, but his departure will set off speculation about other potential candidates.

title: The Ebola Soccer Survivors
description: Struggling in the shadow of Ebola, survivors of the disease in Sierra Leone found new strength and solidarity on the soccer field.

title: William T. Vollmann: By the Book
description: The author, most recently, of The Dying Grass says the deader the author, the more worthwhile the book. Who would keep bringing out editions of Gilgamesh if there werent some magic in the story?

title: The Fundamental Way That Universities Are an Illusion
description: To understand the failures of the modern American college system  from admissions marketing to graduation rates  you can begin with a notorious university football scandal.

title: Q. and A.: Ma Xue on Why China Has Embraced Korean TV
description: Read in Chinese |

title: Review: Suspense and Charisma in The Car Man in London
description: LONDON  Is there a better dance show currently running than Matthew Bournes The Car Man? It seems unlikely. In this loose reworking of Bizets Carmen, sex, violence, glamour, fate and death are thrillingly bound into a plot of film noirish suspense, brilliantly performed by Mr. Bournes company, New Adventures, without a single dull moment or loss of pace. On Wednesday night, Marcelo Gomes, an American Ballet Theater principal, added to those thrills in a charismatic debut in the central male role.

title: Investment Gains Lift K.K.R.s Quarterly Results
description: Kohlberg Kravis Roberts reported strong second-quarter results on Thursday, buoyed by gains in its biggest holdings and a favorable fund-raising environment.

title: Fiat Chrysler Files for I.P.O. of Ferrari
description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles said on Thursday that it had filed with regulators to spin off Ferrari, the Italian luxury sports car maker, in an initial public offering in the United States.

title: G.M. Earnings Soar in 2nd Quarter
description: DETROIT  General Motors reported on Thursday that its second-quarter earnings were five times as large as a year ago, despite charges taken for currency fluctuations and asset write-downs in foreign markets.

title: Information Retrieval for Seniors
description: Dear Diary:

title: Is Victoria Beckham in Play?
description: On Wednesday, a reader sent me a tweet asking if it was true that LVMH Mot Hennessy Louis Vuitton had bought a stake in Victoria Beckhams brand; apparently, she had been hearing lots of rumors. Well, I have an answer, of sorts.

title: McDonalds Sales Dropped in 2nd Quarter, Cutting Profit
description: Its going to take more than a better chicken sandwich to lift sales at McDonalds.

title: Israeli Forces Shoot and Kill Palestinian During West Bank Raid
description: JERUSALEM  A Palestinian man was shot and killed by Israeli troops Thursday during an arrest raid in a West Bank town that is a stronghold of resistance against Israeli occupation. It was the second fatal shooting in the West Bank in two days, and the third episode of its kind this month.

title: U Aung Thaung, Burmese Politician Accused of Abuses, Dies at 74
description: YANGON, Myanmar  U Aung Thaung, a senior Burmese politician who was implicated in violence against dissidents and accused of personal corruption, died on Thursday in Singapore. He was 74.

title: Hello Mother, Hello Daughter: Texts of Misery from Camp
description: WHEN my first daughter was born, my mother told me that my life was going to change; that my emotional weather would no longer be dictated by my own moods, but by hers. Youre only ever as happy as your unhappiest child, she said.

title: Super PACs Versus Donald Trumps Super Mouth
description: Donald Trumps blasts of runaway bombast have created many fretful moments for fellow Republicans, but nothing may be as galling as his surge in opinion polls through what political pros cherish as free media: Mr. Trump hasnt had to pay a penny to strut and caper ahead of the pack. His caustic utterances have been too inviting for the news media not to flash them instantly across the nation in these early days of uncertainty and fickle audience involvement in next years presidential election.

title: Daily Report: Sales of Apple Watch Suggest a Familiar Path to Success
description: Asking if the Apple Watch will become a hit or a flop is a bit like asking if my 2-year-old daughter is destined to go to Yale or to jail. Interested parties can speculate on the basis of thin evidence  she learned to walk pretty early, though on the other hand, she still thinks cats say bow wow  but youth is inherently unpredictable, and anyone venturing a long-term forecast based on short-term performance runs the risk of looking quite silly, Farhad Manjoo writes in his State of the Art column.

title: Soyuz Space Capsule Blasts Off
description: The spacecraft was launched from a Russian facility in Kazakhstan and is carrying a Russian, an American and a Japanese citizen to the International Space Station.

title: Monsanto Presses Case for Merger as Syngenta Reports Results
description: LONDON  Monsanto continued to press its case on Thursday for a merger with the Swiss agricultural and chemical giant Syngenta, saying its rival doesnt have a long-term vision or plan that would create the same value as Monsantos $45 billion offer.

title: Fresh Off Frozen, Bobby Lopez and Kristen Anderson-Lopez Prepare a New Musical
description: LA JOLLA, CALIF.  The songwriters Robert Lopez and Kristen Anderson-Lopez are rushing to catch a performance. Its just 10 days until the first preview of their new musical, Up Here, at La Jolla Playhouse, and the pressure is on.

title: Donald Trump Threatens Third-Party Candidacy
description: Donald J. Trump has been roiling Republicans by attacking his rivals on their weak poll numbers and questioning their energy (Jeb Bush) and intelligence (Rick Perry).

title: 1940: Britain Drops Silent Column
description: LONDON The local defense volunteers received added recognition this afternoon [July 23] when War Secretary Anthony Eden, acting on a suggestion made in Prime Minister Winston Churchills last broadcast, announced in the House of Commons that they would receive the title of Home Guard. At the same session Churchill delivered a stinging setback to the so-called silent column, which has been under fire for some time, as an insult to the intelligence of the British public.  New York Herald Tribune, July 24, 1940

title: Plenty of Blame for U.S. in Jamaica Loss; Mexico-Panama Descends Into Chaos
description: It was a night of firsts for the Americans in the Concacaf Gold Cup semifinal, none of them good.

title: Viewfinder: Mark Havens
description: Mark Havenss Out of Season series

title: Tunisias Secular Government Cracks Down on Mosques in Aftermath of Massacre
description: TUNIS  Among a flurry of security measures the Tunisian government began after a gunman massacred 38 tourists last month in Sousse was a crackdown on dozens of mosques, creating concerns that the secular government may be falling back toward the authoritarian ways of the former dictatorship.

title: New York Strikes a Welcome Deal With Uber
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio and Uber made the right call by striking a deal that puts off a proposal to limit the growth of ride-hailing companies in New York City. There are far better ways to reduce congestion and take care of other problems that city officials blame on Uber.

title: Boko Haram Helped by U.S. Policies, Nigerian President Says
description: Nigerias new president, Muhammadu Buhari, sharply criticized the United States this week for refusing to sell his country weapons in the fight against Boko Haram, in a speech that raised eyebrows in Washington for its echoes of previous Nigerian rhetoric.

title: Tracing Hip-Hops Phenomenal Rise
description: PARIS  In the summer of 1985, when some neighborhoods in New York were ruled by gangs, Philippe Fragione, an aspiring hip-hop artist in his teens, was visiting the city for the first time. I had always dreamed of seeing the birthplace of hip-hop, where it all started, he said.

title: How to Smuggle a Saint Out of India
description: Based on accounts from Indian law enforcement officials and investigators from the Tamil Nadu Idol Wing in Chennai, India.

title: Greek Lawmakers on New Reforms
description: Greek lawmakers spoke Thursday after Parliament voted overwhelmingly to approve a second batch of measures demanded by the countrys international creditors.

title: As German Church Becomes Mosque, Neighbors Start to Shed Unease
description: HAMBURG, Germany  There were cracks in the steeple, and the southeastern wall would somehow have to accommodate a niche pointing toward the holy city of Mecca, in Saudi Arabia, but those were not the biggest misgivings Daniel Abdin had about buying the Capernaum Church here in 2012.

title: Three Approaches to Twitter Wars: Taylor Swift, Action Bronson, Drake
description: The biggest hits in music this week are not songs, videos or albums  theyre tweets.

title: On The Campaign Trail With Hillary Clinton
description: Amy Chozick, a politics reporter, describes the ups and downs of covering Hillary Clinton as her presidential campaign ramps up.

title: Kids in the Kitchen: A 9-Year-Old Cooks Pasta With Tomatoes and Mushrooms
description: Can a 9-year-old cook a healthy dinner the whole family will enjoy?

title: What to Do This Weekend
description: Need help finding something to do? Want to beat the heat?

title: Judge Orders Release of Misconduct Findings Against Officer in Eric Garner Case
description: A state judge in Manhattan has ruled that basic findings of misconduct against the New York City police officer who held Eric Garner in a chokehold cannot be kept from public disclosure, a significant defeat for city lawyers who have long argued that such records were protected under a provision of state law.

title: He Got to That? The Amazing Sports Rallies That Never Seem to End
description: It happens to us all the time. Someone emails or tweets a link to a video with a subject line like You Have to See This or Greatest Rally Ever. Were often amazed at the competitive will and athletic prowess of athletes competing in some random international tournament. So we decided to look for the rallies that might really be the Greatest Rally Ever.

title: The Follow-Up on Ebola: Surviving and Soccer in Sierra Leone
description: Almost a year ago, I met Erison Turay in the worst moments of his life. After surviving Ebola and being discharged from the hospital, he stood at the perimeter of the hospital fence shouting to his sick mother and trying to throw her bottles of soda. Sixteen members of his close family had already died from the vicious disease. Many more would soon follow.

title: Kerry Defends Iran Nuclear Deal Before Skeptical Senate
description: WASHINGTON  After four and a half hours of contentious questioning, three cabinet secretaries deployed Thursday by President Obama to the Senate to defend his nuclear deal with Iran appeared to keep Democrats largely lined up as a bulwark against Republican opposition.

title: Benefit of End-Stage Chemotherapy Is Questioned
description: It is an excruciating question for cancer patients with a prognosis of only months to live. Should they try another round of chemotherapy?

title: M. Night Shyamalan on Endings and the Wayward Pines Series Finale
description: Describing Foxs Wayward Pines to the uninitiated is like taking part in a pitch meeting that never ends: Its Twin Peaks meets The Twilight Zone meets The Truman Show meets Lost To that list of titles, you could add at least two more  The Village, which shares the Wayward premise of a town nobody can leave, and The Happening, which anticipated Mother Natures harsh response to environmental tinkering. So it makes sense that M. Night Shyamalan, who directed both of those films, would make Wayward Pines his first television foray, directing the pilot and executive producing the rest.

title: Painting Used as a Kitchen Bulletin Board Estimated to Bring $1.1 Million
description: LONDON  A painting by the important South African artist Irma Stern, donated to raise funds for the defense in the 1961 treason trial of Nelson Mandela and his fellow African National Congress detainees, has been discovered in a London kitchen, The Guardian reported. Covered in letters, postcards and bills, it was being used as a bulletin board until spotted by Hannah OLeary from the auction house Bonhams, during a routine valuation in early May.

title: Laying Eggs of Just the Right Hue
description: The eggs of the spined soldier stink bug vary in color depending on how much light is reflecting from the surface onto which they are placed, according to a new study.

title: The Ultimate Temple Raider?: Inside an Antiquities-Smuggling Operation
description: The 30 or so guests enjoying spring rolls and white wine were gathered in a small third-floor gallery at the Metropolitan Museum of Art to celebrate Subhash Kapoor, a convivial Manhattan art dealer who had donated 58 miniature drawings of Indian aristocrats, deities and beasts.

title: A Hundred Cities Within Seoul
description: The Korean filmmaker Bong Joon-ho turned from the street into a passageway barely wide enough for two people. Look at these dirty stairs, he said rhapsodically, pausing to peer through a doorway at tiles of perhaps 70s-era vintage. The passageway descended farther and took a hairpin turn into a pedestrian alley of uneven brick walls, overhead knots of electrical wire and drying laundry. Maybe a detective could chase a criminal here, he said, presumably imagining actors careening down the alley. I have to shoot something here before something destroys it.

title: NASA Says Data Reveals an Earth-Like Planet, Kepler 452b
description: Inching ahead on their quest for what they call Earth 2.0, astronomers from NASAs Kepler planet-hunting spacecraft announced on Thursday that they had found what might be one of the closest analogues to our own world yet.

title: Shopping for a Doctor Who Fits
description: I had already been given a heads up about my next patient by one of our schedulers. The notes next to her name in the electronic medical record read, New consult, switching care, patient preference. Do not cancel any other appointments until this one is completed.

title: The Death of Sandra Bland: Questions and Answers
description: As more details are released on the death of a 28-year-old black woman in a Texas jail, curiosity has mounted over the circumstances. Here is what we know about what happened to Sandra Bland.

title: My Longform Podcast on Public Editor Agony and Ecstasy
description: When Max Linsky of Longform asked me a few weeks ago to appear on his weekly podcast, I gave my usual answer. I told him that I dont really do interviews, but prefer to let my columns and posts speak for themselves.

title: Lou Lamoriello Leaves Devils to Join Maple Leafs
description: When Lou Lamoriello stepped aside as Devils general manager in May at age 72, he quipped that his age was no secret and that he had to be honest with himself.

title: A Big Victory for Fast-Food Workers in New York
description: The Fight for $15 effort for higher pay won a major victory on Wednesday, when a wage board formed in May by Gov. Andrew Cuomo proposed raising the minimum wage for fast-food workers in New York to $15 an hour. The increase would be fully phased in by the end of 2018 for workers in New York City and by mid-2021 for those in the rest of the state. Currently, fast-food pay in New York is about $9 an hour.

title: Mayan Hieroglyphics Found in Guatemala
description: An archaeologist working in northern Guatemala discussed the discovery of intact Mayan panels thought to be 1,300 years old with ancient hieroglyphics that provide insight into the civilization.

title: 1915: Submarines Active Off Turkey
description: LONDON British submarines are displaying renewed activity in Turkish waters, and as a result all the enemys seaborne traffic in his inner seas has for the time being been paralyzed. A telegram from Athens to the Daily Telegraph says that a British submarine recently attacked and sank, before the western entrance to the Bosphorus, four lighters laden with ammunition. The torpedo explosions were so effective that they blew into pieces the lighters, the cargoes and their crews. Meanwhile Russian submarines continue their work of destruction in the Black Sea, where they have rendered practically impossible the navigation of enemy ships.  The New York Herald, European Edition, July 24, 1915

title: Langos Truck
description: A Hungarian food truck serving traditional fried flatbread.

title: Langos Truck Presents the Flavor of Hungary on Four Wheels
description: If you are Hungarian, langos (pronounced LAHN-gauche) is the taste of summer, of days on lawns overlooking the 50-mile-long Lake Balaton, which those who live in the landlocked nation call the Hungarian Sea.

title: Vogueing Is Still Burning Up the Dance Floor in New York
description: The style was introduced to the mainstream in the early 90s with the film Paris Is Burning and Madonnas video for Vogue. It still thrives in New York, if you know where to look.

title: Letters: Ally
description: Ally

title: After Her Last Isolde, Waltraud Meier Looks Back
description: MUNICH  Near the end of Peter Konwitschnys production of Wagners Tristan und Isolde, the title characters walk toward each other, closing a red stage curtain. They have fled the world in death and, dressed identically, are alone together at last. Tristan reclines in front of the curtain, looking up at Isolde.

title: Travel Diary
description: The designer Wes Gordons birthday vacation to Harbour Island in the Bahamas.

title: What Singers Feel When Leaving Beloved Roles
description: What does it mean for a singer to say goodbye to a role? Is it routine? A relief? Or like a funeral? Three singers spoke about giving up a beloved part.

title: Judges Ruling Relegates One Spanish Team and Saves Another
description: MADRID  Two months after the end of the Spanish soccer season, the action continues to play out, not on the field but in the courtroom.

title: Behind the Poster: Wombat Drool
description: Last year, after 39 years of lemurs and moonrats, David S. Kessler retired as the longest-serving zookeeper at the National Zoo in Washington. This summer Mr. Kessler turned his wisdom about small mammals and his longtime love of theater into Wombat Drool, a semi-autobiographical show in which he plays a zookeeper giving a slide-show presentation about wombats and other underappreciated animals.

title: Chris Brown, Barred From Leaving Philippines, Looks for Answers  Via Instagram
description: Chris Brown is stuck in the Philippines and is appealing to Instagram for answers as to why.

title: U.S. Jets to Use Turkish Bases in War on ISIS
description: ISTANBUL  Turkey plunged into the fight against the Islamic State on Thursday, rushing forces into the first direct combat with its militants on the Syrian border and granting permission for American warplanes to use two Turkish air bases for bombarding the group in Syria.

title: Kerry Defends Nuclear Deal to Senate
description: Secretary of State John Kerry defended the Iran nuclear deal on Thursday before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, meeting resistance from Republican members of the group.

title: Recalling a Few Strikeouts in Pursuit of Pedro Martinez
description: When someone in a seat behind you pulls out a trumpet and begins loudly playing merengue, prompting dozens of passengers to rise and dance as your plane sits on a runway at Kennedy Airport, its a clue that this reporting jaunt may not be like the others.

title: Irans President Defends Nuclear Deal in Blunt Remarks
description: TEHRAN  Pushing back against domestic critics of Irans nuclear deal, President Hassan Rouhani suggested on Thursday that the alternative was an economic Stone Age and that the accord was the precise reason he was elected two years ago.

title: The State of Uber: How It Operates in the U.S.
description: Uber has ended the latest struggle in its ride-sharing operation after New York City dropped, for now, its plan to limit the number of vehicles the company could operate in the city.

title: Jewish Hideout Declared Polish Monument
description: A hideout used to help Jews escaping the Holocaust has been declared a national monument in Poland.

title: Brunello di Montalcinos Balancing Act
description: For a great wine, Brunello di Montalcino has had more than its share of detractors. People I know and respect have derided the wines as too big, or not sufficiently reflective of terroir, or overly manipulated to fit critical fashions.

title: Marco Rubio and John Kerry State Differences on Iran Nuclear Deal
description: Senator Marco Rubio of Florida gave a taste of his stump speech to Secretary of State John F. Kerry on Thursday and, in response, was offered a lesson in diplomacy.

title: Ruth Porat May Be Just What Investors Think Google Needs
description: Adult supervision is back at Google.

title: When the Young Lords Were Outlaws in New York
description: On July 26, 1969, a group of young Latinos stood in the band shell in Tompkins Square Park, in the East Village, and made an announcement. They were founding a New York branch of a revolution-minded political party called the Young Lords.

title: Mike Hale on the Emmy Awards 2015: Predictions, Wishes and What-Ifs
description: Mike Hale, one of the TV critics for The New York Times, shares his opinions on this years Emmy Awards, which will be hosted by Andy Samberg on Sept. 20 on Fox.

title: Neil Genzlinger on the Emmy Awards 2015: Predictions, Wishes and What-Ifs
description: Neil Genzlinger, one of the TV critics for The New York Times, shares his opinions on this years Emmy Awards, which will be hosted by Andy Samberg on Sept. 20 on Fox.

title: After Defeat, Britains Labour Party Argues Over Its New Leader
description: LONDON  Having suffered a shocking defeat in Mays general election, its worst result since 1987, the British Labour Party is busily ripping itself apart over the choice of a new leader.

title: In Connecticut, the Twilight of a Trading Hub
description: For years, traders and bankers would gather for power hour at the Mortons steakhouse across the street from the train station in Stamford, Conn. Mortons red awning waved like an invitation at the base of a hulking 13-story building that held the operations of the Swiss bank UBS.

title: Donald Trump Visits Border in Laredo, Despite the Great Danger
description: LAREDO, Tex.  From the moment he landed, wearing a white Make America Great Again baseball cap, Donald J. Trumps visit to the border of Mexico and the United States seemed to know only one speed: full throttle.

title: Whiplash Warning When Climate Science is Publicized Before Peer Review and Publication
description: [ | When the Hansen paper finally passed peer review and was published in March 2016, the elements predicting an imminent rapid rise in sea levels  the aspect of the paper that drew the attention of CNN, CBS and other major media  were largely replaced by projections.]

title: Princeton Shows a Rediscovered Guercino Painting
description: An actor known for his role as an Italian Mafia assassin is now promoting and exhibiting an old master painting of a bloodied, dying saint.

title: A Collection From Napoleon IIIs Dentist, Now on View at Penn
description: The University of Pennsylvania is showcasing overlooked bequests from Thomas W. Evans, a 19th-century dentist to European royalty.

title: Thomas Coles Art Studio to Be Recreated
description: The 19th-century painter Thomas Cole built an art studio with gingerbread woodwork and Hudson River views in Catskill, N.Y., but he enjoyed it for only a year or so before his death in 1848.

title: A Guide to New Yorks $15 Minimum Wage Proposal
description: A wage panel recommended on Wednesday that the minimum wage be raised for employees of fast-food chain restaurants in New York State to $15 an hour. At a rally later in the day for workers and their supporters, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said, There is no doubt we are headed in the right direction. But questions remain on what exactly is next. Following are a few answers:

title: Wes Gordons Harbour Island Birthday
description: The ocean freaks me out, with all those sharks in there, exclaims the fashion designer Wes Gordon. It was lucky, then, that Gordon chose Harbour Island in the Bahamas for a four-day beach getaway this month to celebrate his 29th birthday with his longtime boyfriend Paul Arnhold. It was literally like bathtub water, its crystal clear, and there arent plants or rocks. I think even the sharks there would be too relaxed to do anything. Good for Gordon, whose sophisticated silhouettes reflect his own sensibilities and who isnt exactly a beach bum: We dont go that often  I get really red so easily, he says. There are certain places that have a very loyal cult following, and Harbour Island is definitely one of them, so we thought it was time to check out what that was about.

title: Wall Street, Seeing Opportunity, Invests in Struggling Hotels in Puerto Rico
description: Puerto Ricos tourism industry has fallen victim to the islands struggling economy, hit by one misfortune after another. In March, the San Juan Beach Hotel filed for bankruptcy. This week, the Condado Plaza Hilton was forced to close its casino.

title: Chris Froome in Control at Tour de France; Frenchman Wins Stage
description: ST.-JEAN-DE-MAURIENNE, France  This was supposed to be a breakthrough year for French riders at the Tour de France. But instead of building on their success from last year, the home teams have generally met disappointment.

title: Exploring Yorkshire, One Pub at a Time
description: Exploring the world of local brews that feel as much a part of the region as its moors and old textile mills.

title: Uniting a Mysterious Ring With Its Rightful Owner
description: On my 25th wedding anniversary, I received a silver ring covered in diamonds via United Parcel Service. It came with a gift receipt but without a gift card. Oddly, the price tag was attached: $2,350, which, if calculated in cubic inches, was almost a bargain.

title: Sandra Blands Arrest Stirs Reader Reaction
description: Marie Tae McDermott is a news assistant and comment moderator.

title: A Tasting Tour of Yorkshires Beers and Ales
description: The long hike across the West Yorkshire moors passed over hills peppered with scrubby grass, through fields of heather and over jagged rocks and gurgling streams. Along the way Id been severely scolded by more than one chattering red grouse, and ignored by innumerable flocks of grazing sheep. Eventually Id made it all the way to Top Withens, a ruined farmhouse whose setting was said to have been the inspiration for Emily Bronts Wuthering Heights. Sunburned and tired after the long walk, I needed refreshment.

title: Republicans Have Minds Made Up as Debate Begins on Iran Nuclear Deal
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Bob Corker, Republican of Tennessee and the chairman of the Foreign Relations Committee, stared at Secretary of State John Kerry on Thursday with thinly veiled disgust.

title: Benjamin Walker To Star in American Psycho on Broadway
description: Benjamin Walker is about to get bloody, bloody all over again: Hell portray a singing serial killer in the musical adaptation of the novel American Psycho, which is now officially part of the 2015-16 Broadway season.

title: Fighting Corruption in Albany, One Lawmaker at a Time
description: Corruption is so deeply rooted in the culture of New York that it obviously takes an outsider to make a difference. That role has, once again, fallen to Preet Bharara, United States Attorney for New Yorks Southern District.

title: Jos Parl to Bring Sculptural Paintings to the High Line
description: In the 1990s, when the High Line was an abandoned and derelict railroad, Jos Parl used to sneak up onto the train tracks to take photographs that he called memory documents. Now visitors to the elevated High Line park in the meatpacking district will have a birds-eye view of the first outdoor installation in New York by Mr. Parl, 42, a Brooklyn-based artist.

title: Focusing on Women in Surrealism
description: Female artists are rarely among the go-to names in the Surrealist canon. Man Ray, Dal and Magritte often come up, but Kay Sage or Leonora Carrington? But dropping the names of these and other women associated with the Surrealist movement of the early 20th century may become common, thanks to exhibitions at the Los Angeles County Museum of Art or Frida Kahlo: Art, Garden, Life, at the New York Botanical Garden. And now, Sothebys, hoping to capitalize on growing interest and raise awareness of these artists, will hold a selling exhibition, Cherchez la Femme: Women and Surrealism, from Sept. 15 to Oct. 17 in New York.

title: Kinetic Works by the Artist Gego Are Headed for 2 Shows
description: In Latin America, Gego is like a goddess, in the same way Frida Kahlo has a myth around her, but she is not so known in America, the gallerist Dominique Lvy said of the artist Gertrud Goldschmidt, whose delicate, three-dimensional geometric compositions expanded the possibilities of kinetic art. Born in Germany, Gego  the childhood nickname stuck  escaped anti-Semitism in Hamburg in 1939, at age 27, and fled to Venezuela, where she lived until her death in 1994.

title: Messy Mexico-Panama Semifinal Leaves a Stain on Concacaf
description: After a night of chaos at the Gold Cup regional tournament, the national soccer team from Panama gathered for a picture, waved to the camera and held up a banner.

title: The New York City Poetry Festival Expands on Governors Island
description: Summer is the season to take a break from essential reading, a chance to flip through lighter fare or tackle that hefty classic youve been putting off for years.

title: Tom of Finlands Hypermasculine Gay Images in The Pleasure of Play
description: For several decades, beginning in the 1950s, Touko Laaksonen, a corporate advertising designer based in Helsinki, moonlighted as a pornographic draftsman named Tom of Finland.

title: Weekend Entertainments from the Archives of The New York Times
description: 38 YEARS AGO

title: Ebecho Muslimova Draws a Clumsy, Manic Alter Ego
description: Many people have distorted impressions of their own bodies and consequent feelings of inferiority. Its hard to maintain a positive self-image when unrealistic ideals are thrust before our eyes everywhere we look.

title: How To | Make a Squirrel Salad
description: The punky British artist and recent cookbook writer Sue Webster shows us how to make one of her favorite salads. Its got squirrels in it.

title: Meet Aalto, a New Finnish Brand Inspired by All-Night Raves
description: Primitive and raw are a few of the words Tuomas Merikoski would use to describe his new womens label, Aalto  but judging from his first few collections, the terms relaxed and retro come to mind, too. Im not trying to make it too abstract or too conceptual  its still clothing you can wear, says the 36-year-old designer who introduced the brand with a Pre-Fall 2015 collection in January.

title: Amid the Donald Trump Show, Republicans Hit the Campaign Trail
description: From their seats on the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, Marco Rubio and Rand Paul tried to score points for their presidential bids on Thursday by blasting Secretary of State John Kerry over the Iran nuclear deal. In New Hampshire, Jeb Bush and Gov. John R. Kasich fielded questions from voters at town hall-style meetings. Carly Fiorina hit four events over 10 hours in Iowa, while Gov. Scott Walker and Mike Huckabee spoke to conservative state lawmakers in California.

title: Review: Horse Money, a Surreal Voyage Into the Past
description: Pedro Costa, the Portuguese director of Horse Money, is one of a handful of filmmakers who could claim to have invented their own approaches to narrative. Beginning with Ossos (Bones) in 1997, he made a trilogy of films set in the Lisbon slum of Fontainhas, an enclave of Cape Verdean immigrants that has since been razed. In the subsequent In Vandas Room and Colossal Youth, Mr. Costa veered away from pure fiction and allowed Fontainhas residents to shape their dialogue and scenes. Drawn from real-life details though hardly documentaries, Mr. Costas movies unfold through monologues and tableaux, finding poetry and myth in the lives of the marginalized.

title: Review: In Southpaw, Jake Gyllenhaal Tries to Box His Way Back From Tragedy
description: Connoisseurs of boxing sometimes wax eloquent on the nuances of the sport, but boxing movies tend to value impact over finesse. Few genres are so reliably and bluntly conventional. Primal stories  rise and fall, ruin and redemption, the love of a good woman  are punctuated by scenes of carefully choreographed pugilism. Violence and sentimentality dance in the ring, and the audience leaves satisfied, if not exactly surprised.

title: Costly to Treat, Hepatitis C Gains Quietly in U.S.
description: EDGEWOOD, Ky.  Zach Wayman says he first contracted hepatitis C several years ago by sharing needles with other heroin addicts. He went into rehab and was successfully treated for the virus. But he relapsed into addiction and reinfected himself, testing positive for hepatitis C again this spring.

title: In Israel, Some Support the Iran Deal
description: As far as Americans go, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has pretty much drowned out other Israeli voices on the nuclear deal between Iran and the major powers. He has called it a historic mistake. On Wednesday, his ambassador to Washington, Ron Dermer, met 40 conservative members of Congress as part of a full-court Israeli push to persuade American lawmakers to vote down the accord.

title: Review: Dark Was the Night Confronts a Demon in the Woods
description: Theres certainly talent in Jack Hellers fright film Dark Was the Night, beginning with its cast. The busy TV actor Kevin Durand (The Strain on FX, Vikings on History)  here playing a small-town New York sheriff contending with a supernatural monster of Native American legend  conveys tender sorrow and steely resolve with understated dexterity.

title: Michael Smith Examines Lifes Absurdity at Greene Naftali
description: What kind of world do we live in, where the fountain of youth is in a Florida theme park, ballet is used to demonstrate the frustrations of airport security, and our greatest existential conundrum is how to keep those white Apple earphones untangled?

title: Flea Theater Sets Season Featuring a Hollywood Visitor (and Zombies)
description: A world premiere by Thomas Bradshaw, a play by Jennifer Haley directed by the Hollywood veteran Joel Schumacher, and a real-time zombie war-game played out on the streets of TriBeCa are among the highlights of the Flea Theaters fall season, the first under its new artistic director, Niegel Smith.

title: Senate Panel Takes Small Step Toward Easing Travel Restrictions With Cuba
description: Congress took its first bipartisan step Thursday toward endorsing the opening with Cuba that President Obama announced last year, as a key Senate panel voted to ease travel and trade restrictions that have been in place for decades.

title: Review: Unexpected, a Tale of 2 Pregnancies That Unite and Divide
description: There is barely a false note in Kris Swanbergs intelligent, well-mannered drama Unexpected, which tells parallel stories of two unforeseen pregnancies. Sam (Cobie Smulders), 30, who teaches science at a crumbling, soon-to-be closed high school in a poor Chicago neighborhood, lives with her boyfriend, John (Anders Holm). With no immediate plans to marry and start a family, she has her heart set on landing a high-powered job at the Field Museum designing a science curriculum for the city school system.

title: Marion Cotillards Effortlessly Chic Gala Look
description: The Star: Marion Cotillard

title: Anthems for the Mother Earth Goddess at Andrew Edlin Gallery
description: As the invasion of Chelsea by giant glass boxes continues at a breakneck pace, Andrew Edlin is moving on (to the Lower East Side), its small, antiquated building slated for demolition. Anthems for the Mother Earth Goddess, a provocatively plaintive group show of temporary murals and one sculpture installation, is the gallerys last exhibition at this location.

title: Black Travel Groups Find Kindred Spirits on Social Networks
description: As I stood barefoot at the entrance to the Chottanikkara Bhagavathy Temple, a labyrinthine Hindu shrine in the southwestern Indian state of Kerala that is forbidden to nonworshipers, a man studied me.

title: Autopsy of Sandra Bland Finds Injuries Consistent With Suicide, Prosecutor Says
description: HEMPSTEAD, Tex.  A county prosecutor in Texas said Thursday that an autopsy of Sandra Bland, who died in a jail cell here nearly two weeks ago after a minor traffic stop, concluded that her injuries were consistent with suicide, not homicide, a finding that underscored growing doubts that the jail did enough to monitor her.

title: Review: A Gay Girl in Damascus, a Documentary About a Hoax
description: Even knowing the secret of A Gay Girl in Damascus doesnt make this documentary any less tense. Thats a testament to Sophie Deraspe, a director who understands how to let a plot unfold.

title: Alex Rodriguez Tumbles Into the Plate, and the Yankees Keep Rolling
description: A few minutes after singing a line of Frank Sinatras New York, New York and twirling the tip of his glasses in his cup of coffee to mix it, Orioles Manager Buck Showalter discussed pitching, specifically in the American League East.

title: Summer Reveries, Frame by Frame
description: Graphic novels on a kick-back summer reading list.

title: A Family Rift on Middle Ground
description: Since our father died 10 years ago, my sister and I have not spoken. I have tried to heal the rift, but it is useless. My psychiatrist and her counselor agree. But our cousin, with whom we are both close, refuses to accept my decision. This may be because my sister claims to want to reconcile, though her actions say otherwise. When I ask my cousin whats going on with my sister, as I would about any family member, she refuses to tell me anything and accuses me of snooping. Is she trying to bully me into reconciliation by withholding information?

title: Review: Big Significant Things Compares Landmarks in Life and on the Road
description: Big Significant Things is a cute idea in search of substance. This wan film, a first feature by Bryan Reisberg, gives us Craig (Harry Lloyd), a young man who is on the verge of taking the next step with his longtime girlfriend. No, not that next step  theyre about to buy a house.

title: Review: In The Vatican Tapes, the Sinister Stare of Possession
description: THE VATICAN TAPES

title: Review: The Young Kieslowski Is a Sobering Comedy of Consequences
description: There are no grand romantic flourishes in The Young Kieslowski, an uncomfortable comedy about an accidental pregnancy that upends the lives of two freshmen at the California Institute of Technology. The title character, Brian Kieslowski (Ryan Malgarini), is a whiny dweeb with wide, frightened eyes who is obsessed with losing his virginity. He is certain that his lack of experience is visible to all. Leslie Mallard (Haley Lu Richardson), whom he accidentally impregnates in his first go at sex, is a self-professed Christian who has sworn to remain chaste until marriage.

title: Review: In Pixels, Attack of the Retro Video Games
description: Poor Washington is having a bad summer. The city was destroyed on television Wednesday night in Syfys Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No!, and it takes a beating again in theaters with Fridays release of Pixels, in which it is attacked by giant versions of 1980s video-game characters. Expect some of those many presidential candidates to begin dropping out of the race this weekend.

title: Pakistani Panel Rejects Fraud Accusations in 2013 Prime Minister Vote
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  In a major blow to the Pakistani opposition leader Imran Khan, a judicial commission released a report on Thursday rejecting his accusations of widespread fraud and irregularities in the 2013 general elections.

title: Review: Five Star Casts a Cool Eye on Gang Culture
description: Slow and steady, and with remarkable assuredness, Keith Millers Five Star plays mean-streets drama in the lowest of keys. Relying on neither raised voices nor cocked weapons  although both appear sparingly  this documentary-fiction hybrid observes gang culture with a calm eye and a clear head.

title: Review: Daniil Simkin Offers Intensio at Jacobs Pillow
description: BECKET, Mass.  If youre a dancer looking to start a side project, it helps to have supremely talented friends. Thats not a problem for the American Ballet Theater principal Daniil Simkin, whose Intensio had its premiere on Wednesday at Jacobs Pillow Dance Festival here.

title: Sue Websters Second Course
description: The punky British artist has been using roadkill in her sculptures for years. Now, in an unusual new cookbook, shes serving it up with a side of greens.

title: New York City, Reimagined
description: Kate Neckel illustrates what she would do were the city her playground.

title: Review: Frank the Bastard, a Trip Back to Old Crimes at the Commune
description: Clair Defina has few memories of her first six years, spent at the Maine commune where she was born. When her mother died in a fire there, her father whisked her away.

title: Bonsai Show at Maccarone Honors Roger Brown
description: This exquisitely calibrated group show honors Roger Brown, the Chicago painter whose Virtual Still Life series is on view in the gallerys larger space (at 630 Greenwich Street).

title: Amazon Reports Unexpected Profit, and Stock Soars
description: We have reached Peak Amazon, or perhaps Prime Amazon.

title: Chris Christie Sidesteps Questions on N.J. Transit Train Delays
description: Facing growing anger from commuters over systemic and lengthy delays on New Jersey Transit trains, Gov. Chris Christie refused to answer a question on Thursday about the states rail service before he left for a campaign trip to Iowa.

title: Trump Arrives in Texas for Border Tour
description: Donald Trump, the Republican presidential candidate, spoke about immigrants and immigration upon landing in Laredo, Tex., for a tour of the border with Mexico.

title: A Growing Divide on Race
description: How views on race differ among black and white Americans.

title: At $1.3 Billion, Nikkei Is Paying a Lot for Financial Times
description: Nikkei, the Japanese media company, is taking a bold step with its purchase of The Financial Times and is receiving accolades for making the $1.3 billion deal. But the financial logic behind the deal to buy the newspaper from the British publishing company Pearson, raises questions  if cold economics are the only consideration. Nikkei paid 35 times The Financial Timess adjusted operating income, about three times the newspapers worth.

title: Tiny Homes With Style
description: Christopher Burchs Cocoon9 is producing small modular homes that shake off the dowdy aesthetic.

title: Movie Review: Southpaw
description: The Times critic A. O. Scott reviews Southpaw.

title: A So-Called Independent Foundation Enters the Mylan-Teva Fray
description: The takeover battle between the pharmaceutical rivals Mylan N.V. and Teva went into full-scale fight mode on Thursday when the independent foundation created by Mylan to fend off the hostile bid finally acted.

title: Hillary Clinton to Return to the Hamptons for Vacation
description: After much hand-wringing over their vacation plans, Bill and Hillary Rodham Clinton will return to the Hamptons this summer, according to people with knowledge of their August plans.

title: The Best-Selling Sports Books
description: The best-selling sports books in June 2015, according to the New York Times best-seller list.

title: This Weeks Movies | July 24, 2015
description: The New York Times film critics review Southpaw, Paper Towns and Phoenix.

title: How a Palestinian Hamlet of 340 Drew Global Attention
description: SUSIYA, West Bank  Yousef Nawajaa strode between the tents bedecked with Palestinian flags, scattered through parched orchards and rocky hills, shouting delightedly to a man nearby: Hey, did you hear? John Kerry spoke about Susiya!

title: Cuomo Calls for Minimum Wage Increase
description: Speaking at a rally on July 22, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York called for a raise in the minimum wage to $15 an hour.

title: Movie Review: Phoenix
description: The Times critic A.O. Scott reviews Phoenix.

title: Review: Phoenix Shows Rebirth and a Ruse in Postwar Germany
description: In Christian Petzolds new film, Phoenix is the name of a Berlin nightclub where Nelly Lenz goes searching for her husband, a piano player she calls Johnny. World War II has just ended, which suggests that Phoenix, the title of this compact, haunting thriller, might have other, larger, metaphorical meanings as well. In a few years, Germany will ascend from the ruin of military defeat into an era of political stability and economic growth. Nelly, a Jewish singer who survived the Nazi death camps, is undergoing her own tentative rebirth  her face has been reconstructed after it was damaged by a gunshot wound  and her friend Lene (Nina Kunzendorf) encourages her to prepare for a new life in Tel Aviv.

title: Movie Review: Paper Towns
description: The Times critic Manohla Dargis reviews Paper Towns.

title: Lazard and Evercore Do Better for Owners Than Big Rivals
description: Lazard and Evercore are doing more with less in the continuing mergers-and-acquisition boom. Second-quarter results reported this week show that the two independent advisers have not reaped as much benefit as much larger rivals from the recent deal-making surge. But they leave more of the gains for shareholders.

title: Review: Lucky Stiff, Still Farcical, Returns as a Movie
description: Lucky Stiff is the work of writers who, with seasoning and much tougher editing and direction, might give their generation its own Bells Are Ringing or Pajama Game, the critic Frank Rich wrote in The New York Times in 1988 about a new musical that had opened Off Broadway at Playwrights Horizons.

title: Government Pension Cuts Tangled in Patchwork of Legal Rulings
description: Two years ago, lawmakers in Puerto Rico faced the soaring cost of government pensions and did what lawmakers across the United States have been doing: They cut the pensions.

title: Review: The Outrageous Sophie Tucker Recalls a Jazz Powerhouse
description: If you close your eyes and randomly select a page from the autobiography of the singer Sophie Tucker, you may well end up reading a throwaway anecdote like this: Queen Marie of Romania came to Chicago during our run there. We all hoped she would come to see the show, and an invitation was sent to Her Majesty. But she sent a gracious letter of apology, and we had to be content that night with Al Capone and a party of 20. Flip a few more pages, and theres this: Will I ever forget the hamburger dinner I cooked for Fanny Brice and Aunt Jemima!

title: Panama Burns Six Tons of Drugs
description: Panamanian authorities burned six tons of seized drugs, mostly cocaine.

title: Review: Paper Towns Tries to Fold Significance Into the Everyday
description: Teenage angst has been a lucrative movie racket for years, but what happens when the kids are pretty much all right? Not a whole lot, at least in Paper Towns, a serenely bland adaptation of the John Green young-adult novel about a regular boy in love with the mystery girl next door. Once upon a Hollywood time, when American adolescents were in the grip of social mores and studio censorship, nice guys wooed nice gals with boyish smiles, well-behaved hands and tamped-down desires. Whats old is new again in Paper Towns, a melodrama in which smiles still tremble, hands largely behave and freedoms just another word for everything an ordinary boy doesnt want to lose.

title: D.N.C. Lifts Ban on Convention Fund-Raising
description: The Democratic National Committee will lift its ban on donations from political action committees and lobbyists for it convention fund-raising and for the accounts it shares with presidential campaigns, highlighting the coming shift within the party as it moves from being led by an incumbent president to its next nominee.

title: Review: Only You, a Chinese Remake of the Tomei-Downey Rom-Com
description: Based on a 1994 Hollywood romance of the same title with Marisa Tomei and Robert Downey Jr., Zhang Haos Only You covers similar but not identical bases: Fang Yuan (Tang Wei), a Beijing veterinarian, has twice been informed by fortunetellers that she would marry a man named Song Kunming. Engaged to a dentist, she intercepts a phone call from her fiancs former classmate  a certain Song Kunming. Accompanied by her levelheaded friend Li Xiaotang (Su Yan), she impulsively flies to Italy to find him. But instead she meets Feng Dali (Liao Fan), an expatriate buyer and restorer of antiquities who impersonates the elusive Kunming until the ruse is uncovered and he must win over Yuan as himself.

title: Ground Zero Arts Center to Shrink Further
description: THE Performing Arts Center planned for the former World Trade Center site was dealt a serious blow on Thursday when the corporation in charge of downtown redevelopment insisted that the project come in at no more than $200 million  about half the original estimated cost.

title: Pictures of the Day  Iraq and Elsewhere
description: Iraq and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Review: Smosh: The Movie Wades Through YouTubes Shallows
description: People love watching jackasses doing stupid things! yells the chief executive of a certain huge video-sharing company. Its our bread and butter here at YouTube.

title: The Last Party Celebrates New York Club Culture
description: A lively, messy scrapbook of a show, The Last Party surveys, as per its subtitle, the Influence of New Yorks Club Culture: Mid-70s to Early 90s. Presenting photographs, videos, paintings and a re-creation of the Mars Bar, the famous dive that became a tourist attraction, this exhibition looks back on a downtown scene of gleeful debauchery.

title: Jeb Bush Calls for an End to Energy Subsidies
description: Former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida has called for something that his brother George W., the former president and oilman, might disagree with: a ban on energy subsidies.

title: Review: Samba, About the Travails of an Illegal Immigrant in France
description: Directed by the team behind the hit French odd-couple comedy The Intouchables, the breezy Samba centers on a Senegalese immigrant (Omar Sy) and his caseworker (Charlotte Gainsbourg). Hovering between the insider and outsider perspectives the two characters represent, the filmmakers Eric Toledano and Olivier Nakache deliver a mostly buoyant take on the immigration travails that preoccupy France today (and more and more of its movies).

title: July 23, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Iraq, Turkey, Burundi, and Germany.

title: Review: Dylan Goes Electric! Considers Folk, Rock and a 60s Divide
description: Saturday night is the 50th anniversary of Dylanageddon: the night Bob Dylan savaged the Newport Folk Festival by making loud, electrified noise at a sanctuary that had never been thus sullied. The story of his 1965 assault on Newport is very well known. Its effects have been contemplated ad nauseam. Its details show up in every Dylan biography. Its so essential to the Dylan story that it may even have engendered folk songs of its own. So the idea of a book to commemorate this geezer milestone seems unnecessary, to put it kindly.

title: On Life, and Death, After 85
description: A group of New Yorkers, 85 and older, share their experience of growing old, and the knowledge, joys and fears that come with it.

title: Yasuo Kuniyoshi, a Modernist Often Overlooked, Gets a Smithsonian Retrospective
description: WASHINGTON  Apparently, it is not quite Yasuo Kuniyoshis moment. This Japanese-American painter, who was born in 1889 and died in 1953, is the subject of a superb retrospective at the Smithsonian American Art Museum here. But, unfortunately, The Artistic Journey of Yasuo Kuniyoshi will be seen nowhere else  not even at one of the several American museums that have lent to it.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on todays top stories.

title: Drone Films Crop Circles in Russia
description: Drone footage shows an apparent crop circle formation that purportedly appeared in a field in southern Russia on Tuesday.

title: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres the latest.

title: Review: Ubu Roi, Mom and Dads Party of Grown-Up Grotesques
description: Vive ladolescence! The spirit of rancorous rebellion that rumbles within every teenager is storming the bourgeois barricades in Cheek by Jowls inspired rethinking of Alfred Jarrys Ubu Roi, the satirical drama that once rattled Paris to its foundations, which runs through Sunday at the Gerald W. Lynch Theater as part of the Lincoln Center Festival.

description: Full reviews of recent jazz performances: nytimes.com/jazz. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

description: Elena Hermosa looks at the struggle to preserve the culture and traditions of Honduran Garifuna immigrants who make up a large community in the Bronx.
